r9OeNBPUKOTtk79lNxp5qA.text: Ate here the first time we came to Vegas this summer and it was delish! I'm rely big on thai food and have had some of the best and this one definitely is up there!  We ordered the satay chicken on the grill, comes with peanut sauce, cucumber relish and ciabatta bread. Soooo tender and delish!  We ordered the green chicken  and so ordered rice . The green curry dish comprised of green curry, chicken, thai eggplant and basil! A real authentic rich flavour! Not too spicy!   The wait staff was attentive. No complaints there.   The decor and up keep was top of the line! A real nice modern.  Must go!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basil beef thai rice
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green chicken curry

AEu1MKPr9bzAAglnrLzZdQ.text: This is not Thai. If you go to this place with the mind set of not eating Thai then you might find it satisfying. The only thing that is Thai, spicy hot, they make it spicy hot where your tongue is buring only if choose so.  Decor of the place is nice. Service is fine.

1DONTQtXT009872sroy6-A.text: This is a great eatery with quality atmosphere and cuisine. It is tucked in the back off of the Casino main floor so it is not easily seen beyond the giant "yellow" wall. Great for people watching even if you are tearing up from the spicy Drunken Noodles. Have been here a few times and love the fact that it is open late and takes Open Table reservations. Families are welcome to sit along side the hot night clubbers. This is a must stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken Seafood Noodles

ydepRfdwllVhnKecs0tMyA.text: Absolutely horrible service. Restaurant was less than half full. Took over 30 minutes for our server to come take our drink order. She never checked on us during the meal. Again at the end took another 30 minutes to get her attention for the check. An absolute embarrassment of a restaurant. Maybe because we weren't dressed like millionaires she decided it was ok to ignore us? Well she got her wish with a big fat zero tip. Will never be back and suggest everyone avoid if you're looking to enjoy a night in Vegas.

mLGU7oH7fIPIrvjc70q8sg.text: Staying at Aria and was super excited to try this place out.   We didnt have a reservation and the wait was going to be 1 1/2 hr. So we decided to do to go orders. The hostess informed us that it would be ready in 20 minutes. We came back and it wasn't there yet. We waited around and not until we asked did they entertain us. Thats the only time they went and checked to see the status of our orders. They told us that the kitchen was behind and to come back in 10 minutes.   (by this point its already been an hour)  We walked around and came back. Only 1 of our orders was ready.   They could've done a better service in letting the customers know the situation. In addition, they should have done something to compensate for the wait and the wrong information provided.  It has now been an hour and twenty. We're still waiting for our last order.....

SnXRPcrjz3kpye1IzdWG5Q.text: We were hoping to try Blossom but the wait was too long.  Glad we ended up here though because it was delicious!  The pad see ew was good, I could have enjoyed a little more noodles but it had a good flavor.  The pineapple coconut fried rice was AWESOME, so flavorful!!  We also tried the corn egg drop soup and it was good.  The atmosphere was nice but not too fancy and the wait staff was attentive.  Prices were not outrageous, which says a lot for a frugal traveler like me haha.  Looking forward to visiting again someday!

biJYl28So8O3AdBnbs_4hw.text: Ordered take out hit the spot after a long night.  The fried rice was $20 but there was plenty for the 3 of us to share.  We ordered a 7 on the hotness scale 1 to 10 and it was hotter than expected.   The staff seemed annoyed when I called for takeout and when I picked up but they weren't out right rude.

0fRYYy4DxNzs75H0GgOAZQ.text: We went here for my 21st birthday dinner. I absolutely love Thai food and this restaurant definitely hit the spot. Tina was our waitress. She was efficient and had an awesome personality. We started with some drinks. I ordered the Thai Spice (basically Thai Tea with rum - SO GOOD). My friends got a couple bottles of Singha and wine.   You can order family style or your own entrees, like most Thai restaurants offer. I got the Vegetable Phad See Ew at a 5 spice level and it was perfection. Just enough spice, not too oily, and the tofu was fried in nice, small cubes. My friends ordered yellow curry, green curry, chicken cashew nut, vegetable phad thai, basil beef, and mee goreng.   Everyone was really pleased with their dishes. Prices were reasonable for the quality of service. Tina helped coordinate the bill and included subtotals for us. I would certainly return here for some Thai comfort during my next trip to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Phad See Ew - yum!

2eUzjj_hy5EuST0lPOX-gg.text: Possibly one of the worst meals I've ever had. Terrible service as well (very inattentive) but the food was the worst part. We first ordered the steak salad and I've never seen red meat come out so fatty and raw for a salad. It was inedible. Then we ordered the chicken basil and the chicken was rubbery and tasted frostbitten. The manager did take both dishes off the check.

Pz85C_Jf4oRNPsoRXiVqRg.text: Our group was craving Thai food for dinner, and Lemongrass did not disappoint! The ambience was great, and we were seated promptly with our online reservation in which we made 4 hours in advance. I enjoyed my pad thai and the food my friends shared - I highly recommend the curry! Overall it was a positive experience that satisfied our desire for Thai.

PwHL5yyxpN-5fEr_1KsFDQ.text: Thai food was delish! Dan Dan noodles - fantastic! Loved the raspberry martini too. This was a late lunch and not busy on a Monday at the bar. Great service Jose!

IfSNf3ei2KEseXLHIfxZZg.text: Pretty much the worst Thai food I've ever had.....all of the dishes we had were a miss on flavor. Don't waste your time here.  My husband and I ordered the Tom Ka Kai soup and it was ok, it was really lacking vegetables and spice. We also ordered the basil chicken and the panag curry... The basil chicken was really oily or greasy just had a bad flavor really didn't like it. The panag curry was also lacking spice and vegetables and flavor just wast there.

ygL2d04101s3qkzxP3MSWA.text: Pretty good food. I have been to Thailand several times so I don't think I'll ever find Thai food in the States as good. It was good though.   In don't give it 5 stars though because of the price. It's pretty expensive for middle dishes. 16.00 for Pad Thai. Here in LA I get just as good for 8.00. But it's the Aria.   Service was good. Korean gal Kathleen was our sever. Very friendly and attentive to us.

fRb9yaPwhdHFBFfk8PI_2g.text: This place is incredible! I could not believe how inexpensive it was for being inside the Aria. I went to a Wolfgang Puck bar and grill the night before and spent twice as much for a burger and pasta. At Lemongrass, we got an app, rice and a main course for next to nothing! It was so good too, the sesame chicken was great! I highly recommend this place, The quality is amazing

MG-mkDfxxpyz3t5eoRouEw.text: I want to say thank you to Lemongrass who reached out to make things right. They read my review and aplogized that I had a bad experience. Many businesses don't take the time to do this and therefore makes this a restaurant I would try again. Great customer service!

bfdD3qovMRkJWYAIZAJ6ag.text: Food was bad. Service was beyond bad... The only dish we cared for was the shrimp spring roll. Everything else was poorly put together. Main dish was cold. Waiter never came to us to check up on us. We didn't finish our plates and we did not pack to go. Stay away... We will be complaining.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1dHIjYa2jrTb4DcqG-PRMw.text: Generous portions, good food (not the best of Thai I had), and decent service.  They took us in without a reservation although the place was packed.  Tucked away in the Aria.  Had pad Thai, drunken noodles, tom yam soup, beef and broccoli, and some other dishes (not all by myself!  Was in a group).  Wouldn't be on my top places to go but good if you want something different from everything else.

PLlKvl2mokXm3-K8n_XTdA.text: Came around 11:30pm for a late night snack after getting hammered left and right by drinks. I was helped by a nice woman, her name was a Connie who I believed is the term manager. She knew my drunchies kicked it hard and explained to me what items were customer favorites and etc. I ordered a Thai iced tea, pineapple fried rice, and chicken satay. I must say, everything tasted amazing and just as accurate from the description provided by Connie. I would definitely come back!

hVG7c9pqjdKEah_Nsl-aWg.text: I read many of the reviews on Lemongrass and now that I have dined there, I understand cause for the dissenting reviews (noting point losses mostly in service inconsistency and bland food.) I have not tried other Thai restaurants in the Las Vegas area yet. But, I enjoy Thai food and had many opportunities to have really great Thai cuisine.   Both dishes I had (chicken wing appetizer and drunken noodle entree) were recommendations from the restaurant to be among their "best". But, if you've tasted good Thai, you will agree that the flavors are comparatively bland and the texture is not ideal in some dishes.   The service wasn't well coordinated, but I prefer being checked on by several servers asking/offering the same items to me then to have no one check on me.  I rounded up and gave Lemongrass 3 stars rather than 2.5, mostly because on a 5star rating, they barely made crossing over the halfway point. Honestly, 4 stars and above should be reserved for restaurants that are far better in class than their great competition, however, Lemongrass is not at that point yet - I hope they get there.  Up shot: I did like the mango sticky rice dessert. I think the interior is very nice and most importantly, the staff are very kind. But save the sticky rice, it's not a location I'd bring guests to who love Thai food. For as attractive as the restaurant is, I wish they invested more in the food.

f_7bPPDohC7q_TZL7prdkw.text: We were stay in Aria and happy to see a Asian food there. But, we were disappointed by the service, not the food. The food is good even it is over priced. But the service is really not there. The waiter seems always in rush and impatient.  I will not come back again.

CC_aYqq3x6Vm7Or3kDzXgA.text: I try Thai restaurants in every city I visit, this was by far one of the worst I have come across. I mean, the Thai restaurants in strip malls just outside Vegas serve way better food than this place. Penang Curry was bland, for some reason the chicken was very chewy on both our entrees and my friend did not feel good afterwards. Jasmine rice is not served with any entrees even though they cost about $20, go to this place only if no other restaurant is open after midnight. Save your money and make some time to visit Lotus of Siam instead

0gz_VsklLGvHVhAGTAOKog.text: One of the better places for eating thai food on the strip. We were quite sure we could handle spicy and chose to go 5/10, trust me, tears in our eyes, it was burning HOT. But it tasted so good, that we enjoyed finishing our food. I would suggest go for a 3 or a 4 if you are not used to eating spicy food. But the overall ambience and service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ooo.. Spicy

Hj0D5fD-GbVOQp4ft7tcdw.text: Aria was the closest hotel to us (Vdara), so we came here to eat. Initially, the girls wanted to eat at Blossom but it was closed and Lemongrass was right next door. I ordered the Wonton Noodle Soup ($14). I was already expecting it to be a bit pricy. The shrimp in the wontons were big but it was lacking in flavor. I added some hot sauce to my soup, which didn't do much.   Service was good. My glass of water was always full, even when I told them I didn't need any more.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton Noodle Soup

4sX6qk24hgvqzUvbeWOypA.text: This is a great great place for a late-night bite @ Aria!  Location: Go past Elements and the Carta bar, past the large ORANGE wall and make a right, it will be next to the sky suite elevators.  Early this year, my boyfriend and I booked our Aria stay with a $50 daily restaurant credit which forced us to eat at the restaurants there once a day! We went to Lemongrass many times because we liked the food and because it was open late!  The service is excellent, the waiters will be very attentive and helpful! The food ranges in prices but will generally be between $14-20 dollars.  The higher priced items will be seafood, and a couple of selections with Lobster are $110 hehe  We have tried fried rice, chow mein, sesame chicken, cashew chicken, pepper prawns amongst many others and have never been disappointed!   My all time fave is the Fu Chow Fried Rice which comes with diced shrimp, lima beans, carrots, fried rice and a delicious gravy! YUM!  Will definitely be back during our next Aria stay!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fu Chow Fried Rice
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Chow Mein

T-NypEx4peVoAtuC989MoQ.text: Lemongrass at the Aria is a very good Thai food restaurant. My wife and I ate there twice during our visit to Las Vegas. The food was very good and the atmosphere was nice and quite. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys Thai food!

OaED2nFsuzLPxMeCqELTVg.text: I was craving Thai food after one of the many shows we saw and decided on lemongrass. Wow. Food was delicious and fresh. I had the cashew nut chicken and my boyfriend had the green curry w chicken. Both were perfectly seasoned and the rice was cooked to perfection. It wasn't anything fancy or expensive and was super delicious and a perfect after show meal. The ambience was quiet and simple. Nothing Vegas style about it... But definitely amazing food and good service. Would go again.

I_Em3Ybxcj-LNEuAHIpGyQ.text: Food was great and it was located with in casino aria The coconut water is damm expensive.

wLFEU3hVZqV_s05b8cQGNQ.text: The ambiance was nice, the chairs were a tad bit uncomfortable (very little padding), but really this should be about the food, right? Well...it's fine. Just fine. Nothing earth shattering. I had the jellyfish appetizer, which is really just cold jellyfish cut into strips like pasta and tossed with sesame and chili oil. Someone was WAY TOO heavy handed with the sesame oil, which ruined the entire dish.  My table ordered a bunch of spring roll and pot stickers, those were fine.  For my entree I ordered the Beef Sczehwan noodle soup with beef, beef tendon, and baby bok choy. The broth was good, a little mild for my taste, and it turns out I'm not a big fan of beef tendon, a wee bit fatty for my liking. (Who knew?)  The wait service was okay - after 20 minutes of sitting around and waiting for our check after eating we finally went to the hostess station to ask for our bill.  If you're looking for an awesome Vegas dining experience, and you should be, I wouldn't go here. It's fine if you're trapped in the casino and want some sort of Asian food, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again.

-9cHusI2AjcZs2U_j8ZVlg.text: I'm a fan of this place. Pretty good thai food. And their fried rice is very good. A bit overpriced but not bad when you use your comp points. I wouldnt go out of my way to eat here. But it is convient for its location right inside the Aria.  UPDATE as of 3/12/2013 I've been eating here a lot more since I moved to Las Vegas and all, and Aria is where I work. Here are my favorites so far: Yellow Chicken Curry , Drunken noodles with seafood, Chicken & Basil, Spicy Cucumber Salad, Tom yum talay, Pad Thai, Chicken corn soup. (NEVER ever get spicy level above 5, only if you dare, they will make a grown man cry and sweat lol and this goes for everything)

VUkW1M1E98ORZgcmdjEayw.text: Overpriced, but then again what is not overpriced on the Las Vegas Strip. I would recommend their Panang Duck Curry. It is very tasteful and has lychee included. It is by far my favorite curry. They have light appetizers that come in small quantity. I enjoyed the chicken satay, salmon spring rolls and chicken wings. Those were my favorite appetizers from the menu. Their seaweed salad is not the usual kind of seaweed salad you normally get at sushi restaurants. It is horrible and has no flavor. I go to Lemongrass as my last resort. I wouldn't say this is my favorite Thai restaurant. But it is scrumptious when your desparate:-) that is the truth!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Main entrance of LemonGrass

TJceYyClH5zlsRTB0I0j8Q.text: DO NOT be mislead by the negative reviews on here. At first I dismissed this place for the better reviews of Blossom (right across from Lemongrass) but upon arrival I liked the menu of Lemongrass so decided to wing it. The outcome was surpassed expectations. The food is excellent and properly authentic Thai. Even the spice level is Thai spicy (from 1-10, 3 is a medium, 6/7 being SPICY). My favorite was the panang duck for the creaminess of the sauce and the crispy duck (skin).

NTbrdrsjH-FrcELVmFJy4g.text: Had the pad thai and chicken wings.  The first 2 pieces of steak in the pad thai i had to spit out cause it was chewy, very gross.  Low quality meat.  The chicken wings werent anything special.  I wouldnt go back

84R75EHVOIwf5kTFluVs3A.text: Goto spot for my late night poker session refueling.   My go to dish is the Chicken PadThai. Big portions and fresh.  Lemongrass always gets my comps and always will.   Props to Aria for having great food selection for casino/poker room players.

0F0CB9yC3UeLpU90sqo3fg.text: Delicious curry and seafood.  Good service.  Prices are okay for Vegas.  The potstickers were good but not great.

WiYWLoVovLS0Si8LIfq63w.text: Happy to have Thai food in Vegas but am biased since we have one of the best Thai restaurants in out neighborhood back home in Atl

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6PcLNKrIu4hnfwQuWsTBfg.text: The first time my wife and I went there was last year. We ordered red curry and Pho which were very good. Two weeks ago we went there again but unfortunately the curry was too sweet. The atmosphere is very nice though.

MyQ9wJ9Cxrim5fjo-9jCkA.text: Worst Thai restaurant ever. I am highly disappointed that they are part of Aria.

ocw2o7-jPX569ghUXzT50Q.text: Service is slow.  Tables and booths are uncomfortable to sit in... but the place looks nice and the food is really good.  Tom Kha Chicken was probably the best coconut soup I've had (something I usually order at most Thai restaurants) and, oh man... the yellow chicken curry.... wow.  We couldn't stop talking about how tasty it was.  Mmm.  If you're in the mood for Thai, you'll like Lemongrass.  Just don't expect great service.

enyMlgi6lZfP15Z2p7Vnzw.text: Came here after a long drive of 8 hours. Got refreshed after having the awesomest Panang Curry and Pad Thai !! Will definitely visit again.

zzlA5LiIi6QeMFJxO-lNNQ.text: The dim sum is so delicious. Love that there open late night the service was good lacking some ambience but overall good staff and food experience.

h5SmrJEgqX0bMHOStpOMJQ.text: me and my husband had a great time here. we celebrated our 6th year anniversary over there last 25th of this month and everything they served was outstanding. we got the $50 option/person that served starters, soup, entrees and dessert. we love there tom yum soup we got it on mild and it just got the right amount of kick, their skewers for starters was also delicious esp the cucumber salad on the side the fried duck panang curry was my favorite everyone is raving about it too here, it wasn't in the option so i asked if they would make it for us and we'll pay extra, they did. my husband had the rib eye steak too which was also outstanding. they we're aware its a special occasion for us so they also gave us a free mango sorbet which was really awesome bdw. overall, it was a great experience!def. recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. vanilla ice cream for dessert
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. nice ambiance too!
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mango sorbet

Re16k6kf3V70Bv2AUKEiBg.text: Several REALLY delicious vegetarian options;  Red curry (we added tofu) and vegan Pad see ew with tofu were great!! Deliciously spiced.   Great ambiance, low light but not too dark.  Great ambient background music.... lovely and not too expensive for the quality of the experience. Close to $14 for the curries....   One of our favorite spots when staying in Vegas as it isn't "trashy food" nor is it ridiculously overpriced or stuffy/fancy.   Elegant yet comfortable. Love it.

hgmdtgZondwoSxTA306jTQ.text: Great ambiance and decent prices. Even when we weren't staying in the Aria, we find ourselves coming here for good Asian food.  There are better food and there are cheaper Asian restaurants in Vegas but Lemongrass has a great mix of taste, ambiance, service, and price.  Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge yarn spin wheels that act as chandleliers. They&#39;re like giant Japanese lanterns but give a distinctive Southeast Asian feel.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very nice textile theme to the restaurant. Unique, modern, yet warm and inviting.

Gi0stcG3Jc2T21QpNu7Ymg.text: First time here and it was great!. The ambiance was nice and the food was outstanding. Some of the best Thai I have ever had. The nice part was that it was right downstairs from our room in the Aria.

-QQX5A24BILuQraJYiCyww.text: Varied feelings here. Love the ambiance and the location is right next to Sky Suites entry so very convenient. The food was mixed. My Roast Duck and BBQ pork soup was pretty good. The meat was delicious, but very cumbersome to eat. It's screaming hot and the duck is on the bone, making for a very painful and messy experience. Again, flavor was terrific, just awkward to eat. Our dumplings were amazing, by far the highlight of the meal. My wife had sweet and sour chicken and it pretty much tasted like every other sweet and sour I've ever had. It wasn't bad, but no where near elevated. We also had service issues, but they comped our dumplings and were apologetic so I'll let that slide. I think the best description for Lemongrass is meh. -

9nEd7wR-guePF9vE_weJJA.text: Review from a vegan perspective.  Vegetarian items are clearly marked on the menu. We mentioned we were vegan to our waiter and he was able to answer questions on the subject for us for how items were prepared.  My fiance and I shared the fried tofu with sweet chili sauce which was amazing.   It took quite awhile for the food at this point, even though it was slow in the restaurant and the waiter became almost none existent.   But the chefs made up for any inconvenience by preparing some of the best food I've had in awhile. I had the tofu clay pot and she had the pad see ew noodles. Both were flavorful and perfectly cooked. Truly unbelievable food.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZJhEDdQik454nhyfnhdU3w.text: What can I say? When its good don't change a thing!! GREAT to see Lemongrass is exactly as it was when we left it last year. The service and variety on the menu is fantastic! The quality of the dishes and drinks is awesome and at prices that are more than fair on the Las Vegas strip. Had the pleasure of meeting the manager and thanked her for doing such a great job. Have already had three meals this stay and a couple more to go at Lemongrass. If you are in Vegas and need an Asian food fix come here! Has never disappointed us year after year!!

CcwpReuIOtWuLjFcv0F3lA.text: Worst drunken noodle I have ever had. We also ordered a Pad Sea Ew, and these two dishes look exactly the same except for some red peppers and basil in drunken noodle. Both taste so plain in flavor that we had to rely on adding chili sauce on the table to make them not flavorless. Price is high given the poor food quality: $20 for a fried noodle and $15 for satay. Not coming back again!

53d1324h2e8SKUZ38mqkZw.text: Well.... something happened in the 2 months since I last wrote my review. I've returned to Lemongrass 6-7 times since, and the quality has seriously deteriorated.  First, the lobster satay, which as been the staple of every order, has come out.... well... crappy. They come out piping hot on the outside, and cold (sometimes, even still slightly frozen) on the inside. There is NOTHING more annoying, disappointing, and downright crappy about biting into something you're looking forward to, and it comes out like a badly heated frozen dinner.  Their "very popular" crab curry..... tasted more like curried scrambled eggs than anything else, and their "dan dan noodles" were also absolute crap. Ugh.... HOW could you let things go consistently wrong for 2 months after 3 wonderful initial experiences????  My family also managed to get food poisoning when we went on Monday, a few days ago. EVERYONE.   Sad to say, I don't think we'll be coming back here, except maybe if I have a ridiculous craving for their coconut ice-cream desert, or their Penang duck.  Please get your act together!!!!!

aFmcd3LlNFUe43Fr--HEEg.text: Pad thai was flavorless mush, the chicken in there may or may not have actually been chicken . The beef and broccoli were equally unappealing. Broccoli was pretty much all stems that were very hard to chew, probably did touch a frying pan...for two seconds... The spring rolls on the other hand were a complete delight.

QEsHVdgo7jdu70m5hbn8vw.text: Went here for a Saturday night family dinner and was super impressed. The ambiance was gorgeous, staff was friendly, portions were served family style. Everything was delicious. Highly recommend. The rice was so fluffy!

S2pH-52HSevz0Fs0Ue89jw.text: We had a group that ate here on a Thursday night.  We were seated right at our reservation time.  It was very nice and calm in the restaurant.  The lights were low, quiet music was playing and the decor was really nice.  Our waiter provided good recommendations for appetizers, ensuring that we would have enough items for our party.  We had the veggie spring rolls and chicken satay to start with.  The veggie rolls were good and the chicken satay skewers were fantastic.  I especially loved the peanut sauce that came with them - a little bit of spice, but it added a lot. I ordered the Chicken Pad Thai for my entree.  The waiter told us that a 2-3 on the 10 point scale would be very spicy, so I ordered my spice at a 1 (low).  When the meal was delivered I was happy to see the pile of sprouts off to the side, as I'm not a sprout fan.  With my first bite of chicken, I was happy to know that it wasn't very spicy, but then I quickly realized that it literally had no taste at all.  Rather than a bed of noodles, I felt like the chicken was served on a bed of sprouts with a couple of noodles thrown in.  The chicken was well cookies, but I would definitely have enjoyed some flavor.  Luckily we had some sauce left over from the appetizers and I used that to liven up my meal. Our waiter never stopped by after the meal was served to check on us, and a different waiter offered coffee/dessert.

QRVk89LrFNrOFMl8-8zTWQ.text: I actually loved Lemongrass! The food was superb! We came for dim sum and it was really yummy. Although it was a little pricier than what would would get at a non-Vegas strip establishment, I was happy with the quality of the dim sum food. The shu mai and the har gao were really big and totally worth trying. We also ordered some other dim sum items and enjoyed it.  The service was okay- I had to ask several times for my water to be re-filled.  All-in-all, I highly recommend if you're staying at the Aria! It was quite yummy!

7wEPD3a3S6OeUrIMbQcnJw.text: We stayed at the Aria for my husband's birthday and decided to go here for dinner since we love Thai food. Almost everything on the menu looked tantalizing but since we had no microwave or fridge in the room, we decided to keep it to an appetizer and entree to share.   Drinks: My husband orders the Thai beer anytime we go out for Thai food and if its available. As for me, I walked in with a cup of champagne that we popped in the room to kick off his birthday. I was worried they wouldnt let me in with it and I would have to down it at the door but we were seated with no issues and no wait! (We did have reservations for 9pm)   Appetizer: potstickers, they were good but I've had better.  Entree: crab fried rice with a fried soft shell crab on top. We ordered spicy level 5 since he said 3 is pretty hot. We like our food spicy but this was not spicy to us. We had to add hot chili sauce to it. Crab was very fresh and light.  Not as flavorful as I'm used to for it being Thai food but it was still good but what lacked in flavors made up in the ambiance. What a beautiful place!   I probably wont return again but only because there's too many other places in Vegas to try to be repeating the same place twice.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorgeous entrance!
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ambiance
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab fried rice with fried soft shell crab on top

Nlfdk-3i9PH_35Ep-vM6kw.text: The food was good but do NOT order anything with shrimp. I ended up getting food poisoning and was so sick the next day. Not the Vegas experience I was hoping for.

bOLZuG6pghw7T_oHFeZ9Yg.text: If you like so so quality and horrible service...this is the spot for you!  Make sure to watch out for Bang as he was the worst server of our week long stay.  We ate there on 7/18/18 from 8:45 PM to 9:45 PM.  Won't be back...

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big boy Bang...

ePXyeNLsd1bOz33wVNwlww.text: The only reason I'm giving this place a 3 stars is because of the customer service. The waiters/waitresses were very attentive - always refilled our waters and checked up on us constantly. The food however was rather disappointing. We already expected everything to be overpriced because that's just how it is.   We ordered something light before our flight back home. Chicken pad thai and dan dan noodles. I already had a feeling the dan dan noodles weren't going to taste very good because this restaurant was supposed to be a Thai restaurant. Dan dan noodles is Szechuan cuisine. Just looking at the dan dan noodles once they were placed on the table, I knew something was wrong. Where was the chili oil/flakes and minced pork? It looked more like peanut noodles to me. These were probably the worst dan dan noodles I've ever had.. it tasted nothing like it at all. The pad thai was pretty good. Not too strong of a flavor, but was very generous in its portions.  The flavors still however cannot justify the $18 per dish.. lol. Overpriced and unsatisfying.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i2uxrPtN6i3L5EBEo-qXiw.text: Vegetarian Options: OH MY GOD this place is amazing.  Being a Thai restaurant there are plenty of vegetarian options, but the food was absolutely delicious.  I went with my sisters (all 5 of us are vegetarian and 1 is gluten free), and we ordered the vegetable fried rice, pad thai, red curry, spring rolls, and panang curry.  We loved all of it and it was so fresh and full of flavor.   Service: The service was great and our waitress helped us make some decisions when what we really wanted to do was order the entire menu.   Ambiance: This place is super swanky and would be a great spot for a date night.  It has some romantic lighting and is an overall beautiful setup.

0jY75BdviivQfUkJCjlZZg.text: I went for my birthday. Even so, the service was just horrible. I was seated around 9:30 and ordered quickly. I didn't get the appetizer until 10:15 and it was just three pieces of bbq pork buns. Not once did the waitress stop to check in on us. She seemed to notice our questioning faces and yet wouldn't care to notice. The table next to us came later and had their foods ready earlier ? It was just really disappointing on top of the overpriced dishes. The food wasn't even great either for having to had to wait so long for it. Never got another refill on water.  Thanks, A.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Even though I waited 50minutes the noodles were white in some parts

U-tDDt6EKHwNeoHPMrJ73g.text: My girlfriend and I were staying in the Aria and were excited to hear from the concierge that the most authentic Thai restaurant on the strip was in our hotel. We stopped in for a late-ish snack, so getting a table was smooth enough.  We ordered the shanghai soup dumplings and of course the pad thai.  The soup dumplings were the worst soup dumplings I have ever had. They came in these strange foil cups, suggesting they were not steamed in an authentic fashion. They tasted much more like frozen regular pork dumplings and contained little to no soup, far from authentic, and below average at best. I suspect trader joe's frozen soup dumplings are better.  Secondly, the pad thai portion was decent, but the flavor was mundane. We didn't get it spicy, but that certainly shouldn't hold it back. It had no sweetness, no tangy-ness, and contained veggies that I have never encountered in a pad thai before.    I wonder if the all-asian staff is ashamed of the food.

8tqZKNnUR9hgKZBeLbZsWw.text: Such an awful experience! Do not waste your time!  Extremely over priced, small portions, slow service, rude staff, and the manager is a complete asshole!  Also haven't seen my server in the last hour!

LPmpJo8SWGHsmF_MmKYfHw.text: I still love this place.    Not sure why the low ratings.     Service is spot on with refills.    Anthony the bartender is attentive and keeps everything flowing without being pushy.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom ka chicken

eortTOQLVSneVUH9Gtj0lQ.text: In the mood for pho and it was good. They also have other noodles and Asian cuisine.  Excellent service in a great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fS4PEj5rjWWsIuTObuFkqQ.text: I was craving some Asian food and stumbled upon Lemongrass at Aria. For strip pricing, this place is reasonable for some comfort Thai food. We ate at the bar and were greeted by Tony the bartender. He was very friendly. We ordered some shrimp Phad Thai and also some fish cakes. The fish cakes were really delicious and the pad thai fulfilled my Asian craving.   I actually came back to this place a couple of hours later because my other friends were also having an Asian food craving. I had the Tom Yam Hed which is a abalone mushroom soup as well as their Singapore Noodles to go which consists of stir-fried rice vermicelli, BBQ pork, shrimp, onion, bean sprouts, bell pepper, egg, and curry powder. I was amazed by how well the singapore noodles lasted a couple of hours after a late dinner. The soup and the noodles were pretty good. At least I know that the quality of the food is consistent. It is a great place to come if you are indeed staying at Aria.

y0naIO4hGAyZuVvKsZ5Kcw.text: It's easily my fave restaurant at the Aria. As soon as I landed at McCarran, all I could think about was the char kway teow at Lemongrass.  Was it the best? Mh.. No. However, they do it right and it always tastes good to me. I will always try to squeeze two portions of it per one Vegas trip.   Other than my beloved char kway teow, I never really tried anything else here except the chicken and corn soup and mee goreng. Friends ordered the dan dan noodle, drunken noodle, and pad see ew. I was always sticking with my shrimp char kway teow cooked spicy. Sooo good!!!  The restaurant was next to the baccarat lounge and across from Blossoms Chinese Restaurant. It caters mostly to South East Asian foods. This hotel is smart as there are tons of S.E Asians that gamble hugely here. My friend, CK, recommended this place several years back and I still love it to this day. He told me to get a fried garlic crab this time. He said it was out of this world. I didn't get it though because I couldn't eat a whole crab alone.  I'm a big fan! The service is always pretty quick, perfect if you were trying to slip in lunch in between meetings. We were in a time constraint to watch Zarkana, and they did an awesome job in getting the foods we ordered in record time.   When in Vegas and you like South East Asian cuisines-Thai, Vietnamese, Malaysian, Singaporean, and Indonesian... Lemongrass is the place!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad See Ew
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Char kway teow
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan dan noodle

hhTZJUSo_qjiddR0ZV47tw.text: Outstanding food, good service, excellent pricing... 100% Recommended.  The environment and the quality of the food really is what you would expect from a restaurant at Aria

oKp6TWTIhtCDtZnZ5LEYSA.text: Lemongrass' outstanding SATAYS is the reason why I return to this beautifully decorated restaurant over and over again!  This time, I tried and enjoyed their fried shrimp wrap also!  This place is perfect for a light lunch or a late night snack!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Satay - yum!
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Wrap - delicious

5Xz3qe01abf2wwZWhD1Q1A.text: Lunch Review ...  Friend had a craving for Thai food, so we decided to have lunch at Lemongrass.  When we sat down, I was surprised to learn that they were also serving dim sum (not sure if this is a regular part of their menu or limited to Sundays is often the case at Chinese restaurants) and admittedly a little wary ... as I've found that most restaurants that mix cuisines end up doing none of them well.  Thai Food - My friend ordered "Drunken Noodle with Seafood," which was not bad but not necessarily good (a little on the bland side and skimpy on the seafood) ... how about mediocre.  Dim Sum - To my surprise, the dim sum was pretty good.  I didn't order much (so my review is based on three dishes only), but what I ordered was enjoyable:  (1) Leek and Shrimp Dumplings - Less like a traditional dumpling (with a distinct flour wrapper you might associate with a potsticker), but still okay; (2) Turnip Cake - Very good, and I am a HUGE fan of turnip cakes; and (3) Ginger Scallion Tripe - Also very good, and I am also a HUGE fan of tripe.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken Noodle with Seafood
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim Sum - Shrimp and Leek Dumplings
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim Sum - Turnip Cakes

Np4sOBezuPl4bPMdBqN9cA.text: I am late writing a review but a group of friends and I came to Vegas earlier this year in May for a ladies trip. We made dinner reservations several weeks prior and the staff were accomodating when we did not like where we were seated and asked to move.  The restaurant is located at the Aria so the location is great. The atmosphere and lighting inside the restaurant is warm and inviting. I would recommend looking decent and dress up for dinner but it is not a requirement.  The food and service is great, I ordered one of my favorite Thai dishes, shrimp drunken noodles.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodles with shrimp -spicy dish

JFuRNoIhu9ex6Ep7ZULduA.text: It pains me to have to write a review like this. A customer dining in a restaurant inside a world-class hotel and casino like ARIA should not have anything less than an amazing experience.   It began when I called the restaurant reservation number to make a reservation. I had an important dinner meeting, and I wanted my guest to have an awesome experience. I made a reservation and got a confirmation number. When I arrived at the restaurant,  nobody could find my reservation. I called the reservation line, and after talking to a representative, she encouraged me to talk to the manager. So I requested a manager, but after waiting more than 10 minutes on hold, nobody came back on the line and I hung up. Thankfully, the restaurant was not busy, so they were able to seat us.  When we sat down, I chose a bottle of wine and ordered it. I asked my guest to have the first taste. He tried to be enthusiastic. Then I realized that the bottle we received was a different year than what was on the menu. No wonder my guest struggled. I brought this up to the server, and she didn't think it was a big deal. I requested another bottle.  The meal was good. My desire is that the restaurant will make the experience better for its customers. Not plan on returning here unless things change.

dJKoBumy03TGexiPlDBCsQ.text: This place is not exactly a wow, but not a horrible choice. Pretty trendy feel to it, good background music.   However the service is below average.   The food quality is average. Nothing special.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining area
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of the menu

cAGnMaw7EwTmpjVUXTT8Qw.text: Do not miss the crispy prawn rolls. The prawns are tender and flavorful. The restaurant decor is subdued in the nicest way.

w4qCYhrJ0XyNvFFSaZ_P1Q.text: This used to be the place to go when I am in Vegas and this time was not the case.  I ordered a yang Chao fry rice and a hot & sour soup to go and the rice was very dry without any flavor.  What happen to the glistening appearance for chinese fry rice? Soup was blend with salted mustered green?  That's the first I've had in hot & sour soup.  The hostesses have such an attitude which I cannot even begin to comprehend.  This is supposed to be a high end thai restaurant and it seems to be losing its identity.

lfw7SbWALH3ubNoxYioQ3g.text: Unlike many reviewers here, we were staying at the Aria on a group rate, so did not have a "meal credit" to blow.  We weren't looking for a romantic dinner, as after spending all day at her conference, the wife had to "send a few emails, and quickly look at something for work", which destroyed any chance of date night.  We weren't inspired by the Aria's in-room dining options, and know that Thai is often a decent choice to offer alternatives with her gluten allergy.    Make no mistake, we didn't expect a terribly authentic Thai experience.  The signs were a broad menu that included udon, sesame chicken, and pho, and the fact that their signature beverage is a Watermelon Caipiroska.  I'm not sure why their menu covers so much of Asia, as there are separate Chinese and Japanese dining alternatives at the Aria.  But, that's neither here nor there, as we were after the usually-GF Thai stuff.  Because the wife was going to be busy, we just were going to pick up and bring it back to the room.  We both went downstairs, in case there were questions my wife would need to answer.  The young lady working the hostess stand on a Sunday night was, honestly, more friendly than we expected.  She walked us through our allergen questions, quickly dispatched our order, and before we could comment very long on the what looked like young, fit, and well-dressed platform-heeled blonde twins going to the secure Tower Suite elevators with what looked like their very affectionate dad, she came out with our bag of goodies.  We just went with a straight up chicken "Phad Thai" (not used to that spelling).  I didn't find it overly spicy, nor did we ask for extra hot sauce to customize it with.  Even though it took a bit of time for us to get back to our room, the food wasn't "stuck together" like some report here.  I was expecting to be underwhelmed, and come back downstairs to grab a pizza slice or something for my dinner later, but the ($18) entree was plenty to feed us both.    So, for the ability to handle my wife's gluten allergy without worry, the nice hostess who helped us, and conveniently and quickly feeding us both for about $20, we were pretty happy.  3.9 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our to-go order of chicken Phad Thai did the trick...

77mxbJjI2fAYWRwHb_erVg.text: We arrived at Lemongrass at around 8:30 p.m. on a Saturday. Place was decently busy, but we had made a reservation about three hours earlier (when we checked-in to Aria).  If there's a 3.5 star button, that's what it would get. While the service and drinks were quite good, two of the three menu items we ordered were not. We started with the Prawn Rolls (good to note that these are note "rolled", they come out as deep fried prawns), and in general were a bit flavourless and cold.  We then shared the Duck Panang Curry which was out of this world. Amazing flavour, huge portion of duck (which was tender and cooked perfectly). Followed that with the Dan Dan Noodles - yikes. It tasted... off... like really off. Hard to explain, but definitely was not to our liking.  Overall we may give Lemongrass a try again, if only to order 2-3 plates of Duck Panang Curry!

pCDbT51WUNxSW9pwEDZgiA.text: Very delicious Thailandaise food! And the price is quite friendly. I recommend yellow curry seafood, tom yam soup, and pineapple fried rice.

RR1Kzn9WDGq6mnP7uGyWFg.text: Worst experience in this restaurant. The food was good but the service is really really bad. I would give 4 stars for the food but service doesn't deserve a star. They took 20 minutes to refill the water.  The server (Ten) was not giving us any attention. When we told about this they didn't even bother to say sorry. Would not come here again.

9sSD4hQGRK9qDREgw79Rmw.text: We were looking for something vegetarian. We had pad Thai and red curry, both of which they agreed to make without egg and mushroom. Red curry was good, and the pad Thai was phenomenal. We felt the red curry could pack more flavor, and we missed tofu in it. They ask you to specify spice levels on a scale of 1 to 10.  Our waiter was very pleasant, and we liked the simple, elegant decor. Someone (from aria?) offered a photo shoot - they shot 5ish photos which looked great, but were super pricey ($140) so we didn't buy it.

UBjPDuh7Y4FHZstJLu2rTg.text: Found this place while staying in the aria Hotel. It's Thai food and it's not very good. We started off by asking what was the best dishes in the house and we got no opinion from the server on this question. We got a noodle dish a beef dish and hot and sour soup with a vegetarian fried rice and it was all very average at best. It wasn't flavorful and frankly upset my stomach hours later. The hot and sour soup was very bland and not very rich, the meat dishes were very grizzly. I do have to say the server was nice and pleasant but the place just doesn't quite have their act together, not even sure it's great for a quick lunch.

NmB7iLPDyZWykczm8qw8Zw.text: I wouldn't call this "authentic" Thai food. It's okay. I ordered the green curry with chicken and brown rice. The curry itself was bland. I had to douse it in chili paste to make it enjoyable. The meat was moist. Service was short and borderline rude from the bar staff. I had to wait until I received my food to be served a glass of water.

VbKy4IrmB22EqnZS3551Fw.text: Decor is very modern. I like how it looks like noodles. They also had really pretty flower arrangements. The food was okay. I had the cashew chicken with steamed rice. The rice portion was huge, but it got cold quickly which I was a little disappointed about. The chicken was pretty flavorful. I would have liked more ginger in it. I would have loved to have hot tea with my meal but I couldn't get over the fact that they were trying to charge $4 for it. So, I stuck with water. I was more impressed with how everything looked than how it tasted.

GE749mzeAtaj0hbTZfoHRw.text: Yum! This is probably the best Thai food I've had on the strip. It's open late until 2am, unlike most of the other restaurants in Aria that close around 10pm. My favorite dishes here are the beef satay (the meat is so tender and soft!) and the soft-shell crab fried rice (generous lumps of crab mixed into the rice along with a whole soft-shell crab on the side). The Thai iced tea here is also very good...a bit on the sweet side, but I don't mind at all :)

KCIjiPrUagBUD97-I3bUYA.text: I find Vegas has a large selection of Asian restaurants, yet none are authentic enough to want to go back. Lemongrass was recommended by the bartender at View Bar at Aria.  My drunken noodles with shrimp was cooked where 1/2 the noodles were dried and 1/2 were stuck together.  Not the great Thai food and its menu is a blend of Thai and Chinese, not sure the menu difference between this and Blossom.

6n9nT8Rup_eT3mgk-wJm3w.text: A little over-priced... but so is everything in ARIA. It is what it is on that front. I will go back for the food, the service and the drinks. It was great as far as I could tell, and it wasn't busy.. but neither was anything else at the time. The flavors were awesome, everything was fresh and tasty.. I say give it a try. I will be back Lemongrass!

6ZB93N063PTmqVyZ5idluA.text: I dined at the restaurant prior to seeing Viva Elvis at the hotel. The restaurant claims to be a Thai restaurant, but it seemed to be more of a fusion. I had order Pad See Ew and received Pad Thai. All of the food tasted the same and the waiters treated us as if they were doing us a favor. The only thing that was slightly average was the wine. I would not recommend this restaurant even if one was looking to simply waste their money.

taICs4HbX2mfQoVsPV8Nlw.text: Absolutely dreadful, don't waste your time.   Decided to try this out the Saturday after Christmas. Wish I hadn't bothered. The restaurant serves Thai food although you wouldn't know this as they don't display a menu outside! We didn't have a reservation but went just after 9pm and could see that the restaurant was only half full. Asked for a table for 2 when the girl at the desk finally returned and she said she could see what she could do! She managed to find us a table but really didn't seem to know what she was doing.   We ordered and this is when we should have realised there would be a problem. The table next to us asked for the manager to complain about something, we should have left then! However, I know they had only been open just over a week so I thought it wouldn't be too bad. Little did I know.   We ordered a satay and salmon roll to start and then chicken green curry. I wanted chicken satay but was told there was no chicken satay and I could have pork instead. Why could they not put chicken on a stick??? Had they run out of pre-prepared chicken satay? We also ordered a bottle of wine.   After around 15 minutes our waiter brought a glass of wine. Oh dear, but not the end of the world as this was easy to fix. He brings the bottle back and then proceeds what seems like at least 5 minutes trying to open it. I have never seen anyone spend so long trying to open a bottle of wine. I almost asked for the corkscrew myself as it was embarrassing to watch him fumble with it. When he finally opened it he then dropped the cork in the wine cooler! He certainly wasn't used to opening wine and by the way he slouched around the restaurant and didn't seem to know what he was doing I got the impression that he hadn't worked in a restaurant before.   By this point the couple at the table next to us had been sitting there around 10 minutes without a menu and if their body language was anything to go by they weren't having a fun evening.The woman next to them was sat with arms folded staring towards the kitchen too.   Had a glass of wine (this was nice) and then another. By this point I'm wondering where on earth the food was. We weren't drinking fast and I know that some sort of food should have arrived before we'd had 2 glasses of wine each. I then see a table opposite (who had arrived quite some time after us) being served food. I check my watch and it is almost 1 hour after we arrived. We call the manager over and ask what is going on and where our food was. He returns to say that there has been a problem with the order being put into the system (ie it wasn't!). I'd had enough by now and say we would like to leave and we'd pay for the wine. He tells us he'll take car of the wine for us and we leave.   This is the first time I have left a restaurant before even eating. I understand that they had only just opened and were bound to have some teething problems but half of the staff seemed completely useless and lacked any experience. There were a couple of people rushing around and looked like they had worked in restaurants before but the majority of them were clueless. No one spotted that we never had any food in almost an hour and the manager was stood practically next to us the entire time!   One more small thing, I was sat on a comfy seat but my husband said the chair he was sitting on was incredibly uncomfortable (he mentioned this just after arriving too so it was nothing to do with the wait).

22evteP6pqYawZR7E4QU9Q.text: The food was drab and not worth the price. The only good thing is the decor. The entire restaurant has a loom theme which is unique and interesting. Overall, take pictures from outside but avoid the food.

v4Q2fVP9ut__bDthxmZzdQ.text: Horrible!  Huge disappointment.  The Tom Ka soup was OK.  But the main dishes were dreadful.  The red curry duck dish was served with, and no joke, only duck SKINS.  There was literally no duck meat in it.  For $18 it should be considered a crime.  The cod for $25 was poor as well.  No taste.  Las Vegas has some amazing food and as a semi-local living here and in LA, I can honestly say I haven't had such a poor experience in a very long time.  Dont waste your time or money!!

PwfiUUFitX4dT5LQL_q-_g.text: Yummy!! Beautiful presentation and amazing taste. Atmosphere is cool and understated. Definitely worth walking thru the casino for dinner (sound like a local snob but didn't mean it that way). Hooked on the coconut water- gives a whole new meaning to the word "refreshing" especially after those Chang beers and spicy soup!! Service is friendly and efficient - another plus

TUxoSEJc6xp1lI7UkqlbtA.text: Taste explosion!  Generous portions. Beautiful setting. Forget Julian Serrano. Eat here.

FZlNPFvHbHZRLT-Tj8iuBQ.text: Finding good food in Vegas without trading in arm or a leg can be difficult to say the least! Lemongrass is in the Aria Hotel which is a beautiful hotel and it is in a great area, the City Center. I tried the Drunken Noodle with Shrimp and I was blown away at how good it was. I was also blown away by how spicy it was even though I was informed it would be medium. Despite this glitch the food was divine and reasonably priced and the service outstanding!

BD0wCPR8PkQhlprnTaYunQ.text: It's unfortunate i only went there once during my stay at the aria. i really wish i had gone back again if time permitted. we ordered our dishes not so spicy but it came out thai spice..which means, it was spicy! forgiving that much, i thought my seafood noodle soup was just perfectly done and the cod fish dish was nice and buttery. The salsa the cod fish came in was really spicy but tasty. The cocktails were also a delight. :)

7YrzMnU29rIDcXhHBsfQBQ.text: For a Thai restaurant being in Aria you would think it would be excellent but that wasn't the case for me. Food was nothing special but what threw me off was other Asian dishes they were selling like chinese style dim sum which was pretty bad. I've eaten at a lot of thai places and this one dissapointed me. Spent about $130 for lunch and left in a bad mood. Service needs to step it up over there too. Will not be going there in the future.

VYiTyetJUVyRN-fyV3KLtA.text: Did not try too many items as our shrimp mousse appetizer and soft shell crab salad were filling and very good.  The mango for the mango and sticky rice could have been sweeter.  Prices were reasonable for Vegas and most of the other customers were Asian.  Service was fast and efficient.

Hnuj6PKVXX9V7ZXNLN-QBA.text: Ok ambiance, good family restaurant. The appetizer prawn wrap was delish, shrimp marinated and fried in a spring roll. I could have eaten 10 of them. The thai omlette was a good concept but was too rich and drenched in oil; it would be much better if it was egg whites only. Our other noodle dish the drunken noodle, it came out cold and the seafood was decent. Service was mediocre, on the slow side. But the pad thai tasted great!

yB_41TZI7oDkMIxHy3gYTg.text: Good service and atmosphere, but overpriced for your typical Americanized Thai food. Save yourself some money and do the 10 minute drive to Chinatown.

U1m0CkCD1J2kC5OWsngCHw.text: overall- OK, not the best Thai restaurant ever. I have tasted much better. Also, the portions are very, very small. I would recommend this for couples. On the expensive side.  By the way, I would definitely recommend reservations if you are reading this. The concierge at Aria said they didn't take reservations...but they did, and we had to wait 45 mins. :(  The service was not very good first of all. My family tried to get a few bowls so we could share the dishes, but they didn't give it to us until we asked a million different waiters ( exaggerating, of course). We were wondering why the waiters were standing around chilling when we asked for bowls...?!  Anyways, we ordered Tom Yum Goong, and Tom Yum Tay ( or something like that) and they basically tasted the same. Tom Yum Goong was a little bit sweeter though. You can choose what spiciness level you want.   We also ordered soft shell crab fried rice, satay chicken, and creamy red curry with prawns (I forget the name in Thai).  Fried rice - I thought it was good, just a bit bland. My family thought it was nothing special. Comes with fried crab pieces on the side.  Satay chicken - the chicken was good, but the peanut sauce wasn't. The bread was good though.  Curry - I thought this was probably the best part of the meal. Delicious. Creamy. It was small, and came with only a  few (maybe a bit more) prawns.  The restaurant was very high class ( in Aria ) and a bit formal dress is probably good ( not necessary, though )  Hope you enjoy this review and it was helpful!! Also, thank you to the first reviewer for helping my family and I decide what to order.

_a-y86kc1qTk52A2nMHTwQ.text: Enjoyed some very tasty food while visiting Aria.  Got my yellow curry fix by ordering the dish w/o fish sauce & added fried tofu to make it vegan.  Had the spring rolls (these were fried - better known as egg rolls) and lemongrass iced tea.  Our non-vegan friends had the beef pho and orange chicken and happily devoured.  Beautiful restaurant and good experience!

Fp_rpFyX3F4gLsyihS3YLg.text: I went here with a bunch of girlfriends for lunch and would have to say I'm not sure I would come back with all the other available restaurants in the area. The service was really good as they refreshed out plates after the appetizers and kept our water glasses full. We ordered the jellyfish which I thought was good and had a slight kick. The Pad Thai was decent and the yellow curry had alot of onions. I did enjoy the crab omelette and drunken noodles though. I also LOVED the watermelon vodka drink. It was SO incredibly refreshing and I would come back here just to get that!!!

PiMLYaJcbGHj4f5fnACwCg.text: I sat at the bar for lunch and the service was great and the food was AWESOME! The soup was huge and I have been craving it ever since I left there! I would highly recommend.

jUjNTbSvdTcTGpnfa2GF_w.text: Compared to all the other Thai restaurants I've been to (monthly all over the world), the food lacked flavor and was overpriced for what you got. The quantity was descent but quality was not up to par. It was oily to make up for the lack of flavor and not great.  I would not come back here with all the amazing restaurants in Vegas. Majorly disappointing.  We had 4 dishes and 2 appetizers; all were disappointing.

jh0oOcQ29pkDn_ensJwZ5A.text: I am really impressed with the service, quality, and of course the food! We ordered the jellyfish which is kinda like the texture of tripe and was a little on the sweet and spicy side. We had the vegetable fried rice which was sooo delicious and had a great smokey flavor. The pad Thai was declicious too although a bit spicy for being ordered as mild. And lastly, we ordered the red curry with duck... Wow so good! We. Would definitely come back again not only because of the food but for also the quality of their customer service.

VKXtYaGivitXqO5KtzT2zg.text: Service is ridiculously slow especially when it's 11am and there's only 4-5 tables present. It took them about 10 min to sit us because the host wasn't even at her post. Food was mediocre at best you'd be better going off strip but if you don't have a car then this is your best bet in aria for asian food.  I wouldn't recommend this place unless you had transportation or hight want to eat Asian food else where.

PC7WJ77ECwSjb731b-I6mg.text: Great food and not too bad of price. We had a group of 8 and had excellent service. Never had to wait for drinks or had to try to flag down the waitress. I ordered the Yellow Curry and loved it.  The reason I didnt score it higher was because we were sat in the front of the restaurant, so EVERYONE walked by you to their table

j4tqsBh-19U-i5jFaD0j0w.text: A solid 3.6 stars.  Tried the Beef Pho, Wonton Noodle Soup (wontons were huge half shrimp, half pork.  Could not finish.  All dining partners were happy also, decent and fresh food, though not over the top delicious.  Would return though.

msOji-XJYM8zDmCMsRz_vQ.text: First off, if a customer intends to order 2 entrees I believe the waitress has no right to tell the customer otherwise. My husband was starving and intended to order 2 dishes.The first thing the waitress pointed out was the serving portions are "really big" and there's no way he can finish it. The waitress even pointed to another table to inform of the size of the dish. Anyhow, he only ordered 1 entree (Won Ton Noodle Soup) and ended up ordering an appetizer (pot stickers). The appetizer arrived and it was very disappointing. The pot stickers had no flavor and was very dry. I'm not 100% sure but I have a feeling the pot stickers are from Costco. Moments later our entrees arrived. The Won Ton Noodle Soup was a disappointment as well. It was bland and had no flavor. Luckily, my dish (Drunken Seafood Noodle) was tasty but it was very oily. I wouldn't return to this establishment for a 2nd try. The experience was just okay and it could of been better. The waitress we had was an older lady with an accent. The wait staff who brought us water were younger and much friendlier.  We only tried this establishment because we had a food credit from staying at the Aria.

YQKC7dmhI7RDaNeqaLWFiw.text: I get the beef pho to-go. Not just because of hangovers but bc I actually like it. And it's one of the few spots on the strip that serves it

1zHzCvVxPvvmfY_t0Iyfzg.text: Mediocre Thai food.  There was nothing amazing about it, but it wasn't bad either.  I wouldn't recommend the thai iced tea- I've had much better.  The place is really snazzy inside.  Good service too and prices weren't too bad considering how expensive Vegas restaurants tend to be.

TIsZgVLCxp88KyoiXPfjuw.text: This was our last dinner in Vegas and we had a craving for Thai. Chose Lemongrass at The Aria based on the menu, and we were not disappointed.  I had the Panang Curry with Duck and honestly, it was the best panang curry I've ever had in my life. Fantastic flavor, even without the duck itself. It was so delicious, I could have eaten probably three more orders of it. We also started off with the veggie spring rolls and they were quite the tasty appetizer.  The place was pretty busy about 7:30pm on a Friday night, so we ate at the bar. Service was excellent - great attitude, very attentive. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our meal.  I will forever be going back to Lemongrass in Vegas, specifically for that panang curry!

sMFxoNiOoQIMILsbGWkDiw.text: So here's the deal.   Went there for lunch one day with clients and it was great food great service.  Ordered a Vietnamese iced coffee to go after that meal so I could push through the afternoon conference sessions.    BUT when I returned the next day to the bar to order another one things went South Fast.   Ordered 2 one for me one for my colleague.  10 minutes later a man shows up and asks if I was it hot or cold (1st warning sign).  Brings me 1 drink that was almost white, no coffee color at all. Says to me when I ask what it was that he is Vietnamese and knows what he's doing.  Really?   Now we have to wait for the 2nd one he forgot to make.   Bartender says he just got there and isn't helpful at all.  I paid and left.   One rude waiter can change a restaurant experience.

VUYfuhiueYvP3PXszV_-WA.text: Went there for dinner. Service was good after our order was taken, but it took a while for the waiter to come to us in the first place. We had the Salmon Spring Rolls and Satay Chicken appies and they were awesome. I would have prefered a little more basil in the spring rolls, but considering I usually don't eat salmon, it was amazing. Chicken was very nice and tender - absolutely no meat stuck on the stick when removing it and served with a very nice dipping sauce.  Main courses were Grilled Pork Neck, which was very nice, but on the salty side. And had the Drunken Noodle with Seafood, which was more interesting than I expected. However, I asked for something with a bit of heat but not too spicy, and ended up with something that had 0 spice to it.  It came out to be about $35/head. Overall, I thought the appies were better... they are what bumped my rating up from 3-star to 4.

ogZJI_6u3UeF9JvQuzfkmg.text: Stop by here if you like Thai food and if you are near Aria.!  Prices are reasonable, for good Thai Food. This is where I discovered my love for   TOM KHA GAI  (coconut, chicken, thai garlic, mushroom and lemongrass, i  dont like mushrooms and if you dont too, still try it cuz its not one to miss) So much flavor.  Also ordered the salmon spring rolls, satay, and pad thai (pad thai was nothing special, but still good =).  Service: waiter look straight out of animae comic book very polite, food took awhile but well worth the wait!  Ambiance was very clean, simple and cozy.  Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom Kha Gai...So good!! I fell in love... So much flavor
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SATAY

gIOBSmxP6aQQXZUa1Vkifw.text: Food was great. I recommend the chicken satay with peanut sauce appetizer.   I had their watermelon and cucumber drink. It was refreshing and not too sweet.

Yj3jd0PlXlyg88ey3x9gWA.text: came back with my BFF. They offer Dim Sum for lunch now. There' sonly 1 Dim Sum cart goes around the dining room. Limited choices, & we ordered:  - Xiu mai - mediocre, - Fung Chao - chicken feet - no taste to it, - Hao Cao - shrimp dumpling - wasn't even hot. - Schezwan beef noodle soup - Thai Fried Rice - the best one of all.  I was surprised that it was supposed to be a Thai restaurant, but the menu offers from Vietnamese to Chinese, Thai to Singaporean.  Service was good, but the food wasn't, even we were hung over!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Schezuan Beef Noodle Soup
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Xiu Mai Dim Sum
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fung Chao - Chicken Feet Dim Sum

y4yANQvdJfeLKpwvwEos2Q.text: Came here to order take-out since we didn't have time for a sit down meal and the neighboring Chinese restaurant was overpriced and didn't have take-out.  Service at the front desk was excellent. I ordered the chicken satay which was good, even if the bread was soggy once I had made it back to my room.  Overall, an A-OK experience.

k4zf5MVU6y7YES_5-trjYA.text: The atmosphere is very nice, but my pad thai haf no flavor at all. If you have a car drive to Lotus of Siam.

3UkKkoVVRhlOpGEvtsP9AA.text: Stopped in with a coworker on our way to a meeting. I explained we were in a rush and the were very happy to help. The service was fantastic, the food came out very quickly and it tasted great.   Five star service, four star food.  I'd definitely go back, especially if I had more time to enjoy the experience.

HXq2xg3fQQcb4BPHsda-CA.text: very unaccommodating with people with food allergies they cook with soy oil all the good is pre-prep and they're unwilling to make any modifications to the accommodate a food allergy.

VwXH85knvCczYuYXbLcksw.text: My best friend just to happened to have planned a Vegas trip the same weekend I was going to be in Vegas, how crazy is that?!  She was staying at the Aria and we decided on going to Lemongrass for dinner.  There was no wait at 7:45/8:00PM on a Saturday night which was great!  I would categorize Lemongrass as an Asian Fusion restaurant.  They make a bunch of different Asian dishes.  The food is good but not great.  We ordered a TON of food:  Fried Prawns Jellyfish Spicy Cucumbers Chicken Wings Vegetable Fried Rice Three Cups Chicken Beef Pho Pork and Pickled Vegetable Noodle Soup (Xue Cai Rou Shi Mian) Spicy Beef Noodle Soup (Nu Rou Mian)  The Fried Prawns were YUMMY.  The prawns are huge, and the dipping sauce compliments the flavors so perfectly.  I quite enjoy jellyfish, but this one tasted a little too water-y.  They must've washed the jellyfish and possibly soaked it in tap water, because there was an overwhelming tap water flavor when I bit into the jellyfish.  The Spicy Cucumbers were seasoned with the right mixture of vinegar, sugar and spice.  It actually tasted really similar to the appetizer you'd get from a legit Chinese restaurant.  I got the Beef Pho and was a little underwhelmed.  I felt like I got more beef, tripe, flank, and whatever else they put in my soup than noodles.  And because the beef, tripe, flank etc. looked weird, I had a difficult time wanting to eat it.  I ended up having a big pile of that stuff on my side plate.  The server seemed to be in love with one of the girls and would be SO chipper and smiley with her.  Anything she needed, he'd get for her.  I believe his name is Van.  This was a pleasant dinner, and somewhat affordable.  I think I'd rather try some of the other restaurants at Aria, perhaps the buffet, next time.

1lzRPauqBVYulYMX486hnA.text: It was simply delicious! My husband and I went for dinner and enjoyed everything we ordered thoroughly! We cannot wait to go back again!

w4bgO5xotpIsq86QL6EjXQ.text: Great ambiance and perfect Thai.   Love this place.  The decor is off the charts cool.  The panang curry is the best I've had.  I'm bias since I feel like mine is super good, but this is even better.

l3HNivxz6LcZdnIgc-3uXQ.text: My friends and I were staying at the Aria, and this was one of the only restaurants that didn't require a reservation during lunch. We got right in and were pleasantly surprised.   All of us decided we wanted Dim Sum - almost every single dish that came off the cart was delicious. My favorites happened to be the Pork Buns, Shanghai Steamed Dumplings, & the Vegetarian Roll. I really recommend getting most of the dishes your first go around, so you can decide your favorites and go for seconds. That's the beauty of small plates!   Our bill would've been extremely reasonable had we not gotten multiple rounds of mimosas... oops! Overall, it was a really wonderful experience, and I highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim Sum Lunch

kDr4Zoik0eNcQA8HdlVFpQ.text: The place was great find! My date is on a plant-based diet so that's how I was able to find this place. First, the restaurant itself is really beautiful. It has a nice decor and an upscale atmosphere. Also, their cocktails were great. I forgot what it was called but I had this ginger cocktail that was just amazing. That being said, the food itself was a but of a let down. It was good, but it wasn't any better than other Thai places you could go to with much more reasonable prices. But the ambiance I guess made up for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B0e2TwAaTdmN2POMpjOmKw.text: Came here for a light lunch with my beautiful wife. Located off the casino floor. Very nice place.  We started with the Crispy salmon rolls which have cheddar cheese, Thai basil, and sweet chili dipping sauce. Very good indeed. next we had the Spicy asian cucumber made with cucumber, chili-garlic, vinegar, sesame oil which was very tasty.   For our mains we had  Stir-fried pork, dried bean curd, garlic, bamboo shoots dish which I loved and my wife had the Deep-fried sea bass fillet, shallots, scallions,Yu-Hoi sauce. which was perfectly cooked.  The ambience is nice and it is not too loud even though the casino is right next door.  Service was great 5/5 and Food was good 4/5. Overall 4/5. We will be coming back hr next time we are at the Aria!

RwYDV2vCvl17vE_X5Y2cVA.text: You're in Vegas. Let's save some time.  The best things about Lemongrass are the Watermelon Caipiro and the potstickers. The rest of what we ordered was a tad below mediocre. I would come back and sit at the bar for the other two items though, they were absolutely perfect. If you want a meal, keep walking...

ZxkKlF0QqgTLm2abcyRi2w.text: came here 3x times in a row. Got the yellow curry the first night, was great. Got pad see yew the 2nd, was really not great. Tried the yellow curry the 3rd time, which was a different type of yellow curry. For this kind of prices, and this kind of place the consistency and the quality of the meal be just amazing. Falling short for being a fancy-ish place. Still the most affordable ($20 for a curry) place around the Aria.

Eu8SOeBGV7V16efaRP8Rmg.text: Food was just okay. Not very authentic. Service was just okay. Didn't feel like they were very attentive. We ordered seafood chowfun noodles and chicken wings and thai glass noodles salad. Salad was a little bit sour. Its a bit overpriced but that's because it's inside Aria hotel. We came here twice to order to go and sat down one time but that was because we were too tired to go outside.

LzkcEDOsyWotaa8ZOe9NxA.text: Yum, yum, yum! I was very skeptical about going to this place, as this had a 3 or a 3.5 rating on Yelp. But, oh what the hell, we had a craving for Asian food and we happened to be in Aria. This restaurant is inside Aria.   There are food carts going around and one nice lady asked us what we wanted. We were a bunch of vegetarians, so the only veggie stuff they had was steamed vegetarian bun. Trust me - it was yum, the best steam bun I've ever had.   Pot stickers - decent. Ordered the vegetable fried rice for entree. I really liked it. Not too spicy. Pretty bland but good.   Other than that.. Drunken noodles was good. Panang curry was good too.   I'm happy I visited this place. The ambience was really good too. 3.75/5 overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed buns - vegetarian - BEST ever!
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan fried vegetarian rolls

7vL4CFXLKZpyc4HObW0xPw.text: Really disappointed in the food here. Came here for the second time after having a wonderful meal a few months back with clients. This second time as just nothing short of sad.  Ordered both the Drunken Seafood Noodles and Pad See Ew and both were absolutely flavorless. No seasoning. No sauce. So dry. Tried adding some soy sauce and it still wasn't much help.  Thai Iced Tea and the egg rolls were good. Service good. Entrees awful. Would not come back here again after forking out $60+ for this meal we ended up not eating much of.

hFbbOW2IwWCV7PTndebQgQ.text: Wanted a convenient place to eat lunch that was near our hotel and Lemongrass seemed to fit our budget. The restaurant has fancy decor and ambience due to location inside the Aria I'm guessing. It's spacious inside and there wasn't much people dining in at the same time as us so it was pretty nice and quiet.  Food was mediocre. It reminded me of an Asian mix between Thai and Chinese cuisine, except very overpriced. They also serve dim sum, but my party was not interested. We all ordered and shared a variety of plates, which included the below:  Crispy Marinated Squid $12  Wonton Noodle Soup $16  Young Chow Fried Rice $18  Thai Crab Omelette $19  Honey Walnut Shrimp $25  I've been to traditional Chinese restaurants and had similar if not better Wonton Noodle Soup and Honey Walnut Shrimp for half the cost that Lemongrass charges. Wish they added more wontons and vegetables alongside the noodles in the soup. The rice, squid and shrimp served as decent fillers for lunch. I did not care for the thai crab omelette, but because my tablemate was hungry - she finished it.  Perhaps we ordered the wrong menu items and should have gotten more 'Thai' dishes. As Lemongrass is generally known for their Thai cuisine, maybe we messed up by ordering Chinese here. It was not worth the money. Safe to say, I won't be dining here again if I do see myself back at Aria.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton Noodle Soup $16
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey Walnut Shrimp $25
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai Crab Omelette $19

OZFY3uHTpZwQAKQFzNBH3g.text: Good Thai food with reasonable prices inside the Aria casino that a cup of regular coffee is over $6! One would say what happened to the old days of Vegas that food & shows where almost free & give away to get you over here to gamble! Not anymore.  To get back to the food review, this is our second lunch here as we liked  the food.  My wife ordered vegetarian fried rice and chow main soft noodle with vegetables with add of tofu and both dishes came out good.  The service was good and the servers are very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice Bar
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In the hallway of the restaurant, fresh flowers

Cayif5YxovQkLr5ySSVgUg.text: Yummy but pricey food. Great customer service by the ladies of lemongrass. I wasn't happy with the $12 coconut I bought other than that the chicken fried rice, red curry, and chicken satay were delicious!

4ECXnYU1KIQObT3_OSqNsQ.text: The menu selection is definitely authentic. All the flavour were well balance and for sure the chef do know what's Asian food.
