Comparing to all other Asian restaurants in other hotels in strip. Lemongrass would be the top Asian restaurant. I actually went back 2 times within 5 days in Vegas because food was too good.   Laksa - very aromatic. Good balance of curry and coconut milk. Seafood were fresh and huge portion of season given and generous portion.   Pad se ew - nice flavour. Noodles were soft but chewy. Pork were also tender but not too soft as some restaurant marinate is with lots meat tenderizer. This restaurant still has a bit but only a small amount.   Beef noodle soup - light clean beef broth with chucks of beef brisket and tendon. Very nice flavour and soft. Noodles were ok but the pickled vegetable was the star of the dish. Intense flavour and spiciness but not overpowering.   Screw the so call international buffet in hotel on strip. Spend the money on real food such as lemongrass.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p_V2TjZhSh5s_etwfHeTKQ.text: YUCK What are they thinking ?  Not ONE good thing to eat!  It started with very greasy egg rolls and went to REPULSIVE hot and sour soup that tasted like a dirty bowl of toilet water with 12 scoops of salt.  Asked for diet soda .....got coke and a pissed off waiter. The pad Thai tasted like oyster oil I don't know what to say each dish was GROSS SAVE YOUR GAMBLING MONEY  Go eat at 550 pizza in the same casino  And whatever you do if you have high blood pressure double your dose if you have to eat that nasty food

OJzQwmKm83Soo1_p2aOvnA.text: Came here a few months ago so I am not as up to date as other reviews, but the food was alright. Nothing really amazed me compared to other locations for Asian food on the strip. The seating was nice however and the design of the restaurant is also comfortable. Soups are usually a great choice here.

MvEsAB_sEEHA6C-SOVbzYQ.text: A great spot for some Asian cuisine. Not a visible as other restaurants and resorts as ARIA is bit overshadowed by the Cosmopolitan. With a craving for some asian food in a tough time slot way after lunch and too early for most restaurants opened for dinner. We were able to get in with our co workers. We enjoyed the dumplings that were very tasty, the cocktail creations were great as well. The Thai Panang Chicken Curry dish I had was delicious. The service was great and the atmosphere of the restaurant was really nice as well. A nice touch is the coconut milk served in a real shave coconut. A must try among the variety of many restaurants in the Aria and Crystal Palace.

POslHOG35yL2VMbLfAeIRw.text: WOW - how wonderful not have to make a reservation as I walked up to the desk and was advised the bar was available.  Had a great server Anthony and ordered a nice pot of Oolong tea (as I feel a cold coming), and ordered Chicken Satay which was so Thai authentic it was wonderful, then Crispy Squid which was good but wasn't expecting it to be deep fried and it tasted like grains of sand in the batter which could also be Thai authentic when you buy it on the beach and ordered potstickers which were so yummy.  Service was impeccable and food was 10 out of 10 !!  I will return !!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hxJxXxs3e8j08_AithjZVw.text: The food is nicely priced and the food is very fresh and tasteful! They do takeout for your room with the room order service and you can dine in. Our server was very nice and recommended great food. The duck curry was very good and we ordered shrimp fried rice since it doesn't come with rice. You could order what you want even if it's not in the menu as long as they have the ingredients to make it. Too bad for IPA beer choices as they don't have a selection. But overall everything was perfect. I order food here twice for take out to my room and dined in for lunch. Keep up the good work guys!

Iz1fGSQjjxy4H6aKFunjdw.text: One of my favorite places to eat when I'm staying at the Aria Las Vegas. They are open late so it's great for a late night bite.  They have a lot of dishes ranging from traditional Thai cuisine to Chinese dishes. I particular love the Pad See Ew, easy simple dish that always delivers on flavor. My wife had the basil with beef dish which was ok, the only problem was that they skimped on the beef and overloaded the dish with mushrooms.    The service was decent.  We did wait just a bit longer than were use to but the staff was friendly and accommodating.    The prices at lemongrass aren't bad either considering their in a casino on the strip.  Once again It's a place I recommend if your staying at the Aria.

9--6NGbaCX6wOEufx17Jng.text: Love this place for Thai food on the strip. Lots of vegetarian options, my favorite is the pad thai and also the green curry. The food can be really spicy and I would recommend not going over a "4" on the level of spice...they aren't messing around!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nhVY5XXyM93Zc_NQtTDhEg.text: I ordered food from here to go (while staying at Aria) and it was pretty disappointing overall. I ordered the chicken pad thai (which was bland), vegetable fried rice (which was white rice with a few veggies) and egg rolls. The only thing that was good was the spring rolls, everything else was mediocre. Cost $50. I wouldn't ordered this again!

k5zPRaqCuNtDLf7pRQv4dA.text: Good Thai teas, to give you some extra pep at the tables while cooling you off.  The food was fine to good.   The staff very accommodating.  It was a fun adventure.   My only complaint was there seemed to be a only a few of the 'treasures ' in the entrees.  By that I mean the curry featured lychees and cashew nuts, there were three lychee in the whole dish.  A few more maybe, roughly chopped to disperse them, would have been better received. Same was the story with the cashews.  The sauce was nicely done to a medium spice level- I think I had the panang curry and it was good, but not quite to that next level.  My husband had the pineapple fried rice - it's his favorite in Thailand- here again just a little more pineapple would have made the dish better.  The restaurant is a bit hidden but a nice place to try.

CN5xNPyTw2uyPTg41-6L8A.text: My husband and I went last week when we were staying at the Aria Hotel.  As vegetarians, we were really impressed with their dishes. They were happy to customise pretty much anything on the menu to our preference and it tasted excellent!   The ambience, service and food were all great. The price was an added bonus, unlike other places on the strip- it wasn't stupidly expensive and the quantity of dishes more than sufficient for 2 people.  We would definitely go back the next time we visit Vegas

KiFcLjfrgjk5nuubFZ4a_Q.text: Lemongrass is always my top choice for Thai food when I visit Vegas. Their server, manager and hostess are very friendly and also take care of every details since I walk into the restaurant. even though there are always a long wait at the weekends (so reservation highly recommend!) but it always worth.  i really like their satay, basil beef fried rice and mango sticky rice, instead, i also tried their seafood before, it so delicious.   i dont know why so many people complain this restaurant. but every time i eat here, guests always leave with smile and thank for their good food and services.   you should give them a try !

ypwI1Th92g2y5bPZCwrl7Q.text: Definitely not impressed.  we ordered pad see ew and drunken noodles with seafood. Practically the same looking dishes that arrived at our table.  There was a good amount of seafood in our dishes but as far as flavor goes it falls FLAT!  Oh but the Prawn Rolls WERE good.  We also got a to go curry order, spicy #5 on a scale from 1-10 with 3 being their Medium. The word is 5 wasn't even spicy. At all.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodle with seafood
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood pad see ew
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prawn Rolls

0uRNQ18OCSS07qPQa21x7Q.text: Best Thai restaurant in Vegas!  My girlfriends and I visited Vegas one weekend and we decided to have lunch here since it was conveniently located in the hotel we were staying at. The ambiance of this establishment is very modern with unique decors and embellishments. I definitely felt like dining in a 5-star restaurant at decent entree prices.  We ordered a few dishes to share: basil fried rice, pad thai, three chicken spicy dish along with tom yum soup. The basil fried rice was very flavorful and I could definitely taste the basil! This is probably the best basil fried rice I've had compared to other Thai restaurants I've been to. The pad thai was delish, loved that they put the peanuts and bean sprouts on the side because my dining companions enjoy the noodles without it. The three chicken spicy dish was great! Very flavorful with ample amount of meat. The tom yum was my least favorite, only because it was way to spicy for us! (But that's our fault for ordering it too spicy. They will ask you on a range of 1-10 how spicy you would like your soup.)  Our server was very friendly and sociable. She came around often to replenish our drinks. I would definitely recommend for others to try this place out if you're a fan of Thai food. This restaurant is authentic and uses quality ingredients!  Will definitely be back in the future! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basil fried rice!
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai! Super delish!

tXWgVjQ8Horbf2J_2MNUxw.text: Meh.  Good not great, overall not impressed with quality of food vs price.  Of course in a casino, it's overpriced.

c1FLVRgXZ9qtCnDZO6z1dQ.text: We ate at Lemongrass a few years ago and remembered liking it. But not anymore. I should preface this review by explaining we eat Thai food about once a week, have been to Thailand three times, and consider it one of our favorite kinds of food. We like it because it's so flavorful. It's almost hard to go wrong ordering Thai food. Even Thai food in food courts at shopping malls is pretty good. But not what we had last night. The food at Lemongrass was the worst Thai food I think I've ever had. We ordered chicken Pad Thai and Tom Ka soup. They were both almost tasteless. Literally. I ate some of the Pad Thai simply because I was hungry and only had a few tastes of the soup before pushing it away. The two dishes and a beer cost $50! Rip off.   There are many excellent restaurants in Las Vegas. Don't waste your money and time on Lemongrass.

9NVmmg06sxpk70QMyyKRmw.text: Chicken Satay, Baked Pork Buns, Pineapple Fried Rice, Tom Yam Soup, you cannot go wrong ordering this lineup ... it was so delicious ... Lemongrass is so good I'm shocked it's not 4 star rated or above unless people aren't ordering the right food on the menu, one of our favorite restaurants in the USA!

9QySwrJUmmifAL8CiB7V7w.text: Tom kha chicken soup, chicken cashew, young cho fried rice. Everything was amazing and full of flavor!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry botinical drink, southern Manhattan, spicy cucs!

UYMmuOTvb1kjFdV8KKmd1g.text: Great drunken noodle and ribeye tamarind sauce. Ambience is good. Service is good. Food delivered at timely manner. Good portion. Forgot to snap more photos Bc food were too good and made me forgot everything.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t8dPw2OZee5ZDtYanaKIGQ.text: The decor here is amazing and food is delicious!! Would definitely come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So creative! Whoever designed this is a genius!
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy dessert and fresh fruits!

HelwhzRGxDN-iJgJ2-LOhQ.text: We were in Aria and found this place and decided to give it a try. We ordered spicy shrimp and crispy noodles. The shrimp was really good, we asked for mild so it had a hint of spicy. The noodles were perfect as well. The staff here is really freindly and thr atmosphere inside is really nice. The reason i am giving this place 4 stars is because the portions are really small compared to the price of each dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy shrimp
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy noodles

acZcR1vFjOIYhd2uQJENzw.text: Don't waste your money the Thai food is a joke. No flavor just a hot mess. For $50 you would think it's good but nope bland dry food. Aria you really missed the mark on Thai food. If you can't cook simple Thai favorite dishes. Close your door!! Thai people would throw stones at this place.  I really appreciate the manager commenting about remaking my food but she never offered a refund. Which I was fine with my whole reason to write the review was that the food was really bad and wanted to warn other people. If they can't get it right the first time in a nice hotel. Do you really think they would the second time my experience has been no! But do try the steakhouse at the aria it is very good.

ij9Q0juDetH67AXak2kRGA.text: We were craving delicious Thai food so we sought out this place- definitely glad we did!  Located inside the lovely Aria hotel, Lemongrass is a bit of a walk from the lobby but totally worth it. We didn't have to wait long to be seated and all staff were super friendly. The decor is intimate and interesting, warm environment.  Let's cut to the chase: food and drinks. We each had different drinks and enjoyed each (though I recommend the one with watermelon).  The appetizer was a let down. Marinated jellyfish (which I've had and enjoyed before) was blah. But the main courses made up for that! I absolutely ravished my spicy basil tofu and the girls loved their curry dishes.

tqm_xTwVWwVyjiDgwYQHGw.text: I have been to this restaurant at least three or four times over a period of six or seven years.   The food is terrible.   I don't know why I keep going back. I guess I'm here on business and it's convenient and maybe, just maybe it's improved. But it never did. Thus this review.   Just terrible, unless you have extremely low low foodie expectations.

-C_hRwDjWONoH8lvUOd1uA.text: What a nice place to go to for some authentic Thai food. Located in an area full of fun and artistic architecture, this is a great place to go to for a nice date, hanging out with friends, or to simply enjoy an upscale yet a little casual experience. The music was nice and upbeat, and the waitress very friendly! Not to mention good food and Thai Tea!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What is life without great Thai Tea?
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful flowers. Simple, elegant designs.

2DOsgbhJs8EqoGtN1JcWyg.text: * Price: reasonable comparing to anything else in this resort;   $70 for two (papaya salad, drunken noodle, beef pho and 2 thai ice tea); 4 + star.  * Ambiance: modern , beautiful decor! 4 + star.  * Location: inside of the Aria resort, across from Blossom.  3 star. * Meals: fresh,  tasty,  more like asian medley... not just thai food. There is Chinese and Vietnamese dishes on their menu as well.  Large portion! 4 star. * Service: pleasant, fast and polite! 4+ star.  This is averaged to 4+ star for me. Since it opens until 2 Am, I added another 1/2 star!  We stayed at the Aria to see Jason Mraz concert... so we did not get any discount or perk on resort and food...  We came here around 1 AM and they still sit people! The service was good (some reviewers complained about the service!) The waiters were very polite and pleasant.  Anyway,  our drink and food came out at a good pace. The papaya salad is fresh and perfect. Drunken noodle is basically Thai Parseew which is a flat white noodle stirred fried with seafood in soy sauce.  The beef pho is pretty tasty. The meat is very tender. All portions are large! We were pretty full after the meal! It is quite tasty and comfort especially after a late night drinking! We were glad to have a great meal at this late beside pizza!  We were skeptical at first because of some bad reviews on yelp... but we're surprised about this place. Could not believe they got 1 or 2 star (someone must have had a bad day! )  You can easily spend $50 for a sandwich and salad at Jean Phillips and minimal $100 per person at other joints in Aria! So, c'mmon people... This place is deserved some Kudo!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papaya salad
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pho
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodle with seafood

Wp7las3nSemhUoBe6SkJNg.text: Lemongrass has such amazing Thai! My hubby and I came here for the first time today in the Aria which is absolutely gorgeous. We were seated right away and our server was so sweet she even let me charge my phone! We ordered the sweet sesame chicken which was incredible would totally get it again with brown rice & then we ordered pork soup dumplings which were so good too! I probably wouldn't get the dumplings again just because when you try it once it's kinda all you need (for me anyway!), but will definitely be back. 5 stars!

wGPXbV7aJroOhMC698lOdg.text: I loved the high quality Thai food here and lively evening ambiance. The menu includes pretty standard options - we ordered the spring rolls and fried tofu to start and the green and red curries and tom yum soup for entrees. I was disappointed at first that we were paying $15+ for food we could've ordered at the Thai take out near our hotel, but after my first bite into the spring roll, I realized how perfectly made all of the food was. The spring rolls were wonderfully crispy on the outside and the vegetable filling was soft, but not overdone. The fried tofu was equally scrumptious - crispy on the outside but inside was tofu that melted in my mouth. Both the curries had incredible depth of flavor and were perfectly spicy, with just enough sauce for the veggies and tofu. Everything served in giant bowls so no one leaves hungry. Would absolutely return!

q0YCYLnqNBs3pvXOCTNEPA.text: I really like this place. Girlfriend takes me here every time we are in LV.  Great food that fills you up.  Be careful about the spicy rating, I can eat plenty of hot wings but I ordered Pad Thai at level 3 spicy and I went through my beer and 2 waters pretty quickly.  Food is very good and atmosphere and service is first class.  Really like this place

D4dKtpnMVXiB7x9NSVXIoA.text: Decor and staff is very warm and friendly. Aesthetically, this is an impressive establishment. However all my favorable impressions fell short when the food arrived. I ordered a Thai staple: Red Curry. After the first bite/slurp it seemed to be seriously lacking in flavor and viscosity. This is probably due to the fact it was made with water rather than coconut milk. The complex flavors that make red curry what it is were simply not there.. I don't really have to dissect this further. A big error was made and I'm severely disappointed. I will not be returning for curry here any time soon.

O_2uj1bLPj3TFA7mJxB4-w.text: Ate here last night for dinner. We stayed at the Aria so it was perfect in terms of location and convenience.  I was a little apprehensive because I was expecting overpriced, mediocre Thai food, but I was pleasantly surprised. My tom yum hed soup was absolutely delicious and for $8, it was a hearty, filling portion. I love tom yum soup and they definitely know how to make it at Lemongrass. You can tailor your spice level from 1-10, with 1 being super mild.  Everyone was happy with their food. I'll definitely be back to try more!

bLiQ3C7LbgRS6yUh_NCe6A.text: I come from Seattle, so Vietnamese food there is pretty top notch. That may cloud my judgment of the beef pho here, which I say is mediocre at best. The pho was not steaming hot, so it got to lukewarm temperature faster than I am used to, which is sad because I had a sore throat and hangover and needed something hot. The meat was not bad at all, but the noodles were short and clumped up, which may be due to a colder soup. The broth also had a different taste that I wasn't used to. It did not taste like it was cooked with beef, rather it had a cinnamon-y taste like it was from a soup packet. Overall, the beef pho was not to my liking. It may trick other tourists here in the hotel, but not I. Also, service was decent enough to add a star to this rating.

zZ667U2chh1lhiCwNtZjzg.text: I got into Aria about Midnight and was starving, so as I walked around the amazing complex, I found Lemongrass and was quite impressed. Since it was close to 2 AM, I only ordered a "Snack" of The Tom Kha with Chicken and the Fried Mushrooms. The soup was a serving for two and there were so many mushrooms that they were mounded on the plate! Definitely more than a snack.  The Soup had great flavor, lots of chicken and just enough spice to raise a sweat. The mushrooms had a light delicate batter and a deep earthy flavor. The restaurant itself is beautiful and very wheelchair accessible. Service was friendly an efficient. I will be back for dinner next time I visit Aria.

wdL3V9qk-efdv-6j2Zwe7A.text: Loved this place!! Honestly some of the best Thai food I've had in a while. I had the spicy mushroom soup, green chicken curry, a peanut satay sampler, and the coconut ice cream. It was all amazing. I can already tell I'll be craving their curry for days. A little pricy but worth it for the great food, awesome service, and lovely atmosphere

mCjKnwA6BGTrGoCrKR3rBQ.text: After a night out and skipping dinner, we were starved! We really wanted to try the Mexican restaurant in Aria but they were closing (boo!). After asking which restaurants are still opened we chose Lemongrass.   The decor is pretty and modern. The booths are hard to get into though! You cant just slide in. On the table they have a cup with wooden/bamboo chopsticks. I personally think if it was an upscale Asian restaurant they'd be pretty and reusable but that's my opinion.   We ordered Tom Kha Chicken to start which was awesome. They didn't spoon the soup into individual bowls which I thought was odd. I guess I'm just use to Asian restaurants doing that. For our main course we had black pepper prawns, sweet and sour chicken, some kind of curry, and I think Chow Fun. All tasted good but weren't outstanding. I guess I've had better Thai/ Chinese food with better service for cheaper back home. But then again I have to give them credit for being open so late.   After adding some sodas, beers, and white rice the total was well over $100. Overall I doubt I will return even for late night grub.

aQ-ncVdNyH1Bb7XJ5oSBEQ.text: I should have gave them higher rating but after I finished my dishes and got back to my hotel... I went straight to the toilet and... My stomach did not feel so good. I think maybe because the dish was too oily. The taste is ok. We ordered stir-fried mushroom over rice and yellow curry(I had this one)

1gGCwm4ZyWXfoJS6dsSWCA.text: Lemongrass is billed as the strip's first Thai restaurant at a major resort casino. The restaurant's location is ideal, tucked away from the main casino located adjacent to the high limit baccarat casino, Club Prive (high end gaming), the Sky Suites lobby, and Blossom (chinese restaurant). The decor of the restaurant is decidedly modern, with warm earth tones and decorative pipes serving as walls.   I found the food to be (not to my surprise) very americanized with the exception of the duck and yellow curry, which my party decided to order spicy. The menu allows you to pick your spicy-ness on a scale of 1-10. Because of this, I believe that the higher you go on the hot scale, the more Thai the food will taste. The pineapple fried rice and drunken noodle were bland, and were served in extremely small portions. The orange chicken however was probably the best orange chicken I have ever eaten as the chicken meat was still juicy on the inside.   All in all, I would recommend Lemongrass as a good place to eat Thai food if you care more about overall ambiance than authenticity of the food. Its location next to the Sky Suites lobby makes it convenient if you are staying on that side of Aria. As another added bonus, the restaurant is open for lunch at 11 am and is open late till 2 am so if your craving Thai food to cure your hangover, Lemongrass is the place to go.

XN3mOuRf2JcA9spffbNFWA.text: Duck curry, oh my god! Insanely delicious! A must try, im not a fan of curry but is the right amount of curry and spiciness and the duck nicely tender.   Service very helpful and really know how to pair the food with wine. Not expensive for been on the Strip and specially at the Aria.   Definitely will come back.

42r6XW87vfNXs89jUJY45w.text: Well I wanted this place to be better. The waiter was not friendly, found plastic in my green curry and the food was mediocre for the price. Definitely will be passing on this place in the future.

r8cy9BEgRXnQfVofJXlG9g.text: We didn't really know what to expect from Lemongrass.  We just wanted some Thai food and figured Lemongrass can't be that bad!  After looking through the menu, you can tell that Lemongrass isn't a True authentic Thai restaurant.  There's more of a... Thai Chinese fusion going on here.  Still, we were pretty damn excited since all we had for the last few meals were fast food!  + Tom Kha Chicken - chicken, coconut, lemongrass, galangal.  Solid tom kha.  Not the best I've had but it's solid.  We had 4 and the portion is good for a bowl of soup each! $8 + Panang Duck - coconut red curry, duck, ground peanut, lychee.  My favorite out of all the ones we tried!  I think the duck is fried so it had this crunchy skin and it is very good with the red curry.  No bones!  VERY small portion though, and the curry is more of a paste.  Lychee sits on the side. $20 + Drunken Noodle - spicy rice noodle, prawn, scallop, squid, Thai basil.  Good to share.  Lots of fresh seafood.  We were actually surprised by the amount of seafood! $20 + Three Cups Chicken - bone-in chicken, ginger, basil, sesame oil, Shaoshing wine.  Yes yes, I know this is not Thai, but we did want something Taiwanese for whatever reason so decided to go for it.  Biggest disappointment out of all.  The chicken is fried then stewed in the pot with the ingredients, but the flavors of the garlic and ginger didn't really penetrate through.  Maybe I'm just a little picky since I love this dish normally :P $16  The Thai dishes we ordered were all pretty solid so definitely going that route next time.  We knew it was gonna be expensive and it sorta is.  $20 for the noodles and curry, $16 for the chicken, and $8 for the soup.  We also ordered jasmine rice & brown rice to go with our meal and each portion was $3.  We didn't try any of the alcoholic drinks since we were still sorta recovering from the night before.  Fountain drinks are at $4.50.  Again, a little high but at least there is free refills!  Service was good and the decor/ambiance of the place was pretty nice.

88Z7QT-I8ogI2wLaOElvNQ.text: Just make sure to go past the incompetent hostess at the front with communication problems, who will make you wait for a table for 30 minutes for absolutely no reason, tell you to go take a walk, when there are tables available, and go straight to Eric at the bar. He will take care of you. Thanks Eric!  (And by the way, after we were already at the bar for 10 minutes and ordered apps she tried to come get us for a table.)

2CeAst57f-9ijSJ9TxWDQw.text: The Phad Thai was good. I asked for it to be really spicy and it was super mild. It was also pretty greasy but it was good. The dessert however was where lemongrass won my heart! The coconut ice cream on top of Coconut sticky rice was AH-MAZING!!! Get the dessert! Service was excellent!

u3gvXk5aHGlaaBTEAqUO0w.text: Try pad thai spicey level number 6 togo, great place to go if you want to grab some food to bring up to your room especially after midnight. :-)

a-sbT-3DEqShO3AIEia9zw.text: The vegetarian spring rolls were amazing. They are very quick with the service and very accommodating. Really liked the ambience too .

pJytXtyWpJ32FI0sZChJQw.text: This was one of our last meals on our Vegas trip and we definitely enjoyed it. It was conveniently located in the Aria hotel where we were staying so we decided to give it a try since we love Thai food. The place inside is ultra sheek and modern with a contemporary flare. It's very nicely decorated with nice tables and furnishings all around. This place was delicious overall, we ordered the veggie egg rolls which were very fresh and the chicken pad thai. It's on the pricey side at $18 but you get what you pay for, the quality of the ingredients was superb, everything tasted super fresh. The only thing I didn't love is that our server asked us how spicy we want it on a scale of 1-10 but I didn't think pad thai came spicy at all? We figured we'd give it a kick and told him 5, but we really should have said 2 because our lips were on fire, but in a good way, so I can't truly complain. Next time I would just get it on the mild side. Our friends had the pho and a thai curry dish which they seemed to really enjoy.   Another plus is how fast the food came out which was perfect since we had to catch a cab to the airport and we were in and out within 45 minutes and we took our time eating. However, the place was pretty empty around 2pm on a Monday afternoon so no reservations are needed. If I stay at the Aria again, I will definitely come back. Plus, I read that the executive chef is from Bangkok which shows you that the food will be good and it was.

gq-REVu7h3YDSnmlFUZCGw.text: I'm a local but a friend of mine was staying at Aria so we decided to have lunch here. We ordered the soft shell crab salad, steamed pork bun and the yellow curry with chicken ($34 each). The low rating isn't because the price was high, I don't mind paying if the food is good and the service is up to standard. The yellow curry and the pork bun were very good. Service here is HORRIBLE. Our waitress was so rude and dismissive and we waited 15 minutes to get her attention to pay. Really disappointed and was hoping for more considering the rest of the staff at Aria was so pleasant.

PgV6m1A1ynjLuHOrs3Zdqg.text: Suprisingly the place was not bad. Very nice modern decor and ambiance. My wife loved the curry and compared it to an authentic restaurant in Newport beach that we used to frequent. I really enjoyed there salmon rolls and pad thai wasn't too bad either. Will probably be back....

zZAEHdwGbVW30f3T4mU1CQ.text: We went there for a quick lunch, but turns out the place is really great. We had chicken feet from the dim sum Menu, Soft crab fried rice and tom YUm GOong seafood soup. Seafood is really fresh and all of them are delicious. The service is great, they even separate the soup for you, which is normal here. I will highly recommend soft crab fried rice.

c0TortcyeS6gFH_SWqQ1fg.text: like this place fir to occasional dinners , the place is not expensive and tasty. the lack of customer service makes me rate this place three star

7leiwMjkpS9xLRywzHYOSw.text: So glad we went here, the ambiance and the food were lovely. From appetizer to dessert the food was excellent. I was advised to get the duck, but got a lighter noodle dish.. I wish I tried the duck! Beautiful, romantic place. The small bar next door was also very cool.

iuImDCz1KD-_feCMJk8RMg.text: Its over priced but the quality of food is definitely good. Being from Los Angeles I have tried many different Thai places and where this one shines is that the chef seems to have an understanding of restraint when it comes to seasoning. Often Thai places tend to overdo a lot of the flavors to appeal to people's expectations of what Thai food is "supposed" to be but this place gets it right and adds a definite touch of refinement to the dishes.  I would recommend coming here if you don't mind the price 'cause if you're expecting normal Thai food portions you're going to be disappointed. I went here for lunch and I would recommend the same. Don't go here for a big dinner because you may be disappointed.  I had: Rib Eye (good, small portion), Pad Thai, Coconut Soup (really good, I usually don't like it), Mint beef, Mango Sticky Rice desert (good), & a Thai tea (muted flavor compared to the usual really sweet versions; refined)  All-in-all I do wish more Thai places seasoned their food like this but I would have to pass on eating here again.

HLs2z5t-CPRxVLDaMbwCKg.text: This place has really nice decor. We just wanted to visit Aria since it was new and stopped here for early dinner around 5 PM. The service was very good and they were very attentive. They even asked us for chop sticks!! Good. I can't eat Asian food without chop sticks, I guess I'm Asian lol.   The food was very ordinary. Not worth the overpriced price we paid for for regular Thai food. We ordered the Tom Kha soup with Chicken. Beef skew with some sauce for starter. We had Green Curry and Pad Thai for entree. The Tom Kha was pretty good, and the portion was huge. They gave us a lot, it could serve four people. The Beef Skew or whatever it was called was good too with that sauce. The Green Curry and pad Thai was very ordinary. It couldn't beat regular Thai places around here. We took some to-go for late night snacking since we couldn't finished it but we left it at the roulette table!! Dang.   It was a good new experiment but definitely not a restaurant I would recommend if you're in Vegas. I would say go for lunch or late at night when everything is close. For dinner, go somewhere else. As least their receipt was really thick and nice lol. Don't know if anybody else noticed that.

PwKQ3ridehWyDVDu2Bbg3g.text: I thought that the food here was pretty good, and service was excellent, but I wouldn't have come here if this wasn't one of the only places open at the Aria at 11pm.  We ordered the crab fried rice and the chili shrimp.  The crab rice was good, with chunks of crab meat, but the dish was overall a little bland and benefitted from some chili sauce.  The shrimp was cooked perfectly, but it was overall only marginally better from any neighborhood Thai place but at 2x the price.

31WNueBbzX-FrExYuQXYKw.text: Wow, just wow. I am not one to give out a 5 star review unless it is earned but I was impressed with just about every aspect of Lemongrass. I started my experience off with a Mojito, which was simply delightful and refreshing. The wait was short and we were escorted to our table before our drinks arrived. Of course, a server brought them right over to us. Besides being accommodating, the staff was patient with my indecisiveness and demands. I ordered the Pineapple Fried Rice with chicken instead of sausage. It was absolutely delicious and there was something unique about this even though it seems like a simple enough dish. The individual I went with ordered the Sweet and Sour with shrimp and I just had to give it a try even though I would never think to order it myself. It was very tasty, just the right amount of sauce and there was no sour with not too much sweet, which was nice for me. Overall, I definitely recommend.

XwBHSHDaTAyJ4-LL5aYZ3Q.text: This just hit the spot.  I stopped in for a light meal and decided to enjoy it at the bar.  The bartender was great and made a cocktail suggestion that paired well with my food. The Tom Kha Chicken soup was $8 and large enough that I could have stopped there.  The flavors were bright and balanced and it really hit the spot.  I also had their Spicy Papaya Salad and it truly was spicy.  It tasted so fabulous that I wanted to keep eating, but my tongue finally threw in the towel after the tears started coming.

vG9If6OzkDdfr8I-cAF-oA.text: We had the noodle, curry, and fried rice. They are good except the noodle was really dry. Great service. Relatively rxpensive for the food quality.

nVtzBuUYCzTy-Aa5zKTT2Q.text: I went to this restaurant as i was staying at Aria and was looking for a lighter meal and referenced the zagat ratings for the restaurants in the Aria. Not sure how this restaurant rated a 26 in zagat which is pretty high. I found it to be decent but have found much better thai restaurants elsewhere. I went with an octopus appetizer which was breaded/fried and while light had no distinguishing characteristics. For my main dish, i went with green curry with chicken which had eggplant as one of its main components different but ok. Service was slow and lackluster on a night which was not busy for he restaurant. In my regular use of zagat ratings, i would put this place as a 22-23.

aa1u08gGrcrrkTHcBym4lA.text: Located inside Aria Hotel, next to the Bacarat area.  Not sure why they call themselves a Thai restaurant when, like most Asian restaurants in the various casinos in Vegas, they serve dishes of all diffrent Asian cuisines.  Nevertheless, I was a fan of Lemongrass -- probably one of the few good things I have to say about Aria.   The food was yummy and authentic. I particularly liked the sesame chicken, extra spicy and the beef chow fun.  The tom yum soup was also really good.   Service was horrible -- really, really slow despite not being all that busy. Decor was nice.  There are definitely better Asian restaurants in Vegas.

eS4LhsclEIMnV3BAdBRu7A.text: I had dinner here the last time I went to Vegas over Labor Day weekend. We were in the car on our way there deciding where to go for dinner. One of my friends mentioned that she had dinner there once and that it was pretty good, so we decided that that was where we were going to have dinner.   The food was pretty good, not spectacular seeing as I've been to Thai restaurants that I absolutely love, but it was good. Not something that you couldn't get at your neighborhood Thai restaurant for much cheaper. Don't get me wrong though, price is not a big deal but I believe in getting what you pay for. The food was a bit overpriced but then again, what do you expect, it's Las Vegas! I ordered the Lobster Tom Kha, it was tasty. The only thing that bothered me was usually restaurants take out the inedible parts of the soup such as the lemongrass and galanga but I found myself having to spit them out while I was trying to eat my meal. My boyfriend ordered a fried noodle dish which was tasty, except it was a bit dry.   The decor was really nice but the hotel itself is really nice! The service was good. This is somewhere I might come again in Vegas but not really as a first choice.

nlv5Z534aO14hvFCL6z0qA.text: Beautiful decor and a relaxing atmosphere.  Food was great. Ribeye steak was cooked perfectly and served with amazing little mushrooms.   Service was very poor. They have some sort of cart that comes around offering a table side service but we couldn't understand what the guy was saying...eventually he just walked away.  The other servers were okay. Not on the level of other restaurants in this price range.    Pot stickers appetizer, ribeye for me, some sort of spicy chicken soup for her, and two  "specialty" drinks came to $75 with tip.  I'd go back.

6tSXBrgBBSKgbu8fnSiGxA.text: Just finished a stay at the aria and started out here for lunch. One of the best meals I've had at a Thai restaurant.  Most Thai places I've been to offer Thai hot but never deliver. Ordering here, we asked for a 10 and they definitely delivered. The server at the bar, tony I think his was, was extremely helpful in making dish recommendations.  I had the Beef Basil Fried Rice which was really hot and fresh. My friend had the Green Curry based on his recommendation and it had great coconut flavor.  Will definitely go back again next time I'm in the area!

ZqyIHhH4-ey_aONEQw6RTA.text: This place is great - good food and good service. I'm a bit surprised at the people complaining about the prices - maybe they've never been to Vegas before and would be better served getting $2.50 hot dogs from Casino Royale. This place is definitely reasonably priced for being in a hotel like the Aria, and late hours are an added +. Try the Bua Loi for desert (I have it for breakfast too), it's delicious.

FYpPAaGfAJ7cK9uwy2lNRw.text: This place was like an oasis in the desert.  Delicious cocktails like the Chai Spice that was featured on Vegas' M Life magazine, and thai and chinese inspired dishes that reminded us of home (West La).   It was everything we needed to check out of the craziness of Vegas for a couple hours. We sat at the bar both times we visited, and it was chill.  Exactly what we needed after one too many glitzy restaurants/buffets :)

3Hpibk3rvnyx1jg8PlrYUg.text: i love how all the restaurants at Aria are all so fancy and pretty! i'm all about good food, but i hate how those types of restaurants can be a bit intimidating sometimes. i can't really stand the super dim lighting and how quiet everything is. i'm trying to see what i'm eating here.. and i would actually like to have a normal toned conversation without the fear of every single person in the restaurant hearing about it. the restaurants here are perfect! there's enough space in between tables so that you won't accidentally eavesdrop and while the service is great, it isn't intimidating. the food here is a blend of asian fusion, something i'm not usually a fan of, but their wings and salmon rolls were really really good. i'd have to say that most of their appetizers sound more appealing than the entrees. i should of just ordered a ton of appetizers and skipped the entree altogether

aD-eEHE6nOwK9nSCdHxr7Q.text: We ate here last night with friends and had a lovely dinner. Luckily we went with someone from Thailand, so they could guide us through the menu. The ambiance was lovely and our server was more than attentive. The lobster skewers with the Peanut Sauce was excellent and easily one of my favorite dishes. We also had the Drunken Noodles which were very spicy, but very tasty. My top dish was the Chicken Curry. A definite must have. All in all a good Thai restaurant in a beautiful hotel.

YjagCz5adwGshKYdcAooYQ.text: Located inside Aria.  Service:  3 stars Cleanliness:  5 stars Food:  2 stars  I love Thai food so after looking at the menu I didn't hesitate to ask to be seated.  The ingredients they use are fresh, but unless I came on an off-day everything is WAY TOO SALTY.  I ordered the Tom Yum soup with Tiger Prawns and Basil Pork over steamed rice.  I couldn't believe how salty everything was, it completely overpowered any other flavors (e.g. lemongrass, basil, etc).  I wanted to wash down everything with water, but the waiter only came back once to check on me.  Given the number of choices you have in Las Vegas, I would avoid this place.

ROdTroOVTLVyzkPLy7mfXw.text: I am a big Thai food fan..When I went to Vegas, I had Lemongrass on my must try places when few friends had suggested.Their food is really amazing and the decor and ambience is so inviting.The restaurant was so packed, we were worried we would have to wait too long in spite of having a reservation.But our wait was less than 10 minutes.We ordered prawn rolls and fish cakes for appetizers.They were great and so was their Tom Yam Ghoong Soup.For mains we ordered the soft shell crab fried rice,chili sea bass, crab curry and fried tofu in mushroom sauce.We couldn't stop eating even for a minute and finally when we did we could eat no more..We were stuffed to our mouth and would loved to eat more if our stomachs would have permitted.The food is outstanding and the manager and the entire staff is very friendly.Its on my favorite Thai restaurants list definitely..that reminds me I need to make one.

LhY6f_7sfzDe5HtvJwpUQQ.text: Large generous portions, waiter was slack and slow.. Asked for tea coffee 3 times before we got refills., Food not spicy as requested. Sesame chicken was good however top layer was not hot. not a repeat for this one

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemongrass

8506uPFd-UgewZ5NLU7R3Q.text: Slow service, and the mee goring tasted literally like noodles in tomato sauce. definitely a miss.

cLNkFn9m3bUxjtVDVnmHcw.text: Food was great.  Steam rice was extra- which  is lame. Service was slow - but that is the case at most places in vegas. Overall a great experience.

uLkLlxSFH3Vbh2aDmm_DIg.text: Flavors have great potential, but falls short of excellence.  My dish was dan dan noodles with overcooked noodles-meh.  One friend had drunken noodles which was good.  We had excellent spring rolls.  Our soup was an incredibly tasting tom kha; however,  large chunks (but not large enough to pick out) of lemongrass and makrut (generally considered inedible ) were left in the soup.  The final dish was a great tasting curry.  Six out of ten was too spicy and we are in to spice.  On our visit, it seemed that there is potential for a really great meal here.

WWnKvnwrfb5YSbcf9yeQiw.text: For a Thai Restaurant located at The Aria Resort and Casino I anticipated more. The restaurant's design and interior decor is absolutely gorgeous, but that was expected considering it's located in a beautiful hotel in Vegas.  The service and the food was just ok, It took forever for the server to attend to us and the restaurant wasn't even busy. The background music was so soft and boring my boyfriend and I thought we were going to pass out at the dinner table. We expected a little bit more excitement for our dinner. I ordered the sesame chicken and I thought I was going to get chicken with more ginger and garlic flavors, but instead I was served a huge plate of super sweet fried chicken. I was also disappointed because rice or vegetables weren't accompanied with the meal and the server didn't offer any side with the main dish. Luckily  I was with great company and we made the most out of our dinner experience but I don't think I will be visiting this place again.

0dbBwgiEPx51_gy0-dbaFg.text: If you take out  the settings, this is just like any other mediocre neighborhood restaurant pretending to be different from other Chinese restaurants in the area by calling it Thai, or Vietnamese; when in reality the food is just an unauthentic blend  made for the palette of unsavvy non-Asian customers.  The service is horrible, the food is somewhat tasteless, the presentation lacks any shred of imagination, and to top it all, it is way too overpriced, even for Vegas.  Don't even bother trying it...better go to Panda Express than this place...

a0HitjtJVlzch7gHnD9QzQ.text: We had a terrible experience at Lemongrass. We where a party of 8 people and when we put our names on the list the hostess told us it would be 45 minutes wait, after sitting at the bar for 45 minutes we approached the hostess to ask if the table was ready, (having seen that the restaurant was half empty)  she preceded to tell us that it would be another 45 mins wait. When we confronted her regarding the sudden change she began to argue and tell us that there was no solution, only after we asked to see the manager who came after 15 more minutes, did we get possible seating solutions. The food was good but no good food could over come the poor service experience we had here. We obviously won't be dining there again.

wNem6h01CVTYa5rBrnu70A.text: The food here was pretty delicious, although my only complaints are that the service was a bit slow and the mango sticky rice was no where near as good as other places I've tried it from NYC to LA.

ZRtXTmLzqzDdt3_DRaM1sw.text: The ambiance was great, the decor alone compensated for the lack of taste in the food.  The service was excellent, it's unfortunate that the food was nothing to write about.  I am a foodie and a gourmet cook/baker myself and I probably expected a lot based on the reviews here.  I ordered Tiger Prawns (which didn't seem like they were-usually Tiger Prawns are darker in color) which was really bland. The PIneapple Fried Rice was just okay. I love Thai Cuisine and sadly the taste did not justify the price.  It seemed like it was not an authentic Thai Cuisine.

hqwP_Iuqk4EaMZBeifhEBA.text: lemongrass at aria i thought was a great find. its hard to find a good fancy asian restaurant nowadays. their decor was really cool. very modern just like the rest of the hotel. there are private rooms as well if u have a large party.  their menu is straight to the point. satays, curries, noodles and main entrees. we had the satays for our appetizer. it was really good. each order comes with four. we also had the gyoza. pretty standard. and their fried prawns were amazing. we did our entrees family style. we had the steak with tamarind sauce, and omg it was incredible. one of the best steaks ive had wc is weird because i didnt expect it from an asian place. we also had the singapore noodles. soo good! and their chicken curry. they have the usual spicy scale. we got ours at number 3 and it was pretty darn spicy. i can only imagine their number 10.   we didnt get desserts as we were going to china poblano next door for that but i glanced at the menu and they had pretty good choices too. they had mango sticky rice wc sounded really good.  the prices were actually not as bad as i thought. although they had  110 dollar lobster dishes that im sure are incredible. i think its worth the money as u are getting a more formal and nicer dining experience at an asian restaurant with good quality food and great ambience.

-o9Zv0JYwzl4xLnjA07uIA.text: It was our last day and we were getting ready to leave the hotel and I was starving so we spotted this place and I figured I would order some chicken Pad Kee Mao to go. In the menu they only had seafood but the girl at the front said she would substitute the seafood for chicken, I also asked to make sure it's really spicy.  $20 later I have a fair sized order (for $20 bucks I did expect a lot more) of SEAFOOD Pad Kee Mao and we were in the cab on our way to the airport so there was nothing I could do about bringing it back, I just had to eat it. I will say that it was very flavorful, perfectly spicy and the seafood was fresh but I would have preferred the chicken that I ordered.

wwYuAiRkJ5lNe5ndig9k-g.text: Im a fan of this place, food has been consistently good when i come here.  It is inside the casino and it does loose some authentic ambiance but hey your in vegas.  Ive tried only a small portion of the menu but so far so good.

fZYXGmr6bCKKPoYhWQsiUg.text: Incredible experience at this restaurant. My boyfriend and I shared 3 entrees and they were each outstanding. The spiciness of the food was just right. This is the best Thai food ever had. I stopped eating Thai for a while because none of the restaurants were making the food right, but this place gave me hope on trying new Thai places. The decor is gorgeous and the service was great. I will have to make a stop here whenever I'm in town.

fsqw9buM1FowV-6OtxVyDw.text: Their main course and curry dishes do not come with rice. Recommend yellow curry chicken and pineapple rice.

-l37dXJVKNbpHtZHQK4ANQ.text: Tasty food, good service, and great ambiance.. but be careful with the spice level on the orders. We had it as #7 but it turned out to be way to much. Being Indian I can handle a high spice level but this definitely gave me a good run for my money. So I suggest 3-4 but if you're daring enough or drunk enough lol.. go for the 7 ;)

8Zpq8yv3T36gvqipYjZ9IA.text: My rating may be slightly skewed because this was my first real positive experience with thai food, but we were all completely satisfied with Lemongrass.  The atmosphere felt really upscale without making us feel uncomfortable.  We had the satay chicken and the red curry.  Both were delightful!!  The service was prompt and attentive.  All around good experience!

j_jw836b6duzzdR3_fae-Q.text: My wife and i both love this place. We wind up ordering way too much food because there are so many menu items we enjoy.

INxf-xwXVHO_aOTSSTYlbQ.text: I'm only writing this review to tell everyone to order the spicy coconut lobster soup and Thai iced tea. I just came here for a quick bite, so I can't speak to the rest of the menu, but try these!

H-EzbpUp0_VjMF3B5a-ZXQ.text: I had the yellow curry here and even though it is really hard to mess up this dish, I thought is was pretty good.   I would not come back here to order this particular dish but it was the least expensive sharing item. I thought this place was a bit pricey, but the city center theme was created to be upscale so it is understandable.   I also had the papaya salad that came with the coconut rice. It was very good.   Being a local and having so many great thai food restaurant options, I would never head out to lemongrass just to have lunch. But if the presentation and ambiance is important to you, it would be the way to go.  My friend and I had lunch here and were trying to plan our resolutions for 2010. We were interrupted a bit too much as the waitresses were very eager to please. I don't mine an occasional excuse me, and checking up if the food was OK, but literally interrupted me more than 5 times. I would have preferred that they recognize that we were having a conversation and just refilled my water and took my plates away rather than interrupt me.

2lE9TfF8BU7xzzkQaWM2wQ.text: Really tasty.  This was some of the best Thai food I have had in Vegas, and there is a lot of great Thai food.  I would absolutely come here again should I find myself on the strip.

xA26z-qaS8nUnVfk78nZKQ.text: I am surprised about all the poor reviews.  We have eaten here half a dozen times and the food and service has always been excellent.  The duck curry is flawless.

IhWvPfbHRSgSo59cjoCwBA.text: I had the Mee Goreng entree. Noodles were thicker like pasta (which I wanted) but unfortunately, it tasted like an Italian pasta dish more than the spicy noodles I was craving.. I might go back, but definitely would not recommend that dish.

V--QCnvE6hb6W27B8yzRLg.text: Waiter was rude. Food was just ok. Nothing special at all. Restaurant ambiance very nice but it doesn't live up to expectations. We ordered black pepper shrimp which arrived cold. Ordered coke zero which arrived flat. One other dish (green curry) arrived with a spoon that's normally used by people to eat soup! Have never seen a dish served with that kind of small spoon.

zzF_5swfSqi0DAfej7vMww.text: The meat sticks were awesomely flavorful with nice presentation. The food arrived quickly, hot and fresh. Our server was the best part as he seemed happy and responsive and took great care of our table of 6 easily.  Given this isn't the nicest Thai available, it's still good value and a great location!  I'm also not a seafood eater which the menu choices had plenty to accomodate all tastes.

-H_BF8f8jkNG3AaMo8W4nw.text: We stopped in before Cirque du Soleil's Zarkana show @ the Aria.  It was more of a logistical reason why we ended up at Lemongrass.  Otherwise, I would have chosen a cheaper (and more authentic) Thai restaurant.  Very, very, very expensive for Thai food.  Four people + no drinks = $100.  I understand this is supposed to be a high-class restaurant, but was expecting a better experience overall.  Everyone's meal came out fine.  Everyone enjoyed their meal.  Service was okay.  Our waiter disappeared for long periods at a time, but the water girl frequented our table every few minutes.  Ambiance is nice.  Relaxing, low light.  Up-scale.  A lot of rich white guys taking their escort dates to dinner.  I would have much preferred a mom and pop Thai restaurant.  Better food, and better pricing.

vWt9whISNdtToEsJeJ4zsw.text: The restaurant is beautiful, and the service is great.  The food however is not that great, unless you like sweetened Pad Thai (vegetarian "J") & Basil Beef Fried Rice.  Spring rolls were good, but that's about it.  The food looks beautiful, but it's too Americanized and too sweet.  Perhaps the other dishes are better...For the high price $$$ I think there are better options in Vegas....

2yWqw4anlHzzY8TQc9YlZQ.text: We did the tasting menu and it was very good. The peanut sauce for the Chicken and shrimp satay was so good. Panang curry was delicious. Seafood Tom Yum soup was good, but the seafood pieces were large, which is usually a good thing except when trying to eat hot soup. Atmosphere and service was excellent.

H8Z5d7dV10FXH21vAugJBA.text: Panang curry was out of this world. Nice aesthetics, good food all around, friendly staff. The pad thai wasn't the best, the pad see ew was super delicious too

lsJarB1Zn2zBvAuoVvuJyA.text: Came to this place thinking I was going to have Thai food seeing as it is a Thai restaurant, but we found out that they actually have dim sum every day of the week, so we couldn't resist. I live in Southern California, so I we have plenty of restaurants that have authentic Chinese dim sum and this place actually held its own with them. The dim sum was exactly what I've had at other quality dim sum restaurants. One drawback: dim sum for 3 people ended up costing me over $80....Kind of a pricey lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim Sum lunch

6pNOU6f_1mFzmhBYiy1NBw.text: Average Asian fusion. Has an impressive dimsum selection - shrimp dumplings, bean curd, pan-fried turnip cake were good. Xiao long bao is only average - much better at Red 8 at Encore. Drunken noodle with seafood had plenty of basil and fresh seafood (calamari was excellent), but presentation needs work. Lunch is reasonably priced. Love the setting - very calm, tastefully done. Service was excellent.

yTbolXUquYOGpd1n8FP2Dg.text: Service was poor and food was bland. You would expect better from a restaurant at a 5 star hotel and when you meal is $90 for 2 people.

gA5sVTO9g9VC6QQIZj2sCg.text: I came here once and i had really high hopes for this place. The flavors werent all there and ive had better at the thai place by my house. Super overpriced for what youre getting. The seats are uncomfortable and to speak to anyone else at the table I literally had to lean across the table. It was nice to look at but I wouldnt spend my money there again.

btzKJtVRGPiczwdHafEQtw.text: Great  yellow curry, fried squid was really good and loved the pickled cucumber. service was good as well. Would come back!

oqU7PqSiRDRkv9Rps3WQBw.text: Even thou it's pricey the food is well worth my 5 star review. I read a few review regarding the service but my experience was very good, with very attentive service with clearing dirty plates and bringing  fresh plates. We ordered beef sate,  the portion is a little small but very tasty . The lemongrass coconut soup is also another greatest dish but my 2 favorites the duck pan Penang curry and Thai basil chicken.

7HDAJ1FZP7qDawLJyIdC0Q.text: One Word Jellyfish, 8 bucks probably not going to like it but you have to say you did it. kinda like flavored dry silicone beads. Everything  was really good. satay was excellent. The Kua gui was very good, and super spicy sesame chicken, 7 on a 10 of heat. over all a very good meal, a nice fusion Thai here, the hot spice was awesomely hot, yum, the service was the only iffy part, but everyone was really nice and we had everything we needed.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super spicy Sesame Chicken yum
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kua Gui
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Jellyfish

NL5kWzbQJqPvPrz4i7Kghw.text: I'm a huge Thai food fan, and Lemongrass did not leave me disappointed...in fact it left me wanting more.  We got into Vegas after midnight and by the time we checked in to our hotel it was late and Lemongrass was really the only restaurant open that wasn't a coffee shop.  We sat at the bar and our bartender was fantastic.  He made us his signature watermelon cocktail, and was great company at 1:00 in the morning.  He gave us great advise on what was good on the menu.  We had the spicy asian cucumber salad...AMAZING...for something so simple, it was soooo good!  We also had the yellow chicken curry and basil beef fried rice, and simply put it was fantastic.  I'm so glad this was our only choice, we weren't disappointed.

OvhWl59evCBvlcMMnY1vZg.text: I was here in June, and 6 of us had a business dinner with fine service and tasty food all around.  On this last trip, though...  First we ordered drinks and an appetizer.  They arrived in this order: 1) My date's drink.  2)  The appetizer.  3) My drink, after our appetizer was complete.  At one point during the appetizer, my server stopped by the table to ask if I had received my drink (he should probably know that, right?); when he was informed that I hadn't, it didn't exactly put a spring into his step.  I still had half my cocktail in front of me when dinner arrived, and with it, the wine we had ordered to complement.  The chicken satay appetizer, phad see ew moo and yellow curry were all unremarkable, and a few dollars more than you'd pay for better quality elsewhere.  I wouldn't return.

wsbF1ch-LbtQRg2HJj9Zlw.text: Love Aria.  Best hotel on the strip.  However, the eatery... didn't follow suit. This place is bit expensive for thai and what you get.  Service was just okay, they seemed unorganized.  Maybe cause they're fairly new, but employees seemed unsure of everything.  Got alot of blank looks when I asked a question.  "Can I eat in the Bar?" Blank stare.  "Can I still order off the Early Dinner Menu on Weekends?" Blank stare.  "Wheres the bathroom?" ..... Blank stare.   Skip the early dinner, btw. Too pricey.  Just order off the regular menu.  Or go to Serranos.  That place is awesome.  Service and food are on point there.

pNNwyg6vF0DNFupvdZNIzg.text: I'll just preface this with the fact that I don't really drink. A Long Island after a failed club crawl (review for that to come) plus with a few botched attempts at imbibing took me and me 100% Amazing Asian crew to Lemongrass. They graciously seated us, about 20 minute from closing. We ordered the drunken noodles (how ironic), Singapore noodles, and something else that resembled pho. We also ordered pot stickers, and chicken wings. EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS. This may be slightly biased as I probably would've eaten anything at this time. SO GOOD. SO GOOD. SO FLAVORFUL.

hxEFaueLVr2s3E5Zr-LkIQ.text: Most over rated restaurant at aria we ordered fried rice, drunken noodles and red curry and for appetizers we ordered spring rolls. The spring rolls were greasy and the drunken noodles were super spicy we couldn't even eat more than a bite. Not to forget despite of us complaining for the spice level we got charged for it. Most horrible customer service ever  never going back again

KkyNWpQeZpJGbqknqIDNtw.text: Always great food with low price. Once you eat here you will never like Thai somewhere else.

EFnRxUlwtWp4Bc0lZYcAYg.text: Very expensive and I did not perceive I got either quality or my money's worth. Restaurant is terribly noisy. A conversation is near impossible. This is not a Thai restaurant, as Lemongrass would lead you to believe. Mix and match from Asia. Sort of... Tom sam salad was gritty and not very flavorful. Curry was not bad but plain white rice, to put your curry on, was a la carte at $3.00 per cup with an $18.00 bowl of chicken curry. What a rip. They don't ask you what alcohol you want in your drink. They just pour from the expensive bottle and you find out when the bill comes. Suggested gratuities on the bill start at 18%. Filipina waitress tried to sell us on signing up for their MasterCard so we would not have to pay the $9 per hour parking fee; in 'Self Parking'. This place left a bad taste in my mouth. We won't be return customers.

mQZu_h6POfYRaoAv5L9cQw.text: This is one of my favorite Thai food places. It was very convenient for us because it was located right in lobby at the hotel we were staying at. If you go there the best thing is the Laksa. It was probaly the best laksa i have ever had! 10/10 recoomnedd!

WILVQ4SXReX1dC7ucRnugg.text: Great friendly and helpful staff.  Noodles are awesome.  Coconut ice cream with sticky rice bowl was unbelievable and one of best desserts I have ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

akThTBP10Y45a4AaSjdFvw.text: I wished i remember his name but i was so sick that night i went to this place. He was very caring and accommodating, very great customer service! very well-mannered and very well-trained staff. The food were so good, i had SHRIMP ROLL? i can't remember its name on the menu, and the chow fun was very delicious too! I would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. very classy i love it
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the best!!!

rz-zrR81ASPF8Rdz32OUPQ.text: absolutely try thai basil soup  ~  its a clear broth w basil & lil pork meatballs  made a new friend @blackjack tables who was also stayin @ARIA  ~  so da next day, he dropped by here 2 say HELLO while i was dining w my GF & he tried my fav soup  ~  so when i flew back 2 LA, he stayed & even ordered himself da very same soup + garlic/lime steamed cod  i have visited here a handful of times but im a creature of habit so i tend 2 order da same dishes cuz we only have a party of 2-3 each time i come  ~  some of my frenz werent as content w their orders, tho waitstaff here deserves praise 4 their attentiveness, so i would say i give 3.75-stars

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. made a new friend @blackjack tables, who dropped by 2 say HELLO

QhvjkZm8KK_dBUQNp-j86w.text: I'll start from the beginning. It was a 30 minute wait for two people. The menu looked promising even though there aren't that many good options for vegetarians. The restaurant itself is pretty nice looking and our server was unremarkable (I'm sorry) . As for everything else, what a sad, overpriced disappointment.  The appetizers took a while and were nothing special. My vegetable fried rice was pathetic. It was like something I made in the middle of the night with random things I found in my fridge. I don't think an Asian person made that. It's embarrassing to call that Thai food. The red curry was also mediocre at best and it didn't even come with rice we had to order it extra! Wtf. I've been to a wide variety of Thai places all over the country and this is the most disappointing place I've ever been to. The only way it could have been worse is if we got sick.

iWD34xD0lwAnAWQ--tcsuA.text: Ordered a very hot dish. Came out with 0 spice level.

qlzK8oYEcCiXByCuJCSkRQ.text: Great bartender!!! Drinks are awesome with my buddies. Ordered some dim sum and some soup. Sat at the bar great seating. Very clean and classy restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

--VzRBg_dXKVszRPevsswQ.text: The restaurant is not easy to access unless you are staying in the Aria Sky Suites. The Thai tea was stronger than I've had at other places but that is actually a good thing. The crispy vegetable spring rolls were only crispy on the outmost shell. Then it got gooey chewy quick. Also they charged $3 for some peanut sauce that was pretty weird. More like coconut soup with peanut butter in it than the traditional sense. Do not waste your money on it. Wanted to try the Tom Kha soup but they don't have a cup size portion available. It's go big and waste or go without. Now the Phad Thai was high on the flavor scale to me. There was an ample portion to split between two of us and still couldn't finish the whole plate. The steamed jasmine rice was worth the up charge. The ambiance is pleasant and appealing. Not too noisy.  1 drink, 1 appetizer, 1 entree $50. I've had better for half the price.

rmjjq89uxCffmyBOpbTgfg.text: Lemongrass was recommended as a good place to eat at Aria. Ordered the red curry and pad thai. The food was pretty good. My bf asked for 0 spice on his pad thai but it was spicy.  Curry does not come with rice, make sure you order the side rice if you want rice. The mango coconut sticky rice dessert is a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango coconut sticky rice to go
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red curry

u6BS0PqunKOWD-FpJ-LwxQ.text: The service was good and the food came out fast. Reservation was recommended but it wasn't as busy as some of the other famous strip restaurants.  Pad Thai I had ordered was a 7/10 spicy which simply equated to more Chili peppers.

t72381RHByprh5PX6hlNNQ.text: My friend had a gift certificate to Lemongrass so we decided to have ourselves a Thai feast.   The service here is phenomenal. The server was friendly and quick to take our order and all of our food came out in a sequenced order and in a timely manner. We ordered a seaweed salad and spicy Asian cucumber salad which came out first. Cold and refreshing they were - I absolutely loved the cucumber salad. It had a vinegary dressing and spice to give it a little kick.  Next came out our chicken skewers from the Satay grill which we nibbled on for our appetizer. It came with a peanut dipping sauce that was tangy and delicious!   For our main course we ordered several dishes. Pad Thai (noodles), Pad Pak (veggies), and a few other unfamiliar chicken/veggie dishes. The food came out hot and tasty! The flavors were mild in the majority of the dishes but still very good.  I still prefer the authentic Thai food you'd find in a mom and pop hole in the wall Thai restaurant. Lemongrass is a popular Thai restaurant on the strip that I would definitely recommend to tourists who want to dine at a hotel/casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our main dishes including Pad Thai and Pad Pak
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seaweed Salad and Spicy Asian Cucumber Salad
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Skewers off the Satay

dG5jp9_bWhqXFcbmlxsz5A.text: Very good excellent outstanding flavors, great quality too. Best Tom Kha with chicken soup I've ever had. Great portion sizes and not expensive. Would recommend to anyone, nice atmosphere and excellent service.

8erwlHmf1Ouqv-s-gGI0PQ.text: Yum! Great food and service! Word of advice....when choosing a heat level for your food, don't go above a 7! We ordered a 10 and it was intense!

6xKBQc_VPG3-gQXHfJbIUg.text: This place was absolutely delicious . Our waiter was great ! He recommended me the Lasak which is their specialty , it had scallops , shrimp , squid , tofu , in a coconut curry broth with a little kick . It was to die for ! I loved it ! A must to visit if you are at the Aria

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Pho
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasak
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Friend Squid

uv1PATuumW-uaRbf85xOGA.text: The place is nicely decorated and the service is good. The food was very tasty we had green curry, crab friend rice and pad Thai noodles.  Their spicy levels go from 1-10 where 3 is medium spicy. Their medium spicy is definitely spicy compared to other restaurants where you order medium and it's not spicy at all. I ordered 3 and 4 and I could defined feel the heat!  Reasonably priced and plentiful portions.

YTZWa9TZMlp_o8NQu092sg.text: Look, I know how these Casinos feel about attending to their customers' needs in the sense that they really do not care because everyone dreams of coming here which by the way is an illusion. Being a Vegas resident I have visited Aria at least 25 times since moving here in 2016. I usually go to Sage and Alibi and I have spent quite a few bucks there with an overall outstanding demeanor and generosity however on 12/14/18, a bartender at Lemongrass believed it was "appropriate" for him to order a hostess to kick me out of the whole entire property(Literally)-NOT BECAUSE I DID NOT PAY FOR MY MEAL but just because I was dozing off( That was their explanation). I looked around the restaurant while I was trying to understand their rationale to such conclusion and I could see people being loud and not even ordering a single thing on the menu but all eyes were on me. In a split of a second I was already surrounded by untrained and uneducated guys who believed that can exercise their "shameful" authority that has been given to them to order a Trespass notice because of my refusal to leave even though I know it is a public property but just to ask me to leave without just cause is completely absurd. I called MGM Public Relations Department his morning and I was transferred to a lady at Aria's Security Department who continued on from where they left off on Friday by "preaching" to me how the Organization has every right to ask me to leave if I was found sleeping in a restaurant and how Lemongrass is part of Aria and not an isolated establishment. I hung up on her and called the Property's Public Relations Line again and I was given John McDaniel's' e-mail  and I will be writing other Executives including James Joseph Murren. I deserve nothing but a big apology for the manner I have been ultimately treated

8OfAFTRBhNTKCiGKngez5A.text: Skip the steamed Sea bass. A bit too fishy.   Like the chicken and corn soup. Solid.   We asked for sauteed bokchoy, asparagus and mushroom and it was pretty good.   Nice ambience especially for dinner settings.

pzb2bPvHZwY-vXtKqP41_Q.text: Solid Thai food and good ambiance. Good for lunch, other places are better for dinner time in Vegas. Service slower so make sure to pro-active if you need something so you don't impact your dining experience with frustration.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pad Thai
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork potstickers

ynF9xZuk1TjFbphVE-L9pw.text: First time at Lemongrass for a work lunch/meeting. I have never really eaten much thai food, but I will say that their menu looked very good! A lot of variety. We started off with their Thai Iced Tea and it was probably the best Thai tea I have ever had. Not too sweet, just perfect. For an appetizer, we chose the Prawn (shrimp) skewers and also delicious! I ordered the Garlic Shrimp with brown rice and it was delicious as well! I will definitely be coming back and if not to eat, to get that yummy Thai Iced Tea :)

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu with their delicious Thai Iced Tea

6hQ3bxLc3KCBvVGtQayfvQ.text: Recommended by a colleague so I came thinking of a bowl of noodles. It had a good menu which is not totally catered for Americans only but had a decent spread of Thai, Cantonese and Asian dishes, including laksa and Singapore fried noodles (which I never knew what it was until I was overseas!). I'll have to try the dim sum and dumplings near  Nice ambience with chill out music somewhat like cafe del mare.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wanton noodle soup. Hits the spot!

2Yvg1ocWrTopsRT14I8Bwg.text: I'm sure there are better Thai restaurants in Las Vegas, but I  stay at the Aria once each year for work and Lemongrass is just convenient for me.   I love the option to order from the room and just charge it back to the room.  Pad Thai is just as expected and they remember any modifications I request.  I have ate at the restaurant and liked it, but again, since I'm there for work, take-out works for me.  Request for chopsticks, extra hot sauce, etc.   The prices are pretty high for thai food and they do charge extra for your meat options, but again, this is Vegas... what can you expect?  Overall, I'm happy with the quality of food and the generous portions.  Keep it up, Lemongrass!

Kbwckb6MRvMxWR99vbd7PQ.text: Not only is the decor amazing, but the service attention to your needs and the delicious food make it divine!   My server Parinya, went the extra step to ask if I had food allergies and then made suggestions based on that so I would enjoy my meal! That's service!!!!   I've been in Vegas for 3 days and have eaten at Lemongrass twice already!

KD9oCLsv_AsKc4BagNsOTA.text: I got the Duck Panag Curry and it was easily the tastiest curry I'd ever had. I got it at a 6 which was very spicy but it wasn't a painful spicy. It's hard to describe but some things can be the same level if spicy but you feel it differently. I felt the spice as I ate it, but it didn't linger and bother my lips.  The entree was so good that I came back again a few days later and ordered the same thing. The appetizers were nothing spectacular.

Fb_0DTd3su2n2F37tL9hZQ.text: Very good food, but servers let you feel that you're not important and don't pay attention to you. You can see that they smile because they should. So, we did feel not comfortable there. Next time would deliver food from there, don't really want go there again!

cs9SicTPvzZkuGgoAoXckQ.text: Service is great. Attentive but not intrusive. The food was good- decent variety for decent prices. A bit noisy due to proximity to the casino and it's open design with little sound absorbing materials. Yes, I would eat there again!

KfFMk4A2FNG6qsuIZ_SPQg.text: Food is very delicious. You know it's authentic Thai food when all the waiters are Thai. We always order the duck and it never disappoints! Make sure you can handle your spices! The level of spices can be from not spicy to very spicy.  Cute decor and the waiters are nice, except of one of the waiter was very pushy.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XrnGEFMXvLGcb48NeI9U5A.text: First time at Lemongrass and the food was wonderful! We got the vegetarian bun, Panang curry with tofu, and the pad Thai with shrimp. All were delicious with tons of flavor. Tons of vegetarian options which was great! You sit down and they come around with the dim sum cart and can choose what you would like. They have a list of all the dim sum they offer right on the table so all you have to do is ask for what looks good to you. When ordering you can say how spicy you want the food or not.   If you don't make a reservation, expect to be waiting for a table for at least 30 minutes. Very busy as soon as they open.   Minus one star for the service. The man going around with dim sum and the woman who delivered the food were both super nice, but the waiter left a lot to be desired. Never came by after the food was dropped off to see if everything was okay and never refilled our water until we were almost finished with the meal. Service can really make or break a meal and when spending time and money at a restaurant, the server should treat you with respect and give you the proper attention.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panang curry with tofu

g6s4H8KhMUvuexUvWSgoSQ.text: I think the food here is pretty decent. I've been here several times and was never disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gj6PZLy2DaIR5IbOm4efMg.text: This upscale Asian restaurant is located in the Aria hotel in Las Vegas. The ambiance, customer service, the staff, the food was all good. I ordered the fresh Young coconut juice which was served in an actual coconut. I ordered the Young Chow fried rice. Which was fried rice with pork and shrimp and I added spice level 6. I love spicy. Everything was good with the rice but the shrimp had no flavor. The prawn rolls was good especially with the plum sauce.
