I also tried the veggie spring rolls which was served with a sweet chili sauce. I loved the fried banana with ice cream. The ice cream was on point. I didn't give them a 5 only because my rice could've had a bit more flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lmHbRrdwPSvrbB_GQ7zRAg.text: Good Thai restaurant in aria. We like it, me and my wife for our late night dinners.   Recommend:  Hot & Sour soup.  Tom yum is good.   Black pepper shrimp are good also.  Cashew chicken was ok.  Rib aye steak is perfect on the dot.

8fV5H5M70L2IRe3hwT-oyw.text: This is my friend and I favorite restaurant to go to while in Vegas.  Cesar has been our server the last couple times we were there and is very nice and attentive.  We love the soup dumplings and spicy cucumbers.

LAPC6ZqtsrO_PaGCKUr-7Q.text: While having a walking around and shopping day in Vegas we wanted something different for lunch. We love the smoke free Aria so wandered around and found Lemongrass.  First of all I want everything on this menu so we will be back. The service was incredibly prompt and precise, the dining room busy but not noisy and I noticed they are open until 1am so perfect place to have that late night bowl of soup after a few too many drinks.  We had a light lunch starting with the pork satay skewers which were beautifully presented. Followed up by the assorted dim sum with three perfectly prepared and steamed buns and dumplings, better than I've had in some top end China Town restaurants in major western cities. Topped off with 2 gin martini's made for the perfect Vegas lunch!  Can't wait to return.

Vvnn3YnpJubzEDqSE3px5w.text: Good food, good ambiance. Just one tip, it is spicy. They ask how spicy you like on a scale of 1-10. You would think 5 is moderate but no If you are not the spicy kind ask for 2-3. Overall, great experience. Clean. Nice staff.  Recommended!

Xv2Z0tWpRHEbr0YetyRNUg.text: Food all good but service too sux. We ain't got

h0UBaIRc4kQZmJkWtDzdZg.text: Excellent service, excellent food, excellent design. Clean. Fresh. Organized and after the 100 times I'm eating here as a area addicted guest I can highly recommend everyone to enjoy that amazing restaurant.  More then 5 stars!!

HTivgjUFDUpYcEwzALnzQQ.text: Casual attire is welcome which I was not sure about but all types of apparel were represented. Service was outstanding you couldn't ask for more very attentive but they didn't bug you. Dumplings and spring rolls were amazing. Pad Thai and sweet and sour shrimp were amazing. Portions were good I got 10-12 huge pieces of shrimp with my dinner.  All in all 2 appetizers, two appetizers, one beer and a hot tea were approximately $70. I would have paid more and portions were larger than I expected. No clue why the ratings are considerably higher.

tWXFVkyds-hB2CYm9zLrTg.text: Located in Aria just across from Blossom. We did not make reservations Friday evening, so we waited 30 minutes which was not bad in Vegas. Once seated, it did take a while to get our order in. We ordered har gow, wonton soup, short rib soup, and pad see ew.   The har gow was incredibly juicy. The wrap was smooth, and thin. The shrimp was plump. The wonton soup has excellent flavor. The dumplings were not overpowering and were fresh. The noodles in the soup was a bonus. The rib soup was crazy delicious. The beef was tender and perfectly cooked at medium rare. Their pad see ew not so exciting. The tofu was cut in small cubes and the noodles were a bit dry.   Overall, a nice restaurant for party of 2-4. Nice ambiance with a small full bar.   Check out their drink menu. They have lots of sake selections.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton soup
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Har Gow
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton soup

Y6VdsJJCXAFpb0Nv3sA2Jw.text: The food was okay. The service was... Slightly less than one would hope for and the day I went the demographics of the clientiel eating there was very rude. I am trying not to let other people's behavior interfere with this review but for those wishing to eat here...perhaps be prepared.  The service while they met me with smiles... They were inaudible and eventually asked me to step aside while waiting for my hostess to return. While logical me understands... This could have been done with more finesse.  The food... Beef pho was okay... Like thats the theme here everything is "okay" but nothing to write home about. The Pad Thai... Which for a Thai place should be stellar...was...OKAY. It could have used more spice and flavor... Also. It kind of tasted like Chinese noodles rather than Thai.  The atmosphere/demographics also eating here I found to be rude and pushy. Perhaps it was a fluke.

oKRiFLDSrc36kx6BT03BQg.text: This is definitely not a place to check out if you're looking for authentic and delicious Thai food. My go to dish every time I eat Thai food is drunken noodles so I ordered that here and it was very disappointing. Actually I think it was the first time I ordered drunken noodles and it was not good. We were seated at the bar and the bartender who served us was very attentive and the decor is beautiful but there are much better places to eat in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodles. It was not good :(
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xEOWOOaomqXKMfNks7WuZw.text: The food was very tasty and authentic enough. Pricey for Asian cuisine, but it is in a higher end hotel so expected.

XeX_C1UPOo8IMOaHhoieeA.text: My wife and I were with few friends for Dinner here. The service was prompt and the server explained us the options considering 3 of the 4 were vegetarians and one vegetarian among them does not eat Tofu or Mushrooms.  I got Mee goreng ( spicy) . My friends got Green Curry and two other dishes.  They all liked it.  Prasad

MxOs_b0LOIsI18oCh9W2LA.text: Had dinner here tonight and had a wonderful experience! The restaurant is beautiful and the host staff was nice as well. Our waitress Amber was so kind patient and knowledgable of the menu - she answered all our of our questions and had great recommendations!! I got a watermelon Capiroska to drink and that's basically watermelon and gray goose and that was delicious. My mom got the Berry something - basically gin, blueberries, and soda. That was good but not great could have been a bit sweeter. All drinks were creative and 12 dollars. For dinner we got the Red Duck Curry which is actually yellow and a bit sweet and very delicious. We also got beef pad Thai which was the best pad Thai I've ever had!! They also ask how spicy you want each dish and we got both medium which was perfect. SO recommend this place and can't wait to come back with friends!!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Cairsihka - grey goose and watermelon juice! Delicious!

ZkmtlvaNT-UZtQGcZiCqMA.text: I was hungry when I started, impressed the prices weren't catastrophic. Fried veggie rolls were good.  I left full which was the goal. For asian food in LV do this if you're starving and too lazy to look around. If I was in Aria I'd go here for sure for convenience.   If you like super spicy food just tell them, they'll make it spicy.   Servers were nice.

aD7g4wZvkjx1oSKApv2CtQ.text: Amazing menu! Truly legit Thai! So underrated! They go way beyond the basic stuff to feature authentic Thai cuisine with varying levels of spice. It's overshadowed by the other restaurants but this has been the best meal at the Aria!

g_N8bRM3dDa3XxAJn_vQtw.text: Great authentic Thai food with a very large menu full of many options. Our server was great and helped us decide between dishes and we were not disappointed! I had the drunken noodles with seafood, my mother had an octopus salad (I think) and a some soup I can't remember! But everything was delicious including the drinks. Service was great too. Came here for a late lunch on a Monday and restaurant was very quiet in just the right way.

HERl6dtN1DnbdOWrfqcmFA.text: Great food at a reasonable price. Atmosphere is very peaceful and wait staff friendly and knowledgeable. My wife has a gluten allergy and all staff were very conscientious.  All in all we will definitely recommend this restaurant to those who enjoy some spicy thai!

XqoSxLSxkoAhGYXzMkGq2w.text: Great food, service solid. Had Green Curry with chicken for lunch, food came quickly and got me out in a hurry (had limited time).  Only reason for a 4 rating, I got some pushback from server when I ordered curry with heat level of 10 ( scale of 1-10). She said it would be too hot for me!?!? Curry was nice and spicy, but have certainly have had hotter!

rvDe3iNJiJ5z-eBSyDbsoQ.text: Man this place was good! we ate here twice during our 4-day trip. I had the pork and duck noodle soup and I think it's best I've ever had. The duck was just PERFECT.  We also had dim sum here. Although it was a little more expensive than what we normally see in Seattle, the quality was great. My husband kept telling that for Dim Sum in the middle of the desert, they did an amazing job.   Service staff was great and prices were reasonable for Las Vegas.  .::UPDATE::.  Ok so I had to go back and write about their ROASTED DUCK AND BBQ PORK NOODLE SOUP. I went back home to Seattle and went out to find the best Yelp-Rated place for duck noodle soup.   The result: Vegas was better. Trust me.

F2LKrUtim42ut6ux5S2UvQ.text: Absolutely no taste whatsoever, the foods are very plain, cold and the meats tasted like they have not marinaded or any ingredients have been added.  The service is very slow and lousy, it was not busy period. We don't recommend it. We will never come back unless they change to different Thai chef.

wHZ1hSmPH_2m8kUfHpWiTQ.text: I liked the ambiance. Very pretty and classy but food was mediocre. Tom yum soup has chewy shrimps N lacked the authentic flavor. Chicken basil was also chewy and was mediocre n lacked basil flavor. Brown rice were good. Go there for a nice dining ambiance but don't expect a good quality Thai authentic experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gATQ1IQXSj-YM86gNruWUw.text: Three of us dined here on 5-6-2014: restaurant not busy. We ordered cashew chicken, mushroom and asparagus, bok choy, cucumber salad, and oolong tea. Also brown rice. Food delicious and seasoned nicely. Server excellent; only reason for less than five stars is bus service cleared all utensils before we finished the meal and kept taking plates before we were done.   I'm from Chicago, so I am accustomed to high dining prices, but Wow Vegas takes the extreme pricing to a whole other level. 100.00 high, but food delicious. Waiter did warn me three times that their Jasmine green tea was 25.00 glass.  I skipped it but I was curious what a 25.00 cup of tea tastes like?

yS3AF1H0CbhyX5sJ-mRDcA.text: Coming from SGV and SF, I was a bit underwhelmed by this place.  Although it is decorated to be fancier, being in Vegas.    Service: This is the better part, they were friendly and suggested wines or alcoholic drinks.    Food:  Nothing that stands out too much, although we did do the restaurant week for Vegas, some portions seemed to be small but definitely nothing special.

MIST2YGkHHXDnaJtK2tHNQ.text: I have been here twice, and both times it was amazing!  They have a lot of vegetarian options, but I always get the Pad Thai J. I get a level 2 spicyness because I'm a wimp, but it still has kick!  Service is great, prices are decent for the portion size! Love this place!

kZty8Jfw3V2W1qDWC1EMHA.text: Great ambiance, spectacular food, service can sometimes be mediocre...but overall...best Thai food on the strip...and quite possibly my favorite Thai restaurant in the country.

Tuf1Sx6jFK876blFTUpp6Q.text: I have several favorites at Lemongrass. Pad see ew is so yummy. Beef chow fun  is excellent. Pepper beef udon is outstanding.  Soft shell crab fried rice is probably my favorite, a bit pricey but worth the treat. Oh, the pineapple fried rice is also amazing.  So many more I want to try...like lobster satay. Can't wait to come back. Love the ambiance and service.

Ue_1BXxijGb_qvBK6jtxVg.text: This is a good Thai place. Spring rolls are excellent and so is the staff. The drinks could be stronger, but all-in-all very good.

iFWZR0BksNCM5XRXIfiD3Q.text: I am a Las Vegas local and came here with my mother, brother, aunt, and her husband. My aunt had been here before and she had said it was pretty good...so therefore we all decided to come here for dinner.  We ordered the vegetable spring roll appetizer and that was pretty good. It wasn't as greasy and the sweet chili sauce to go with it was really flavorful.  For a starter, I ordered the Tom Yam Hed soup and honestly it was an explosion of all kinds of flavors. I actually had to stop and kinda sit there wondering what the hell I was eating. I think I may have misread the ingredients because it wasn't something I enjoyed very much (the flavors were so overpowering). My brother had the Tom Kha Chicken soup and said he enjoyed it.  For my main course I had the Pad Thai with Chicken, and honestly I have had WAAAYYYY better Pad Thai here in Las Vegas from hole in the wall Thai places. I felt like it was bland and flavorless. I also asked for it to be super spicy (10/10), and honestly it wasn't spicy at all. I was actually really bummed because I figured a Thai place as upscale as this inside Aria would have some pretty banging Pad Thai...but oh well, I'm going to stick to eating my Thai food from my regular spots here in Vegas.  The rest of the family ordered different curries and they said it was ok. Oh and none of the dishes come with rice so you would have to order the rice as a side. Kinda figured since its upscale and usually upscale tends to be only A la Carte.  Overall, this place was ok. It wasn't anything special and nothing really stuck out to me. Our total bill for 5 people came out to about $170 so the price wasn't too bad. The service was great with a very knowledgable and kind staff.  So will I come back? Maybe...I'll give it another shot some other time if I happen to crave Thai and am inside the Aria.

8VSWkzP1YBHrhd000WNB7g.text: Was a bit weary to eat here after reading some not so great reviews. But we enjoyed it very much. Green papaya salad, a favorites was one of the best ever. Service was pleasant. Ambience soothing.

VisXOCOQ-nXah6gmrnQVww.text: My husband and I went here for Christmas dinner. The wait was going to be 50 minutes so we headed to the bar and spotted an empty two top in the bar section so we asked to be seated there instead. They said OK but were very up front about how busy they were and that service would be slow. We didn't mind since we didn't have plans for after dinner yet.   We ordered the chicken satay with spicy peanut sauce - yum. Next up, we ordered the yellow curry (suggested by the very friendly bartender) and the husband got something with seafood I think. We asked for 8's because we love our Thai food spicy and what we got... was nothing short of amazing. I'm telling you that i've been to Thailand and had their curries... This is on par with the authentic cuisine.   The prices weren't terrible considering you're in Vegas and the ambience was beautiful -- white thick rope tying everything up and dark wood everywhere.   If you like Thai food, don't like being ripped off for subpar food and you're a foodie that doesn't mind waiting a bit between courses, Lemongrass is your perfect Vegas dinner spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken satay with peanut sauce

yeMvoJf86H9vfmFMJNJF0g.text: If I am eating in a hotel like Aria I expect the food to be great! The food was terrible.  We asked for mixed vegetables in garlic sauce and all we got was Chinese broccoli. When we asked the waiter he said the chef did not think one should use other vegetables in that sauce. They did not make us a vegetarian curry either. Spring rolls were too oily!

xXt_pc76uAdOcml3q8Hq9w.text: We had excellent service, the food was mouth-watering and the ambience was pleasant.  Aria is very well-decorated in general, and this restaurant lives up to the rest of the hotel. It is modern, well-lit and tastefully done up.   The wait staff was very attentive, helped us to place our order and refilled our water glasses regularly .   Being Indian, our palates craved spicy food but were advised that on a scale of 1 to 10, 4 was already pretty spicy. So that's what we picked and it was a good decision. The order included chicken satay (perfect and wonderfully presented), Thai yellow curry(very aromatic and garnished with toasted coconut), mushroom basil fried rice (yummy) and cashew chicken (tender and flavorful). All this for a total of $56.00.  Afterwards, while boxing our leftovers, the waiters included utensils and napkins, which was thoughtful.

BaV_kRz-x2ARGieIaZN0jQ.text: As the first Thai Restaurant in the strip, Lemon Grass didn't disappoint. I live in Los Angeles and frequented thai restaurants in Thai Town, obviously, this is not in the same genre. But the dishes that I ordered are tasty and quite satisfying. Again, the price is 2-3 times as much as regular thai restaurants, but still much cheaper than Blossom, the chinese restaurant across the hall. Recommended dish: The thai crab  omelette, the tom kha lobster soup. Pad Thai is decent. Tips: this restaurant opens till 2 AM. Actually during the high season (till Jan 1st, it opened till 6 aM) so if you need spicy thai food to work out the hang over after clubbing, this place will be waiting.

r43WnAChqg16ToDJL1laew.text: AMAZING food.    Very tasty, a bit white-washed.  They allow you to pick from 1-10 on the spicy level and I picked 8 and it wasnt spicy at all.  Other than that its so yum!!  They have dumpling carts where a server comes by and asks which ones you want to try for a relatively low price $4 - $9.  Really good place for Thai on the strip over all!  Ramen type noodles were amazing!

ZJhnlUKXAoON1PPiYZFobw.text: Went there for a late night bite so we chose something that won't be too greasy. The food is alright, not too impressive. The only thing that made me remember this restaurant is that we happen to chat with the chef and he ended up offering us two deserts on the house. :)

igN4-AfTO_AQi2dU3K-eDA.text: We had a comp and weren't starving so we got the insanely priced lobster dish (like $110, if I recall correctly).  It was pretty delicious.  The drinks were great and the service was really good.  If you're looking for a Thai place in Vegas, this is the spot.

YP72cl-kpiFoyLrwM0J_oQ.text: Most of the dishes were very good, service was attentive and the portions generous (granted the prices are on the high side, but I still thought it was a good value). I also really liked the ambience and it is a great reason to check out Aria as well. Would return.

mrrBh8x0ehY1CRPM37reLw.text: This place was in the back and I had to ask a few times where the restaurant was. It was pretty hard to find. I chose this place because someone recommended this place to me. And the Chinese restaurant next to this place was really expensive.   As for the food, It was was decent. For the price, I would not go back to this place. I spend $60 excluding tip for 3 dishes. But I guess $60 in Vegas is pretty good already. None the less, the food was not good enough for me to walk the Strip to Aria.

oEw06VZksTuksaAnYSBkMA.text: Went to this place twice over our weekend stay in Vegas. Once for take out and once for dine-in. We usually stay at MGM, and I'd compare to this restaurant to the Grand Wok in MGM in terms of tiers of restaurants.  Pricing (for Vegas that is) and food were really good! We ordered the yellow curry and pad see ewe one night and green curry and a noodle soup on the next.  The pad see ewe was just okay in the husband's opinion, but the curries and noodle soup dish were pretty tasty.  The spice levels were just how I liked it, and it was HOT, but I kind of wished it was a bit more coconut-flavored.  Nonetheless, the dishes were still great, and they were good meals. Service was great as well.

j5hlyZ5X0KqzT25XOYOLcw.text: Not bad for Vegas.  We enjoyed a variety of different dishes here, although I was not impressed with the silver noodles.  The Tom Yum Goong was good, and the rice dumpling dessert was excellent.  Our servers could have been more relaxed, but we had no complaints.  If you're at ARIA and looking for a decent, casual meal that won't break the bank, I recommend Lemongrass.  They are also open throughout the day.

zX97T7Zunem5zN7r-4EDmA.text: The service was great, food was delish, and decor was nice. You can order your food on a hot scale( 1-10) depending on your ability to take the heat. Really tasty, good quality.

ATosjJidiIHETLdAZOULcA.text: my wife and I heard of this place, went there and loved it. aps were good and the pad thai was great.  right near the poker room also. cool

S87pVylO0qFt9Z3B6mNplg.text: The ambiance is great! You would have thought you'll get the best service too but I guess it is not always the case. We had a late dinner so we didn't really have a difficult time getting a space for a party of 5. We ordered  Tom Yum for a starter.  The waiter managed to brought in the soup, 5 bowls & 5 spoons on our table in one shot. Almost perfect! except he didn't bring a ladle. He turned away but I  called his attention just in time before he disappear from my eye sight, I asked for a ladle, he replied and said " Sorry, there's no ladle in the kitchen.!" Seriously?? We were shocked by what he said, how does he expect us to scoop the soup with? this is just a common sense! Oh well, we decided not to ruin our night just because of that so we just started scooping it with our soup spoon. hmm... Nice Resto inside a 5 star hotel and yet couldn't afford a laddle.. After few minutes, the same waiter came back with a ladle but we were half way done scooping the soup! He probably realized how stupid his excuse was! The main entree came next..the food is mediocre but i will have to give 5 stars on the Thai Crab Omelette, i really enjoyed this one. We also had this Garlic and Lime Steamed cod. It's looks so good! but the taste was a total opposite. We actually  returned and cancelled this menu because the fish was either not fresh or not cooked well... I am mainly giving them 3 stars because of my overall experience..

kIdV0QeTfdaUqyZKW9aZuA.text: If you're a True Asian, you'd want to stay away from this place. The food, and for the price, tastes low quality and without care. If you're into washed down asian flavor, you'll love this place.   actually, it's not even washed down asian flavor, it's more - doesn't taste like asian and doesn't taste like asis fusion. seriously, you'll find better places to eat than this place.

vdutYR2VI0t8je_1JvDZNA.text: great service. this place is open late so you can go just about anytime reasonable. the food is good. the crab fried rice and chicken wings are great. i usually  like to order a lot of finger foods and share some main dishes. there is a lot of variety and the taste is good.

WHo_XcajyWLco4aE-34yEA.text: Decent Thai, though overpriced and a lot of attitude at the door.  When we arrived we saw a hostess desk with one person standing there punching on a computer keyboard and occasionally picking up a telephone but not saying anything on it.  Listenting to messages maybe?  Anyway, she kept doing this for awhile before she finally decided to look up at me, acting somewhat annoyed.  When I asked for a table for two, she responded with "you'll have to wait for the hostess" and went back to her keyboard.  So this is definitely the hostess desk, there's no mistaking it, and she is the only one there.....but ok.  We waited awkwardly for about 5 minutes when another woman walked up. Again we asked for a table for two, and she advised it would be about 20 minutes.  Fine, we'll wait.   We ended up waiting about 40 minutes, during which time, one or the other of the two came up and asked for my name on at least 3 separate  occasions.  Talk about a short memory.  We also saw several people walk up after us and then get seated while we waited.   What was the deal?  Were we dressed too casually?  I'm NOT the type to dress in shorts and a t-shirt to an upscale restaurant just because it's Vegas.  We dressed up for Stripsteak the night before. But this was listed in the CASUAL restaurant category in Aria.  On all of  the hotel restaurant listings and on the Aria tv channel, they categorize the restaurants as either formal or casual, and this was casual.  And it's not like we were that casual.  I was wearing jeans and a polo type shirt.  My wife was dressed failry nicely as she always does.    Anyway, once we finally got through the attitude at the door and were seated, the service was actually very good.  The food was good, but nothing spectacular.  Being from Los Angeles, we're used to good Thai food, and at 1/3 to 1/2 of the price here.  If you live in a city where good Thai is hard to find, this might be a good spot to try, if you don't mind the attitude.

zVfL-C36Ey7cpV3VtqEA8w.text: Pro: it's open late. The food definitely tasted good and the waiter was very friendly.  Cons: EXPENSIVE! I mean I know it is Las Vegas and everything comes a little bit pricy. But the entrees are pretty expensive already, then you have to order a portion of rice. And they only have one kind of rice, no other choices at all, what really surprised me given the location and type of restaurant.

TPGdOg_Bp5YLRrJoxNpXaA.text: This review is based mostly on the service and bua loy dessert. My boyfriend and I went here for restaurant week. We ordered pad thai and chicken curry. We said we wanted the spice mild. Well, the food was not mild. It wasn't that the food wasn't good. It really was, but we couldn't handle the spice. I think I got full off of all the water I drank. The servers were very attentive  and even offered to redo the dish. The bua loy dessert was heavenly though..... It was the best thing ever...... So creamy.... so smooth..... so sweet..... so good.... and it cooled down my mouth from all the spice.....I would come here again but just for dessert.

IITqkOdBj3A1fo1yrYww5Q.text: I ordered the drunken noodles with shrimp - soo good.  totally hit the spot.  The decor is great and even though its in the casino you cant really hear all the noise.

22y8l_UYFaIfLkyKjXpn-g.text: I've eaten here a couple of times, and each time my my expectations have been lowered. The first time I ate here I LOVED lemongrass!! Then, I came again, and again, and this last time- I'm sorry but it was weak. First of all, I REALLY like Thai food, so when I walk in I pretty much know what I'll be ordering. One of the people I was eating with asked the server which of two dishes he recommended; he obliged and recommended the green curry, while basically trashing yellow curry. Well, guess who likes yellow curry? Yep, me! He noted down green curry in our order; but I made him change it cuz he ordered what he wanted, not what I wanted. (first mistake!) He suggested we have rice with the curry- okay- to be expected. Then he suggested we order the soft shell crab fried rice. It's like the guy just wanted to pump us out of our money! It was really annoying. This has been the 2nd time I wasn't happy leaving Lemongrass. I think I'll have to find somewhere else to get my upscale Thai fix.

F6_a9F2-w5MCSdxbZRS0xQ.text: Amazing!  My family ate here twice during our two day stay and we loved it - particularly the dumplings!

EOHvJBE1sWtzCr9fxJps_g.text: Okay, I loved everything we had here, but especially the chili lime steamed cod. Wowie. I could have eaten two of these. It was that good. I ordered it spicy and it definitely was. Delicious!  The ambiance here is great and service is efficient, if not a little too orderly and emotionally detached.   Prices, for the Strip, aren't that bad. I've seen higher for much less quality. I'd return!

-7ClrbRbpvxeyjXYRx8BEg.text: It's a Thai and Chinese food combination restaurant. My girl friend and I had Tom Yung soup, noodle , basil chicken and Thai teas tonight . The food and the service were good. It's a nice and clean environment. Both of us with  the tip spent $105 total. It's a little pricy but we enjoy the food there.

NSJqv0UW_WuJKA10q9WkKw.text: Um No. The Shrimp fried rice was better once I added my Satay peanut sauce. But the  Chicken Satay was the consistency of Rubber- tough, dry, and chewy.  To be located inside the Aria the service  was below expectations. This place is tucked off in a corner down a hallway.  My waiter came twice. Once, at the beginning to take the order and at the end to pick up the check.   I took my food home- hoping I could make it better but no. I guess it was worth a try. But I was a little disappointed I didn't take my money to my usual spot upstairs to the Aria buffet.

AKklQYwqXpBsA_GZHawhCg.text: Aside from waiting for 20 minutes and it being pricey (for the small amount of food you get) the dim sum wasn't half bad. We had the shrimp and chives which were awesome and chicken Satay- both great. The munched chicken and basil bun wasn't my favorite and was literally only 1/4 of a bun for almost $7. The siu mai from the cart wasn't so fresh but had great flavor. Our server was very friendly and super nice- she gets 5 stars!

C56dNjQrHo_2T6-ivWqmIg.text: I really like their food especially dim sum. They always have carts walking around the restaurant which is convenient. For food i give 8/10 . The restaurant is really nice, i'll give around 9/10. But for the waitress/waiter, they're so slow and never come to my table even i was trying to talk to them. I understand that they're busy but i'm one of them that they have to take care. I went there for lunch round 11:10am which they just opened for 10 mins, but they're so busy! I would recommend the restaurant to hire more waiter/waitress.

ESD3NEtbVMoKJE2Sg0v92A.text: Used to come here, and great to see that it's still here and the same. Expensive though, could have gotten like 3 meals instead. But that's what you expect here so no surprises. Portion size not bad either, or I probably wouldn't come. So good, it's 5 stars.

R3zEAUpctJfAqy1Yle3lsg.text: I ordered panang curry and the beef pho.  Both terrible.   First of all. The curry does not come with rice lol  How can I eat curry without rice? Also the pho tastes like jujube and ginger, which we did not expect at all.   Overall, it was waste of money.

EMTPvUHnANS-W3E4uuhMjQ.text: For a Thai restaurant, there seems to be a lot of Chinese items of the menu. Not a bad thing, since there are still Thai items. Lemongrass has the option to order from the main menu, order from a dim sum menu, or both.  The wait on Christmas day for my party of 4 was 10-15 minutes, which was not bad at all since it was packed. The decor around the restaurant is elegant and well placed with an Asian vibe. The booth where we were seated had a very large table (enough for probably 6-8). The condiments available were soy sauce (which was a little strong for my taste) and hot chili sauce. I liked the generic restaurant music that played in the background; it was captivating yet subtle.  My party ordered dim sum before ordering entrees. Each item on the dim sum menu ranged from 4.50 to 6.50, which is a little reasonable. The total is added to the final bill. The chicken feet (four per order) were very tender and flavorful. The sticky rice (2 servings per order) had good flavor and was nice and hot; inside was a slice of sausage, mushroom, and pork (I think it was pork). The scallop dumplings (I think five were served per order) were juicy and tasted just right like scallops are supposed to. We also had the Siu Mai (3 per order) which had a very tender meat filling, but lacked flavor. The steamed buns (3 per order) had a good flavor and the bun itself was cooked just right, but I have had better. Something that caught us off guard would have been that the carts that served the dim sum did not have normal rice. It was off guard for us because rice is the staple starch food in all of Asian cuisine, and to not have it while eating dim sum felt like something was missing (I know it's not an actual dim sum food, but having to wait for the rice to come with the entrees was a little disappointing).  From the main menu, we ordered chicken chow fun ($16) and the tofu and pork (Forgot the name and actual price, but it was $15-20). The portions were big enough to give each person at the table one serving. We were also offered rice, which we then ordered one bowl of brown rice and one bowl of white rice. The chow fun did not have a lot of flavor at all. Even adding soy sauce and chili sauce to it did not bring out a lot of the flavor. The tofu and pork did not have much flavor either. As a matter of fact, there was more tofu than pork served to us.  One thing I do not like about this restaurant would be their silverware. I had the option to use chopsticks, but our serving utensils were silver that were awkwardly heavy at the bottom. Whenever I would want to rest the silverware on my plate, the heavy handle would force the end of the silverware to hit the table. This caused a few accidents moving plates around.  Our service was OK. We were served drinks quickly and even got one round of refills. Unfortunately, whenever the waitress would stop by, she would quickly leave before I could ask for a refill. Even after we were done eating, I wondered where the waitress was to give us our check. Despite these shortcomings, our dishes were quickly cleared by the bussers, so we were not totally ignored. I was a little bummed out that we were not offered dessert.  For a restaurant in Aria, one would only have high expectations of their restaurants. The best part of my dining experience here was the dim sum, but I think with how much money we paid, the best part should have been our entrees from the main menu. I feel like I can go to Chinatown and order the same food and it would taste better than how it was made here and it would only cost a fraction of the price. Service, like I said, was OK, and I get that I went here on a holiday, but going to a place like Aria, one only expects something better than what everyone else has to offer. Lemongrass was not absolutely amazing, but left me with a little disappointment. I'm not coming back here.

rIagp9oZ4qkkBQvQ_zlZpg.text: Let me start off by saying that this was not our first visit to lemongrass. I am not sure if the the chef has changed or what but this time the food was absolutely sub par!!!! Really really no flavor at all. The service was so slow, we were 9 ppl and had 3 orders of 3 dishes and it too them 45 min to get it out. We told the lady who seated us that I was my aunt's 62nf bday so can we have some dessert out for her, then we reminded our server and even before that we had the hotel concierge call the restaurant about it buy NOTHING ! They just handed us the bill. The staff there needs to learn how to smile. Very very disappointed!!! Both in the service and the food. We were there sat Jan 6th 2018

c8K4no_8Uw6VWQRrmgMZXg.text: Shrimp Pad Thai and Black Pepper Shrimp was delicious but watch how spicy you ask for it. I always order extra spicy when I order my food but on a scale of 1-10...I did a 5, and it was very spicy. Food came very fast and staff was friendly. I will definitely be back !

Vw46cmmdbQSHxDrEjfWibg.text: All around a great place.   I went there for lunch, the lighting is low, the ambience is quiet and the food was some of the best I've had.  Service was very good, the staff is friendly and helpful. I will go back every time I'm in Vegas.

ncXO5ifAFUtZ78t-pdKoEA.text: Very good dim sum and wonton soup.  It's definitely over priced but that's to be expected considering the location.

urFh06I3F2qK6Ub2w06RrA.text: Long wait. When they finally call you to seat you after a 45 minute wait, they take you to the worst possible tiny table with no privacy. Lacking completely in courtesy or any attempt to accommodate the hotel guests. They get my worst rating for that reason. Avoid if you can!

keL8DdEIfwRKQSsWgmV9Pw.text: Quite possibly the worst meal I've had in Vegas.  The 'crispy' chicken wings are anything but.... soggy skin uck!  The curry was watery with undercooked potatoes and the chow fun was average.  One star for the waiter who was nice.

_vsQVROE1M7hPOLbsz739Q.text: We visited Lemongrass for the first time even though visit Aria quite often. I don't think we will return here any time soon. My husband and I decided to try $49 tasting menu and the dishes were not very tasty. The other couple ordered a la carte. Basil rice was tasty, so was pineapple fried rice. The soups we did not like much. The service is not up to par, no water refills at all, we waited for food for a long time. Not my favorite place for sure

ji3VHe0d_uy6j0juwKz8fQ.text: Love this restaurant! One of my ultimate favorites in town! We have been here many times but most recently this week.   The decore is so beautiful and relaxing, makes you feel like you are miles away from a casino hotel while still in one. Location is tucked down a hallway from the main walkway. Service can be a little slow, and I would suggest calling ahead even if you are only a little bit away because they do get a wait quickly.   This last visit we got our all time favorite dishes: Vegetarian Spring Rolls, Lobster Tom Ka Soup and Panang Duck Curry. I of course got a glass of the Justin Cabernet, he had the best Thai Iced Tea.   They ask you for your preferred spice level 1-10 and say 3 is a medium, we got a 6 on both dishes, as we both love spicy food, and thought it could have been spicier, however be warned we have ordered the same dishes at the same 6 spice level and it was the hottest dish we have ever had, so I think it depends who is cooking that night.   Highly recommend, this is our go to recommendation for all of our out of town guests as well!

PvfR-7JkPcVLBACe5Zxdsg.text: Got in with no reservation...pineapple fried rice was delicious!!!  Service was good.  No complaints!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good...

JjSaYJgb7C9yZxyw8EQ_Aw.text: Modern, dim lit decor and the strands in the front entrance reminds me of noodles hanging down!    It's as good as you can get in terms of having pho on the Strip of Vegas and Vietnamese cuisine fused with other Asian cuisines, such as Chinese and Thai.    They offer dim sum only on Sundays.  I guess it's because that is a family gathering day.  That's my supposition.  Nonetheless, they make the dim sum small plates, such as the pork ribs and tripe pretty good here.  They have chicken feet too!  Made well here as well.  Try it out!  There's no harm - you're in Vegas anyways!  The waitress who assisted us, was great.  She came by our table a lot of times and offered us dim sum too - especially when we didn't even know that they served that up!  Their broth and noodles are actually made well here.  You can tell because the rice noodles in the beef pho, for example, does not get soggy, but still noodle sturdy when it has been in the broth after awhile.    Their chicken wings are crisp and moist on the inside - well cooked all by itself!    As for their Thai dish, such as their Pad Seew Ew, it was flavorful, but lacked the ultimate umph and jalapeno marinated in vinegar zest to it.    Keep this in mind - this place is the remedy if you are craving pho or for fulfilling some good Asian food in you and you are limited within the confines of the Strip!

2CxUeIrE58MloBjxp21XTA.text: Came here on a whim for Thai food which seems a rarity in the strip. Was informed of the 30 min wait but headed to bar which was free to serve food immediately ( was never given this option which would have been nice). However, other than this hiccup food was well made and spicy enough to my tastes...enjoyed the Tom Kha soup and spicy basil. Bartender was polite and attentive. Would happily go back the next time I'm in town or recommend if you want Thai food on the strip.

_3blH5d-nxhdxcZ0rw-FwA.text: They serve super delicious comfort food that is a real treat after a long day navigating the strip. There's also never usually a wait for a party of two and they don't require you to dress fancy, so it's also really convenient. They have a good selection of cocktails which taste excellent and are usually pretty strong. Whether you want dim sum, hot and sour soup, or spring rolls, they deliver and deliver well. Their seafood drunken noodles is a pretty unique offering and when they say that it will be spicy, they mean it! I love a place that isn't afraid to serve me a truly spicy dish when I ask for it. All the food you and your partner's hearts can desire will cost at maximum $150. Highly recommended.

laG9_hAVrDW7hpPILeOFgQ.text: Came here late around 9 pm and it was still packed. Luckily it was only me so i sat at the bar and got a sear right away.  Bartender took my order right away when i was ready.  Got thai iced coffee, crispy fried tofu, and drunken seafood noodle.  The portions are pretty big so i kinda ordered too much food for myself but oh well.  The tofu was good but they didnt give enough sauce for dipping.  The drunken noodle was kinda bland but they gave a lot of seafood so it definitely fills you up.  Its a nice restaurant but probably a one timer for me.  Good but there are so many better restaurants in Vegas to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

As-MMc8mlbJ3Nemg3jHVtw.text: Delicious food with a nice environment paired with fast service and relatively low prices.

a9DixYfYHU-abhglxUJI-g.text: One of my favorites when in Aria Resort the curry Dungeness Crab is a must try but bring a big appetite it's a lot to eat

cjCFC_6wDrjZ9o2O625Uaw.text: Had late dinner here last night around 10pm. We were seated quickly but we waited almost half an hour after we placed our food order. I'd say the shrimp pad thai was probably the best dish of the night though the portion is relatively small for its price. I had high expectation for the crab omelet, soft shell crab salad and garlic Chilean sea bass but was quite disappointed. The crab omelet was way too greasy and the eggs soaked up the oil. Soft shell crab salad was too salty and too sour - the fried soft shell was not crispy either. Garlic Chilean sea bass was the greatest disappointment - it was cold when it's served. With $28, you only got two tiny pieces of fish. The seasoning was also way too heavy that you can't even taste the fish. The chicken curry was decent but not memorable - there was so much more potatoes than chicken...... if you happen to have intense craving for Thai food then this place could be okay but otherwise I wouldn't recommend it for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

28Vc4xQWWHTzif9HLF0tOg.text: I have been visiting Lemongrass for almost a decade, solid 4 stars on food, service is not consistent but usually pretty good. I have tried just about every single item on their menu, and as anywhere else I do have some favorites.   I'll start with the best of the best, make sure to order their Maine  Lobster with ginger & scallions sauce, there is a salt & pepper option but not as yummy.   Noodles, Their Cantonese chow mein is very good,  Pad Thai is good but too sweet for my taste.  Soups, my favorites are Tom Kha chicken or lobster, and their Sweet & Sour, both great, there is also a  vegetarian Tom Kha option, the Wonton noodle soup is also very good, but I like the other two best.  Dessert, sticky mango rice is excellent.  Considering it's location, and portions, menu prices are very good.   There are several excellent restaurants at Aria, however, if you are in the mood for Asian food, Lemongrass is an excellent option.  mangia!

Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot stickers
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chow mein

fAXvelWl41x3nWitHNO7qA.text: Lemongrass is a little hidden gem at Aria. The food is delicious and they have quite the variety to pick from. From Chinese to Thai to even steaks, Lemongrass has something for everyone. I personally tried the Ribeye Steak and it was delicious! However, rather than ordering it alone, I did Signature Tasting Menu which included a starter, appetizer, entree and dessert for $49!  I saw some people saying that this place was overpriced and it's not. Being born and raised here I know that to get the quality food that Lemongrass offers for the price it is at is a great deal on the Strip. Anywhere else will be extremely expensive and charge a fortune.   I definitely recommend this restaurant! One of the best at Aria!

WqXd6yRr7F1uVuh-n-u30g.text: Unfortunately this wasn't great food!  It is across between Thai and Chinese, huh?  We had the Pad Se Ew and Pannang curry. The noodles wasn't bad, actually good. The curry with rib eye didn't work. Didn't even taste like curry and was way overpowered by the coconut and peanuts. I also had to send back the rice which wasn't thoroughly cooked.   My wifey and I were both disappointed since this was the 1st restaurant we tried on this trip!!!

Fv8KomPwMfKPjaqkc32lrQ.text: Here is the 3-1-1:   Food: So, for years since staying at Aria we have always walked by this restaurant, but we finally decide to check it as it was open late and what a surprise.... the menu was extensive with a variety of Thai, Chinese, and other South East Asian fare. From stir fry to noodle soup the flavors and variety was impressive. A standout was the beef fried rice (sound generic) but seriously it had charred pieces of rib meat and the rice had a slight crunch which was hard to not keep filling your bowl. From walnut shrimp to duck curry the flavors are legit and it is not your typical overpriced casino Asian restaurants.  Service: Very attentive waiters and your water glass is never empty. For a busy Friday night, you still feel you are not being rushed. The food comes out quickly and piping hot.  Ambiance: Very cool vibe and bright enough where you could red the menu though it looks dark. Comfortable booths and tables and far enough from the casino floor where the noise level is perfect.

SWRQ3GHTYDbRGOSBOdssVg.text: Though I have been here before clearly one of the top Thai restaurants available. The soft shell crab fried rice is screaming(the best in the world hands down). The basil chicken put hotness at a 5 that was above perfect. Pot stickers where amazing. The young coconut was fresh and sweet and the staff were superb. Great TEXTURE and TASTE

8VEH3F74e4mTCkx6dzS0bg.text: Came here for breakfast as I saw they had dimsum.  Pros:  Great location. Good service.  Instead of the dim sum, I ordered the friend rice instead, it was more than acceptable.  Price! reasonably priced, and probably the cheapest meal I had in Vegas!   Cons: Decor didn't really shout 'Asian' restaurant, it was a bit dark and smaller than one would expect.

Pp5Sey7WLEcg8682x86J5g.text: First let me explain why the 4 start and it's because of the server. The server was overpowering and rushing our party of 12 and was not polite by any means for the scale of the restaurant. The moment one of us said can I see a manager he toned down and realized his mistake. I hope the management takes note of this.

1txQF5M2C-G1xrgEh86PHQ.text: If you visit Lemongrass, you must try the Chilean Sea Bass! It's their house special and will not disappoint (be sure to order rice, this dish does not come with it).   Pros:  - Super cheap for the location - Super quick and high quality meat and flavors - Laid back ambiance  - Good for date night or large groups  Cons:  - Dis-organized hostesses  - Not all dishes come with rice - No upsell on drinks, sometimes I was left thirsty!

kVSZR3q6UzCBo7wDXQwH_w.text: I and my wife used to visit Aria Hotel & Casino and enjoy the Thai food in Lemongrass. We went to Lemongrass to eat dinner on this visit too. We ordered Crab curry with hot 7 degrees. The taste was amazing, real crab meat was extremely delicious with cooked vegetables.   The server "Kathleen" who can speak English and Korean perfectly was amazingly kind and very helpful. We went the next day too for late lunch but sever was different but also a good server.  We ordered crab curry, rib eye steak with tamarind sauce, and others. All the food was very delicious, especially the rib eye steak was very soft and very tasty.   I recommend this restaurant strongly compared with the price and the taste.

xVWGBJ5f7PQBT8AApADbCw.text: Very fancy , nice looking place.  The food was not good. Our chicken was rubbery and dry. Got ill before I got out of the Aria hotel and was sick the rest of the night until 4am.  Ruined our last night in Vegas.

luslo05J3PZwhBzVo3bW4Q.text: Plush asian restaurant set in the Aria Casino arena with some seriously delicious food. The ambience is very casual and the super dim lit setting,combined with soft music on the background, makes the whole dining experience very relaxing.You would find a lady going  around the restaurant with a cart of piping hot and amazing dim sums,do try them!  We were here for lunch and ordered a red curry and tom kha soup with tofu. And here comes the important part,when placing your order the waiter would check your desired spice level,  from a scale of 1-10.Be very careful with the number you pick.we picked 7 and boy they are serious about their spicy scale!! We usually consider ourselves very decent with our spice tolerance and they managed to bum us!!! So go with 3-4 if you want a very decent ,no running nose, burning tongue  dining experience. Having said that, the food is very flavorful and delicious. The soup is amazing with flavor bursting with each sip. Their portion sizes are big. I only wish I went with a 4 or 5 spice level.

ovRMk6jUNvl9t_oP8OU3KQ.text: Very calming decor with great lighting. Good for groups or being intimate for conversation. Food was delicious. Not too spicy but full was flavor! Pad Thai was the best thing I ate as well as their soup!

-qXMjNef5xulG4AUuI5IVg.text: We just arrive in Vegas. It's lunch time and I'm craving some Asian food.   Conveniently located where we're staying this trip, within our hotel is Lemongrass, just outside of the Sky Suites entrance at the Aria.   Pretty ambiance. I decided my friend needed to have noodles, an Asian/Filipino tradition because when it's your birthday it represents longer life and more years to come.   We ordered the dim sum sampler. Unfortunately their choices are limited on weekdays; har gow only on Friday's and weekends :( We got siu mai, 3 steamed pork buns and another spinach type of pork dim sum.   My friend also was intrigued to try the jellyfish appetizer which was okay. Served cold topped with sesame seed lightly drizzled or tossed in probably some sesame oil. It was okay as well.   The noodles we ordered were the beef pepper udon. Well obviously a little more peppery than normal. It also had green onions, white onions, and soy beans. It was also just okay.   Overall the taste was blah and non-spectacular. Maybe I've been spoiled from living in the Bay Area where there's great Asian food/ Chinese food and China Towns in Oakland and the city but I was not blown away.   The tastes were only mildly flavored. But maybe so only to cater to the different guests that arrive from all over the world? Idk I hypothesize.  I gave the third star for the ambiance because it is a beautiful venue.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jellyfish
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum platter

lKfoEjx7uZV5_KMhHGcR7Q.text: Really tasty Thai food in the Aria hotel! We enjoyed the Thai basil rice and a curry dish with spring rolls to start.  It was plenty of food for two! Our service was prompt and the ambiance is really romantic and chic.  I'll warn you though that their 1-10 scale for spice is deceiving. I asked for a 7/10 at first and he convinced me to go down to 5/10 and it was still almost too spicy for me to enjoy. We usually order our Thai food "hot" elsewhere so this took me by surprise.

HpPnmsYYy2rQhIKUIkL7bA.text: Yum!  After a few more extravagant meals in Vegas, this was a nice meal of more familiar flavors that really hit the spot.  Considering we had the meal to go, I wish they packed some plates and utensils, but otherwise a great meal!

Ewb9fMnZ1KCKL0rHpDetxQ.text: Excellent service.  Food is geared to westerners. I had pho. Very bland. Hubby had rad nah.  Noodles aren't the authentic wide rice noodles.

trftSVtEln4X9F_S4CIinA.text: I was disappointed in Lemongrass. It does not seem to be a True Thai restaurant. The food was beautifully presented but lacked the excitement and exquisite tastes that Thai food offers. The decor was also very nice and the wait staff excellent. I was just bothered by the lack of True Thai taste.

TXySD-P8AbawTO_c3RiIAw.text: Overpriced and slow service.  Pho was bland and you have to ask for Sriracha otherwise you just have it as is.  Reservations needed even though there's plenty of open seats.  It was weird.  Servers were friendly and place was clean.

ndd5se8fYSFRVGZBQDktfA.text: I came to Lemongrass with a group of girls for a bachelorette party after reading really favorable reviews online.  The ambiance was absolutely beautiful. Nestled right behind the High Rollers Lounge in the Aria hotel, you escape from the hustle and bustle from the casino, and almost forget that you are in Vegas until you hear someone screaming that they've won.  The drink menu had nice options. I have the blueberry gin infused cocktail, simply because it had St. Germain which I'm a sucker for. I was satisfied but not overly impressed.  The food received mixes reviews from our party. I thought it was decent, but I've definitely had better Thai fusion food. The prawn rolls were absolutely delicious, while the pad thai definitely left me with the case of the yawns.  The service was very good. Alex, our server was incredibly nice and patient. He blessed a few of the ladies with insight of which item to choose, the menu could be a tad overwhelming for a first time visitor.   Overall, I gave it 3 stars because I'm not dying to go back, but I wouldn't be opposed visiting if another restaurant is open.

LL02JOvV4EEnw9pfv6WQmg.text: Went in at 1 am and got some of the freshest, highest quality Thai food you can imagine at that time. Waitstaff were great despite the ungodly hour, great portions and vegetarian selection. Ambience was lovely.

bE5edF1m492IJyy27AHr-A.text: Great Food, but service could use some improvement. I would recommend the Chicken Basil and the Spring Rolls, as those were both delicious. Spice it up if you enjoy hot spice also...7+.

iEjQ_dAePTj96lSU1oMkVA.text: I am giving this a 4 stars because the service was great.  The food is good and the ambience is nice.   Just call ahead or place a reservation on Yelp before going.   I was nervous about the reviews but this is a good spot.  They can also make almost any dish vegetarian.  Portions are good size too.   They have a spicy/hot level 1-10.  A 3 is good range and a 4 gets kind of hot (I like spicy for 4 was good for me). It is not that pricey either.    The dessert was very good! I had the sticky rice with coconut ice cream.  We actually came back for the dessert a day later.   Over all nice date spot.

gAumAPt4qAYXf9dvFKrvwQ.text: Some of the best Dim Sum I've had! Every time my girl and I are in Vegas we definitely make a dim sum stop here! Everything on the menu is fresh we've yet to be disappointed! My favorite are the siu Mai and the crab dumplings. They're soft and feel as if they made them there in the spot for you. Normally I'm not a fan of the BBQ pork bun but Lemongrass changed that. I can honestly this place deserves its high rating!

hb9beefW-mJVqvV3H9UVWg.text: Very great food! I've grown up in Guam and none of the foods in the states have been anything like the Thai food back home, but this one almost had it!! The pad se ew was great, Penang was great but Could've used a little more something not sure what it was, the pineapple fried rice was great too the shrimp could've been a bit more cooked. The fried banana with ice cream was so good and the coconut ice cream with sticky rice too! The dumplings were awesome!! Our waitress service wasn't that great though she didn't check on us only to keep bothering us to check if we are going to pay our bill. We asked her to get us drinks and she never got them. We had to ask someone else and another waitress got us our desserts instead. But I would highly recommend eating there it's great!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple fried rice, panang, pad se ew all good!
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork dumpling, shrimp dumpling, and chicken wrap I think. Didn&#39;t care too much for the wrap
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried banana with ice cream and coconut ice cream with sticky rice

lVGAg_0frGdatNjg6I6Qqw.text: Lemongrass is the first Thai concept restaurant within a Las Vegas casino/hotel.  The interior decoration is very beautiful.  It is located within Aria's casino level, near Blossom (Chinese restaurant).  I tried the food during the Aria "Play Days" (essentially a dry run for selected employees and their guest), and honestly thinks that once the initial pre-opening butterflies are worked out, it will be a good restaurant.    I tried the Tom Yum Goong (prawn soup with lemongrass), and the portion is large enough for 2 to share, and it came out nice and hot, just the way a hot soup should be served.  The flavor is good, but not knock your socks off great.  The mushrooms and prawns are really fresh, and the prawns were not overcooked like at most restaurants.  The Chef's Signature Crab Fried Rice was also very good.  It was served piping hot and the rice is not greasy like at most restaurants.  It was one of the best fried rice I have ever tried (but Ding Tai Fung's fried rice is still tops in the fried rice category for me, but Taipei is just too far to travel for a fried rice fix).  The only disappointment for me was the dessert: Mango and Sticky Rice (Khao Niaow Ma Muang).  The mango was surprisingly good (considering that the ones we received for our operation is pretty bad in quality this time of year), but the sticky rice was undercooked and lacking in the traditional coconut milk flavor. This is a very easy recipe to master, so I was very surprised that it was not made at least as good as your typical Thai restaurants.  Anyway, I took a few pictures of other dishes that others ordered, and those look good.  I can't wait to go back and try their other menu offerings once it is open to the public.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A big bowl of Tom Yum Goong with lots of perfectly cooked prawns.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef&#39;s Signature Soft Shell Crab Fried Rice.  Try it!

G4PlNspdJsc4Jr8c9qWVLw.text: Food was just "okay" & the service was very slow, inattentive & mechanical.  It's a shame that our servers didn't take it more to heart to create a nice, memorable dining experience...they seemed to be just going through the motions of the job.

4X30pfWIamWk3LwRE76ClQ.text: Know what's funny? When I'm a few clicks from Chinatown/SGV at home I rarely feel like eating dim sum. Send me to the epicenter of hookers, blow and blowing hookers and I instantly crave it like clockwork (the dim sum, not the prostitutes/drugs); it always hits right around 10:44am on the 1st morning waking up in Vegas. Pft, like I'm gonna leave the Strip to go get sum dim sum...no. NO! YOU CAN'T MAKE ME GET IN THE CAR! No-oh...there's a place in ARIA?! Okie =)  Chinese-Thai fusion -- to my stomach that translates to: dim sum and satay. Asian soul food and tropical shee-at. I feel only the slightest bit bad because LG has been deserving of four stars my previous two visits but with the last one, well, let's just say third time was NOT the charm. Hehehekekekejajajaja. Amirite? Yah, I am totes rite.  Aside from ordering your typical assortment of spherical balls of crap enveloped in cocoons of some sort of rice-based skin (as an Asian I feel pretty ashamed I don't even know what I'm talking about) such as har gow, pork bao, shao mai, turnip cake, etc. you can of course get Thai dishes. No lie, we've probably ordered 90% of the same thing each visit while sometimes changing it up and subbing out a dim sum plate for something else. Can I mention how cute the phrase daan taat is? Egg custard cups...they even look adorable. If I could personify this dish I'd want to squeeze its cheeks, slap it in the face then swiftly punt it into a wall because it's just too gosh darn ky00t. Daan taat in animal form is a maltese =)  To regain focus on the foodles...the beef satay disappointed us this time around. In fact, most of the dim sum disappointed too. Did it taste skanky like a used diaper laced with pencil shavings? Nah, it tasted decent like always but the temp...argh. Such a seemingly simple aspect when serving food but tough to execute correctly on a consistent basis. All the dishes were either a couple of degrees above being lukewarm or getting dangerously close to flat out cold...clearly not the optimal temp to serve dim sum or meat on a stick in a pineapple under the sea. It's almost as though the carts were circling the depths of hell for a few mins too long...and by hell, I mean Lemongrass. And by mins, I mean a maybe a half-hour or so. The worst was the satay -- the surface temp completely turned me off since I felt like I was basically licking a cold cow popsicle...ahhhhh!  It doesn't help that without fail, at least two people order the young coconut. 12 mothafluffin' dollars per...that's a 6 or 8 place bet in crapaud =( I mean, they're alright but I don't see what the big deal is with these stupid nuts. In particular on this last trip the examples we were served weren't ripe so it was tough to scrape the meat off and it wasn't exactly sweet flavored. Kinda slimy too, akin to squid...blech.  Still, I won't let this deter me. Yes, you can bet your sweet fanny I'll be updating LG when I revisit in a few months. Plz to be turning the heat up a few degrees on your stoves and grils?

cIP3WVdiNOJbIAIMRBIbXQ.text: great food-very generous entrees unlike the more expensive restaurants in the hotel. We sat at the bar and Juby the bartender was very kind and pleasant.

IFB6TkM59sc_rI2Ux08KpQ.text: I wanted Pad Thai and this was the only place I could locate on the strip. It was so lame! A complete let down. I frequent a hole in the wall place back home and it is the best. PF Changs is better than lemongrass.

Y0xFZ26MxTEprLiXM9pOcQ.text: Oh my goodness, I loved this restaurant!   My friend and I split one of the Pad Thai dishes, just to have some food in our stomachs (there wasn't a lot of extra room for full stomach in our outfits... if you know what I mean...).  We both ordered the Pink Leopard to drink, that drink was AMAZING.   There was a very short wait, so we grabbed a glass of prosecco down the hall, and they called me when our table was ready. Really great Saturday night dinner.

vwsEGFfeXfH4m8MtaeZlGw.text: Service is horrible. The waiter is taking forever to come to my table.  We waited a while for more water.  They don't even know what is Thai-boat noodle!!!  It's not real Thai-Food if you are looking for real Thai Food.

pwyPcYKsyGZ1k9i9uK7QHw.text: Food, atmosphere, and service were all fantastic! If your looking for a high end Thai restaurant this place is perfect. They use the freshest of ingredients and service is amazing as well.

KpfGrVYjXXc5E3vXLq6K_A.text: oh shoot. this draft is so old. the food was alright, service was slow since we came at that awkward in between lunch and dinner time..i don't remember much except, fresh young coconut was $12

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan dan noodles

TMYCiAU9wQYPQzrtLaWV8Q.text: I'm a big fan of Thai food, so after a week in the U.S. I had been craving a good Green Curry. Unfortunately, I didn't find it at Lemongrass.  The service was excellent, so no complaints there. The food was extremely average though, and definitely not worth the price. We ordered satay chicken and Tom Kha Gai for starters, and green and yellow chicken curries for mains (entrees). All of the meals were well presented, but extremely bland in taste. The Tom Kha soup had too much lime juice, and the curries were both almost tasteless aside from the spiciness (we ordered very mild, as we prefer the taste to the spice). The satay chicken was better, but still much too subtle in terms of flavour.  I wouldn't recommend this if you're looking for somewhere to eat in Vegas, but there aren't many options available if you want Thai food. Disappointing.

dDeCXRHugmRgZiI_Hla86A.text: Great location. Accommodated our two person walk-in party within a few minutes on a Saturday night around 10 PM. We shared the vegetarian spring rolls for an appetizer, for entrees we had the BASIL MEAT with added shrimp and added Jasmine rice (stir-fried spicy Thai basil, bell peppers, abalone mushrooms) and the Sweet and Sour Chicken with added brown rice. I must say that was without a doubt the best shrimp I have ever put in my mouth. It was cooked to perfection. He raved how great the brown rice was, I tried the sweet-and-sour chicken and it was good-definitely not as sweet as your average Asian-American takeout which lends to the authenticity of the meal. Regrettably I didn't take any photos of our food, but it was good enough that if given the chance I would go again.

shvpH9U6c5Le6AimX-R6mg.text: Quite delicious! Our table ordered a chicken satay, tom yum seafood soup, and fried shrimp skewers as appetizers to share. They were all quite delicious; good flavor and tender meats. I ordered a Thai iced tea and a drunken noodle with seafood, and it was pretty good. The Thai iced tea was too sweet for my liking (although I had already asked for half-sweet). The drunken noodle was good and spicy! Good portions too, but pricey (as normal in Vegas). Would recommend if you're looking for some good Thai food!

AxxtFGLJVt70Vf9pYK6_jw.text: The thai spice cocktail was very interesting though by the end I wish I had just gotten thai iced tea. I ordered the pad see ew. I thought the food was ok nothing too special. The restaurant was pretty.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai spice

2xWnBSmF3CwlYlRuYsYtEA.text: All was right until the server sent us the wrong dish and we ate it unknowingly (the curry had beef instead the chicken we ordered). Fortunately our party of 4 didn't have dietary (or religious) restrictions with eating beef, but it left a bad taste in my mouth as he didnt appear to apologize or attempt to compensate for the mistake. Sure your restaurant is in a huge casino resort, but that gives you no right to bad customer servicing. The food was decent, would've enjoyed the experience more had the mishap hadnt happened.

Siqs1dolnHhpratTZyy2Lw.text: A must destination spot on the strip, great food and beautiful ambiance. We suggest the Tom Kha, Phad Thai, and Curry plate

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Phad Thai
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom Kha

gyAZOZCrCe63yvgeZ4wdLg.text: The only reason I didn't give this place 1 star is because they had good service. Food here is not worth the money. The noodles they use are disgusting. My chicken was bland and had a fish texture. The pork they used are all fatty parts. The curry is watered down. And seriously, salmon in egg rolls? What!?  The price is outrageous and the taste does not justify the price, at all. It is hands down the worst Thai food I had in years.  I would compare the food to someone who is not ethnically Thai and tried to make Thai food for the very first time with very little to no instructions.

zP24pqczzqf6dYIC4eS--w.text: Food is overpriced, but service is great. Yellow curry chicken is good. Seafood Drunken Noodles is tasty. Pork buns are not worth the try. Chicken wings are okay. Basil shrimp are large with okay flavor. Spice level 3 out of 10 is the highest I have ever tried, and I like spice. Pink Leopard drink is the best drink in the world and worth dining there to get.

iSKqo30JQ-DUXMXVviGmCA.text: The food was mediocore,at best. You're paying for the loud ambience, which is getting a bit repetitive at each of the restaurants on the Strip.   The chicken wings were the saving glory of the meal, as they were well seasoned and well cooked. The green curry was pretty soupy, and didnt have any other flavor other than the coconut. The basil meat I was most disappointed by, because you could not even taste the basil that was in the dish.

4Vm5ExEN7C75aUw56d8wCA.text: First off we luv this place!  Been coming here whenever Vegas for a few years and it never fails to delivery.  From the freshest coconut water (I'm Caribbean so I know the difference and this is legit), to my fav the salmon spring rolls its always a delight. I'm also addicted to the pineapple rice and the '3 cup chicken'!  On those who are complaining, I honestly can't say what I find wrong and this is literally my nth time in last few years. Everyone I bring here luvs it.  Take out is also awesome.. we do this with my family quite a bit.   I recommend it for when you want some privacy, good service, a bit of class. I'll be back in 4 weeks!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seriously the best fresh coconut food on the strip. Also found great gluten options for my mom!

L1KnF8ySYKMgy0DH8duROA.text: Service at the bar was borderline rude.  Prawn appetizer was greasy.    I told the bartender that I was going to the bathroom and that is be right back.  When I got back, my food had been thrown away.  The decor included a drunken girl slouching asleep at the bar next to me.  Not what I expected.

L9bmWM6U0303FH0CKapG2g.text: Good food...service NEEDS HELP! Very nice/kind servers but you need to train your servers better. Our table and others around us were constantly trying to get server to take order, bring extra plates, bring check, bring drinks...very slow. Was almost uncomfortable and made the evening "awkward". Not gonna make it in Vegas with service like this.

9rOMCRzV7jrR6z4W0JHRHw.text: The food is decently priced. The lowest price I payed while staying in Vegas. The fried rice, chicken/vegetable pad Thai and red curry are all amazing. The chili is actually really spicy if you want spicy ask for level 3. The service was horrible. Our waiter took for ever to come. We asked him not to use any peanuts in the pad Thai and he forgot. We didn't bother telling him because he was M.I.A and took forever to do everything.

1RygQdiqL0pjL43jFlEmJw.text: Pad See Ew: su.pr/15ttFB I bet I could finish that entire dish on my own. It was that tasty! But dammit, I was with co-workers and I suppose it would've been polite to share. Pretty much anything that involves kale is a quick sell for me. The fact that it was used in this flat noodle dish with tofu was absolute awesomeness! My co-workers also had the Green Curry with Chicken (which they liked) and the Tom Yam Hed soup. I'll admit, I tasted the Tom Yam Hed which was spicy goodness but I can't guarantee that it's vegan because the broth tasted seafood-y. In fact, the leaf icon that indicated vegetarian dishes in the menu wasn't next to the Tom Yan Hed so that was my bad :/ Gasp! Oh, get over yourself..."the vegan" just told you that a potentially non-vegan soup was tasty. That's gotta mean something, right??? ;D P.S. The decor is absolutely fabulous! Contemporary design with ropes stretched across the ceiling. Makes me wonder...if one of the ropes were cut, will it all unravel? Hmm...
