M0iqChFDaaEE6K3QKPfWiA.text: We had a late dinner here one night because it was one of the only restaurants still open, and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food.  The panang curry and green curry were both very good, as were the egg rolls.  Prices are slightly high, but reasonable considering the location.  The only reason I can't give 5 stars is the service. There was a 30 minute wait to be seated, but there were empty tables and multiple staff available when were finally seated.  Once seated, service was slow, and our waiter seemed disinterested.  I will return and hope for better service.

ukWJMo8XeTBSVj1iZl24ZQ.text: Incredible food all around. Came here with some colleagues as our conference was ending. Great food all around from appetizers to soup to noodles.

Yt3DBZhGIiBkT3laKNAgbg.text: Great food and service. We had the hot and sour soup, pad thai, chicken cashew and potstickers. Everything was great and we really enjoyed the ambiance.

rOnxO6UX8tgu9QoIyrxJCg.text: If you are looking for a solid Thai food place at the Aria with vegan options, look no further. The food here was flavorful with generous portion sizes for sharing. Our server, Ten, was very knowledgeable about the menu and made us feel welcome and eager to return in the future. Thank you Ten for a very memorable experience! :)

mm_8Kx13sKtpiG7uFpYrzg.text: The food was delicious and the decor was really cool and different.   They have a wide variety of really good items and it was hard to decided what we each wanted.  The four of us each ordered an entree and ended up sharing with each other since the portions are large. We would for sure go there again.

maCqBoWCUbPYTGLNi4cOEQ.text: We ordered the Jelly Fish and Fried Squid Apps. Our entrees were  the Drunken Seafood Noodle dish and BBQ Duck soup! Everything was incredible! It took a while between Apps and Entrees but the staff was friendly and treated us very well. We will certainly be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizers Jelly Fish/ Fried Squid  Entrees Drunken Fish / BBQ duck soup

lJN3c-fsWvw71kBhq7_X7Q.text: Had a staycation at the Sky Suites and decided to give this place a try. We went about 11pm and the resturant was crowded but we didn't have to wait. Ordered the crab fried rice which came with a soft shell crab on top and big chunks of crab mixed in with the rice. Also ordered a bowl of hot and sour soup. I enjoyed both, the rice had a lot of crab which was good because the dish was kinda expensive. The soft shell crab had a good taste to it but it was really small. Overall I will visit again.

4nlRRX2Vh2W8joqJOuq7hA.text: We had lunch here.  I got their chicken wings and they were five star, with the right amount of char from grilling.  I also got udon noodles, very good.  My friend got coconut soup.  Also very good.  The price is what you'd expect to pay at Aria.  Aria is an upscale property.

jjtZu7bzQHXtgM8aNPbZkg.text: Pretty good Thai food for the Strip.  Came here for dinner one night on my last trip here, and had a great experience over all.  Our server was really nice and friendly and food was brought out appropriately rather than all at once.  He was patient with our drink orders and was able to make substitutions to some of our entrees as well.  Cocktails are all pretty good here.  I had the Watermelon Caipiroska and it was a table favorite.  Really tasty and refreshing without being overly sweet.  You can't even taste the liquor in here.  My sister had the Berry Botanical, but the green tea was a little overpowering.  The Ginger Peach was good too but the vodka does come through even with the black tea.  Wine list is decent and included a really tasty Pinot from Holdredge.  I loved how the wine list was broken down between delicate and full-bodied.  For appetizers, we started with Chicken Satay and Veggie Spring Rolls.  Satay was tasty with a really good peanut sauce, served with skewers poked into a pineapple chunk.  Spring rolls were standard but good.  For dinner, I split an order of Dan Dan noodles and Basil Chicken with another member of our party.  We sub'd the minced pork with sliced chicken, but ended up getting minced chicken which worked out just fine.  Didn't realize it was going to come out as soupy as it did, but that was OK.  The chili oil and peanut combination gave it a nice sweet and sour taste.  The basil chicken was AMAZING.... all the pieces of meat were so tender and juicy.  The flavors were amazing... we couldn't stop eating!  We skipped dessert here, but I am sure there were some treats on there.

LCYcFDcfRiQoPw71knkKRA.text: We dined here while searching for a reasonably priced, yet unique meal . Located in Aria, Lemongrass restaurant is beautifully decorated with a dark and quiet ambiance to it.  The servers are quite friendly, and patient. lol. The server went as far as explaining many of the dishes to us ingredient by ingredient. I went with the beef fried rice which I was certainly satisfied with. The rest of my family seemed just OK with their meals. Oh, and there was a mix up with my girlfriends dish. She had ordered a vegetarian plate, but when it showed up it had chicken on it!! She brought it to their attention and they quickly apologized and assured us they would make it properly for her. And they did do this, however, it took them forever!!! And the place was mostly empty, certainly not a full house that night.  The food was good overall, but certainly not something we are dying to have again on a future trip to Vegas. Other than the mishap with the veggie dish, service was fairly good.   I would dine here again if I were ever craving Thai food.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basil Beef Fried Rice

OmfNDGiieA8TKEIIqhyygw.text: So lemongrass basically goes heavy on flavor. Curry super spicy, soup super salty/sour, but I like it like that.   Only downsides are the dishes with chicken in it cause they use some dryy chicken breast. No good.   Their presentation is good..

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried banana with almond ice cream  yummerz.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango sticky rice.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chick chick chicken skewers.

0Ig7uusQGpfskjMczbEwhw.text: Came into Lemongrass for a late dinner. This place should not be confused with the many amazing restaurants at the Aria Blossom. The Asian restaurant  directly across is a lot better. However, this place is open until 2am and it serves mediocre Chinese food. I'm from NY, home of the best Chinese food, so I know. All other restaurants close at 11 in the Aria so this restaurant is more of a cafe and has a fancy decor, staying consistent with the Aria.

AvOXKrukmGXE0o_l4-kA_A.text: Food was delicious and flavorful. We could taste all the ingredients in the dish and nice ambience.

7d4gxjgBBcgmghpTzQwRrQ.text: Ambience is excellent! I am a vegetarian ND I was really glad to see the options there. Spring rolls were amazinng but was a little dissatisfied with the entree- fried tofu mixed vegetables. Tofu pieces were too big and the gravy wasn't great either. Liked Garlic fried vegetables. Found the Entrees a bit too pricy for the quality.

qPii2NnxU5u8I_TwL7PWew.text: Lemongrass was a perfect date night venue for our Valentines dinner in Vegas.  The ambiance was amazing with a very romantic type of venue that made it special than Thai restaurant I have ever been too.  The seafood entrees were terrific and the spice level was to our satisfaction.

e5Gau7lxGv23rxmE9CDkeg.text: Came for lunch during my last day in Vegas and was pleasantly surprised. The interior was very modern, trendy, and chic but the food was still traditional and tasty. The service was great! My water never was empty, I was promptly introduced by a waiter and had food shortly after. Everyone was very nice and attentive.   The food was very good as well. I ordered the Panang Curry with tofu and was very pleased with it. I ordered level medium for spice and it was more like very spicy. Too spicy for me but the broth was so good that I ate it anyways. Different than normal Panang curry but had a nice twist. I enjoyed it!  Would definitely return, but would be careful on the spice level order.

Ta6SPGZw3Uqpyo3ZAfR3Pg.text: Short wait for a great table for a large group. Varying array of cocktails and food to please everyone.  I had the duck penang- delicious. Another crowd-pleaser was the crab fried rice.

Eto1zeSev_bqs9JbJrfHSQ.text: Ordered shrimp phad Thai level 7 spice. They brought out chicken phad Thai. Took it back and brought back shrimp phad Thai that was cold and no spice or flavor. Ended up ordering the panang curry with rice level 7 spice. Anthony put in the wrong order once again they brought duck panang. I've never had bad service here until I sat at the bar and ordered with Anthony smh.

pDNsaUA4UZWxtqu61xUC5Q.text: We stopped by here after we ate about 2 hours ago. Just wanted to try out some of the appetizers which were pretty tasty and I had the spicy soup. Yes it's very spicy. I would come back here to try out the main dishes next time.

FHZownhOcm8J-h4KGtIXoA.text: Very average food. Was a bit disappointed with the selection and quality of the items on the menu. Serving portions varied dramatically within the same family of items - our friends ordered Panag curry ans it was barely a 2 person serving whereas we ordered the Red curry and it could have easily served 4. There is no innovation on the menu and works well if you are looking for classic Thair fair, however then the quality leaves you disappointed for the price you are paying. For a casino restaurant, I expected more.

H5_IFXai2AcvPAjmP8BR9g.text: Bad service led to bad food led to a bad experience.  I said "I'm vegan." The hostess manager (I forgot her name...maybe Santara or something? She is Thai, I believe.) suggested the panang curry. I aked her if it could be made completely mild. She said yes. I had my doubts, and confirmed again.  Turns out she didn't know the menu.  My takeout order came and I left to eat it. Spicy. Sweating. Nose running. Not pleasant for this Midwesterner. Didn't...couldn't enjoy the meal (which was only brown rice and tofu in panang sauce...No veggies.)  Brought it back and complained. Asked what we could do. She said we couldn't do a refund. I said fine, then how about a free dessert? She said she would "talk to the chef" to see what could be done. Last time I checked, the chef takes orders from the manager, and will prepare whatever. She comes back with a scoop of ice cream (for a vegan). I send it back. She coffees back with a few pieces of watermelon that didn't look all that appetizing. Gotta say, they tastes great. But, I think she should have given me a choice. If she would have, I would have chosen and been restored to good. The way she treated me, she gets yelped at.

eFz1PqBxpd-0pJpOL-SDLg.text: Lemongrass!!!!!!!!!! This is where I eat when i have nothing to do an i'm sick of gambling at Aria..  Food is good. Designer asian food. No complaints when the food is comped. Play more, eat more :)

eBqowcrymgZmtEZEmENqrg.text: Beautiful restaurant with mediocre food and lousy service.  It's a shame to waste such a nice space in the corner of the Aria hotel casino.  Though it's in a quiet corner the restaurant was very loud during our late Friday evening dinner.  Food was hit or miss with good Tom Yum Soup and thai cucumbers but bland and tasteless main courses that were supposed to be spicy.  The chicken Ka Prow was g-d awful and tasted like something in a Midwestern factory cafeteria.  It consisted of chicken with dull vegetables in a thick and flavorless gravy.  This was supposed to be a spicy dish!  Sad!    Even sadder was the service.  Our waiter took our order, delivered appetizers and then we never saw him again.  His photo might be on the side of a milk carton by now.  We just sat there for 40 minutes until a manager brought us the check with attitude as if we were interrupting her day.    I get better food and service at my local thai carryout place that charges 1/3 as much.    Management, you need to monitor what's going on in your restaurant.

nW60qi7NYM_FYRvnJsCpnQ.text: I love me some dim sum!  This place is delicious.  We tried the prawns, dumplings, chicken basil bun, and drunken noodles.  Everything was absolutely  delicious.  I have never had a shark fin dumpling and I had to try it.  I loved it.  The dim sum is on trays and they come by and let you pick what you want.  Their spice level for the noodles is 1-10 and we got 4 and it wasn't that spicy at all.  The chicken basil bun was really great.  I loved the pops of basil flavor in it.

AQHqFfMEmsgRGH4I1VMURw.text: Love this place! The service is top notch and the Penang Duck Curry is stellar! We always come here when we come to Vegas and it never disappoints us. Great and calm ambience that is very romantic. Good for late night because it's empty!!

zjfeLBpvF3AsRW5DY3qInQ.text: It's clearly that some of them are Chinese food with less care made. Tastes are not good and maybe worse than the street food. Not recommended for anyone looking for Asian food.

sosJoaufw-7djsPKkyhYHw.text: Incredibly disappointed. Service was borderline unacceptable -no offer of beverage refill, no checkin once food was dropped,  no offer of dessert or after dinner beverage. Husband vegetarian tofu in clay pot was so spicy to be inedible without any spice symbol or question of spice level desired. No tip, no return. No recommendation. Waste of $100.

h8W6rapCGZhpD15ZsKTmpg.text: Great Decor followed by good food. They have a very good variety of dimsums. The food is delicious.

HXsYio2-NHwa6zNMm1X3yg.text: Came here because we were looking for dinner after midnight on a Monday night (near the hotel), and this was one of the only options.   The food wasn't great. There was way too much salt. They say that its authentic, but its not even close to it. Dim sum at a "Thai" place?   Cocktails were also subpar (way too sweet) and weak.   Won't return.

BRB_dmwaYmTpHeGGV6BXFA.text: Great food, really good flavors! Beware we like it spicy so we told the waiter makes our like #6 and I wish he would have told us that there spicy levels are not like normal restaurants! it was definitely really spicy but still had wonderful flavors! I loved pretty much everything we ordered.  We had the panang curry w/ tofu, rad noodles and Vegetable fried rice.  My favorite was cucumber salad it was very refreshing!  Overall good food, I think the service was okay I wasn't too impressed with it especially being inside of Aria. But great food, I will come back if I am every back in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panang curry w/ tofu
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rad noodles

f8miAFWSRLL3EuVjx-2DYQ.text: Great settings, horrible food.  Ordered two dishes - Dan Dan noodle and pineapple fried rice. The Dandan noodle is not authentic at all because it's stirred with the wrong sauce! Talked to waitress and was told it is "Thai style Dandan noodle" and that's complete BS. This is a chinese/Thai restaurant and Dandan noodle is chinese Sichuan cuisine. I have never heard thainland has such dish.  Pineapple fried rice: just horrible. The rice is too dry and sticked altogether in trunks. The rice is unevenly stirred in the wok and you can see the color difference. I can tell it's done by an armature cook. I can cook better fried rice. Plus, I would expect at least some sort of nicer presentation of food such as a real pineapple next to it (like what lots of Thai restaurants do), but I guess not.  Would not come back and recommend to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple fried rice (horrible)

-VojXglEqU4wa-RJPo2fcg.text: I'm a fan of Lemongrass in the Aria hotel. We ordered take-out and ate in our room as they had a verrrrrry long wait on a Tuesday night (1.5 hours). When we ordered from our room tablet, our food was ready for pickup in 15 minutes!   We ordered: Shanghai Dumplings - Delicious soup dumplings, the skin a bit thick for my liking but it held the soup in very well, and didn't tear when pulling the dumpling from the container (Common occurrence when ordering XLB to go) They came with 5 for 1 order.  BBQ Pork Buns - Came with 3 mini buns / order and they were also delicious. Perfect amount of Pork to Bun and the buns were soft and pillowy.  Pot Stickers - just okay, we expected them to be more crispy like the photo but they were just steamed with a tiny bit of crisp on the bottom.   We had the Mango Sticky Rice for dessert which was good, hard to mess up.   Would definitely recommend Lemongrass if you're staying in the Aria, though there is better Dim Sum elsewhere in Vegas.

DLRq2AA59vUZVdjA5KlBzA.text: We got four dishes and all had some of each. The yellow curry was the favorite of the group. It was all extremely spicy to the point where it all kind of tasted the same. I found a hair in my food. The service was slowwww. It took a long time to get the check after we were all clearly done. It's basically in the casino but with partitions around the dining area.

qJHTVN4TJsaNN3hjG-GvAw.text: For the most authentic and delicious Thai food in Vegas, Lemongrass has to be on your list. All the food is delicious and the dim sum for lunch is superb as well.  Make reservations as it fills up fast every night. Service is great, the food is delicious, signature cocktails are wonderful as well.  Be cautious about spice levels. Their scale is 1-10 and 3 is medium. I tend to like spicy food and ordered Singapore Noodles at level 5 and lets just say the burn was brutal during and the next day. Stay with a 3 for spicy and you will be happy

P7WAUg_UgfOeRvN4VA2prg.text: Not the best Thai place but okay for the location and price. The decor is nice but the food lacks flavor and very basic. The only thing I can recommend is the pad Thai. The service lacks consistency. Expect to be seated for a while because it takes about 30 to 40 minutes to get your  food after you have placed your order. Make reservation if you absolutely want to try this place or go after lunch/dinner rush.

xPX6CKSUPDZVx4PwPm7Eng.text: I had been wanting to try this restaurant for some time now and my mom brought me here last night for a belated birthday dinner. I was expecting it to be good because she was raving about it, but I didn't realize it would be delicious! The ambiance is very nice and open. Dim lighting and pretty decor. We started off with the cucumbers and spring rolls. Both were very good! The young coconut drink is the best coconut water, I have ever had. I ordered the red curry with beef spicy level 6. It was pretty spicy but since I like a lot of spicy, I will go a little higher next time. The curry though was out of this world! I paired it enthusiastic jasmine rice. So good! I even had leftovers the next day and it was just as amazing. I highly recommend Lemongrass if you want authentic Thai food and a nice ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red curry with beef
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Young coconut

lg1jWvUjj5tTK637nEXWtg.text: I was so excited to finally eat at Lemongrass located in the Aria, and it did not disappoint.  We ordered a few different items (steamed pork buns, veggie fried rice, pad thai, and garlic shrimp).  Everything was DELISH, and I would definitely eat here again.  The only reason that I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 is that the service is super slow.  We ordered our food at about 1:15/1:20 and did not get it until 2pm.  The restaurant was busy, but not packed.  Not sure why it took so long, but it was still yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DFv3pXGbLteHioJVmgo0iA.text: This place is tucked away! If you follow the arrows to the Sky Suites, you'll find your way to some pretty good Thai food here at Lemongrass and they're open pretty late! I was at a loss gambling, so now I needed to feed my hunger pains or keep on scratching that gambling itch to try and break even. Hunger pains won obviosly.   Their menu has a lot of variety. I seriously was debating between the rib-eye, sea bass, three cup chicken, yellow curry, and so many other yummy sounding entrees.  After some thought, I really was craving for some beef yellow curry. It was a VERY tasty curry! The only downfall of it is I expected more protien for the price. There were a good chunk of potatoes, but the first one I bit into was still a bit raw in the center.   Then there's a good variety of desserts to choose from. I was about to go with some standard Thai desserts like the mango sticky rice, but the server recommended the coconut ice cream. Awesome recommendation! Such a mouthful of flavors! From the fruit to the jelly's and the sticky rice. Definitely a must try.  Service is OK here. Was seated right away, which I anticipated for this late. Food arrived fast and piping hot! I was so hungry, that first bite burned my tongue! Water glass was kept full. But also could have had a couple check-ins to see how I was doing.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut ice cream. Must try!
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef yellow curry with steamed white rice.

sHDdLbHrGj5L0y0ay6BpCg.text: I had a very nice Tofu Clay Pot for lunch. It was flavorful and surprisingly hearty.  Overall, Lemongrass is a typical $$$ restaurant you would find in any upscale casino hotel.  This one happens to be in the Aria.  I also had the fishcakes which were on the heavy side. The staff here is friendly and helpful. Service is quick too. The decor is upscale, modern and sleek.  If you are on the strip and don't want to leave for China town and the legion of Thai choices there, then Lemongrass is a good choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu clay pot
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NYJAVtKOSq86y1pCDpcIEw.text: This is still my favorite Thai restaurant here in Vegas. Not only is the food to die for, but the presentation is very pleasing to the eye. I have plenty of favorites here, to start off, their Chicken Wing appetizer is very tasty, a combination of flavorful crispy wings paired with sweet chili sauce. We always order the Shrimp Phad Thai, Tom Kha Soup, and their Chicken and Shrimp Satay. For dessert, we like to order their mango sticky rice and fried banana with icecream. They also serve Dim Sum on the weekends, which is delicious as well. I would recommend coming here for brunch if you want authentic dim sum. The service here is always great. The servers are very attentive and kind. Overall, Lemongrass is one of my go to favorites and it never disappoints. My experience here is always great and exceeds my expectations every time!

4X1M7xreF4rh0kcnCyjchQ.text: All dishes with crab are delicious. Crab omelet and crab fried rice are my favorite. But all food is great at that place. Love it

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. soft shell crab omelet and shrimp dim sum

2kWgachGBItjK_XEqGYtDQ.text: My husband and I had lunch here and absolutely loved it!   Everything was delicious and we were so impressed with the vegan options! The menu has the vegetarian options clearly labeled and the waiter was knowledgeable about what was vegan or could be made vegan. We had the Tom Kha J, pad Thai and Panang curry and were blown away - which is saying something since we were just in Thailand over Christmas!  In addition to serving great food the restaurant is beautiful and the service was fantastic.

Zem6zGsW25gYbaJkr_EhjQ.text: Meh. This place is overpriced and the food is okay. Our hostess sat us down but didn't give us any menus. Had to wait until the waitress came to the table for our order in order to get our menus. I ordered the crab fried rice which is 30 fiat and warning, the crab is breaded!! This isn't even stated on the menu. Won't be back here. Two stars because Tina, the waitress is awesome!

TZPeWolp8PaN0bsX3Ub86g.text: We were looking for some light bites and wandering around the Aria reading menus. I came across jelly fish on the menu and HAD to try it. We sat at the bar and ordered the jelly fish and a scallop satay. The jelly fish was interesting. I don't think I would ever order it again.  It was served chilled and doused in sesame oil. I was having a hard time with the texture too. The scallop satay was really good. It was served with a light peanut sauce, a cucumber salad and some bread. Thank goodness for the bread because the scallops were not much food, especially for the price.  The service was stuffy. The bartenders seemed like they were meh about being there and didn't really care too much about helping people. I actually would have expected way better service from a place like that in the Aria.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop satay
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jelly fish

Z8IodVWG8cR8hiV-DeU7og.text: OMG This is one of the best asian restaurants i have been to in Vegas!  Lovedd the Fried rice with an entree of there spicy vegetables!  Ate out here at like 11pm or something. Ambience is great, service was great and so was the food.  They also had Chili paadi - chopped fresh red chilli in soy sauce which i absolutely loveee!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable entre
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best basil fried rice
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilli paadii

NOyj2M4TblbEe_SXnmiwCw.text: Disappointed by not only the lack of service, but the food. I sat at the bar, as I was traveling. I was able to order quickly, and things started out fine. Then I received my appetizer & dinner at the same time, with no acknowledgment of any issue. The har gow dumplings were....eh. The shrimp was very chewy, and the dumplings were over cooked. I had to eat them with a fork and knife (also because I wasn't offered chopsticks). The yellow curry itself was ok, but seriously lacking in flavor. I ordered medium, and it wasn't even a tiny bit spicy. The potatoes were incredibly hard; I ended up not eating them at all. The server never asked how things were, if I needed anything, nor did he notice an issue with the dish. I wouldn't return.

BFf2kpHhsZ6hsCK9sdcm1g.text: The food was good. Amazing atmosphere! The service was okay. I got a level 4 spice and it was pretty spicy. I wouldn't suggest anyone who can't handle the spice to get anything above a level 2. They said 3 is average.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken Noodles with Chicken, Beef and Pork.

HdHETcURAejU0zRI5f_02Q.text: Went to Lemongrass for dinner on Saturday night and had reservations. There was a line to the hostess but it was minimal. Lemongrass is in the Aria Resort and Casino, directly across from the Chinese Cuisine restaurant Blossom. It is a open floor plan meaning its inside the casino, it is not closed off. The decor is very romantic and dim, the atmosphere and just the interior is aesthetically pleasing to the eyes. I could not stop looking at how table chandelier hanging from above. Our waiter was very friendly and nice overall. However, the food took a while to come out. The restaurant did seem busy so that is probably why. I wanted to try the soup dumplings as they provided 5 for $12. I have eaten better dumplings from other places. We ordered the the three cup chicken pork pad see ew. Both dishes lacked flavor as if the chef forgot salt. The dishes were in decent portion but it really was bland unfortunately.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S_YcAHOfCT2LCbdl10qpSA.text: This is one of my go to places when I'm craving Thai food. The service is always fast and friendly. The food is tasty and not full of msg. For the price I prefer this place instead of the fancy burgee places around the strip.

vQb9vl2K6296r_TIdyhRYA.text: Me and my husband came there with a couple friends for dinner. The wait was only about 20 minutes and they were very good about keeping to that 20 minutes. Once we got seated our waiter was super nice and kind of funny. We ordered spring rolls wontons and the prons for appetizers. They were all delicious. We ordered the pad Thai with the yellow curry and the sweet-and-sour chicken to share. They were all delicious. We are local, we had leftovers that we brought home and ate the next day. They were great still. I would recommend coming here for Thai food. Menu was reasonably price for a dinner on the strip.

FVZiRT5nsmRU61TcyCmajw.text: Located towards the end of the Aria casino, this restaurant is often times not as exposed as the rest of the Aria restaurants. My fiance found this restaurant by looking at a pamphlet they gave us at our hotel. We were staying at for the Vdara, often times we like to eat at the Aria restaurants to get our points. We were in a Thai food kind of a mood so we had to asked concierge how to get there, we were unfamiliar with the area where Lemongrass was. We showed up around 6 PM on a weeknight. We waited for a while for a hostess to come to the stand. There were also people behind us also waiting for the hostess. Finally, when she arrived we were able to sit right down without a reservation. Pretty cool environment for what you would expect for a Thai restaurant. We sat down and before we were greeted by our server, we were greeted by a photographer who took a bunch of photos from of us. Later, she would try to sell them to us in a book. The server came over and got our drink orders. My fiance got to Sapporo and I got a glass of $19 Pinot Grigio. It was very expensive for what it actually tasted like. We decided to get a few appetizers and a meal and split everything. We ordered the salmon spring rolls, the Tom Yhun shrimp soup, and the chicken pad Thai. The timing of each food item that was delivered was perfect. We stayed for about an hour, and got our entire dinner for under $100 with tax. Not over priced. Overall, the food is good, the service is OK, the ambience is kind of boring and dull. We were very tired when we left because of lighting. Overall, this place is OK. It's good if you want Thai food because it's one of the few type places around specific area on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ambience
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom Yhun Soup &amp; Salmon spring rolls
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai

_8bFX76rSjG10fFqRWbn3A.text: This wasn't my first time here but it was my first lunch experience. This is a good option out of convenience but it's not one I would go out of my way to dine at. There are other better Thai options out there.   This time around, we had the chicken satay and the larb salad. Both satisfied and were good but (naturally) overpriced. I feel like they put on the spice if you ask for it and the menu is rather extensive providing something for everyone.

PMJw4cgW7y7RyM39mE1lMQ.text: Take you forever to have a dim sum come to you. The guy just does not care if you have waited for ages. They told me there is a dim sum cart will circle around, but the fact is they never come during the 45 minutes wait.    I was clearly upset about their service and asked twice when I will get my dim sum. They keep saying it will come ... such a trash place

dlsdlyADIkQ0mKEi4I8k1A.text: Great place , great food , great prices .   Go toos:   Green curry w veggies  Pad se eew no egg  Pad Thai no meat   We don't eat meat , so I see the comments below tend to be about the meat being chewy or tough , so I'm not sure . We go here everytime  we are in Vegas - Great food !

SGGmURLHLtUBrWEqXdClpQ.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas.  The food is excellent at a decent price (especially by Vegas standards).  Have tried a number of different dishes between my family and myself and have never been disappointed.  Service is fast, friendly and efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elegant yet simple decor
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft shell crab fried rice, OMG!
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice tea sweetened with Lemongrass syrup

rWLDJWgep0Z6QPDsq-yyPg.text: Love that this place doesn't cost an arm and a leg like most of the other restaurants in Aria do.  Prices are very reasonable given it's in one of the pricier casinos.  This was my 2nd visit to Lemongrass, and my party of four shared the pineapple fried rice, panang curry, crispy chow mein, and wonton noodle soup.  My favorite was the panang curry- super flavorful, loved the lychee, and the spice level was on point! Those 4 dishes set us back just under $80 which wasn't too bad. We even had a small bit leftover.  Will definitely come back to Lemongrass during our next stay at Aria to enjoy the panang curry and to try something new!

EN9hGv0j2j5uzWZKfMgzRg.text: The Aria hotel is beautiful, and so is this Thai restaurant located on the ground floor of the Aria. Although not blow-your-mind Thai food, this is a safe option for lunch.  +2 stars for the ambience and being in the hotel I stayed at +1 for the decent but not great Thai food -2 for the not fresh jellyfish and bad value (expensive for what it is)  Our order: The penang curry with duck was WAY too heavy in consistency... Too much coconut milk and no depth of flavor.  The drunken noodle was quite good! We got it with seafood. Thai iced tea met the standard. Jellyfish in chili oil: Meh, not recommended. Not fresh.

Jzl_MJpWHiL18YNtMcyEZQ.text: Being a frequenter of the Aria resort, I've eaten at Lemongrass many times...always having a great experience.   Dishes I've had most recently:  Pad Thai:  excellent!  I've had pad Thai at a lot of places and Lemongrass ranks among the best. I was pleasantly surprised to receive a lot of large perfectly cooked shrimp with my seafood pad Thai. I was kind of expecting overpriced and few shrimp given that restaurants on the strip can get away with this sort of thing. Nope. Well done, Lemongrass.   Drunken Noodles:   Very very good. Not sure what to say about the drunken noodles, exactly. Nothing stood out as being specifically good. Just that the dish was overall very very good. I mean, they're drunken noodles. They're delicious!  I don't think I've had bad drunken noodles before, but I can't see how Lemongrass can improve on their version. It was tip top.   Young Chow Fried Rice:  delicious!  My only qualm is that it is inconsistent.  They've served me the dish already mixed together and looking very fried ricey (is that a word?) but the last time I went they served the fried rice separate from the primary ingredients and had me pour the soupy-like mixture over the fried rice. I like it the first way better.  Pork Dumplings:  A somewhat small portion for $10, but some of the best I've ever had. Was pretty pissed a couple of times when they gave me very little dipping sauce in my to-go order. But not the end of the world.   The inconsistency in the young chow dish and the amount of sauce given for the dumplings makes me want to give the restaurant 4-stars. No cheap and inconsistent restaurant should receive 5-stars imo, but the food IS top notch and they didn't skimp on the shrimp (hey that rhymes). I mean, be cheap and give me less sauce, shame on you. But you did surprise me with more of an expensive seafood product.  I'll be kind. 4.5-stars rounded up.  I can use my casino comp points to pay too. Weeeee!

TxHEZmuwlhUAEQ6ad-8qsA.text: Got a severe case of food poisoning here which has ruined my vacation. Waiter missed my chicken wings order so when questioned he said they could be out in 5 minutes (regardless of fact they take 15 minutes to cook). Lighting is dark so you couldn't see they were raw. By the time I could see it, it was too late. Spent the next 2 days stuck in the room, throwing up and calling room service for toast. DO NOT EAT AT LEMONGRASS.

Me_sHbrBTBurIyuEXrC27g.text: Good Thai iced tea, spring rolls, main dishes were pretty good as well. Spicy means spicy here so watch out for that. Right portions. Very good staff and wonderful ambience. Good one

prcWfEMxdafo67Duxzrg0Q.text: I'm surprised the reviews aren't higher here.  I've been eating at Lemongrass since it opened and have always had a good experience (although I don't love spicy food).  The atmosphere is nice, the watermelon caipirinha is amazing, and the shrimp fried rice is a great choice if you don't want anything spicy.  We recently ordered the banana dessert and it was good, but not good enough to order again.    I do have to say that on our last trip, we decided to sit in the dining room (we usually sit at the bar) and it took us a long time to be greeted.  We ended up moving to the bar and had the usual good service we'd come to expect.  Juby and Anthony (?) at the bar are great and always remember us.

RC8tYYLBrSQXf0p5yF5U3Q.text: This Thai restaurant was personally not my favorite. My friends and I went out to eat dinner and the maitre d told us that there would be a 30 min wait which was not bad, but after about 45 min, the eatery hadn't called us. I went to check up on where we were on the waiting list and I figured out that our table was ready but they never even called my name! This meant that we could've been seated about 10 minutes earlier!! And on top of that I ordered yellow curry with chicken which was a TOTAL FLOP. THE WHOLE DISH WAS PRETTY MUCH ALL WATER WITH YELLOW COLOR. The chicken that came with the curry didn't taste all that good either. Other than that, the experience was ok. The pad thai, red curry, and drunken noodles were very tasty and staff was very friendly and attentive.

466kTZV_TrrEUM2C54XOQA.text: We love Thai food so we are always looking to try something new. We stopped by here for dinner after a day of walking around. The food was ok- it does not make the top 5 Thai places on my list. I asked for spicy and it wasn't. The food was way over priced.   The decor is beautiful but that doesn't make my belly full.

ck2EbumfXD2SncIj_96iTw.text: Looking for a reasonable price Thai restaurant, here it is. I get most restaurant's are pretty pricey, but this is about average price as if you were to go to a restaurant in San Francisco, ca. We order the Tom kah soup. Very nice flavor. Minus star since they didn't ask for spice level had to ask for pepper on the side. Recommendation was the basil stir fried. Got the beef and was really good. Has fresh peppers, so does a good spice. We got a salad I forget what it was called but, has a nice sour taste with some vermicelli noodles. Over all, good place to go to for reasonable price Thai food.

PLB3voKWcFJb-ovzcposYA.text: The atmosphere is nice and food is good. Portion size is good as well. A little expensive but for casino prices not to bad.

GC_RlykTN-amjFyseB1hZA.text: I came for Lemongrass to try something different from all the regular Vegas food and it was tasty.  I also found I really liked touring Aria. Its such a hip cool hotel with other cool things to see so I would definitely try it.   Seafood Drunken Noodles - I really liked the squid in it along with shrimp and scallops.  I would ask for it to be more spicy as it was a little one note.  Panang curry - Red curry paste with lychees and we got it with chicken.  Very tasty. Our favorite dish.  Vegetable fried rice - tasty and solid.   We really liked it and the ambiance is really nice along with the music. Calming and tasty. Affordable. And allows you to tour the pretty Aria.

sfUQJXvqEcdIuCMGOehufg.text: The Dim Sum Cart was great. Tried some of their new menu, but they weren't that satisfying; it might have been my high expectation.

So3VAxbSlVsvPJoDI_ivsA.text: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in the city!  Authentic feel and it always smells amazing. Of course their food is really the star. I love the Thai Basil Soup and Pad Thai. I have dined here many times and it is consistently an excellent experience. I highly recommend!

j962jLPqxgzLg1qGFAdfNA.text: Nice decor but the service was bad. The waiter we had was lazy. He did not care to make any suggestions. He has no energy not personality. We ordered 5 dishes and one of them was the shredded pork stir fry with dry tofu and it was so salty we had to return it. Then we ordered the steam cod with lime dressing  and it was sour and fishy. Overall the food tastes like fast food but masked by nice decor. He made no effort of checking in on how we were doing. Not even once. He didn't even dish out our soup. For the price that it demands we expected better food and service but it failed miserably. we will never come back again!!! Lucky we gave this a two star!

41FBSZovIrHdJZb5T1gARg.text: Hidden gem in the cosmopolitan. Really good Thai food at a very reasonable price. It's also got a very laid back atmosphere, and the attire is casual. The iced Thai coffee was out of this world

Lvkq0Yxih5UAL4mY7VCSHQ.text: The menu is diverse and had lots of options.  I had the drunken noodles which was very flavorful and had nice complexity.  The Thai iced coffee was phenomenal.

uZtA9JeE_Rg5pxn-P0eR6A.text: The food here was great and it was easy to make a reservation, even on a weekend that was really busy in Vegas.  We ordered 6 dishes family style and it fed 6 girls with good appetites and left enough for a meal's worth of leftovers.  I highly recommend the drunken noodles and the yellow curry.

GXdLFs03KzO5LaWpkorbWQ.text: Very ehhhhh.  I mean I completely realize were not gonna get Orange County quality Thai food here, however, it doesn't give you an excuse to put it on there.  Prime Example: Beef Pho - Come on...Seriously!  Whack and tasteless...then you go and charge $15 for it?!  You would do better with Top Ramen.  Actually they have that on the menu too. Mee Goreng (haha) - You're nuts...and insulting for putting a $20 price tag on it.  With a couple pieces of meat.  Okay it wasn't all bad: Yellow Curry Chicken - Pretty solid and made it spicy the way I prefer it....Good job. Tom Kha Chicken - Jesus this was spiceh!  But okay...chicken texture was good. Yam poo Nim - Good starter.  Recommend to all.  We ordered other stuff but can't manage to finish this review.  I hate places that over charge based on vicinity.  I felt like I was eating a $12 tub of popcorn and a $6 Coke.  DUMB!

q9PCkWYmeY7IRceC2QOquA.text: Whilst staying at the Aria I had a craving for vietnamese pho so I decided to try Lemongrass. This is probably not a fair review as it's not really a Vietnamese restaurant.   I liked the ambience of the place for the early lunch and it was fairly busy.  The potstickers and starters we had were yummy, the pho not so.  I found the broth bland and there was too much beef fat for my liking.   I would try this restaurant again but I wouldn't order the pho.

3M93EQCMVtDA45LDurDZcw.text: Lemongrass is my favorite Thai restaurant in Las Vegas.  Located at ARIA Resort & Casino.  Menu is extensive and mid range for pricing.  Had lunch today and enjoyed the Chicken Sate with peanut sauce and marinated cucumber salad for starter.  Always a favorite - yellow curry chicken with brown rice, chicken pad thai and the soft shell crab friend rice.  Were a table of 6 and shared family-style.  Service was friendly. Great choice with friends from out of town.

wfh780BcXgx8BZY85w-3tg.text: I really like Lemongrass,  my  husband and I dine there quite often. I love the vegetable rice with beef. The desserts are wonderful especially the Phao which is a  large Tapioca in coconut milk. If you gamble at all and Aria is the best place to redeem your comps for dinner. I've always received very good service.

Iqhe2BiGrbET2hwOEvASvA.text: This place was crap!! The service was horrible and it wasn't packed that night. Got there at 10pm party of 6. We waited 10 minutes for our waiter. Our waiter could barely speak English,  he was nice thou. It's not his fault the management doesn't know how to train the staff. I order the sesame chicken and it was spicy. We sent it back. The sweet and sour chicken was barely chewable sent that back. Asked for the manager. My host told her how we waited 10 minutes. She snapped back with a reply "actually only 5 minutes".  What kind of manager says that shit. A very crappy manager. Can't charge the amount you do for the food and then give bad hospitality. Never going back!

qtuFlBDGZ7FWTVePamBbkw.text: Lovely atmosphere.  Attentive and knowledgeable service.  That being said, the food was just ok.  The shrimp was pre-cooked and reheated, not freshly prepared.  The portions were generous, but underwhelming in taste.

ZNjvJ4TabT5NBnXiLAYbJg.text: just awesome great service and food, we tried jellyfish for the first time, it was tasty.. the soup was the highlight of the dinner Lobster Tom Kha Gai amazing!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fun night

ADnyfr4FrGoASZNMVgSNIg.text: This is a great find the Aria hotel.  With all the other restaurants being so expensive it makes this one seem cheap :o)  The boyfriend and I came here on a Tuesday night after seeing the Viva Elvis show and we were seated right away.  This place is not big at all so the seats are kind of close to each other but it was no big deal.  The best value of this this place is the soup.  For $8.00 you get a big soup that is big enough for two.  We got an order of the yellow curry and the pineapple fried rice and shared it.  Including the soup this was definitely enough for two people.  They were a little slow getting the soup out but after that the rest of the food came out in a timely manner.  Our service was great and the waiter apologized for the soup coming out slow.  I would like to come here again and try some more of their dishes in the future!

Kvhxy6034YOeRKYXzidvKg.text: This place serves Chinese fusion type of food, you could tell a lot of effort was put into it when the plate comes out because of how unique the food is arranged, taste wise is not bad. Servers were attentive. Just overall a nice and romantic place to take a hot date!

I0QnsGzEGMRtzXy46IctsQ.text: The food was good... But not great. The Tom yum soup with mushroom was awesome but the garlic shrimp dish was a bit bland. Not enough flavors for my personal taste. Also the entrees didn't come with rice... Service was good but not great either. Servers were very friendly but I always had to look for them and wave at them to get my cup filled with water. But I love the atmosphere and their prices which is not bad at all for a restaurant on the strip. So I will come again whenever I crave Thai food.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef salad
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic prawns
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodles

Ig-TFh2BbcuPCUnRI1Uuig.text: Awesome ambiance, Good food. Open very late. Nice service.

nZZn5MopKNw5idHo4jHrpQ.text: I think this is the worst Thai food I've had in the US. Made reservations with high hopes and came away very disappointed. The fried Flounder was inedible and even the waiter agreed and removed it from our bill after we pointed it out.  Drunken noodles were average at best and the red curry tasted like a instant sauce not one made from scratch. Service was non-existent. Our waiter sat us and never came back so we had to flag down passing staff for everything we needed - ordering, drinks, the bill. It was very frustrating.

4Wn-mNi0Xjuz3sEKstGp5g.text: Amazing food.. The curries red / green and the home style tofu.. Are great value for money!

xh521g-S8ge49LaGKMKKwQ.text: Whenever I come to Aria, I make a snack stop at this restaurant. It is somewhat away from all the casino area and the slots. It is never too crowded here and the staff has more time for you. I always order Thai iced tea to quench my thirst. For my lil snacks I tend to order the jelly fish and the spicy cucumbers. Those two dishes are so refreshing after all that drinking. My all time favorite appetizer here is the salmon spring rolls... This dish makes me melt!!! Every bite is so comforting and it makes me want to cum! Spectacular!!! I love this restaurant in Vegas because it's never crowded, the service is good, the food is amazing. Perfect since the night life is already crazy and loud enough! =)

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OHczov_Otjg2LJXA4oaEwA.text: This place is overpriced, has a limited selection, the service is slow even when empty and they seat everyone on top of each other. Really really terrible. Highly re come d skipping this one.

XtNH4uAi1vuUQlL0yajPHA.text: Hubby and I stumbled upon this place during restaurant week.  Can't attest to how "authentic" the food is, but it sure was delicious!  We had the shrimp pad thai and the green curry chicken, along with appetizers of soup and satay chicken and beef.  Everything was very tasty and service was great also.  We would definitely return to try other dishes!

bEI9tuTttkPQths10uhltg.text: I just finished eating here with my fiance.  The best Thai food I have had yet & trust me I have had a lot having lived in NYC, Chicago & SF.  Delicious soup, lobster and fried rice.  Nice staff, our waiter Van was great & kind.  I was told the chef is a executive chef from Thailand and was windowing tonight, but the food is amazing.

vSk5E7yu7rPZgGnSBZbfcw.text: MMh I love Thai food! This beats almost any Thai I've had in Seattle! Tom kha soup and fish cakes were delicious! And the pink leopard drink was cute and tasted great! Service was very friendly and efficient. Timely as well, and the other staff didnt mind helping out either! Waitress let us know she was changing shifts which was appreciated. Very nice interior, loved the fresh anthuriums and orchids.

iNThBl43fB0UM-3vfiS4wg.text: I liked this place mainly for the atmosphere. They also have a very large menu, so you have plenty of things to choose from. My husband had the pad thai, and I had the pork neck with jasmine rice and we shared spring rolls for the appetizer. We both had some wine, which they have a good selection of as well.  The same with most places on the strip, it's over priced for the food. My husband and I eat a lot of Asian cuisine, and in my opinion, I've just had much better for a more reasonable price. The service was not very good either. They weren't insanely busy, but it took 30 minutes to get rice that I had ordered with my meal. I had to ask 3 times before I got it.  I'm sure I would eat there again, but only if it was convenient.

87eN_o35WNB7AnsZDc0raQ.text: This was my second time eating from this restaurant. I have had much better and authentic thai cuisine, HOWEVER, the level of heat is unbeatable. I am Asian. I grew up eating spicy food. I order my food at level 12 on a scale of 10 at most Thai restaurants. I ordered a level 5 to keep on the safe side since I am staying at the Aria with a bunch of friends and we have only 1 bathroom. We all ordered the green chicken curry, spicy asian cucumbers, pad thai, and the drunken noodles. Also, just to snack on later, we grabbed some chips and salsa from Javier's (the upscale mexican restaurant at Aria). Our mouths were ON FIRE. We were using the chips and salsa (which were also spicy) to quench the fires in our mouths. We were miserable, however, the food is too good to stop eating. Err on the side of caution. If you think you can handle the heat, keep it around a level 5. I promise you, your mouth, stomach, and in the morning, your ass will be BURNING.

klw3VPYRxnWYieGxD0Zxvg.text: I eat Thai food near my area quite often.  There are 3 restaurants near me within 3-4 miles radius so very competitive in quality wise.  I went with my family to LV and was looking for something that isn't a buffet for 1 meal.  Lemongrass came up as good reviews from here so thought i tried it. The atmosphere with nice, dim, dark which was ok.  the foods however wasn't good.  We ordered 4 dishes including the appetizer which was Crab Cake, very salty, by itself wasn't good to eat.  The 3 main dishes was Shrimps vegetables (again salty even with rice) Fried Tofu veg (ok by itself but with rice, would need some fish sauce or soy sauce) and 3rd dish was something i forgot but it wasn't great to stay in my memory.  The cost was bit pricey than the usual Thai restaurant but it was LV so that was expected.  The quality wasn't expected though because it wasn't good.  i wouldn't recommended this to anyone.

18vkf7-pA6rHyRrgZCiTDA.text: Chicken wings were the best prepared I've had. The ice tea was refreshing and great tasting. The service was prompt and polite. Good value for the money.

N_hHK443H0uClPWBOhxqgg.text: This is one of the most beautiful restaurants I've ever seen.  If I could feast on beauty, my taste buds and my tummy would have been deeply satiated.  Do you like gloop? Do you like your food swimming in such deep sauce that you have a hard time determining what you're eating? Do you like gobs of fatty sauce? Then you might like Lemongrass!  Pork rice. Thought it was fried rice, but it wasn't. It would have been tasty if this were steam table Chinese.  Fried rice. Loved the deep fried shitake. But the rest of it was greasy.  Steak and gloop. I'm sure that's not what it was called on the menu. This was a tiny portion of beef, utterly drowned in a peanut sauce that made my arteries harden just looking at it.   Duck and gloop. I don't think it was called this either, but again, the tiny portion of duck was drowned in so much sauce. The dish was probably as many calories as a human should eat in a week.   Sesame chicken and gloop. This was a sweet and sour type sauce with a lot of sugar and gloop.  If you like your food "smothered" in sauce to the point where there is nothing but gobs of fat in your mouth, you'll probably love this place.  Such a beautiful restaurant, surely deserves better food.

lIzpPj8ugz7dwYWpejaN3g.text: Nice ambiance with a modern feel (very suitable with Aria). We order the crab omelet, pad thai, and shrimp for two. Very yummy. The portion were big enough for a leftovers the next day.   Pros: not too pricey (considering it's on the strip), good variety of food, great service, little to wait time, open till 2AM, clean, nice bathrooms, and good location in Aria.  Cons: food is not the greatest as the pad thai and shrimp was greasy. Plus drinks are very overpriced.  Overall, a good place to go too if you're on a budget and craving Thai food. Just skip ordering cocktails.

k7bE8J3RiOhN26xUXq113w.text: The decor of this place is amazing: I'd give it 5 stars. But when it comes to the food, I am not so sure. I am a Pad See Ew addict, and I've been eating it EVERYWHERE, so for $18 a plate, I was expecting to eat the best Pad See Ew of my life. It was definitely good, but it wasn't the BEST. The portion however was of a good size, and the service was nice.  The location is a bit further from the main strip, but then again, it's closer than most other Thai restaurants in Vegas!

FucYYXBDVmUd_z9Ut80aVQ.text: Great ambiance with so tasty and healthy food. Very good service and value for money . Very well recommended .

duQRP6NKU8hwOe5bMaul_g.text: We decided to eat here for dinner since we were in the Aria hotel already.  Had dinner with my husband, so we got 2 entrees and 1 app, food amount was enough to make us each pleasantly full.  Spice level is offered from 1-10 and we thought 5 for medium, but when I asked for 5/medium, the server said 2 was a medium, so we went with that.  Price is what you would expect, this being a sit down restaurant in a nice hotel on the LV Strip.    Vegetable spring rolls, fried -  These were great, pretty close to the ones from my favorite Thai take out in LA.  Green Curry, Seafood - Good flavor as well, had scallops, shrimp, squid and the usual veggies.  Delish!  Mee Goreng, Beef - Spice level of 2 was just enough, 5 definitely would have been too much.  Not a usual item I order so I can't really compare it but it's got a strong tomato flavor a was very good, although I wasn't a fan of the potatoes, being that it's a noodle dish and there's enough carb already.

qBsZRmcRwIG0UtUHKwvCug.text: You might be craving Thai while in Vegas. Understandable.   You might wander into the Aria and find yourself sitting down at a very zen-like restaurant, ordering a pad see ew and finding yourself completely dissatisfied - no spice, minimal flavor, overly inflated prices (they had pho on the menu - for a whopping $15. I've never paid more than $5 - or let's be generous and say $7 - for pho...). Regrettable.  Unlike many things in Vegas, where extravagance and decadence make things oh-so-much more fun, Thai food is probably better served in hole-in-the-wall, marketed-via-word-of-mouth locations - avoid Lemongrass. For authentic, worthwhile Thai food I'm thinking you'll have better luck off the Strip.

Bfxn8TaE2YdKZNWMmA8B_Q.text: Lemongrass is a nice, classy restaurant with pretty good food.  Not spectacular or incredibly creative, but satisfying.  We ate the spring rolls and pad thai, and both were just fine.  We also ate the mushroom basil steamed rice, and the flavor combination of tender mushrooms, red peppers, and basil was really nice.  The service was a bit slow, but our server was really nice and friendly.  Lemongrass is a nice restaurant and the food is good, but I wouldn't add this to any must-dine restaurant lists.

gE3YixuIZ2PT4U5oBaubFQ.text: Actually between 2 and 3 stars... Marginally better than the Thai-Asian restaurant at Bellagio... but not by much... (although it is a more attractive looking place than Noodles). Ingredients are fresh and the service is adequate... it's just that the food is okay... nothing at all special.   Prices are typical for this category 'Strip' restaurant... not worth it... but no surprise.  A good number of folks visit, as it's one of the limited number of  restaurants that are part of a comp package at Aria.

-BDhb8tu9o9Jh6vfD-B9NA.text: LemonAss is more like it. I ate here with a co-worker while we were in  town for a convention. The place was half full at 10pm, but it took forever for our "very busy" server to get our drink order. Re-fills and the food took way too long. Turns out that she was the busser.   We started with chicken satay that tasted  like something frozen from Trader Joe's. My co-worker had yellow curry and gave it average marks. I had three cups chicken. The sauce was fine, but the "meat" was six drumettes. You know, the "other" half of the wing. There was so little meat on these, mostly gristle. This was a $15 entree.   Steamed rice was $3 extra. I've had Thai food all over the country, and this is first Asian restaurant of any kind to charge for it. Soft drinks $4.50, and sky-high prices for booze or anything but sewer tap water.   The waiter didn't show up until is was time for the check. I settled up the bill with a 5% tip.   I mentioned this experience to some colleagues that have been around City Center, contractors that built the place. They mostly agree that there isn't a really worthwhile restaurant in Aria.

CqsCIMzmG1NmSZSyFztgHg.text: It was late and we were hungry.  I've had better Thai cuisine, although the prices were reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mee Goreng and Duck in Red Curry

jKWqDvd0lADjoH1yCwNOZA.text: As a newbie to Thai cuisine, I cannot compare this to any other Thai places. This particular restaurant had an interesting interior design and was very spacious with high ceilings and ropes that suspended the lighting up in the air and cut across the restaurant. The food we ordered was a spicy soup, green curry, and a noodle dish that was chewy and flavorful. The spicy soup though was my favorite since I love spicy foods, lemongrass, and veggies. The green curry had the right amount of spice and tender chicken. The only thing I didn't like about it was the higher price but hey it's Vegas in a nice hotel/casino so what do you expect right?

R_R6u16W4pAO29n_6P6f1g.text: Delicious yellow curry and drunken noodles. Pair it with a fresh young coconut water and the meal was pure heaven! Highly recommended!

tA-naPi6lzU7GQjC5YiKyg.text: good wontons and nice heavy pour on the drinks.  I'll be back for more.

wARpvozIzr2M8FjbgKNvEA.text: As a Thai restaurant, Lemongrass makes amazing Chinese food. Their dim sum was very authentic as well as the beef noodle soup and duck noodle soup.

1SV8Vq2j47uTSYvRv-fnNw.text: In 2014, an excellent Thai dinner with my girlfriend before a Cirque show while staying at Aria.  Fall of 2017, very mediocre dim sum brunch with poor service.  Averaging the 5 from 2014 and the 3 from 2017.  Don't have enough information to draw any further conclusions.  If you live near a major city with a prominent Chinatown such as NYC or San Francisco,  you've had better dim sum at half the price.

NPOtlGasLSbYJxqqSrFyag.text: Was starving and came here for dinner right after going to the Big Bang concert at Mandalay Bay.  It was one of the restaurants that was open late at night and close by our hotel.  We ordered the beef red curry, chicken rad nah and tai chen chicken.  The food tasted good.  Service was good.  But it was a bit expensive, but again, it's Vegas so what do you expect.  Also, for a not so busy restaurant, it took awhile for the food to come out.  The waiter was nice and attentive and our waters were filled quickly.  The restaurant wasn't that busy at that time of night.  Its your basic thai food-nothing fancy or special, but overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rad nah
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red curry
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tai Chen chicken

Rmg3wo_6aPDgqXi4iA2vlA.text: I was considering five stars. I really was. I've eaten at Lemongrass a few times, and the food is consistently great. The restaurant itself is beautiful. The service on my last visit was absolutely terrible. Brought it down to 3.75 stars, so I'm rounding up.  The food is beautiful, flavorful, delicious. Particularly recommend the red curry with duck breast and lychee, the crab fried rice, and the drunken noodle with seafood. Seafood central, but so delicious.  The selection of vegetarian options is scanty, and they don't really reduce the price if you want to sub veggies for the protein.  The mango and sticky rice is spot on! Temperatures were perfect, the mango was ripe and sweet.  As far as the service, things were fine at the beginning of the meal, then really started to slow down about halfway through. Then they just straight up screeched to a halt. After we finished eating, we waited over half an hour to get the waiter's attention to request our check. Then another ten minutes to actually get the check. Good thing we didn't have any pressing plans for the evening! No apology or anything. Good thing the food was so great or I'd be writing Lemongrass off my list for good.

BVzOeEVkOp8gCrFxcK2d0g.text: Absolutely delicious and gluten-free friendly (just ask them to use GF soy sauce in preparation). Had the tofu and veggie bowl and the coconut mango rice dessert and was in heaven. Came back more than once just for dessert! Tip for future visits: make reservations as this place was packed and had a 45-60 minute waiting time whenever I came by (to pick up my takeout).

Z6-sv90m6e2H-2s_8JMIrg.text: This place use to be amazing when first opened Aria Hotel and the dishes all taste different now. Going from my favorite restaurants to no so much anymore. Dishes used to be flavorful and consistent. We ordered their shrimp pad thai, not the greatest. The chicken with peanut sauce appetizer was good. Ice cream is good.. but their main dishes disappointed. Pineapple Rice also not impressive. I miss the old lemongrass chefs.

F7GVc_a-3vOcd43fKmbarg.text: Wow! Huge disappointment. I had the Mee Goreng and my other diners ordered the noodle soups. Pretty much, the common consensus was that the food was bland. My Mee Goreng was  pretty much noodles in ketchup. The Thai coffee was too sweet. The fresh watermelon juice tasted like it was left out for a long time. For the price paid, I really expected better

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mee Goreng - Noodles in Ketchup. Not good!

wLShygBXKiSM1MZ3Abt0mg.text: On vacation and looking for a place in Aria to eat. Lemongrass looks great from the outside and has an enticing menu. When you actually get the food though, it's unfortunately bland, unimaginative and disappointing. I honestly get better Chinese food back home at the random place on the corner. The service was also very lackluster.

iUCzZvnaiIQSfZ8bRB-P6Q.text: After some great experiences with the other eateries inside the Aria hotel, we decided to stop by Lemongrass for lunch.  Being right outside the Sky Suites entrance, we must have walked past this restaurant dozens of times. However, we noticed that it was never really busy - a possible indication of quality?  We decided to try for ourselves.  We walked up to the host stand and asked for a table for two for lunch.  We were sat promptly.  This is where the promptness of service ended.  After what seemed like a longer than normal amount of time, a server came over and took our drink orders.  We ordered hot jasmine tea and water.  After another extended period of time, we received our drinks and we placed our order.  The appetizers, as well as entrees, were brought out at different times, but not as a regulated course approach, but more like bringing out as they are prepared.  This seems to reflect poor execution of timing on the kitchen's part.  For appetizers, we ordered Jellyfish, Potstickers, and Chicken Satay.  The jellyfish dish was delicious.  Crisp, fresh, with a hint of sesame, but not so much that it overpowered the dish.  The potstickers and chicken satay were unremarkable but good.  Our lunch order consisted of Phad Thai and Basil Fried Rice.  Both dishes were good, safe, prepared correctly with nothing remarkable, and not any different or better than any local strip mall Thai restaurant.  In all reality, I've had better at certain strip mall Thai restaurants.  I expected more from a restaurant within the walls of the Aria.  When compared to the likes of barMasa, it is a huge difference in the quality of service and food.

a9Ls6HUaxiLpr_-YdoDAbQ.text: We stayed at Sky suites and didn't wanna go far to eat because we have a one year old baby. So we just decided to go downstairs and grab something fast and hot.  The food was pretty good and the price is affordable!   Our server Mindy was very very good! She took care of us very well. I had my one year old daughter dine with us (5 adults). They got high chair for babies! Food was fast and hot and delicious!!!! I gotta say the service was awesome! Food was great!!!! I will definitely come back soon.

23AWCMsTfXRTzUB4rsLe7g.text: Arrived to Vegas on Friday evening,  was hungry and had a food voucher. Craving for asian food. Saw all the good reviews on this place. Went there to experience it. Want greeted promptly, seated in the center of the room. To me the restaurant needed a little more lighting. We got the prawn satay, seafood drunken noodles, ribeye salad. The prawn satay was really good, it came with two slices of french bread and a curry dip. The skewers of prawns was held up with a piece of pineapple. The appetizer was good.   Shortly after that the drunken noodles came out, it looked good. The flavor was bland, the seafood in it was good except for the squid, it was dry. The veggies was crunchy some of leafy parts was over done. I added in some soy and some siracha chili sauce to it.   We was also waiting on our ribeye salad, this was about 5 mins after they brought out our drunken noodles. You would think the salad would comeout first if not together with the noodles. The wife took the first bite of the ribeye. I asked her how is it, "chewy" she stated. I had a piece, it was chewy. It seemed like they had cut a piece of tissue with it because there was a only couple pieces that was chewy. The salad did have good flavor tho.  Now onto waiting and waiting for the server to get us our check. Seemed like forever, I also saw a customer walk up to one of the servers and said "we need service, we've been sitting for over 10 mins and no one had came over. 5 mins passed I got my check, signed. As I was leaving that table seemed to have not been helped yet.   I give three stars as I had better thai food/experience o in a smaller town, in the US of course.

IZDkQNcj9CIlUNF6mZHV3w.text: What an experience. It's a modern twist of Thai cuisine. The Decor is high-class and encompasses the True meaning of high class. The servers are not only knowledgeable about their product, but meticulous about providing impeccable service.  Lets move on to the food. Most places are afraid to make things too spicy.....these guys arent and i LOVE THAT!!!!!!!

Y_U8aP6L9YyOHIt99GDohA.text: The food was tasteless and the service was terrible. Have no intention of returning to this place. Overrated and overpriced.

UvUIyxW-Bx3cAqs8cSByBg.text: This is probably one of the best meals I had while I was in Vegas Went here after reading other Yelp reviews. We started with an order of the potstickers. So good.  Hot, fresh, and the sauce was scrumptious Eric and I both had the Pad Thai. He had tofu and I had shrimp. So good. I like to judge a place on their Pad Thai. My expectations were met.  The staff was super nice and helpful. My water glass was never empty, which is important when at a Thai restaurant.  I definitely recommend this place if you're in Vegas.

UvPD_aJa8gZDBzDMCmVgRw.text: Excellent food!!! Pad Thai out of this world!!!! Wonderful atmosphere, great food...I would give 5 stars, but the service was lacking. P.S. Rope art on pointe!

cUJAeKvWsbNRXih6JnSxGA.text: We were looking for a good place to eat within Aria and decided to check out lemongrass. Though the decor is nice, the food is mediocre at best. We ordered the vegetarian spring roll as an appetizer, followed by the green curry with chicken, chicken cashew nut, and basil beef fried rice. The spring rolls were not noteworthy. The green curry was over salted. The cashew nut was very bland with the chicken being chew and unseasoned. The fried rice was under salted.  For the price range I would have expected better food.

ZU1omjP7YQ6jlcef5k4vgg.text: Lemongrass was our first stop after checking in at our hotel. I was seriously hungry, overwhelmed by the Vegasness of Vegas, and super grumpy. The yellow curry was like an elixir. It came in a huge bowl, and even though I was hungry (I mean, really really really hungry), I couldn't finish the whole thing. It didn't come with everything that was listed as being in it on the menu, but when I mentioned it, our waitress was quick to correct the problem. She wasn't my favorite server ever -- it was a very generic and impersonal experience -- but she was nice and helpful, and although I like more, I don't feel like I can expect that.   My boyfriend got the vegetable fried rice, which was also really good. Both of us enjoyed our food so much that for the rest of the trip we kept talking about going back there instead of trying other restaurants.   The experience wasn't 100%, but the food was so good and generously portioned that it actually merited the price. We only went there once on this trip, but I'm sure we'll be back again on a future trip.

rEIphn5AmXv-_r2an1afQw.text: Chicken in the sesame chicken meal was stringy and very difficult to cut. My wife had cashew chicken and the meat was recooked chicken...a big "no no" in the restaurant business. I felt sick after foolishly eating here! Also, beware the meals do not include the rice and its $3 extra for white and a whopping $4 for brown rice. Who serves a meat dish without rice?! Its crooked practice

qt6AbBpUBx11uP0UJEC0DA.text: WOW! That is the one word i thought of when thinking about Lemongrass! Their food is amazing and well worth the money you pay. I am pretty frugal too, but this place just delivers some great food. The service was great, the drinks are fairly prices and the food is a fair price.  I left full, satisfied and happy i dropped in. If you have a chance, check this place out!

3q9dJAWpt8n-aCFe1F9E0A.text: This place was mediocre. My favorite part was the tea . We got pad Thai , spring rolls, basil fried rice , panang curry and pho . Everything was just alright. The spring rolls were mushy in the middle . I've had a lot better for a lot cheaper. High prices for small plates . Atmosphere is very nice though.

BhSU0-91_hlPJdCojn41fw.text: ***There were some good dishes at Lemongrass (as well as a few items that did not feel outrageously priced); there were also a few mediocre things at Lemongrass; if you do your research though and order popular items at Lemongrass, you are probably in for a satisfying and maybe even not too pricey lunch or dinner for Las Vegas***  I saw in a taxi that Lemongrass is the only Thai restaurant located in a major resort and casino on The Strip.  Lemongrass is located in Aria and it is open for lunch (it was surprisingly busy for lunch despite its location; it is kind of located in the back of Aria, which I would assume would not get much foot traffic).  Lemongrass features an all-day menu consisting of satays, appetizers, salads, soups, entrees featuring all kinds of proteins (beef, chicken, lobster, prawns, pork, tofu, sea bass, and crab), curries, rice dishes, and noodle dishes.  Like a lot of Thai restaurants, Lemongrass features a big menu so maybe it should not be a surprise that some dishes are good while others underwhelm.  I thought their chicken wings were very good.  They were not battered, but the outside was crispy while the inside was very juicy.  The chicken wings had a good flavor too--a fair amount of spiciness.  The chicken wings were served with a sweet dipping sauce.  The Pad Thai Ghoong also had a good amount of spiciness too and the spiciness was more than I would expect with pad thai so it was a nice surprise.  The pad thai also featured good noodles, a generous portion of prawns, crushed peanuts, and bean sprouts.  I did feel that the portion of noodles was a tad small.  The fried tofu with sauteed mushrooms, peppers, onions, scallions, and oyster sauce featured really good deep-fried tofu.  The tofu had a great and distinct edge while the inside was soft and very creamy.  Unfortunately, the sauce was very lukewarm in temperature.  Even if the dish had been served fresh and hot, it might have needed more heat or flavor.  In addition, with the tofu and the cooked vegetables, the dish felt too soft (there needed to be more crispiness or crunchiness).  The yellow curry with chicken, onion and potato was quite watery and bland.  I really liked the potato, but the chicken was shredded without care and overly dry.  It was disappointing given the quality and moistness of the chicken wings.  The beef satay was not that good.  The texture of the beef was a tad chewy.  The flavor was okay though.  The satay came with garnishes of peanut sauce, cucumber relish, and ciabatta bread.  Service was good--pleasant and attentive.  The food came out at a quick pace.  The restaurant has a mostly dark decor.  The room is comfortable.  And despite being very close to the casino, the restaurant feels very blocked off with walls and such to keep the smoke from wafting over to Lemongrass' dining room.  Prices vary.  Appetizers are in the $10 and below range while several main dishes go for $16; there are several courses in the $25 range and portions vary with some dishes feeling generous with proteins and others feeling stingy with proteins or noodles.  Lemongrass probably has enough good things on the menu that you can have a good lunch or dinner here.  You need to do your research before coming here.  I thought the chicken wings and pad thai were both good, but the other dishes were mediocre.  I imagine there are other good things here and there are probably a few reasonably priced dishes as well.  If you know what to order and get the kitchen on a good day, Lemongrass can probably be a satisfying and not too expensive lunch or dinner on The Strip.  Like other major hotels and casinos on The Strip, Aria offers free self and valet parking.

ggTt9E_nRhOl1UESrpAcTQ.text: For what it is, it is ok. A hight priced Thai restaurant in a 5 star hotel. I had the chicken coconut soup and Pad See Ewu... A flat Noodle dish with chicken. It was good but not great. I've had better Thai food elsewhere. Stick with Lotus of Siam or that Thai place downtown.  Service was quick and friendly, not overly intrusive.

IRwbKLsLXWh2_WBuXbBToA.text: Last minute find on a late Sunday night. Amazing food and great service.  We had the chicken and shrimp satay to start. Excellent!  From Start to finish. Ended with deep friend banana and ice cream. Pad thai, panang and rib eye was perfect! Definitely can't wait to go back next time.

5TW7fRTrcATOkcU6OJfnXg.text: The food was actually pretty good (not great), however that was outweighed by the food poisoning that I got from eating here

fjTPzOdIakADthDKh2Dmag.text: Food: good Service: great Decor and Ambiance: great  The food was good but I did not see how it was better than the regular neighborhood thai joint. I tried the basil fried rice and it was really very satisfying but nothing that would justify the $18 price point. Maybe I did not get the right thing.  Overall would try someplace else unless I want thai food.  Thank you

_Zun0FZYwH1jWUtmqcaY_A.text: Hands down best Thai restaurant I've been too. I love how each item is blazing with flavor. The drunken noodle and sea bass is outstanding. Ive been to many other Thai restaurants and have not been a fan. The atmosphere is calm and relaxing. Pricey, but you're paying for what you get. I recommend the two dishes along with pineapple fried rice if you're a pineapple fanatic.

BP4tB1CjKOVn4ktfpckr1A.text: If I couldn't get all the meals comped at this place, I'm not sure I would eat here. But all the meals are free from my poker comps so I'm here more than I would if free market forces were applied.  The Soft-shelled crab fried rice is really really good fried rice. With that said, it's fried rice and it costs something like 30 dollars. They also have a slew of dishes and you can adjust the "hotness level" on a scale of 1-10. I've tried level 5 and 8, and the dish that was the 5 was more spicy than some of the 8's, so I think it's spotty. If you like your stuff spicy, 8 is a good level.  I don't remember all the other dishes I tried, but they are all decent.
