qg9vIsMGibrieMOaHu7w1A.text: After a late show my mom and I got back to the hotel around 11:30. Many places are closed but they have later hours. Their cocktails are very nice, and their beer selection is large. The potstickers are delicious, and they can make many dishes steamed instead of stir-fried which is better for health conscious people. The sorbet and ice cream are also excellent dessert options.

Sr6EcYEi5439nCfHPLCzeQ.text: This restaurant has a beautiful ambience. It has a very romantic candle light setting and it's located in the Aria which is beautiful as well, also it's fairly reasonably priced. I recommend the yellow curry chicken with a side of white rice.

A-gc8iEGunN4MnHktNiZ-A.text: Another great dinner at Lemongrass! Cold prepared jellyfish, lobster and prawn satays, red curry chicken which I ordered "6 out of 10 heat index" and I was sweating! Try a cold, unfiltered sake to round out the flavors. If you're around Las Vegas City Center you should try this for lunch or dinner.

s56WeMPObcM4NOswvzhWrA.text: I love this place! The prawn satay and salmon rolls are great starters, and the lemongrass seafood salad is my favorite.  Favorite drinks would be the pink leopard and can't go wrong with a whole coconut with a straw and orchid in it lol :) mango with sticky rice a little salty but still I finished the whole dessert. Service is always friendly. And I can use my comps to cover the tab :)

YW8FflwBw0bSCo3n3oOoUw.text: The food arrived late and it was cold. The food absolutely had no flavor at all. The waiter ignored our instructions entirely. We asked our food to be spicy and it was no where near to that. I would really look at other Thai restaurant on a strip that has better service and flavorful food.

yB7-xo-0Ua63ih7VKL0VUA.text: I enjoy eating at Lemongrass whenever I'm at the Aria.  It is a beautiful restaurant with a nice selection of Thai cuisine.  Extra points for delivering to the poker room when I play there.

giZwpQHNbd4wf1TdDpwyVg.text: This place has some great food and the service was outstanding.  I can't offer much help because I don't remember the name of the dishes, but I had to leave a review for the service.  There is something about a waiter who makes sure to point out the 18% included gratuity before leaving the tab that I can really respect.   Definitely recommend this place. Great service and food.

YpSZ9jILPuNk-nf45rvPZw.text: The quality of food is unfortunately not worth it's ambiance. The surrounding is nice and is the only reason this is getting 2 stars. The food was very mediocre. Has the tom yum soup...chicken and mashed on was very chewy and soup was over the top lemony. Also had the basil chicken and chicken was again very chewy...low quality. And I've honestly never had brown rice taste as it did at this place.

PV8AOnCDIRUHUPp1MdjO5Q.text: Had dinner here on 6/22 with family.  I had already read the other reviews. Some reviewers liked this place, some did not. You can put me in the column for liking it.  Started off with one of my favorite drinks, a Grey Goose dry martini, straight up. It was good, so I forced myself to drink another.  Our waiter, Van, was pretty much on top of it. Friendly, knew the menu, made suggestions based on our menu questions. I started off with the Tom Yum soup, spice level #5. Now I love spicy food but following our waiters suggestion, I stuck my level in the middle of a 1 -10 scale. Glad I did because it was just right. I could have gone up 1 or 2 more, but why? This soup was tasty. I had the shrimp version and these shrimp were very fresh and clean tasting.  We had a few different plates and shared among us. I had some type of spicy seafood noodle dish whose name escapes me right now (Grey Goose martini's?) but it is the first dish on their entree list. My wife had a green chicken curry. We switched our dishes after a short while because she thought it was a little too spicy for her. It was not too spicy for me.   Now I am somewhat of an aficionado when it comes to green curry. I make an excellent version myself. The version here at Lemongrass was better than average. My only dislike with it is that I just did not care for the pieces of potato in it, but the rest of the dish was just fine. I would order it myself.  No room for desert. It usually works out this way for me.  I would give this place somewhere between 3 and 4 stars. However, our waiter was really good and that makes a difference so I will give four stars. If you are staying at the Aria, it is a nice option for dining. Reasonably priced......................for Vegas!  Cheers to all

1HXnWPGqjIr3p3i6N-gegw.text: Cake. Cookies. Pie. Brownies. How about a bowl of sweet coconut soup with doughy, flavored rice balls? Lemongrass serves the most unique dessert I've ever eaten. I love new things, especially new things that are tasty and appear to be healthy, even if they're not. The warm coconut riceyish bowl is all that.  Lemongrass also serves the best yellow chicken curry. Ever. And no, I'm not a yellow curry expert. I order it less than 10% of the time at Thai restaurants. However, I try it off other people's plates. If I were to visit Lemongrass again, I'd order it as my own main entree.   Some other bonuses: moist, perfectly cooked chicken satay; outstanding service; outdoor lights installed inside.   I ate here during restaurant week--so I enjoyed a lovely three course dinner for $30.11. It was a damn good meal!

wMff0L57Kiu-h4Yj5izDFg.text: At first I was very surprised by its three star review. The I realized why as my meal progressed. Decided to come here for lunch since we wanted something inside the hotel to save time, and most other restaurants were closed for lunch. Promptly seated when we arrived, and they informed us there was still dim sum being served so we were pretty excited. The food is Chinese and Thai, even though they call themselves a Thai restaurant. So they actually pushed around some dim sum on a cart. We ordered a bunch of things and the guy pushing the cart was a pretty good salesman because we ended up with a bunch of stuff, and he spoke Cantonese as well. Most of the dim sum dishes were b/n $5-7. Definitely more expensive than most restaurants. Chicken feet - 3.5 stars, I like dim sum king better, but it was decent. yelp.com/biz_photos/N7yu... Shark fin dumpling - 3.5 stars, tasted fresh and not too bad. But I've never been a huge fan because I don't really like cilantro. yelp.com/biz_photos/N7yu... Stick rice in lotus leaf - 4.5 stars. This was really good. Very flavorful, filled with lots of meat, and they used regular shrimp rather than dried shrimp. yelp.com/biz_photos/N7yu... The next three is part of dim sum but it was not readily available on the cart. But it only took a few minutes from the point of ordering to arrival. Stuffed crab claw - 4 stars, it tasted really fresh and filled with crab and shrimp compared to most dim sum places. However as you eat the claw you can taste that it's been previously frozen. Fresher than other places, but not completely fresh. Didn't care for the mayo that came with it, just used chili sauce and soy sauce. yelp.com/biz_photos/N7yu... Curry pork bun and basil chicken bun. I like the curry pork bun, didn't taste so much like curry but had a little kick and lots of flavor. I thought the basil chicken tasted a little bland but my bf liked it. yelp.com/biz_photos/N7yu... We had ordered off the regular menu and was waiting on the rest of our food. We picked the basil meatball soup, chicken curry, and after reading good reviews for the satay, I opted for the lobster satay. They bring out the food, and despite repeating lobster satay back to me, they brought a lobster salad. I informed them that it was the wrong item, so they took the salad away and one can only assume that they were suppose to bring me my satay. Basil meatball soup $9 - 4 stars. FIlled with tender soft meatballs, and loaded with lots of basil leaves. The soup was light and refreshing, and the immense taste of basil left my mouth feeling refreshed. Not too greasy, and perfectly seasoned. yelp.com/biz_photos/N7yu... Curry - 3 stars. Tasted like everywhere else to me, the only bonus is that it was loaded with potatoes. My bf actually didn't like the curry and he only ate a little bit of it. I barely touched it so we threw most of it away. yelp.com/biz_photos/N7yu... So about 30-35 minutes have past since they brought me the wrong dish. We are completely done eating and still nothing. Took us about 5 more minutes to flag down out waiter, even though it was not busy at all. And he said that it's almost ready. I didn't even really want it at this point. But he just said it was coming and ran off. Waited waited waited...... 5 more minutes passes by, so I was like forget it, let's go this is stupid. It doesn't take 45 minutes to make satay. So another 5 minutes passes before we find out waiter again and ask for the bill. So guess what, they CHARGED me for the lobster satay that I DIDN"T eat and I DIDN"T receive. Are you kidding me????????? So his explanation was he took off the dim sum items instead. Well he took off three dim sum items that added up to $18 while my satay was $22, so WTF. It's not about $4, because even then our lunch was well over $100. I don't care about $4. I care about the principle that you did not serve me well, and you want to rip me off additionally. Why can't you just reverse the satay?? Why must you do some funky thing and take off three dim sums that adds up to less than my satay? Seriously????????? I would NEVER eat here again. I am surprised for a wonderful hotel like Aria that they would even have a restaurant like this. The service is so below par. Unfortunately I wrote a 20%+ tip before I saw the charges. I always stayed at Aria when I went to Vegas since it opened for the last 10 times I've visited. I am really disappointed. Avoid this place, NOT WORTH IT. Such shady business practices.

Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basil meatball soup

59FkZ1lSu21TgOR55roRwQ.text: Great food and great service. We had a group of 7, all of us very different eaters. I had the panang curry because its my go to dish when i eat Thai. Their version had lychees in it and oh man was the spice on point. Loved everything about it. We also had the cumber salad (perfectly spicy and crunchy), the drunken noodles, and several others dishes, and no one was disappointed! Definitely would go back again!

f5VnTTL8xG_P-QWjoLYNnw.text: It was alright.  I've had much better Thai food. It had good decore, but that was pretty much the only thing that was memorable.

rIiXurrcp07kUnF5B4Agzw.text: We stopped into Lemongrass at Aria in City Center for a quick lunch. They offer an assortment of Asian dishes from appetizers to entrees to desserts.   My wife had noodles and I had a rice dish. (I can't remember the names, and they don't have an online menu). Regardless of the names, our food was very tasty.  But the dish that made it to the top of my experience was their Sweet Rice with Sweet Mango and Coconut. I could have (should have) ordered 2 more of those.   Though there are better restaurants around, this place is good and you won't be disappointed.

xjmtZvPWUDasjjo0Xq-omw.text: Although this place is listed as a Thai restaurant,  it is more Asian Fusion as they have a mix of Thai and Chinese food.  I ended up ordering the Tom Kha Chicken Soup and the Yellow Curry, both them were ordered at a 8 (out of 10) for a spice level.  The Tom Kha Chicken soup was pretty large and was enough to feed 2-3 people.  The flavors were wonderful and there was plenty of chicken pieces.  The only thing that was new to me was these funny looking mushrooms that they used,  they had a purple top, but their bottoms and stems were more of a white/beige color.    The yellow curry was great as well, but there were a few pieces of potatoes that were undercooked.   The slickness of the dish was more on the mild side even tho I ordered it at a very hot level.  This dish was also large enough to share with a friend or two.  I took off a couple of stars because the service was pretty bad.  When I walked in, they didn't have any tables available and so they offered to seat me at the bar.  I grabbed one of the smaller tables beside the bar, sat down and within a few minutes I had my menu.  Then it took about another 10-15 minutes before the waiter came by to take my order.  When I was finished with my meal,  they came by took away my dishes and asked if there was anything else,  I said no and they went away.  Expecting to receive my bill, I ended up waiting another 15 mins before they came back with my bill.  So dinner at a place like this should take about 30-40 mins,  it ended up taking over an hour.  And it was not that busy in the bar area, so I couldn't understand why the lack of attention.  This place is also pretty expensive, for my 2 dishes, a Thai iced tea, and a small plate of rice(yes it was extra) my meal came out to about $33.

rsSXkbochVTsRG6yuOcqPQ.text: REALLY good Thai... beautiful decor, great service, would definitely go again!

3RBxOHCo_ux3yanTgwPrhQ.text: Yummy food and great service. We went for lunch and I'm so glad we did. Everything was fresh, tasty and the perfect amount of spice. I will be returning on my sub sequential visits to Las Vegas.

8XERpUUWS8zY638sR3YIlA.text: Ate here with a group of 4 and dinner was ok/good. The server was attentive and explained the dished very well, and I might return. I had the basil steak and the rest of the group said their meals were good, but not great. For a restaurant in the Aria, this one fell short of expectations in comparison to other Thai restaurants.

BJwqNYRWdl8w4KBbKdrD3A.text: Love Lemongrass. Best Thai food! I love spicy food and they have a 1-10 spice level so you can really customize how spicy you want your meal. I usually get a 3 or 4 and it's pretty spicy! My favorites dish is the Basil Meat (I get ground pork) and side of brown rice. Food is consistently good. Service and atmosphere is good.

h4aeKmFNda5Bk4xJWZ2lMw.text: My husband and I stop here for dinner every time were in Vegas. Great Resteraunt inside of the Aria. Amazing food and great service. The calamari appetizer is a must! Love the Pad Thai. Never have I had a bad experience here.

TXc8ByXJG1cUBLYB5rdZXg.text: My friend and I were craving Thai on our last night in Vegas so we came here. We had the chicken wings, fish cakes, papaya salad, and pad thai. We also had Thai iced te which wasn't too sweet. Just right.. Everything was so tasty and delicious. The ambience here is classy and upscale. The service here is great and so was the food.

4zumXGjI0D4nNm1R8W8NCw.text: We had read reviews about it and decided to try it, but were more than just disappointed after the meal: - The service was not bad, but was a little slow  - The ice water that we received tasted  metallic-y  -  The portions were small (we ordered the chicken cashew nut, and when we received it, it was a small pile and it looked as if someone had taken a scoop out already) - All the food that we received was cold (The soup was actually cold when it reached our table)   However, the atmosphere was nice and was very modern, but we don't think that we will be returning.

IIiGdtbVaDQQW1kzYHz81A.text: Totally impressed!  So I thought.... oh no.... I read all these awful reviews on yelp and we're going to get mediocre over-priced food -  But we thought.... well, it's walkable from where we are...  and we love Thai.. so we thought we'd give it a try.  And aren't we glad we did!  It was great!  The ambiance romantic for a nice dinner, the food fabulous, even made to order (i.e. veg with no fish sauce on request) and the staff so nice.  The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because we asked for the booth we saw...  the host (not manager) said no, however, we notice that when we left after our meal, the whole time we were there the booth was still left vacant.... but fair enough, the booth sat 4 or more and we were just two....  It makes sense.  But I totally support this one.  Really friendly staff who gave great and honest recommendations =)  Delicious!  And quite frankly a shocking surprise of quality on the Vegas strip!

ASO9BLe-fd2R3C3BBvfrNQ.text: Have eaten here numerous times and have never been disappointed. Tom kha chicken and pineapple fried rice are two of my all-time favorites and the fried bananas and Thai tea are the perfect dessert. Only have been there during night time and the staff has always been attentive and helpful and very friendly.

IizBMG7P8khV3E4R9mbXEg.text: I eat a lot of Chinese and Thai food so I know what quality Chinese and Thai food should taste like and this place has it all. They not only serve typical Thai food but they also serve some typical Chinese food as well. The waiters also speak Chinese (Canto and Mando) so if you can't speak English then they can understand your orders in Chinese. I would recommend the Beef Pho, having it here is amazing and one of the best that I've ever had. The only negative I would have for this place is the price. Like all casino restaurants it can be quite expensive for usual simple dishes. But I guess the price comes with quality. And compared to some of the fancier restaurants on the strip this one cost isn't too bad.

EfbloMDBn5LlOkA-upTMjg.text: Wonderful service, and great food.  The ingredients were fresh, the portions were generous and the prices were very reasonable.

EsDoJQKUfTCbeNng_CfSpQ.text: they lost our ressies. however, they made it up by seating our party of 5 promptly, albeit in the bar area. the food was delish. we were starving and our trillion dishes came out speedily. ok, fine, just 7. it was clockwork in motion as the family style plates arrived and we automatically doled some onto each plate and then passed to the person on our right. we were so hungry (oink) that we even pre-hot sauced our pristine plates so that each one was drenched in red by the time food finally joined it. they were gracious enough to bring out a candlelit plate of beautifully cut fruit for our bday girl too. yay for lemongrass, thanks for a bomb (comped) meal!! XO

GykEuDVZYp_ZF6HZx-6XCw.text: Party of 4 for early lunch. Ordered 4 dishes and one  appetizer. Spring rolls great. 2 of the 4 dishes were very good- two of the 4 were so so (bland) and we did not finish those. Chicken cashew should be fabulous here- but it was not notable and the meat cuts were not appetizing- kindof odd shaped with firm texture. When she dropped the check she noticed empty glasses and asked it we wanted refills- well not now... Beef satay is very very tasty!!! Overall expected more fun and flavor for such a prime location and price.

sGnkMQYiXPURLcd5gu_fYw.text: Great Thai food......although I must say my favorite hole in the wall place at home is better - the service was great,,  atmosphere modern & fun.  Food wise I'd give it between 3-4 stars- but the atmosphere & service make it a full 4 stars. Green chicken curry was excellent....  I disagree with the negative reviews of the dumplings- they came with an interesting dipping sauce, and really- how exciting can dumplings get? The Aria is a nice place - seems much less "Vegas" than most of the other hotels on the strip.

3pNrvJ_ub6Fz_UQp1CCXvA.text: Get the curry crab!  Ok i know its $65 dollars, and you can get it in Canada for much cheaper, but hey you are in Vegas so you might as well indulge.  The service is very good as i think it should when everything is so overpriced.  The quality of the food is fresh, but it won't wow you out of your pants.   One thing i enjoyed is that they do have dim sum service in the mornings which was a big pleasnt suprise for me when i stayed at Aria.  Instead of waiting in line for the cafe/bakery/buffet, get some dim sum.  Avoid the pho/ noodles as they are a tad bit diluted.

UwtQzfp_yLj8g-Wqvobi9g.text: Well is it Thai or Chinese, they can't make their mind up. Anyway the Tom Yum Shrimp soup was just lovely many huge shrimp and lots of shitake mushrooms The Pad Thai was pretty authentic again with huge shrimp. The duck red curry wasn't my favorite but if you like it very creamy then you would like it more than I did. Service was impeccable and it's open until 2am!!

vN-64QQU4WZ95L1FTfaRGQ.text: Overpriced mediocre Thai food, but then again what can I expect, it's located in Aria so I guess why it's a $$. The portions are alright, my family (4) and I ordered 4 dishes and we finished everything... Yes we were hungry, but we don't tend to finish what we eat whenever we go out.  I must say that I did like the ambiance and the service was great. If you want to enjoy Thai food and is willing to shell out $$, go to Lotus of Siam instead.

zWZqygMLA2ONXY584fNxIw.text: Fast food preparation and efficient service, very good shrimp pad thai, probably the best I've had!

6EPi3qseaTJksEwvukt1vw.text: Yummy Thai food!  The Panang curry was silky and luscious, although we would have liked to been asked our spice preference (we just like our curries hot!).  Definitely a small complaint.  They did the basics like potstickers and pad thai really well.  There aren't a lot of thai places on the strip, and this was a welcome find.

NzM5xgJSK0JXoLnu5vnMsQ.text: One of the hidden gems on the strip, best Thai food in Vegas alongside Lotus of Siam. Soft shell fried rice and Tom Yum Goong was amazing, definitely worth a try for any skeptics for asian food on Las Vegas blvd..

ldP0D0egUqv5XZfXsPsYMg.text: When you pay extra to go to a nice restaurant, you should get a better atmosphere, better food and better service, so one out of three rates 2 stars.    The restaurant decorations were very nice.    The service started out stellar but somewhere in the middle dropped off to the point where our water glasses were empty for a very long time and were finally refilled with warm water.  Our waiter was very nice but took forever to get us the check and we finally had to ask for it.  I ordered the Szechuan beef noodle soup and although it had a great flavor the noodles were mush.  In retrospect I should have sent it back.

rYqF8e61mjATEsPw-Drm_g.text: Wow, this place may have the best vegetarian green curry outside of Thailand! Truly Incredible!!! Also, the overall experience was amazing--great atmosphere and service.  Next time I am in Vegas, I am going to have to revisit this gem.

uMkOO5qXPRBVNtsuiEfvwA.text: Drunken noodles and pork neck were really tasty and spiced well. I would definitely come back again.

vG6KcXgtSDzRIABn_zW9LA.text: Food is pretty good here. The service, on the other hand, not so much. Our waitress seemed like she was in a rush.  Hubby tried the tasting menu and I got the black pepper shrimp and veggie drunken noodles.

IpgNea262C36OLiZ9nB0Fw.text: I had really high expectations.  For the price it was just ok.  Had the hot cucumbers to start with.  Basically hot pickles from a can.  I had the drunken noodles with chicken.  Portion size was good.  They tasted good, but the best drunken noodles are usually dripping with sauce.  These were a bit dry. Interior is beautiful but that seems to be what you are paying for.

n9TiJsJhk4SlrOkl5Amogg.text: Delicious and wonderful service. We definitely ordered way too much food for two people though!  Got rice, yellow curry, and pad see ew. BIG TIP: mix the curry and pad see ew together! Separately, they taste really good, but together, it is heaven. No need for rice either. We were completely surprised at the portions though. I wish they warned us that they did it "family style". Nothing tasted oily or overly heavy, and we didn't get food coma, which is a first for me. Normally Thai food makes me sleepy because of how heavy and rich it is, but this one was perfectly fine!  Plus, very little wait to get seated and to get our food.   Overall, delicious experience and excellent customer service.

FJFly17IIlNLtZsr6N4O7A.text: This place would have gotten 4 stars, but the second time my spouse and I dined there, we were sat at a rickety table. I hate rickety tables, and higher-end restaurants shouldn't have rickety tables.   The food is good. Its worth the price, but what we wanted wasn't on the menu, however, it was being served. Huh? The portion sizes are decent and the ambiance is pleasant.   We had Thai fried rice - chicken + beef, it was pretty good. As an appetizer we had chili cucumbers, which was quite delish. No need for reservations and I've seen all types of dress codes come through the door.   Get rid of the rickety table and the super butt dent someone left on one of the booth seats and it could be a 4-star place.

ifvtyp5y9CZcdOg4rR6_WA.text: Very mediocre food and horrible service I will never ever return to this establishment.

wb-mMewp9koNaFvmzD0HiQ.text: We had family style- ordered 12 different entree for 7 people to try... Love the sea bass the most. Service was quick.

L6vWr4hv2P7lybL7ksdXjQ.text: Been here lots of times they deserve a good review! AWESOME place ! what more can I say ! You can't find fine dinning during lunch hours Well lighted Our host and server is top notch! I and 3 other friends had lunch on 5.22.14 we started with appetizers shrimp and salmon satay, crispy squid, prawn rolls and bamboo shoots all EXCELLENT flavor ! Main course  Soup tom Yam Hed, garlic shrimp, ribeye Tamarin, 3 cup chix, soft crab  fried rice all EXCELLENT !!! For dessert the BOMB ! Drum roll BUA LOI !  My friends said no more food ..... But we need to eat desserts .... They reply no no no more... I ordered anyway .... When they took the first scoop and tasted it ... They went WOW!!! Bill added up to 199.00 that's great ! We'll recommend .... Like what we say in Hawaii for good food is BROKE DA MOUTH ! Lol

vv40su9lgoJZmZvdmNZ3tw.text: Loved this restaurant, the service, the food, the ambiance all so fabulous. Definitely a great place to enjoy a nice tasty dinner.    I had the chicken satay and chicken Pad Thai - solo good.

SSeUDEJbQOA7EZW88jZDdA.text: Very poor service, took forever to get our food and our bill. Overpriced for mediocre Thai but it's Vegas so to be expected

kWVyQbevzWlbBWmxlf-PPQ.text: The first time I went here, I had morning sickness from my pregnancy so ordered the Thai Basil Soup as it was all I could stomach. Ended up tasting so delicious!! Was refreshing from the basil leaves and the pork meatballs were tender and salty. Soup base was smooth. The second time we came I ordered same thing and was made great again. My husband ordered the Red Curry Beef (heat level 7 - definitely very spicy) and was extremely good as well. Sweet with coconut, lemon and ginger notes. Service always friendly and fast, great atmosphere. Love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai Basil Soup with Pork Meatballs

42n4ovc9MX-VYrPEtW9fHQ.text: Went here on Sunday night for late post-dinner dining after super blood moon gazing BBQ w friends.   I was looking for something Asiany w broth, and Blossom, the Chinese restaurant, seemed a little over the top and pricy given that we had already eaten dinner at the BBQ.   The decor was nice enough in the standard high end Las Vegas/ century city way, but gave a masculine, impersonal, corporate vibe, what with all the wood/ropes on the ceiling and walls and oversized lantern-looking lighting. The restaurant was dimly lit but was not romantic. It didn't even look Asian -- it could have just as easily served hamburgers and martini.   Food:  we ordered Chilean sea bass as per yelp recommendation and it was delicious. A chunk of fish filet was panko breaded and deep fried, and served drenched with thick garlicky sweet and sour sauce, with sliced green onion heaped on top. The green onion strips seemed fried as they were crunchy but was not oily. Not sure how they did that.  Hubby did not like it and thought that green onion strips just tasted hard, but I liked the light crunch. I would definitely recommend this dish.   We also ordered Mongolian beef noodle soup, which had tendon and Bok Choy. The soup was just okay, improved much by a generous dollop of hot sauce, because hot sauce makes everything better. Beef was "dark" meat ( don't know the name of the cut but I accidentally bought it at a Korean grocery store before so am familiar with it). This cut has a lot of blood in the meat so it is dark in color and has a subtle metallic flavor from all the iron in the meat. Tendon was weirdly slimy -- I like my tendon firm but this was more slimy fatty type which is decidedly off-putting. Noodle was fresh. I ate all the Bok choy, some beef, some noodles, and all the broth so My craving was satisfied, but would not order the same dish again.

6j8PdcP7qJLM4heNaobFQw.text: Great food, great atmosphere. The food portion of food and man it toast good. Just keep an eye on how much you eat, it can add up.

gStxAaoc7VRwMRdDeOHkRQ.text: If you like spice Lemongrass is for you!  I was in the Aria and had been craving Pad Thai for a week so I decided to hit up Lemongrass. First off, the space is very cool. The Aria is a 5-star hotel and Lemongrass fits right in.  I perused the menu a little bit just to see what all they offered, but I knew I was getting the Pad Thai before I even walked in the door. The waiter asked me how spicy I wanted my meal on a scale from 1-10. He explained that their food is quite spicy and 3 is medium. I like a bit of kick to my food and most restaurant's "medium" is usually very mild for me, so I opted for the 5. It was perfect! Spicy and hot but not so overbearingly hot that you can't actually taste the food. My bunghole was burning all night, but I wasn't using it for anything other than expelling bodily waste so that was okay. Wow, this review just took an unexpected turn.  Okay, enough about my butt. The food was great, the service was good, the space was awesome and my hotel room had unlimited amounts of toilet paper so it was a successful visit.   The portion was on the small size and should have been larger, hence my holding back the 5th star, but overall it was a great meal and both me and my burning colon will be back.

qv-qkLhif7RyVIMOzN6fXQ.text: 2 stars for location and service But ugh the food is awful!  The menu is just, I can't explain it.  Go to Blossom- Lemongrass is just good for pork soup nothing more  I'm surprised it's still in business

seXlsMMzsF_O8v0cCON0uA.text: Really good thai food, if you are brave  try the jelly fish. The dungenous crab curry was the best thing on the menu.

a6FpLHunmxgz2j4q8Cl1Kg.text: We were in Vegas over a month ago and we've been talking about this place ever since. It was late and we wanted to check out Old Vegas so we stumbled upon this place as we were exiting our hotel. It was fairly quiet, but then again it was really late. We started with prawn satay and coconut water. The appy was delicious but not enough to split amongst 2 people, we were left wanting more. We decided to order dinner instead. We had the garlic and lime steamed cod, I remember it being good but nothing memorably. The phad see ew which was kind of like a stir fry with flat noodles, is what we miss the most. I've gone to a few Thai restaurants in Vancouver but none of them do flat noodles like the ones I've had in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Phad See Ew with prawns only, delicious!!
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fCQ4e6yKCeoaEp04U6G9VQ.text: When we stopped in one of the newest hotels on the strip Aria, as we walked around we stumbled on this wonderful gem.  I  Thai food!  My favorite!  We were seated right away by a friendly hostess.  The ambiance was beautiful without being too intimidating, the service was fabulous and the food to die for!    We started out with a glass of bubbly and the menu offered various speciality drinks.   We had the Pad Thai and it was tasty along with a few appetizers.  I think the highlight of our night was seeing Michael Jordan walking by!  Starstruck!   I can't wait to go back!

GwSJ_TVyeVwnRdrm7zdOIg.text: While in Vegas last week, i had a strong hankering for Thai food (pretty much my favorite type of food), and i demanded that my friends and i find a Thai place to eat. We looked on Yelp and found Lemongrass and although it took us a minute to find it in the Aria, we were so glad that we persistently endeavored to locate it.   It was literally one of... maybe the best Thai food i've ever had. There's one place here in Atlanta that might give it good competition, but i might have to hand the trophy to Lemongrass.  I ordered Phad See Yew (sp.?) with seafood and it was the most perfectly flavorful and wonderful noodle dish i've ever had.  I tried each of my friends' entrees and they were near perfection as well. Next time i visit my friend in Vegas, this is a MUST-DO restaurant.  And beyond the food, i loved the decor and the RESTROOMS WERE AWESOME!

AeEOMlyU2-FMFhWenvi8Vw.text: I love Thai food, and I have to say that I am impressed!! Good food, sweet service, and nice environment! of course a bit pricey, but good quality, so worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prawn satay, must try!! So so so good!
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prawn satay, must try!! So so so good!

mu9xaJxbCKtkWuIxDUC3wQ.text: This was my first time having Thai food. And it was amazing. Service was wonderful, atmosphere was excellent, and the food delicious. But when they say a level 5 is very hot they are SERIOUS. We got a 6 and almost couldn't eat it. Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Atmosphere is great.

fVc3y6GCi6gXaZo2AZ30tQ.text: Soo goood!  They are True Thai and understand the spice levels properly.  We ordered a Basil Beef (level 5) and the traditionally Thai coconut soup.  Soooo goood!   We also had some dim sum which was decent quality and not too bad prices.  I am would go here again!

3P7qnoImwiGHiKtL28YAqQ.text: I decided to try lemongrass after learning about it on a previous visit. A great tip...the restaurant does take out...so I ordered green chicken curry & drunken noodles. The green curry was pretty tasty with a nice amount of heat whereas the drunken noodles were terribly bland. The price was good...2 dishes + rice for $42 is like finding Vegas best kept secret! (Just ask for medium spice for the drunken noodles)

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodle...totally bland
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green chicken curry take out

0QKTzx-Kqi5YBDsWI0iXrg.text: We had an early evening menu. It isn't on the menu but ask for it. It contains of a vegetable spring roll with a fish cake. As an main course it is steamed rice, garlic prawn, and green chicken curry and as finish with coconut milk with some vegetables.  It was the best Thai I have ever had and it is with a relaxing quiet atmosphere a topspot to go to. The vegetables were all wonderfull cooked and vere tastefull. For sure we are coming back here

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garluc prawn
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizer w/ early evening menu vegetable roll and fish cake

FAo5TxD_-fuleoB_E1e-uA.text: Okay so I came into Lemongrass with high expectations.  It's in the Aria after all where I've really never been let down.  But yeah, tonight, tonight is either an aberrant experience or something significantly has changed.  I came into Lemongrass with the idea of having a simple, staple Thai meal -- fish cakes, basil soup, and Pad Thai.  So first of all, the wait staff and hostess were wonderful and attentive but not overly agressive.  The restraunt atmosphere is definately up to the Aria's standards.  However, I really cannot be as kind when it comes to the cuisine.  I try not to be 'that guy' who complains about the soy sauce or the salad.  Tonight, tonight is different.  We started off with the hockey pucks, I mean the fish cakes.  To describe them using the quality "fish" or "cake" would be generous.  These were dry, rubbery, almost undercooked calimari in their texture.  They completely lacked any kind of seasoning or flavor.  So I thought to myself, okay, someone is simply having a bad day.  Next course was the Thai basil soup.  This was definately soup.  It had a raft or flotilla of basil in it.  So one could say it was definately basil soup.  One could tell the broth was pork based and had some layering of that flavor but it was totally over powered by the 3 1/4 kg of basil floating on the surface.  I jest in the weight, but not in the magnitude of the basil.  Then came the final blow to this dish.  If I would say I think they used IKEA Swedish meatballs, I don't think I am far off.  Okay so now I am thinking, well maybe this was a bad decision.  The coup-de-grace of the evening was the Pad Thai.  So I checked and double checked, it had the little hot warning chili on the menu.  I had the idea in my mind that this would have the classic flavors of peanut and chili.  Boy was I wrong.  Saying that this dish had any assemblance of classic Pad Thai and I would be simply lying.  This dish had all of the texture and flavor of an under rated nursing home potato mash and over boiled spagetti noodles that have sat on the stove for a few hours.    At this time, I simply set my flatware down and went about reading the reviews.  Like I said earlier the wait staff is wonderful.  My server picked up quickly that something was amiss and was swift to remove the pallate blanching dish from the table.  He asked what was wrong with it -- more sauce, not spicy enough, not enough peanuts -- all I could say was "yes" and please don't try to resurrect this.  It simply needs to be composted.  To finish off the evening at Lemongrass, I went back to the appetizer menu.  Pot Stickers were my main course for the evening...  Tonight, tonight I have been completely under impressed and simply befuddled by the meal at Lemongrass.  I might come back, but honestly, when it comes to the price, value and the experience.  I'll go and find an overpriced buffet and have my expectations met.  Lemongrass, I'll be passing on you.

qvItJ8U0dqv3waPv5k2new.text: Love this place! Its very pricey for your usual Thai restaurant but the service is awesome! Ambiance is great! Food is really, really good!

WbLIN69qJ3G1eBIHjNxinA.text: Food wasn't tasty at all. We tried the basil beef and sesame chicken and neither tasted good. Though the setting is fairly nice but the food, sadly, Is probably  one of the worst Thai food I ever had.

XFQbdr9QTKTahYcoeBK7HA.text: Three stars for an average place.  Great decor and clean. But for being on the strip and especially in the highly talked about city center I expected more. We had a reservation for a small group of us and were seated right away. Service was good but nothing over the top.  Our group did the tasting menu which I enjoyed but wasn't blown away.  The food was flavorful and when they warn you about things being spicy they are right. We didn't feel rushed and enjoyed our evening but I'm not aching to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert wine
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WzCVlbZ5qVYbofGaVEQyKg.text: Great choice! I hardly believe restaurants in hotels but this place was actually quite wonderful and given the price point it was well worth it!   I find it hard for a Thai place to mess up their Thai food. That being said, wonderful food! First, I came here with a last minute reservation for a rather large group ( about 20 people.) Within 30 minutes, they were VERY accommodating, so this would be a great choice if you come for a convention and need a last minute group dinner reservation.   Food was not too expensive and well within the budget of many people. Especially given that Aria has many restaurants in it but are rather expensive, this was a welcome change. Great food pricing and great tasting food.   Service and staff were very accommodating and it doesn't hurt the place itself looks beautiful - so I highly recommend coming here!

TzPmKcIWlGboNDwrYxXUdg.text: Surprisingly good Thai food on the strip. Like all of the Vegas restaurants, the interior is a sight to behold built with all sorts of rope, wood, as if the modern inteirior was built from found objects in a shipbuilding factory, which is of course impossible in the desert. Anywho, like all vegas restaurants, it is hidden in the back of the Casino but staff here was helping in tracking down the actual location.  We got the yellow curry, the portion size was good to satisfy 2 with normal appetites. The cucumber salad was probably not worth the price but it was tasty and a nice way to start the meal. Everything is very a la carte, and like most of Vegas, rather expensive. Thank goodness for company-sponsored travel :).  Service is attentive and you can bill to your room at any of the "M life" resorts.

_Hkp30U5lhDs0Ql-w7F-JQ.text: Amazing food! Amazing service!  Prices are a little high but worth it. Perfect for a romantic evening

09tfn6-S2whIBHcSehBMvQ.text: Their dishes doesn't taste like authentic Thai food, but I love their rib eye steak with tamarind sauce. I also usually get yellow or green curry chicken. The ambiance is nice & family style feel. Their service is really good, on time, and friendly. I've been coming here the last 4 years and their service is usually A plus and the wait for our food is pretty quick. My friends and I also like coming here for late night quality food since they close pretty late. Over all, I would give it a 3.5.

E1pRcKE3MXGwbjpXT-ro6A.text: One of the best thai restaurants I know. But today's experience was brutal. 1 hour wait time. I brought my brother who is visiting from europe. I asked manager if she could let us seat sooner than 1 hour considering as I was Mlife platinum member and visiting lemongrass every week. I probably have spent total $5000+ at lemongrass before for so many visits. Manager seemed rude and did not care if I was VIP customer or not. Very disappointed. You guys need new manager who cares more about vip customers coming every week. I will make sure to spread my disappointment everywhere I can.

LmvSAYaSoa6VoLTkv3jZjw.text: Good ambience and service. Liked all the dishes we ordered. However they didn't give any rice when we ordered curry which is typical at a Thai place.   Not expensive, will come back.

iH1qi8xmmCzV3QM6j-DApg.text: Here is a summary.  Every time I go to Vegas I WILL go to Lemongrass -- it's that good.  I don't know if it's the best value or not, all I know is it's not unreasonably priced, and always good.  I've visited at least 5 times.  And others I know feel the same.

YKpH_iskQEtRlNBX_CPVtA.text: Pretty good overall and a good value for Vegas... especially within the Aria. Had the cucumber appetizer, Shanghai Dumplings, Chicken Clay Pot, and Tom Yam Seafood--Tom Yam was very good!!  Clay Pot ok.  Appetizers both pretty good!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not sure what this was in my food
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flower!!
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom Yam Seafood

DvWFmpLKYwZ8MyXzZSqvwA.text: 9 year old daughter who LOVES Thai food told me to rate this "more than 5 stars". Food, service and ambiance second to none. Been to Vegas a few times with our kids and for some reason never made it to the Aria but from now on we'll make the Aria our place and the Lemongrass our go-to dinner spot. I ordered their ginger/peach cocktail and wife ordered pink leopard, both were superb. Daughter ordered hot green tea and asked for honey and low and behold honey showed up seconds later. Who does that anymore? Brings something right away? Very uncommon but thank you very much, impressive.  The food was 10/10, we each ordered our own separate meals, shared them and loved it all. Started with some spring rolls and chicken satay, wonderful. We didn't quite finish our food so we asked for to-go boxes. He left and another server came by to ask how we were doing, we told him, hey we just asked for boxes but we don't need them because we're going to be walking up the strip it will be hot so the food probably won't last. I'll be darn he goes right up to our server and tells him we don't need boxes. Again, Who does this kind of service and communication?   This is a wonderful and classy restaurant you don't want to miss if you're looking for Thai in Vegas.

KzT4fXjmmuh9rDfIV5r8fg.text: Very disappointed in the food. Squid app was flavorless. Pad Thai was flavorless,  no matter how much soy sauce and red chili sauce I doused it with. The key ingredient I could not taste, the one ingredient that sets this dish apart, tamarind, was sorely missing. Service was not great at the bar, as bartender was not knowledgeable with the menu.

v5tfp3aUIdQNj9hSUMMc3Q.text: Im not sure why this place only has 3.5 stars but its great!! Fresh food, nice decor, good service!

NNPHqLoQNFTh6RFFabcgSA.text: Service is great. food is ok some of the appetizer are amazing must try chicken satay and fish cake amazing. One thing that I don't like is the peanut sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish cake
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimpcake
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1qvnXhCjB6Opqb8IO3lOHw.text: One of the finest dining experience. Elegant ambiance, great food. The spice level is really hot and so be careful while selecting your spice level. The service at this place was exceptional. Thai lovers must try this place. Great vegetarian options available.

78CPqvddc_k8Rd1_cJmKzw.text: Wonderful ambience -- innovative decor that's open yet warm.  Service was friendly, though on Friday night when restaurant was quite full, not the fastest place ever.  I had a variety of dishes which were all quite good: * Tom Yum Soup -- 6 ginormous shrimp in a great broth with lots of super fresh, sweet mushrooms * Pad Thai - fresh & delicious  I came back for lunch: * Pork Satay - fragrant and tasty * Shrimp roll -- tasty.  the fried noodle wrapped around is both great looking & delicious * Beef Satay - a little dry * Dim Sum: siu mai, stuffed crab claw, and chives shrimp dumpling (with whole baby shrimp) were all delicious * Beef Pho - solid, but nothing to write home about.  Lacking that certain umami in the broth  A bit pricey (but what restaurant in a Strip casino isn't?), but lovely ambience and awesome food!

HK8j9f0Q9scAFfoj7vgSuA.text: It was 1AM Sat night and I had just left Haze because it was way too crowded and I couldn't find my other friends inside. Hadn't eaten dinner yet so I met up with another friend here because we were staying at the Aria and it was one of the decent sounding places still open that wasn't on the greasy side.  Very dimly lit, the decor along the ceiling is like a weaving loom and really intriguing. Fairly quite atmosphere but can easily accommodate large groups.  Our Order Tom Kha Chicken: ($12) Chicken, coconut milk, lemongrass, galangal, abalone mushrooms Chilean Sea Bass: ($28) Deep-fried sea bass fillet, shallots, scallions, Yu-Hoi sauce Drunken Noodle with Seafood: ($20) Spicy stir-fried flat rice noodles, prawns, scallops, squid, Thai basil, Kachai, bell peppers Ginger Peach: ($14) Absolut Peach Vodka infused w/ Black Tea, Canton Ginger Liqueur, and Fresh Sour served tall over ice Watermelon Caipiroska: ($14) Grey Goose Vodka, Fresh Limes and Fresh Watermelon juice  The Tom Kha surprisingly had a strong mushroom flavor that overpowered the coconut. So instead of a more tart flavored soup, it was fairly earthy tasting which was interesting but we didn't love it. I love mushrooms too =/  I ordered the Drunken Noodle w/ Seafood due to the reviews I saw on it. Honestly, it was greasy and tasted like chow mein. Nothing special and wouldn't order again.  Why I would come to Lemongrass? The Chilean Sea Bass. It was cooked perfectly: wasn't dry and very soft.  They drinks were good and very strong. They had better be at $14/drink! Even though they came out in small glasses, they pack a punch. My friend's a light-weight and drank a little more than half the cup and got tipsy. I nearly finished both drinks but my friend was too far out that we had to go back to the room.  Wouldn't go out of my way to come here since there are so many places to eat in Vegas but if I was in the same predicament, I certain wouldn't mind.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. LEFT: Ginger Peach RIGHT: Watermelon Caipiroska
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken Noodle
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean Sea Bass

XbR5df-mvBwa7GsMyBpXyA.text: Very delicious food! Thai tea was great. We ordered the pineapple fried rice (with chicken and sausage) and the red duck curry. The curry was spicy and so good! You can order all dishes with a rating of 1-10 on how spicy you want it.   I also got a Ginger peach cocktail- if you love ginger then this is great, but very sweet.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red duck curry
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple fried rice

QwEWVPUxh5OSd_olLow57w.text: Late night meal at the Aria hotel we loved it! We had the coconut based soup I think it was called Tom kha it was great, Singapore noodles and spicy cucumbers. Loved everything! Great service! Will definitely be back. Had a long wait even at 12am but sat at the bar right away and enjoyed the company of our Cuban bartender and his recommendations.

Hjyu_rRM6uJNLOasQ4JX2g.text: 5 stars for the food and drinks!   2 stars for the service! Our waiter forgot about us (we were a huge group of 8, hard to miss) we had to literally wave him down just to get the bill.

pG_RVNUtSw0Hj_7oOgafiQ.text: The food was good but not awesome good...  My family came here to eat some Thai food and the decor and plating was very awesome. I ordered Drunken Noodle with Chicken and the noodle was kinda bland. The spicy ness of the food stayed on your tastebuds! I then tried some of the Fried Rice w/ basil and Beef, it was ok not the best. It also didn't have much of a flavor but the beef was very tender!! The Pad Thai on the other hand was phenomenal! The crushed peanuts, the spices, the noodles was all great! The bill was a little over priced but it's Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Rice with tender beef and garnished with Basil.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken Noodle

UqFSAT8apRDBpDxszqN_OQ.text: FYI, I think this is the first Thai restaurant I've seen in a Vegas resort, which is good. Variety is always good.   We ordered the rib eye steak, duck red curry, and two other dishes I barely remember.  The duck curry was hands down the best.  It was really tasty, if a tad sweet.  The crappy part about the dish was that there was barely any duck in it.  What duck it did have was tender and well-cooked.    I only ate a piece of the steak - it was ok.  The other two dishes I don't remember were average. We also had spring rolls with cream cheese inside - strange, but not bad.    Overall, the food was fine.  It's friggin pricey for Thai food ($30+ per person after tax and tip), but that's probably the cheapest place to eat at in Aria, next to the crap-tacular cafe they have. And maybe the buffet which judging from reviews, is pretty crap-tastic itself.  Service here, unlike the rest of Aria, was actually okay.  I only had to ask for the check twice.  The food, water, etc. and everything all came out okay.   If I was fiending for Thai food and I was in or near Aria, I'd come by.  It's not really worth a detour.

6k3tjpPuBZnG_UnfMzqQYg.text: Ate here before going to Haze  Unique dishes that were very flavorful  Overpriced for what you get

gSyGxJn3tqcI2_fw8E9T1w.text: first of all, this is not really a thai restaurant.  you are getting some thai-inspired dishes in a chinese restaurant posing as asian fusion.    first of all, the hostess was pretty disorganized, and the entrance of the restaurant was chaotic with tourists with no reservations complaining about the 1.5 hour wait.  we were 13 minutes early for our reservation and they turned us away, which is OK.    for our appetizer, we had chicken satay based on recommendations from yelpers.  terrible-- bland peanut sauce.  thanks for that.  among our entrees, i ate basil thai chicken on the recommendation of the server.  the chicken was dry and a bit stale!  can you believe that--stale chicken!!  service was extremely slow, and although the hostess was attentive, the waitstaff was really weak.    overall waste of time and money.

tgsWEVA2pL6IN7fwRgCp0A.text: The restaurant is gorgeous, the food was amazing and our server was incredibly helpful and attentive. It was definitely a bit pricey, but totally worth it!!! Warning - they charge $12.00 for Young Coconut. Yikes!!!

Jx16H-8vdWC7-tHUx5DSJA.text: We went to Lemongrass this weekend, since we were visiting Aria for a show, and were craving something spicy. The decor of the restaurant is nice, dark woodwork plus neutrals makes for a cool vibe. The seating was very comfortable --  we were in the sofa booth facing the entrance of the restaurant.  Food ordered: lobster tom kha soup, green curry, vegetable fried rice, and cashew chicken.   Tom kha soup was really good, perfect spice. We asked for a 7, and got a good runny-nose spicy that we were craving! Only gripe: the soup was big enough for two, but only had 3 small pieces of lobster meat. The green curry was also good. But, wasn't out-of-this-world amazing. It hit the spot. The vegetable fried rice was not as great. It was on the bland side, and a tad oily. The cashew nut chicken had great flavors, lots of cashews.   I loved how they knew their spice! The dishes weren't bland, and they were spicy enough for us to enjoy, without burning our tongues off! Service was very attentive -- although at times it got overwhelmingly attentive!   Overall, a bit pricey for the food served, but it's to be expected at a strip restaurant. Good service, and good food. Would def visit again.

SGGzQzr7xAoUSE--EidvNA.text: First thing you think of when you go into the Aria Hotel is bling bling, I must be getting paper fo'sho if i'm staying here. That ubiquitous air of wealth and luxury permeates the atmosphere, you can't help but feel like Justin Bieber in Vegas. You're the bomb; anything is possible in sin city. With this new found confidence and flare for extravagance, what sort of dining experience do you expect? I'm thinking exotic. I'm thinking fantabulous. I'm thinking thai food.  So, during my short stay at the Aria hotel in Las Vagas, me and my family decided to go to Lemongrass. First of all, the decor was amazing. Curtains of fringe hung effortlessly on the ceiling, creating a tent over some of the tables. The lights were dim, creating a very sensual atmosphere, mimicking that oriental mysteriousness of Asia. Om nom nom nom, this place looks amazing!  I wish i could say the same about the food. It was like turning on the T.V, being all excited to watch the new episode of the Real Housewives of New York, but getting disappointed when instead, you see the rerun of a cheap, tacky real housewife of New Jersey flipping a table. Don't tase me bro! I love the Manzos and all, but the Simon and Alex are where it's at! Anyway, back to the food, I could have gotten tastier, more authentic thai food at half the price right here in OC. Don't get me wrong though, the food wasn't horrible, it was very much delicious.  For appetizers, we ordered the Yam Ta Krai (lemongrass, fresh prawns, squid, scallops, spicy tamarind dressing) and Tom Yam Talay soup (spicy seafood, prawns, scallop, squid, lemongrass, abalone mushrooms).The appetizers were amazing! The seafood was super fresh, and everything was really tasty and flavorful.  What I was really disappointed in were the entrees. I hate curry...NOT. I'm bananas for curry. Everytime I eat thai food, which is very often, I order curry again and again and again. I would bathe in curry and immerse myself in its deliciousness if I could. Curry is better than shark week; it is legend...wait for it...dary. So, i ordered the green curry since it came with eggplant ( eggplant is a sign God wants us to be happy). I didn't hate it, I could never hate curry. It would be like a mother hating her child. It was just watered down and lacked that unctuous and satisfying spice that curry is supposed to have. My mom ordered the Drunken Noodles, which I guess is one of their specialties. To be honest, these noodles tasted like a typical msg-ridden fried noodle dish from a mediocre Vietnamese restaurant. The crisp on the noodles was nice; but like the curry, it lacked flavor.   The dessert was amazing though! But then again, I've never complained about the dessert at any restaurant. Dessert is like Ryan Gosling; it's good all the time. I ordered mango sticky rice, a thai classic! If you've never had mango sticky rice, you have never lived. The red ruby was very tasty as well. It was shaved ice with corn, jellies, and jack fruit. The corn was a sweet, surprising touch.   Overall the restaurant was average. I would give ten stars for the decor but only three stars for the actual food. Compared to the prices of other shnazzy Vegas restaurants, this place was a pretty good deal. But compared to a more humble, authentic thai restaurant, the food seemed bland. If you want super yummy, exotic drinks, appetizers, and deserts with a cool and stylish ambiance, definitely try this place!

X6EK6nL46sz1C8eL_rEcJA.text: Service was exceptional!!! (if you have never been out of the country the service will seem odd because they will not bring you the check until you directly ask for it) Food was really good. It is a little bit pricey, but to be expected in a nice hotel on the strip.

gPxW-etl554V6HYKx-rRMQ.text: Basil beef was pretty sweet, sauce was thick and had very little kick to it. I eat that as my go to dish in Thai restaurants and this was not one of the best. Service was pretty slow, not terrible, but could have been sharper. Wife and friends enjoyed theirs more than me. Nice decor and ambience though, just not the nicest food.

KDI3kpdzxiCjwn2uTqvPEA.text: WE reserved a table for a party of six and we had a really nice dinner.  We tried some unusual items like Jelly fish (Not that impressive), but all of the staple Thai dishes were great.  For six people we ordered "family style" (six main dishes and 3 appetizers).  the portions were good and the food was excellent.

QfBy99rMYWTr60PU-ZLhWg.text: Lemongrass was very good.  Classier and more than twice the price of what we'd get for something similar in LA, but the cuts of meat are nicer, the waitstaff is very pro and attentive, and the ingredients are top notch.  However, the tom kha was EXTREMELY spicy.  Like, Thai spicy.  As in, we asked for medium (I've been to thailand twice and can handle some VERY spicy food) and we were served something we could barely eat.  It was vert tasty, so I downed it, but had to pay with a tummy ache later.  That said, most Thai places take the really spicy Thai peppers, split them with the side of a knife, and put them in for flavor.  Lemongrass seemed to have ground up the peppers iN the soup, which is kind of a no-no, as it was just WAY too hot, and killed the flavor, so we had runny noses and fire-burned tastebuds.  The Shanghai rice noodles, although not Thai, were delicious, and perfect, and beautiful form the tri-colored bell peppers.  VERY nice, good food (save the crazy spiciness of the soup), and kind of what you'd expect from an upscale casino restaurant.  Not cheap, but good, and it was the only place open for lunch at 3 o'clock.

2SQD7PlMERnoiiZJo7s-OQ.text: Everything, excellent. For appetizers had very light and delicate veggie spring rolls, plus perfectly prepared salmon satay with best peanut sauce I ever had.  For curries you have option on spiciness on scale of 1 to 10. Fantastic coconut ice cream dessert with mango, coconut, fruit jellies, sticky rice-- hit all the right notes in tastes and textures, and seemed light to boot. Staff is very friendly and efficient. Left extremely satisfied. Will return to Lemongrass every time I'm in Las Vegas!

7iQBs4u-5pAeTpckGDiuIA.text: Went here to meet a couple friends for dinner.  This place is just alright.  It's a fancy thai restaurant but in my opinion, the food is not that great.  I've had better at much less fancier places.    We ordered chicken pad thai, chicken soup with coconut milk, and chicken curry.  All tasted pretty bland to me, none of the flavors really stimulated my taste buds.    But, if you have no way of leaving the strip and you're really craving thai food, then I guess this would be the place.  I will say that the service was friendly and attentative.  I can't really comment on the price because my friends were nice enough to treat me to dinner.

YNRL97EapFZqnqyoIuMSrQ.text: Best Thai food I've ever had. A little pricey which is why I took off one star but overall a great experience.

9-cwkAehAydT_UeohyZlAw.text: Ate here with my husband in February of 2010. We are Thai food enthusiasts.  All I can say is: Don't bother!

qjy8Gqm49UVpBHnYEI-DLg.text: We had the Tai Chen Chicken and Pad Thai 'J'  Bottom line: I can cook better Thai food at home. 2 stars for a decent selection of wine and the appealing design/layout of the restaurant.

2UHZnED0z-oYjPRksVJ6Iw.text: I agree with the person who would rate this restaurant 3.5.  The food is comparable to many Thai restaurants in Northern California but nearly twice the price for everything.  I tried the seafood chow fun which is Chinese, not Thai, and it was very tasty although a bit on the oily side. There were scallops, calamari and shrimp which were huge, but had a very funny aftertaste like they had been soaked in something.  That aftertaste turned me off so much I had to stop eating them.  The yellow curry with chicken, potatoes, onions and peppers had a nice kick.  We asked for medium heat and It was actually making us sweat. Nice that they didn't dumb it down for the Caucasians.  The pineapple rice was nice too, with huge shrimp.  There were a lot of raisins or maybe currents in nearly every bite which I didn't expect.  The pineapple tasted fresh and the dish was very good with bits of BBQ pork added in for flavor.  Rice was not included so an additional bowl of Jasmine rice for the curry was $3 - 4, which makes me upset..  Any curry that costs nearly $20 or more should include rice.  Shame on them.  The Thai Iced Tea was really good and freshly brewed (as opposed to package mix).  Not a bad meal despite the nickel and dime pricing and the odd non-Thai dishes all over their menu.  The service was very nice and the restaurant was a very creative design of thread, rope and other material that play with the light.  It was dark but sophisticated and I liked the way it was laid out.  If you're in the mood for Thai, or Asian in general, this isn't a bad option but perhaps not my favorite Asian food on the strip.

vLk30jK46rhjHsI6auK-jw.text: Best service in aria. They are casual dinning at the Aria. But still classy. Dimly light Asian themed decor. Comfortable seating for groups and accommodating for babies. Huge bonuses for vegas with baby and group of friends.  If you are here on the weekends they have dimsum. And some of the best dimsum dishes I have had in the United States. Everything was fresh and tasty. Not overly salty and not overly oily. We got the ribs and chicken feet. We also got the stick rice wrapped in banana leave with chicken. Really very authentic.  On the side I order abalone congee and a spicy beef noodle soup. The congee was perfectly cooked. There were lots of abalone in the congee. Usually other restaurants really skimp on that and give just a couple slices. The beef noodle soup was not as great. The beef tendon was really hard and the broth was kinda on the sour side.  We basically had a wonderful dinning experience and for the rest of our four day trip we kept coming for lunch and late night snack. Open till 2 am!!

EciPQmyB1QLbdPtLkrUidQ.text: I used to work at a Thai restaurant, so I am very picky when it comes to Thai cuisine and this place passes my standards.  It's not the best, and it is definitely more Americanized, but it is great, nonetheless.  The restaurant is beautiful, tucked away in the back of the casino level of Aria, next to a few other restaurants.  It wasn't too crowded and we had great service.  My husband always gets Pad Thai, this one was good, but kind of small, which is really bizarre because my yellow curry was huge, big enough for two for sure.  He liked his Pad Thai, but it wasn't amazing, the yellow curry, on the other hand, was some of the best I've ever had.  I took half of it back to the hotel with me and it made a great midnight snack!  The Thai tea is overpriced, but it usually is at any thai restaurant in a big city.  But it's good, of course, you can't really mess up Thai tea.

9vxNDme9E_oia-EvjWbXxw.text: Shockingly bad. The food was a tasteless sloppy mess. Soggy mush. Considering the hotel/casino, I had pretty high hopes. This food was indescribably bad. They ought to be ashamed of themselves.

_-42JcJQJSwQDAAxmWbDSA.text: I came here for dinner with my bf on a recent trip to Vegas. We were staying at the Aria, so decided to grab a quick bite before watching KA. We ordered the prawn rolls as an appetizer; I ordered the Pad See Ew J (vegetarian). Overall, I think the food was okay in taste, but fairly pricey. I've definitely had more authentic Thai food for cheaper. I did order a glass of yummy Dragonstone Riesling :)  -L.

odU9IBuZvMf1miQD56fkog.text: First time visit to Lemongrass, menu looked good with moderately priced for what they are offering. Ordered tom kha soup. Food arrived after some wait, smelled good but basically so much lemongrass and chicken gristle it was inedible. Told waitress please take it away with a plate full of lemongrass mulch I had on the plate in front of me. No, I'm sorry you didn't enjoy it, would you like to see a menu for something else. Brought our bill with the "mulch soup" still on it. So many other options in Vegas choose something else.

csf5lRZZy9o2deQSTHdlEw.text: Waited forever to be seated. After almost an hour we were taken to a tiny table. When we asked for a "real" table where our food would fit (we were there the other night as well, restaurant is in Aria hotel where we are staying), we were asked to "go and dine elsewhere" because told them that table was much too small for 2 people to fit in!

3HM6ynx1icwnjKxXOpDloA.text: I came here with 11 other beautiful ladies for my friend Jen's birthday. I'm not sure how reservations work because we had a table ready for us when we got there. One of my girlfriends met someone who's got all the Vegas perks of a gambler, so we got a completely free meal minus tip! Free dinner for 12 girls + 1 guy? HELL YES!  Since we were in such a big group, each girl ordered her own cocktail. We also had wine to share.  For appetizers: We had satay grill sticks that were accompanied with a peanut sauce, cucumber relish, and ciabatta bread. We had chicken, lobster, and beef. We also had fish cakes that were delicious.  We shared a coconut soup that I didn't really care for, but that's probably biased of me since I prefer tom yum soup over coconut based soups.  For the main course, we had fried rice and pad thai. I'm not sure exactly which ones we had, but they were good.  I like this place because it's mostly Thai food with other Asian influences. Definitely something I would come back to.  The service was great and we all left happy and full :)

2NncgfHGWDYZ7fhXnFr0-A.text: Lemongrass is inside the Aria casino, has a cool interior decor, and a very friendly and attentive staff. We had the spring rolls, spicy shrimp dish, chicken pad thai, and another vegetable dish that was absolutely delicious...oh and can't forget the out of the ordinary and very delicious fried rice too. It's a nice change of pace from the usual really heavy meals to be had in Vegas.

L2JLNkNrFnc3EUkWunLh_g.text: This restaurant is one of my Vegas favorites. At my most recent visit, my friend and I sat at the bar and ordered diner. It was lively with a great atmosphere. In a previous visit, my group ate in the dining area - excellent service there too. The food is so tasty. In True Thai fashion, the heat is about flavor - not just hot. The drinks are so tasty and strong. The crab fried rice is delicious. The staff is professional and friendly.

BkLaO-2j3sA1eBlUBi2lJQ.text: The food was decent but very greasy and the portions were too large.  Maybe it was just what I ordered (vegetable egg rolls and home cooked tofu in a hot pot), but the other three guests at my table had similar sentiments.  The ambiance is great and the service was good.

A8LkNtj0U_lIn5tCDa1DmA.text: My go to place whenever I'm in Vegas and I'm there pretty often.  Inside the Aria Hotel so you would expect the prices to be a lot pricier but it's very reasonable with good size portions and good food.  Pretty consistent every time I have been here.  Obviously it's not the best Thai food I've had but pretty good and service is usually very good!!

uWGYRb5Ijrh5Ck9RsyMpmg.text: So so disappointing. We just completed a great stay at the Aria, and everything was fantastic EXCEPT for the birthday dinner at Lemongrass I arranged for my husband. First, we waited forever to get our food. Several tables that arrived later than us were severed, while we still waited. The waiter came by three times to remind us it was cooking and on its way. Alone, I wouldn't consider this terrible, but then the food arrived. Mine was not edible as the chicken in the dish was so salty I could not eat it. My husband had Pad Thai, but there were almost no noodles in it. I've had better Pad Thai at home, let alone pay this much for it. When I made our reservation, I was assured my husband's birthday would be acknowledged at dessert, but when it was time.....nothing! And at that point, we had no time to argue with them as it was time for us to go to our show. I expect better from the Aria.

BBWsqQxs76yELfwyvNs1hw.text: If you like HOT & SPICY this is the place to go.  High end Thai food and they have a SPICY METER, 1 is what I got and its equivalent to mild & it goes all the way up to 10. My sister got a 5 and I tried one little drop and my mouth became numb and started to burn.  I don't know if I'm not fancy enough, but the food tasted different from Thai food that I'm used to. But if you LOVE HOT & SPICY, Lemongrass will kick your in the mouth.

O4gCkPagI1LTWy0sVDBVEw.text: after having some pretty pricey meals in Vegas, my hubby and I decided to try Lemongrass.  We had a craving for Thai food, and this was probably the best Thai food we have ever had.  We started with the Prawn Rolls and they were to DIE FOR. The crispy squid was pretty good too. Yummmy.    For our mains we had the yellow curry and the basil beef.  The basil beef was made too spicy for me as there was a misunderstanding on how spicy I wanted it.  However, when I informed the server, he handled the mistake with class and immediately got me another freshly made dish and apologized.  It's okay for restaurants to make mistakes and how I really judge them is on how they react to the problem.  THe problem with my dish was handled extremely well and I commend them for their great service to ensure I was happy.    Our bill came to less than $100 for two of us and we were stuffed!  Pretty good for some really good food in a swanky hotel.  Highly recommend!! We will be back on our next trip to Vegas

HNeGa4aHb_puv457Non7eQ.text: I tried the red curry today.  Hmmm...I liked the Yellow Curry much better. They didn't have Thai ice coffee, so I ordered iced Vietnamiese coffee instead (which wasn't as good). Why do beverages cost so much here?  $9 for sparkling water...is not worth it.

Ld73K1AmtHsRr81dvacc4A.text: Was asked for a choice of white or brown rice with my curry. Chose brown rice and was charged $4 without ever being told. Beware

2KYK5YAtpOIAhmbM_q1omA.text: Food was very lackluster. Very bland and tasteless.  Singapore noodles was not to par.  Spring rolls tasted like the ones you get from a fast food Chinese restaurant. Vegetable and tofu dish lacked seasoning.  Plus slow service and waiter with attitude.

92nAkIt8zb8sr8dsILOOtA.text: This place was alright.  We all ordered the pho, and it was OK.  The best part though (and added a star just for this) was the meat to noodle ratio in the pho.  I actually finished my noodles and had a huge bowl of meat left to eat, which was awesome.  Also, the beef was really tender and delicious, just wish the rest of the bowl was as good.  This place is pretty fancy too.  It's go a nice atmosphere, and the servers were very helpful.  Probably the fanciest pho I've ever had.  Overall: Some pretty good pho (the meat at least) in a nice and fancy restaurant.

-xJcc51EOob5bk3HpW3bXw.text: The dining experience on the Vegas strip is without limits unless you're in the mood for some very good Asian food.  Until recently, I was under the impression that you had to drive off the Strip to find any decent Asian restaurants, but The Lemongrass kind of changed that.  Although it's not the best Asian food you're going to have, it will be a dining experience that will leave you more impressed and satisfied than not.  There were 2 forces that led me to the Lemongrass at the Aria: 1) I was staying at the Aria resort and 2) my wife was craving Asian food.  I was feeling particularly lazy and didn't want to drive off the Strip, so we decided to give Lemongrass a shot.  Unlike most of the dining options at the Aria resort, the Lemongrass won't cost you an arm and a leg, but expect to pay a premium over your typical Thai spot.  The restaurant is decorated in that simple modern look that is consistent with the Aria resort with subtle (or not so subtle) Asian cues.  The servers were friendly and quick to fill water glasses or bring extra napkins, but weren't able to really offer suggestions from the menu (possibly a language issue).  The service isn't over-the-top excellent but it's far better than what you get at most Asian restaurants.    For our late night snack, we ordered fried rice and the prawn spring rolls.  The fried rice was good - nice chunks of meat.  The real winner was the prawn spring rolls.  Their interpretation of the dish was impressive and tasty, and it kind of made me wish that we were hungrier so that we could try another dish.  Yes, the prawn spring rolls were pretty good - light and crispy, not oily, and loaded with flavor.    If you need a comparison: the Red 8 at the Wynn doesn't even compare in terms of food taste and service, despite the Wynn being a much better resort than Aria.  I paid $40 for fried rice and prawn spring rolls after tax and tip - much more expensive than your typical Thai restaurant but not bad for something on The Strip.  Considering the dining options at the Aria, the Lemongrass is actually a decent place to eat - not too artificially upscale or pretentious.

ilrDqJ19ijMZNUJt2HHV0g.text: Came here after partying at the Bank, needed some recovery food. Located in Aria and it was the closest Pho place I could find. Since its in  Aria you know everything is clean and aesthetically nice, service good, food good, but pricey. 3.5 Stahz!

eRfNSE0ROaHszvPHUoVs9g.text: Nasty food,nothing taste good,the worst restaurant I have ever been, feel sick. If this is the last restaurant in Vegas, I still won't go! Bad, too bad

FEcoiLzekGNt1fnwfXHEUQ.text: After reading the reviews here I was not expecting much, but we had comps from the poker room that we could use at this restaurant. We had a first time waiter who was awesome, he ran back to the kitchen when he did not know the answer and helped us pick the right dish. The food was pretty good, and portion sizes were huge, and the dishes were priced right. Great place to grab a quick bite before you head to the Zarkana show.

iW3GWMTfbEL0RN_ijV1VAw.text: Yellow curry chicken with brown rice is very good

GKyuf_63RWNJt9SgZMinKw.text: Amazing pho, probably the best since most places suck local to me in the DC, MD, VA area compared to this restaurant!

DC7tkLPYIJFvJzKwnwLdYg.text: Before you decide to eat here; consider the prices and know that you are on the strip so of course this restaurant would charge you a grip load of money!! Haha why the hell not right? So they say....You're in Vegas $$$! So if you have a budget.. skip this restaurant and spend at the casino. The prices here are ridiculous for mediocre Thai food, it's almost really funny! We were all craving Asian food and didn't want to go far from our hotel and this restaurant came up in our Yelp search and of course P.F. Chang's :/ sad to say.. we should of went to P.F. Chang's...  Nice Huge romantic restaurant inside the Aria Hotel and casino. We were celebrating a bachelorette that night and bought a bottle of moscato ($45) that was soooo good!! sad to say.. that was the only good thing about this restaurant. The food was disappointing.   1. Beef Pho $18- 2/5 don't be surprised that it didn't taste authentic.. you are at a Thai restaurant tien :( oh why did you have to order this, you Pho addict!!!  2. Shrimp pad thai 3/5  3. drunken chicken noodles. 2/5 4. shrimp fried rice. 2/5 5. Duck Curry 2/5 6. $45 bottle of moscato- 5/5 delicious!! one of the best tasting moscatosssss ever!!! Hahah  Service was good, funny dude! However, I wished he would have checked up on us a little more mainly for water!!
