JeycztHWCvbOT7JUWdTl_Q.text: I don't know what y'all go to restaurants for, but I go for the food. This place may look nice, like the rest of Vegas, it entertains you with Asian decorations and silverware and all that shit, but the food is shit. You'll know it right when it comes out, it's greasy. Like what are thy even thinking about feeding you? Nothing looked cooked enough, the tofu was almost raw and the noodles glistened because they were so greasy. I woke up this morning and threw up, I could literally feel the noodles coming up my throat. It was disgusting. Never again.  UPDATE: me and my whole family got diarrhea

EIjBBx7QkaGhtKMl7Pmesg.text: Really awesome decor and atmosphere; attentive and nice service; decent food, especially later at night.  - Fish cakes: had good briny and umami taste, but wish it had a little more spiciness to it and that it was crispier. It was clearly fried, but didn't have a crisp outer shell.  - Yellow curry: the flavor was a little flat, not only because I got it more on the mild side (3-4 meant no spiciness), but because the curry flavor wasn't very rich. Came with potatoes and onions in it.   Overall had the sense that while the flavors were almost there, they were missing a sort of dynamism that left them a little bland.

JrS0lESTi0X2512MkSN3TQ.text: One star is too much for this place. Food is really terrible here. Do not eat here! You've been warned.

UmTNmddNO4bLn2GIbYCpWg.text: Excellent meal. All curries were great. Shrimp satay fantastic. Highly recommend. Make a reservation, gets busy.

J45bqLA0zDG_OJer4HLxog.text: My go-to spot whenever I'm in Vegas. Great food, but this 5star review is for my man, Tony, at the bar. What a great individual with a great personality!  Drunken noodles were exactly what I needed at a level 4 spice level (out of 10..and 2 is their medium).

YnIlWGSyjYU1zMn9TdCjyQ.text: Fck this place. They charge $3 for cilantro garnishment. What the fuq?  I have never heard of any restaurant charging for garnishment. You can buy a fist full bushel for 50 cents....

g1miPJ-HkG6M-1ctTCoGpA.text: Beautiful decor. Great selection on dishes. I came here when I was barely hungry so we did not order much. We ordered the Singapore Noodle Dish with the pork satay skewers. I didn't feel the dish was any spicy as it should be. I later find out that we can request for the noodles to be more spicier than what it was.  Good to know for the future.  Pork satay skewers were delish. It was very juicy and I love the pickeled cucumbers they served it with. Gave the dish a nice freshness and the whole entire dish did have a good combination of sweet, sour, spicy, and savory.  Definitely would come back here to try other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sYW_zm4GXFu1wQUfcdADDA.text: Slowest service I've ever experienced in any sit in restaurant. Food was mediocre compare to its price. Would not recommend to anyone.

bM-n2d6KyrX9KznMIMNlzg.text: You will find way better food in China town. Very plain nothing special average and down .

vDR9CQ46zYRVjdciesnbrA.text: Certainly there are better family-run Thai and Chinese restaurants, but my friend's (vegetarian) wife loves it here so we go on every trip. Service was reasonably good until our waitress went off shift. After that, though the restaurant was half-empty, nobody ever showed up to inquire if we wanted to order dessert, pay our bill, etc. This went on for about 20 minutes before we finally flagged down a waiter and asked to pay.  Reasonably quiet and suitable for conversation.  My favorite dish was the chicken coconut soup.

QtveFEzvsrtfpiYr8iPL8g.text: I went here tonight with my friend and was totally expecting fabulous food. We were both beyond disappointed and will not come back to this location again. Way over priced for the quality of food with lack of any flavor.  1. Pot Stickers $10 Pan-fried pork dumplings, vegetables, chili-vinegar soy sauce  We ordered the pot stickers and that was the only part of the meal that was good. But then again potstickers are hard to mess up.  2. Then we ordered Pla Lobster** $24 Spicy grilled lobster, fresh herbs, lemongrass, Chinese celery  This consisted of rubbery overcooked Langostinos which are not Lobsters. They were very small, tasteless and chewy. No heat whatsoever or flavor in this salad and it consisted of 98% celery. It should not be called a salad. Nothing salad about it. Someone should explain Salad to these people.   3. Then we ate the: Garlic and Lime Steamed Cod** $26 Steamed codfish, chili, mint, garlic, lime sauce  So we SAW Garlic on the plate and SAW sliced limes on top of the fish but in no way was this flavor in, around or in any way infused into the fish. My friend could not eat her piece and left it on her plate. I ate mine but had to put chili paste on top to give it flavor. It was even missing salt. In fact the salad and the main entree did not have adequate seasoning, flavor or at the very least salt.  I ordered a Spiced Rum drink with literally NO RUM in it. for $15.00 I would expect some rum in the drink but all I tasted was thai tea and coconut milk.  So $90 later we left hungry and pissed.  I think the only reason this place gets any business is due to their location because their food is horrid and their drinks are light.  Their slogan at the top of the page: "The only authentic Thai restaurant on The Strip" makes me cringe. As a local they have some serious nerve to claim such nonsense. They seriously must appeal to people without tastebuds. If you're a True foodie, run like hell.  A nearby slot machine must have felt bad for me because I won enough in 5 min to pay for my bad dinner. lol

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar

4KVVoY1QOt6j16w60itjMw.text: Probably my favorite restaurant at Aria.  The duck and bbq'd pork is to die for - everything about it is first class, especially the oh so warming broth.  The curries are spectacular - nice and thick and creamy with a kick of spice (be warned - they ask how spicy you like it on a scale from one to ten and I'm pretty good with spice but man was the seven spicy .

iF03xZrmXyVaTo1aEZmnvQ.text: Beyond delicious. Waitress was very attending and the atmosphere was very relaxing. Sesame chicken was delightful.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kDQpRmZ81G59A5KP2Q0YGg.text: This is not a Thai restaurant for Midwestern palette. If you like Pad Thai as a main course, probably not the right place for you. But if you do like authentic Thai curries that are rich, spicy, flavorful and also kinda light for a curry, this place is amazing. Also crab dishes excellent and we tried the Tamarind steak--very tender and sauce was excellent (bye, not spicy). Dim sum menu is more limited (we were not there for weekend brunch, but rather late on a Fri night so maybe more during the day?) than advertised, but two we did try were excellent--fillings were flavorful and wrappers light and not chewy. Cod looking great, as did other seafood. Service is slightly better than usual casino large restaurants. Certainly friendly and helpful--especially at midnight! And love love the fact this place was open until 2 am. Perfect place after seeing a great concert next door at T Mobile Arena. Just follow the Aria signs to the Sky Suite checkin and you'll find it off the casino floor down a bright hallway. I love Thai food generally and was really surprised at the authenticity and quality. Highly recommend.

O04FikD-h4N428vTBFcYJA.text: The ambience is exquisite  and the service is excellent.However for food I would give it 4.This restaurant  is not that expensive as compare to the other ones  on the strip. Regarding food though it is fresh but for my taste it lacks a little bit of flavor(this might be a bias view as I am brought up in Pakistan and expose to much stronger flavored food.

quQN03NJcc6ZbcX_KTFmKQ.text: Ordered the Pad Thai and it had no flavor. One of the worst pad thai I've ever tried. Ambiance and service was nice though.

x9vaCMX9BFLwemaF0T0Paw.text: The best thing about this place is that they open late EVERYDAY! That's a big convenience for us staying at Aria Sky suites, the restaurant is located right next to the Sky suites tower. We ordered some simple items and a Goose Bloody Mary to go. After too much partying on Saturday, both hubby and I were extremely tired and in serious need of some Asian food!   We ordered garlic wings, wonton noodle soup and hot & sour soup, all hangover cure food of course! The hot and sour soup had no shredded pork in it, just generous amount of veggies in very sour and fairly spicy hot soup, that was all I needed at the moment! Hubby loved the garlic wings and wonton egg noodle soup, extremely flavorful and very delicious!   We felt so much better after some super yummy Thai food, glad we decided to take advantage of this opening late restaurant, we really had no energy to get out of Aria hotel to find comfort Asian food at midnight.   Ps. was too tired to take photos.

77GasrJIe0nDAUJfwDk3Ig.text: It was a nice dining experience  The ambiance was good and the good was great. We dined with a large group and ordered a number of items. Everything was great.  Penang curry, red curry, pad Thai, basil beef were exceptionally great The only downside was our waitress. She was efficient but it was hard to understand her. Maybe she knew and hence was not very conversational

JuCVLHz_AFzkLjZwBMBNxg.text: This place is utterly amazing!  The service out of this world!  Wonderful ambience for a date night!  The food was absolutely delicious! I had the vegetable pad Thai with tofu my wife had the homestyle tofu with vegetables and brown rice and it was absolutely delicious. For appetizers we had the fried tofu with peanut sauce and Tom khai soup. It was very tasty! We are vegan and sometimes have a hard time finding Thai food without clam fish or oyster sauce however they are very in tune to vegans and made beautiful food without those sauces. I highly recommend this place for you to eat and enjoy.

IS1gorV3D-C9ls5gfpFrwg.text: Food: 5 Service: 5 Value: 5  Wow was this place great! Dined here with my boyfriend and we both love Thai food and have a hard time finding it at quality and anywhere in the States frankly. This place though. Wow. We decided to get dumplings the most recent time and absolutely enjoyed them! They came out quickly, hot, and every bite was better than the last! The server was so happy to help us with any questions and made sure to put the order in quickly so we could eat fast as well.  If you have time, I would highly recommend trying this place and getting their sampler of dumplings. Great variety and makes you wanting more and enjoying every bite. Staff also makes you happy you chose this place!

hd9y2j3vQkIOsezSs4v8dA.text: This is the place to have great Asian cuisine with a twist.  Perfect for executing an Impression on your anniversary, date or any special occasion. j3n2tSl0UpV1vKzWBFeFyw.text: This ambiance is great and its located inside the Aria which is a beautiful modern hotel. The food selection is great, they even has Dim Sum. However, the food was average. I typically try the massaman curry whenever I find it, and Lemongrass has it. It was good, was disappointed I had to ask for white rice and pay for it. My partner has the pad see ew and unfortunately it needed more sauce. We found it to had the right flavor, just dry. The Tom Kah soup had way to much mushrooms and lacked spice. Love the vast selection just didnt follow all the way on the execution.

Z9iKyHAYiiVJMWi7M_pA4g.text: I am so disappointed with this place. I usually don't post low reviews, but the unnecessary high prices for unauthentic lack lusting flavor, tiny beverages, & extra charge for rice when ordering curry compelled me to.   The decor and setting sets an expectation for delicious authentic Thai food. Yet you don't get that here. Heck it doesn't even need to be authentic, just good. And again, you don't get that here. I will say the ingredients are good quality, expect good quality meat & vegetables, but everything lacked flavor & authenticity. It tasted like an Italian chef was trying to make me authentic Thai food.  I understand it's Vegas and high prices are everywhere, but usually the food is decent enough to make a compromise. I've been to some bad mediocre Thai restaurants and this place is one of the worst. It's not disgusting, it's just bland. Thai food is known for its intense flavor, so bland isn't good at all! Especially not authentic. They could have been having a bad day, but it's not just that. The dishes just didn't taste authentic. Every dish tasted like it was missing an ingredient or two.   Lastly I'm not happy with paying extra for rice when ordering curry. Rice always comes with curry. Who doesn't eat rice with curry? And the drinks were tiny. $16 for like 1/2 cup of alcohol? That's outrageous! Wayyyy over priced, food quality is lackluster and not authentic. I kinda hope they close down. Feels like a robbery and I now understand why they have a 3.5 rating.   P.s. we came here even with the 3.5 rating bc I think we mistook it for the other lemongrass Thai restaurant. Big mistake!

nI1yWxsFNtEEa1PwwkP1kg.text: Dined here over the weekend with a large group of friends during our stay in Vegas. It was a few hours before dinner on a Saturday night and prior to calling to book a reservation, I was afraid they wouldn't be able to take our large group in with a few hours notice. But the lady I had spoken to on the phone was very accommodating and was very helpful through the booking process.  Considering that the location of the restaurant was inside Aria, I was already certain that it would have a nice, lavish atmosphere, and it did! The interior and exterior decoration was beautiful. I really enjoyed the different arts and decor.  The menu was definitely interesting. There were a combination of Thai, Chinese, and Vietnamese dishes. I ordered a Pad Thai with chicken and a Red Curry with beef. Although the portions were good, the Pad Thai unfortunately lacked flavor. It was really bland and needed either more salt or fish sauce. The Red Curry was a bit bland as well and needed more seasoning. I heard the Panang Curry with rib-eye steak was good though.  The service we received was nice. The staff was approachable and very attentive.  The pricing was affordable for a modern Thai restaurant in Vegas, let alone in Aria. My dishes were $18, $19. The portions were good for their price, but they lacked flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Curry with beef
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai with chicken

qSGlZpYmUqwsB9YHjoBfsA.text: A friend recommended, and we are glad we took their advice. Our waitress, Kathleen, was terrific! So helpful and attentive! We love Thai, and we love spicy food. They did not disappoint. We decided to try the tasting menu. We also added the wine pairing. The food was awesome! Hubby got a 5 and I got a 10. Kathleen was very concerned initially, but i loved it! The soup was spicy, but excellent! Hubby had the curry and it was some of the best we've ever had. Flavor was amazing! Chicken was so tender! I had the pad Thai. Easily the best pad Thai I have ever had!!!! I was a little disappointed in the heat. Maybe it was just because the soup had been intensified by the physical heat, but the pad Thai did not seem nearly as hot. The flavor was exceptional though!!! The wine pairing was one of the beat pairings we've ever had. So often a pairing really does not add much to the meal experience, but this did. Also, we we're celebrating hubby's bday and they brought out some house made coconut ice cream. He loved it. This was a great experience!!!! He's been obsessed . I'm certain he would have eaten every meal here if I'd let him!!!!

gcC1mQxOBqgsGC7F3MZVDQ.text: Lemongrass was the first place we ate when we got to Vegas. It is a bit expensive but that's on par with most other places in Vegas and of course, it's near a casino, so you can gamble while you wait for your table. I ordered the seafood curry and it was phenomenal. They will allow you to choose the level of spice you want, which I appreciated. It had excellent flavor and a good amount of potatoes and fish. Will definitely go back!

eiQ2fErvLXiZGVxGAq-pgQ.text: First off Amber is an amazing server!! She handled our party of 7 like a champ!! Thank you Amber!!  Food here was very mediocre. Pad Thai lacked flavor, tom ka gai was overpowered with lemon, drunken noodles Tasted nothing like the traditional dish. Food was very slow to arrive. Will not return.

igWWl2u2Ntz2d1LeXcqTyA.text: I came here with two friends from out of town.  I asked the server about a cup of soup but she explained that their soup only comes in large bowls.  No starter.  I ordered the red curry with duck.  When askes about the spice level, she said 1 - 10.  I told her 7.  She asked if I was sure and told me the average spiciness level was 3.  I told her 7.  She looked at me but wrote the 7 down.  I ordered brown rice--rice whether white or brown is an extra charge.  After a normal amount of wait, our entrees arrived.  My red curry was good and the spice was almost perfect.  An 8 perhaps would have been better.  The sauce was good and there was a good amount of duck.  For dessert, which turned out to be the best part of the meal, I got coconut ice cream served on a bed of warm sticky rice with ribbons of mango and pieces of jackfruit.  This is the second time I left Lemongrass thinking the dessert was the best reason for coming.  There are so many great Thai restaurants in the area that it's not worth the hassle to go to the Strip and park.  Were it not for the fact my friends were staying at Aria, I wound't have picked Lemongrass.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut ice cream with mango and jackfruit.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brown rice.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red curry with duck.

dEhNQP1QrSa5yVpW46wPmA.text: Came here for lunch as there was no dinner reservations. I don't eat pork so we didn't get the dim sum at the beginning of the meal. For appetizers we got the spring rolls and for meal got the Panang curry. The spring rolls were good but not very different than most other places. The Panang curry was delicious! Very flavorful, the chicken was cooked well and you get large portions! We had curry and rice left over for later as well. The chicken corn soup is also good but lacking flavor a little bit.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panang curry
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls

k9LDWu0kM9tJe8kYPPvbwQ.text: OUTSTANDING SERVICE!!!! The ambiance was beautiful. The presentation was impeccable, and the food was out of this world delicious!!! Located inside of the gorgeous Aria hotel, I highly recommend this beautiful restaurant. The banana fried ice cream is a must!! Save room for dessert!!!

SovQckhGiNbOma0kpi1D7w.text: Ate dinner here and it was absolutely fabulous.  The food was delicious.  Their tom yam soup was terrific, spring rolls like I've never tasted, and their Panama curry was just unbelievable --extremely flavorful and perfect spice.  The service was very efficient, especially considering how busy they were.  The staff are, friendly, welcoming and polite, and efficient.    The place gets extremely busy, even during weekdays so booking ahead is a good idea.  Very casual dining for what feels like an upscale restaurant, and reasonable prices.   Great spot.

Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2W0IwYfki0ojHOaS32FISg.text: We wanted to have a local dinner and I felt like having Thai since it was in our hotel. I wasn't able to get a reservation and when we walked up to see if there were any tables available, we were told that there weren't (even though there were several table that were empty). Perhaps there wasn't enough staff for the night.  We decided to hit up the bar area since it was first come first serve. We were lucky enough to snag 2 seats, and we were provided with menus and drink options.  I ordered a club soda, Thom Kha soup, and the Pad See Ew noodles. The soup only came in a large (no bowl) so you get this humungous serving. The chicken and veggie pieces are cut large, which is kinda of a turn off for me. I like more bite sized foods. The soup was decent and I added a little spice for a kick.  My Pad See Ew noodles definitely needed more sauce and heat. It was a little bland for my liking and I did add chili flakes to make it flavorful. I think I still needed more oyster sauce to add a bit more flavor to my noodles.  A bit on the pricey side, but you're in Vegas so expect to pay a bit more in the hotel restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3h8qd1YuLwx0yiwkx_f_4g.text: Have had some good, bordering on great meals here. Service always poor, but food was good every time. Last few times, gotten much worse. Mediocre quality meats, downright hostile service.  Well on it's way toward a typical mediocre Thai restaurant. With long wait, high prices, and terrible (often hostile) staff to boot. Never again.

76KpgTrkJOUIHxQFEuOJag.text: Attractive restaurant with Asian accents located in the Aria Hotel.  We ordered two appetizers, crispy marinated squid and pot stickers, and shared the drunken noodles with seafood entree.   You can select the heat level for the entree.  Good food and gracious service made Lemongrass an excellent choice for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodles with seafood
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy marinated squid with sweet chili sauce and Pot Stickers with chili vinegar soy sause

cWG8o_UnhcSaM9aYayHBVg.text: Location is convenient if you are staying there. Dishes are good and modern. Liked that they have the standard Thai dishes as well as a few modern takes on things.  A bit pricey for the offerings, but what else do you expect inside a Vegas hotel.  Service was slow and we were left searching for our waiter for 15-20 minutes. Maybe bad timing while he was on break or something.  Decor is great just like you would expect in Vegas.  Will be back next time I'm staying in the hotel, but wouldn't make a special trip for it.

RVJF6YyBw-TGR1jlCw2A2A.text: So we had to wait FOREVER for our food. I was completely starving because our entrees took FOREVER. The server told us we were waiting because they had a large party...there was not a table there with more than 8 people. It was just excuses. People with Togo orders were getting their food before us. And when we finally received our food I wanted to send it back...I had better food at restaurants without the glitz and glamor.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dzclhuhqBtlTWJrNvWxfXw.text: Arrived Saturday around 2p, 20m wait & bar was full so the hostess took my phone number & called when our table for four was ready.  I eat here quite often so know exactly what to order immediately.  We were starving!   Kris took my order.. Potstickers, Chicken Tom Kah Soup, Shrimp Pineapple Fried Rice & Shrimp Pad Thai all to come out slowly like a tasting menu.  All of which are a must & my favs!  Entrees, Yellow Chicken Curry w/ Brown Rice & Ribeye w/ Tamarind Sauce & Sticky Rice.  Shared each course w/ my family as it came out.    Lots of food for $135, which includes tip & no drinks since we had full drinks from the casino & still took home a small doggy bag beautifully packed.  Enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tom kah
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potstickers

4OkjXQWS3UdW2_8OJJXKBw.text: Good service: fast (for our party of 12), clean restaurant, fair prices, food is ok (average quality), green tea and iced tea are good.  I am not impressed overall - especially for Vegas (where you have many options)  Appetizer: Fish Cakes - too greasy The spicy curried fish patties were flavorful but too greasy for me; the sweet chili sauce was ok  Drinks: Iced Tea (regular unsweetened was black and tasted good) the hot green tea was flavorful and good too  Som Tam Spicy green papaya salad, fish sauce, dried shrimp  (I asked for the fish sauce on the side and I am glad I did ... it was not the best tasting sauce. Also there was no dried shrimp on my salad!!) Pass on this for $10.  Entree: Sea Bass too saucy for me (deep fried - breaded and drenched in sauce). It tasted like orange chicken but a flaky version since the sea bass melts in your mouth.    I ordered the papaya salad as my side instead of rice ($3 for steamed $4 for brown) with it. I was not impressed. Random note - there was a huge piece of cabbage that no one at the table knew what to do with in my salad!  Yellow Curry Chicken:  Good flavor with the onions, the coconut milk sauce was not too thick or heavy, the chicken was slightly chewy but overall the dish was flavorful. Spice level 5!  Phad Thai "J" - with chicken added to the tofu, bean sprouts, chinese chives was ok/basic/plain, the chicken was chewy, the tofu was not bad.  Prices are reasonable - quality is sub par for Vegas. It is edible and quick. I recommend trying somewhere else first : - )

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow curry with chicken.  Just ok

d7SXpsK7jsWqUQqTWIAeDQ.text: We visited this restaurant last night and then again this morning. The service is fantastic!! We ordered appetizers last night and we were so impressed that we came again today for main courses.  1. Chicken wings were crispy and perfectly cooked 2. Potstickers were meaty and robust 3. Fried tofu was fluffy inside and crispy on the outside  4. Tom yam was ordered with veggies and was hearty and the added eggplant was amazing 5. Som tam was perfectly crisp and mixed with the perfect amount of spicy sour bite 6. Seafood green curry had large scallops, squid and shrimp  7. Veggie fried rice and hearty and plentiful  8. Rad naw had large pieces of tender pork and the sauce was velvety   NOTE: these portions are family size, so although you see the price point at $16-19 on a plate, it's enough for a 5-6 people to eat. You won't be disappointed!

bzDeS4tzW_KyolXqj0dbtQ.text: I am not sure that I will ever forget this place. I tend to eat so much Asian food and I love Thai the most. Located inside the lovely Aria hotel, Lemongrass is a bit of a walk from the lobby but totally worth it. We didn't have to wait long to be seated and all staff were super friendly. The decor is intimate and interesting, warm environment. Perfect atmosphere. I do recommend to everyone this place.

ogPQ5AfKRWkB9UlZEcs2Yw.text: Could not have a reservation or walk in for dinner so I ordered takeout.  Yam Ta Krai 3/5 Spicy seafood salad. Large shrimp and scallops. A good value at $16. Level 3 (medium) is pretty spicy for me.  Shredded Pork with Dried Bean Curd 3/5 Spicy.

kgwCWcjmY0JLAOtsnls9ag.text: Rubbery chicken, no flavor, and down right disappointing.  Lance the bartender inept and unable to multitask.  What a waste of money.   Avoid this place at all costs.

nx-HfchgyW3JzH371XpJmA.text: OMG!!! This place is a hidden gem! I ate here twice and the food is amazing!! The drinks were perfect!! Service was great! The setting was wonderful! Great job to the managers and staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp fried rice. Yum
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A REAL Pomegranate martini for once  I had 3
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the ginger scallion lobster and it was finger licking good!! Easy to come out the shell. Tender and tasty!

MVPp1q_82O3m-M42uPlsUA.text: Great appetizers, good food. Service was a little slow but ok.  The BBQ pork dim sum buns AMAZING! The scallops skewers appetizer were fantastic as well. Just avoid the Dan Dan noodles, they are drowned in a thick almost grave sauce; weird recipe.

Xv932RzyJrWvoqN7Tfe2RQ.text: Had a late dinner here with 2 buds, and this place was very good and "cheap" by fancy Vegas resort standings. We all shared our entrees Family-style. Had the Seafood Chow Fun noodles (better), Seafood Udon Soup (good), and the Fu Chow Fried Rice (ok). Decent portions, and service was ok. Great ambience though. Try their Thai Tea drink - it's nice and creamy.

KC8JhaSzDGH_aII2QLzm4g.text: Cost effective and delicious.  Arrived late and was told wait was 45 minutes then got lucky when one of the few chairs at the bar opened up.  Duby (the bartender) was fun to chat with while she was making drinks.  The waiter suggested the Green Curry (chicken, Thai eggplant, and Thai basil) and Three Cups Chicken.  Both were good dishes!  I like spicy food but the server suggested a four (on a 10-point scale) which ended up being the perfect level of heat.  I'll definitely return!  11/2016 UPDATE - I had dinner at Lemongrass last month and basically ate the same dishes family style with friends.  Although everything was consistent with my first experience part of of me wished they had improved on the dishes in the last several years but alas it was basically the same.

7rxbHn2LfVeqdGglpYoJlA.text: Very nice restaurant. Delicious curries and fired rice. One of our usual stops when in Las Vegas.  Great service and just love the ambiance. Never been disappointed.

b1Ay6-EPqFX6So3wJgYEQA.text: The best bang for your buck Thai/Asian fusion on the strip!  I love food. Vegas, despite being a culinary hot spot, can be hard to find something right for me. I'm not a buffet person. Fast casual is great, but not for every meal. And the same goes for high end dining- I'll do it for something special, but it'll break the bank if I go every night. Lemongrass hits that rare sweet spot of being somewhere in the middle. It's a sit down restaurant with a nice ambience, provides tasty food in decent portions, all while being reasonably priced.  Speaking of tasty food, Lemongrass carries one of my favorite dishes ever-- the Mee Goreng. Consisting of wok-fried yellow noodle, fried tofu, egg, potatoe, chili, tomato, choy sum and chicken (or your choice of beef or shrimp), it hits all the right notes. The sauce is slightly tangy and sweet while the egg, potato and chicken add a savory flavor. It's served in a hearty portion with the ability to choose your level of spice. When I visit a Thai restaurant for the first time, I always wonder if they are going to white-wash the spice level. This is not the case here with a level 6 nearly burning my palate off (just how I like it!). Last time I visited the waitress even said I'm more Asian than her! If mee goreng isn't your thing (it should be), Lemongrass also offers a variety of other dishes such as rice, curry and even lobster or steak. They have good appetizers too-- I'm a huge fan of the spring rolls (they're fried so don't come here right before the pool) and one of my friends swears by the jellyfish.  Usually there isn't too bad of a wait and you can make reservations in advance. The staff have always been prompt and friendly. I can't say enough good things about this place. It's always a must when I come to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hip atmosphere with ropes and dim lighting.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mee goreng with chicken

3gaSSY-T0OfH0qjiDrh1qA.text: We started with some cocktails at the bar. The Watermelon cocktail was good. The spice Thai cocktail was beyond excellent. Ordered the spicy cucumbers-lots of garlic and spice but I dig that combo! The cucumbers look soggy but are still crispy. For entree we got three items: sweet and sour chicken-pretty normal.  Veggie Padseyew -liked this Soft shell crab fried rice- amazing, lots of crab and the soft shell crab was a perfect crisp!  Bartender, hostess, and waiter were all nice. Overall great experience and will be back.

D9hKq0Mz2wivq_9Vz0fabA.text: Nothing to write home about.  Just middle of the road.  Drunken noodles, Singapore noodles.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7hdsCqHyQyM9VCEi8nJz2w.text: Been here a few times on past Aria visits.  Great heat on the Tom Yum (w/shrimp) and delicious pineapple fried rice.  Grub if you are going to indulge in asian cuisine in house.

oypPGRh2Drh2EhKyfljSGg.text: one place I found near vegas hotel strips with PHO.  man I was dying to eat this after a party at hakassan night club listening to Calvin Harris, thought it's time for a PHO! soup.  calm my stomach down from chugging all that alcohol.  But $16 pho wasn't as impressive as $8 pho I had in dallas vietnamese restaurant.  I guess Authentic really do matter to foodies.

jUg86Nvj0xGxtzpd_23Ndw.text: -Great atmosphere. -Food was Subpar, had sesame chicken, black pepper beef, and basil fried rice. 2/10. Quality like mall food.  -Service was slow. Chang(our waiter)was horrible.  Unattainable.

eddiI6TeU_Q8mSX_OKrF2A.text: Looked down at my soup and saw two little flies. I was so grossed out. Manager apologized and compensated the two cheapest items on the bill. Still will not be coming back

SxBfnrgwLf6tFTOTVg-Bqw.text: Loved it! Green Thai curry was fantastic and so was the pad see ew. Tofu was slightly burnt but That wouldn't stop me from going back.

4oJCNBtpBNzf5V74XahJUA.text: Had a very good experience dining there. The ambience , service and presentation was definitely top notch. Am a great fan of Thai food and this definitely is recommended.

A6af9B1UuuGdlQlfSm3MtQ.text: Made reservation 3 days prior .  Walked in 30 minutes early.  Blank stare.  Started with one server.  Changed to another mid way without being told.  Asked for two checks and received one.  Shall I continue?    Will never return.  Too many great restaurants to choose from in Las Vegas.

9nVGDEI-qLpu8TFKtoZ-TQ.text: I'm very picky about my thai food, and this place just hit the spot.   The place itself has a very nice ambience. Dim lights, sleek furnishings, pretty decorations. We were seated right away, with no reservation (6pm).  There was about 6 of us, and boy we tore our food up.  I had the duck curry with jelly fish appetizer. I've never tried jelly fish before but it was amazing, and the duck curry was just as good - the prices might seem a little up there but you definitely get what you pay for - not to mention the portions are of good size. They're cocktails are strong. You definitely will not be disappointed.

tEeAmZabFqqUzAPYbASPiw.text: One of the best Thai places I have ever eaten at. Delicious Pad Thai and Wonton soup. If you are staying in Aria you owe it to yourself to try it. Our waitress Ten was super friendly.

GvPRSOz4d-8c7ed5akCE8Q.text: This place really took me by surprise. Located right next to our entrance to the Sky Suites, it was convenient for us to eat here during our trip this past weekend. It is beautifully fit for the very modern Aria.  Our service was a bit weird. I understand it's difficult to accommodate large parties, but our service just seemed a bit whacky. A little "all-over-the-place." In a rather empty restaurant, they told us it would take them 20 minutes to set up a table for 10. All I could think of was, why?  Anyway, the food. The food was good and decently priced (especially for Vegas). Our pho was about $12 a bowl? Double what I pay out here in Oakland, but like I said... it's Vegas and it beats paying $70 for a small steak. My friend ordered the soft shell crab (I think) fried rice and it was DELICIOUS. Everyone at the table loved it. They also served dim sum, which was a nice surprise and comparable to Oakland dim sum. I NEVER said it was AS GOOD as Oakland's dim sum... but it exceeded our expectations.  I would highly recommend this restaurant to those looking for an inexpensive bite and if they're at the Aria for any reason.  OH! Avoid the pho though. It was extremely bland...

sw0m9qXtFYj7Qu31PW46xA.text: I love the zen atmosphere at this place. The service was nice and it was quick. The prices were average for the strip but that's just how it is. Highly recommend the softshell crab fried rice and the garlic prawns. Superb!

w7GWCTO1Zsoul7p1QMYwYg.text: You know, I really wish I could give this place 4 or 5 stars.  BF & I have eaten here several times (mostly when we've stayed, because you don't really want to walk down the strip full) and he always seems to enjoy it more.  I'd personally give this a 3.5, he'd probably rank this a 4.25.  There's just nothing that special about it.  Everything looks really nice.  Everything seems fresh and well prepared.  But off the top of my head, there's nothing that screams, holy cow I have to get you again.  Save for (and this would be my 0.5 increase), the strawberry gelato.  There is nothing like it.  And nothing else in the line really matches its par.  Oh well, that and the spicy pepperoni pizza (I know, of all the things).  They make their own na'an, which is good, but is kind of useless because the dishes they offer for you to eat it with are well, 'blah.'  Service is always great, and pricing isn't too bad.  Actually, you can't really complain about price when stuff is comp'd.  Line is never too long either.  It's not that I don't recommend eating here, it really is just more of, I wish they had a better tasting selection.

8ABYld9IidGxlfOD4VJ__Q.text: I recently discovered this gem of a Thai restaurant with a group of friends.  I have been coming to vegas frequently over the years and have tried most of the top restaurants in las vegas.  What I have come to discover is that most of the restaurants in the newer hotels, especially the ones that serve asian fare, are decent, but incredibly over priced.  That was not the case with Lemongrass.  I found them to have a wide range of food that was absolutely delicious.  The decor and ambiance were impressive and the service was excellent.  A great way to enjoy a delicious and fun meal with a group of friends.  Would recommend it to anybody.

Y77MlynBsP_EXVVK34j97Q.text: What a joke. We had an awesome waitress... up till we ordered our meal. She informed us that her shift was ending, so we got stuck with Alex, and over the next five times someone came to the table, we had a different person each time.  My drink ran out three times.  No freakin' way. One time is barely tolerable. But three times?   The place was not overwhelmingly busy. There were at least nine tables around me that were empty, and only four of them occupied. Not sure what the problem was.  The food was *decent*... the fried rice seemed to have a bit too much oil. My friend's Mongolian Beef was overwhelmed with onions... it seemed as if there were more onions than meat.  Overall, the ambiance (Edison-style lights are awesome) was unbelievably gorgeous... but that's about where the Pros list ends and the Cons start.   Better luck next time... but there are so many places in LV/on the Strip that this won't be worth a return visit anytime soon.

KkSPEyJMoptoAUP6RDZs_Q.text: Super glad we picked Lemongrass as one of our restaurants to try on our trip to Las Vegas. Service was very prompt from the start. We both really enjoyed our dishes. My husband had the garlic prawns and I had the mee goreng noodles.  I also had the green tea & gin mixed drink, which was divine. We finished our meal off with the sticky rice with mango. The decor was very unique and elegant - it really set the mood for the meal.

vgsymPAVwhBx7HAWgP3H0w.text: I would give it 3.5 stars. Five for the modern decor, five for the attentive and intelligent service, and 3-5 for the food, depending on what you order. The green curry was fantastic. The menu also includes Chinese and Indonesian dishes and even Dim Sum anytime.  We eat Asian food all the time. You can order hotness on a 1-10 scale. When we said 5, the waiter said that that's too hot. We ordered 3's and 2's and they were plenty hot. And we like hot.   We ate there twice during our 10 stay in LV.   It's in the Aria Hotel, which I consider a must-see for any trip to LV, for anyone who enjoys modern art.   Somewhat more expensive than most Thai restaurants, but, hey, this is the Strip, plus it's the Aria Hotel. The expensive is worth it.

ooX9RBy3L7RRK9HNpAvJZA.text: I would give it 5 stars if the food was serve a little faster.  I went with small children, and it took almost 40 minutes to get our dishes out.  Don't get me wrong, the food was fantastic. We ordered too little so I asked the waiter if we could order another dish, but I was afraid it would be another 30+ minutes. He was really great and apologized for the delay. He assured us that if we wanted to order another dish, it would be quick. And it was.  The char kwe tiau was excellent.  Very expensive place, but very good.  3 dishes for almost $80!

B9bYnzy8zrfTjutkvsjZvw.text: If you like extremely well prepared spicy food, this is it in the City Center for the cheap prices (remember the area)/staff/quality!.......if you ask for mild, it is still  hot- had to down grade to a 4 cuz my mother in law's palate was sizzled (wimp)....otherwise its a FIVE for those of us that enjoy a good sweat while eating.....will return for sure

9WrRrol1KyHBUmhNHd5sKw.text: Had a good meal tonight at Lemongrass: Tsingtao and Green Curry.  Food: 7 - The curry had these awesome mini-asian eggplants (they look like tomatillos) and tons of creamy, yet spicy (I ordered it as a 7) flavor.    Service: 8 - Ate at the bar, the bartendress was very attentive and friendly.  Location: 4 - It's a pain in the ass to get here from even 1 hotel over.  I recommend eating here if you're staying at Aria, otherwise that walk home is a terrible terrible thing.     Other: The bar was STOCKED - I imagine you can get any drink made you could ever want.  It's expensive though, a bottle of Fiji water is $9, and the Tsingtao is $12.

rZuw584bnUqGnlfWTthNaw.text: Make sure if you're staying at The Luxor to check out the $20 off coupon in the check-in booklet. This place is great for 2 people to share sushi and a dish. My colleague and I shared 3 rolls (wicked roll is good) and the chicken lo mein. Two guys had plenty to eat and walked out full. Service is so-so but the food is above average. I come from spoiled CA sushi, so yeah. Enjoy!

8fsFmf75roa7huPAroJYsw.text: Delicious and so nice to have good Thai food in Las Vegas!  Beautiful decor, friendly service and seriously good food.  The salmon spring rolls were great to start and the chicken panang curry with brown rice was beyond tasty!

fSJL5UxcZg9ZPPqV8iFVJA.text: Really Really good food! And the location and ambiance is also great. My husband and I had the Pad See Ew noodles and green curry and it tasted great and the spices were perfect. They were also pretty bug portions. I will definitely come back.

JPUmFpyaL2yHMJcGZlBcSQ.text: Really good food. I will  leave the authenticity debate to others. The food here is GOOD! Love the satays; the lobster salad is unique and delicious. This place has become a must-do when my husband and I are in L V., even tho we dislike the Aria and don't stay there.  But this spot is worth the special effort and the parking.

yAdRGa8I5LizJHH2UKzyZw.text: Amazing! Once we walked in the smell of Thailand greeted us...We ordered pad thai, green curry and lobster, every dish was outstanding!!!

Hs41nL2VGGmYpVa9ZxC-5A.text: Yikes. I should have paid more attention to the Yelp reviews on this place, but there aren't many sit-down lunch options at Aria and we were on a pre-meeting time crunch. The other nearby option was the French pastry place with the pre-made sandwiches laid out in a display case... But we're fans of Thai food and figured: "how bad can it be?"   Well, apparently it can be much worse than we thought. We started with the vegetarian spring rolls and the prawns (which our waiter assured us was "the best appetizer on the menu"). The spring rolls could have come from any cheap hole-in-the-wall Chinese place I've ever been to. I wish they had been better because they ended up being the only thing I ate for lunch. I'm told the prawns were okay, but if they were "the best appetizer," my dining companion commented that the other options must be pretty scary.  For entrees we decided to try the pad Thai, chicken satay and some vegetable fried rice. I kid you not - the pad Thai tasted like dish water. The fried rice had no sauce, and was basically white rice with little squares of carrot and onion in it. The satay came with peanut sauce, and while I had never before met a peanut sauce I didn't like, this one was awful. It was bland, noticeably lacking in sweetness (which would have enhanced the otherwise-absent flavor), and quite honestly just not worth the calories.    We had no complaints about the service or ambiance, but in a city filled with so many great restaurants this one definitely belongs at the bottom of the dining list.

YOF3DMndasfr0cYqSB7uMg.text: Read all the reviews and decided to take a chance for lunch....  this is definitely a 3 -star establishment.  The restaurant decor is beautiful.  The food is mediocre at best.  This is not a thai restaurant, but a restaurant with south east asian cuisine.  You will be dissapointed if you think you are going to get good thai food here.  Thought they had the dim sum cart, but that is only offered on the weekends - Fri, Sat, Sun.    We had the bacon satay.  The server said it was fatty and no kidding, it was.  It was not like the bacon you have at breakfast, but a fatty piece of pork.  You get 4 skewers.  I could barely take 1 down.     We had the Drunken Noodle with Seafood, the Softshell Crab fried rice and the grilled pork neck.  The best dish was the drunken noodle.  It had a nice basil flavor to the noodle.  I could not find the seafood, except for 2 shrimp and 1 scallop.    The soft shell crab fried rice was okay at best.  Lots of crab, but it seemed that they did not clean the body of the crab well, as it tasted really gutty and had a strong fish smell.  The fried rice was like any other asian fried rice.  Nothing special.   The grilled pork neck was the best dish.  The sauce was exceptional.  It did not sound like a great dish, but it was.  Very lean pork with a soy, mandarin, lime sauce.  Very tasty.    Service was okay.  Jeremy was a decent server.  The busboys were able to keep up with the iced tea and water service.  We drink fast and a lot, so anyone who can keep up with us, is fantastic.

6hjJolcRe1LnVWvlYGFGuw.text: My boyfriend and I stopped in recently while walking around Aria on a Sunday afternoon.  My boyfriend wanted me to try his new favorite dish, Pho.  I ordered the Chicken Pho and even though I was feeling sick that day, I ate the entire bowl.  My boyfriend has become a sort of "Pho conoisseur" and he said that was exactly how Pho should taste. I loved it and unfortunately, coming back to the East Coast, I haven't found better (although I've been told to go to my hometown neighborhood of South Philly on Washington Ave).  My boyfriend ordered some sort of Curry Chicken dish and the Tom Kha Ga soup.  He loved every last bit of both.  This will be the first restaurant we go to on our next trip out to Vegas.  P.S. 4 out of 5 stars only because after our waiter brought us our food, we didn't see him again until we were ready for the check.  Usually I wouldn't mind being left alone but being sick the day we went, I really wanted more green tea.

pwl3B_F9V9KktStUZ4pTsA.text: Great Thai food and cocktails. cool atmosphere located inside the Aria. A bit of distance from the Cosmo Hotel but worth it. We initially intended to grab a quick bite and hit the clubs but we ended up spending the most of the night there eating and drinking. The prices are a bit high but worth it.

ffnT0Sow5ZECkHnScYKPoQ.text: Solid asian food at reasonable prices for the strip.  Yellow curry chicken, Basil beef fried rice, and the Tamarind Ribeye are probably my favorites.   What I really love though is the dessert. Mango Sticky Rice is simple and amazing. Bua Loi is also great.  This place will probably never "wow" you, but it rarely disappoints, and they serve pretty much any kind of asian food.

-ZDE_F__yRU-BJVbuVjhGg.text: The chicken Panang was very good.  I had a 7 spice level and it had a nice kick.  You will not be disappointed.

DVaSHIEc83QiKwAjSS6Qkg.text: I enjoyed my dinner at Lemongrass and I recommend it if you like Thai food. While I've enjoyed a couple Thai restaurants in Pittsburgh, this place was very good. Oh, and the Pad Thai is served on a spicy scale from 1-10 however 2 is claimed to be average. I got a 4. I like spicy foods, but man a 4 was HOT!! Very tasty though!

HR8PDogBswd9K90g3Y8AJg.text: Why are we all being considerate about pricing in our review? What ? Money grow on tree for you?   Pad sea eew = $16 Wonton Noodle Soup = $12 Haw Gaow dim sum= $5.50 Seew Mai dim sum= $5.50 Tea =$5.50/person  We came here for lunch after last night of debauchery LOL. The server greeted us. Here in LA tea is free but not in Aria. These tea are grabbed from snow-capped mountain in ChingChongPoo, China. Tea pickers have to climb 15,000 feet with nothing but ropes to pick these tea leaves. This is the story they like you to believe to justified for the tea pricing. It's rare and taste divine! So they tell me.   The server said," We have these special jasmine tea for $25!" And at the same time and at the same motion my friend and I pulled back and said "EASYYYY!!!" It was pretty funny when we realized we said it at the same time and pulled our head at the same time.   We looked at each other and laugh! What's in a tea? Tea leaves and water! Go fuck yourself with the scam! Sorry I don't know what got into me today. It's weekday and work carries over hahhahaha Oh I know I've been watching Gordon Ramsey "F" word show and he cusses alot sorry Love. You should see how he bitch slaps his "Commie" (staff). Funny stuff. Yeap I was at the wrong end of that bitch slap before and it made me a stronger person. What can I say sometimes it's good to take it in the chin. It toughen oneself.  Food was ok, but it's pad see eew how hard is that? Nice dining area. Friendly waitress Ridiculous price for pan fried noodles  $60 total for two people, getting gang bang by Aria priceless.

aZvgcQXkmcVQ7qtfEdHMHg.text: Some of the best Thai food I have ever had! The yellow curry was amazing with just the right amount of spice and richness. I went during lunch so also samples the Dim Sum. The Si Mai and BBQ pork buns we on point. The pork satay was cooked perfectly! I may have to come back to Las Vegas just to go to this restaurant!

xY2g-VQftlz69eBY5zN0Kg.text: I've eaten at Lemongrass 3 times over the years since Aria has been open, and it has always given excellent food and service.  Great curries!

2xwhTMC4VcIuKAtDmaZK7g.text: I was pleased to find a Thai option on the strip.  The restaurants at Aria are still a bit of a mystery to me but I'm finding the lay of the land with each trip.  The decor is very nice and reminiscent of more expensive restaurants.  Some well dressed people were enjoying there meals around us.  The menu is not strictly Thai, but more of a mix of various Asian food options with Thai food as the primary focus.  I actually went non-Thai.  My Szechaun beef noodle soup was good, but not as spicy as I thought it should be.  Comments from the table were that some of the meals hit the spot, but the soup was not bold and tangy like we were used to having at Thai places in the Bay.  So, reasonably priced ... not perfect food, but quite good and more of a fusion or Pan-Asian option.  If you are dying for authentic Thai, this place might be lacking in some of the bolder flavors I associate with the genre.  But I was happy with it overall and the service was good.  I would come back.

N7qWBE4pSAnAz0_4PX-HFA.text: The food was good, but the reason of the low stars was because of the slow service, we ordered food which came timely, but after dinner we wanted to order dessert, but the server paid no attention to us, and we waited for 30 minutes for the dessert menu. Nice food, but not sure if will come again due to service

RNq5MJEFKwydw8N6Km352A.text: Would rate 3.5.  I've eaten here several times this year during work related conferences.  The staff is fantastic.  Food is very good, and offers a good variety of other Asian cuisines, not purely Thai.  I've had 5 of their soups and they were all great.  Like all of the hotel restaurants in LV, everything is overpriced.  Would be at least 20% less, even in a major metro like SF, LA, NY.

e03p9QzFQb3ANp8wFJk1FA.text: Came here twice and tried a few things and overall, it wasn't anything special. The place is a combo of Thai, Singaporean, Chinese, and such, but primarily Thai.  The food:  Chicken Satay: Holy crap those are good. Combined with rice and you've got yourself a yummy grilled meal. If I remember correctly, there were 4 skewers, but they were large skewers so you could have it all to yourself as a meal or share with others as an app. The chicken were tender and wasn't burned, but grilled to perfection. The sauce was good and there was bread, but I didn't care much for that.   Crispy marinated squid: Hated it. Squid was coated with too much flour and there was absolutely no flavor. Very bland, wouldn't call it marinated at all, and hardly crispy at all.  Yellow Chicken curry: Very meh. There wasn't a lot of chicken and the curry was a bit thicker than I expected for a Thai curry. I'm fairly sure there was more potato than chicken.  Thai iced tea: It was ok, but expensive ($4.50!?)  Service:  It was ok for the most part. Waiter came quickly enough and our food arrived in a relatively timed manner, but nothing special.  Price:  By Vegas standards, it's.... ok, but if I were paying this price elsewhere I would freak considering the quality to it. $3 for a bowl of rice? If I were to come back, it'll definitely be for the satay. I'm sure there are better Thai places out there, especially ones that's strictly for Thai instead of a combo of things that Lemongrass does.

ZxefgLVBwHNJ8i7x0SiEdg.text: Not sure why this place has 3.5 stars. I have been here over 10 times and never disappointed. Food and service always consistent. If you sit at the bar, make sure you see Tony!

4LfWkhEO3Qsgn2LzJkoCfA.text: My friend was a 1st time Thai Food person and this was perfect for that. The flavors were on point and everything had just the right amount of spice. A few of the yelp reviews weren't that good but I ignored them.  One review was spot on that said the Pad Thai didn't have enough noddles but lots of everything else and he was right.  Next time i'm in Vegas I'll def go back.

_7SmZenx6GTNjcOOVKQ-EQ.text: if you're complaining about the price.. you're in the wrong city..   yes it's overpriced.. but their wonton noodles were surprisingly good.. and when you're hungover... that's all you want.. even though it'll set you back 20 bucks.. they have dim sum too... and their egg custard tart was damn good too..

vhYVV9_nJqSUFFXGckDeMg.text: Perfect place for a quick lunch. I usually don't make reservations and still get a seat quick.   Food is great. Not something that will blow you away but very good   Service is good aswell.

W9dn1nwOV-xyx49qkYj01w.text: Nothing special. $18 for fried rice. Growing up I better and we served it for breakfast.

kSVOsskwrCFvuce8N9beLw.text: Beef/chicken satay, rib eye, curries and pretty much anything you order here you will not be disappointed. I've eaten here a few times and always have consistent service with amazing food! Best Thai place in town!

LQbUMRXTiOAQBa1ZCzAuHg.text: First, we are Thai. This is the first Thai restaurant ever where I drank a martini before dinner and coffee after. This is the first Thai restaurant I've ever seen where people were offered and served champagne with their meal. Wine is horrid with spicy Thai food, but champagne is heaven. I'm glad the prices are high because it keeps out all the casino riff-raft and street sleaze that's all too common on the strip. We wanted to see if this restaurant could make decent traditional Thai food so we ordered some standards like tom yum goong; green curry; and white fish. The tom yum came with huge shrimpers although it lacked a good spicy kick. We requested our green curry be made with tofu and they did it. The green curry was very good, but again lacked a little kick. The white fish was great-very tasty and served with the traditional nam prik. All in all the food was very good, and very traditional. The wait staff were all Asian, but only a couple were Thai. Our waitress luckily was Thai so our family could speak Thai to her. My pet peave was piqued at this place because many of the farang patrons ate their Thai food with chop sticks. Thai people don't eat like Chinese. We use a fork and spoon for most things. We might use chop sticks if were eating a noodle soup. So put your chop sticks down when in a Thai restaurant and use a spoon and fork!!! We recommend this place. Good service. Good Thai food. If Vegas strip prices bother you, you may want to ask yourself what the hell are you doing on the strip to begin with????? You've gotta order champagne and satay. It goes great together.

hzIfvKqecd5D0EOlPAf9tQ.text: Had a vegetarian Pad Thai J for lunch today. Too oily and need to add lots of soy sauce. I didn't enjoy it that much n the portion is kinda small. Love their soft tofu pudding!  Very fresh n soft :) good service too

7091PO0QrzbX_3-weXH5uA.text: We usually stay at Vdara because it's clean, quiet and bigger rooms.  We always walk over to have Lemongrass.  I love their Yellow Curry, Seafood Noodle Soup, Prawn Rolls and Potsticker.   I can't wait to try their other stuff.

UF-VChve4if8GbPlAQfFzA.text: Came here on a Sat with friends. We were a little early for our reservation so went into the bar. Nice selection of house wines although we had been led to believe they served Cakebread wines, which they don't. But oh well. After a wait of about 30 minutes they offered us early seating in the bar. Hold out for the table lol. The seating in the bar is very comfortable and leans you back ALOT so isn't the easiest to eat from. The back cushion kept moving and that detracted from the whole dining experience. We started with the pot stickers. The port could have used some salt and seasoning. It was very bland, given the chili vinegar soy sauce had no punch that was a disappointment. For my entree I had Phad Thai Ghoong and it was delicious. A very large portion of noodles very well seasoned. I like it on the hot side and could have gone hotter than the 5 I asked for. But every place rates differently so its a learning process. There were four good sized shrimp in my entree and the peanuts were on the side for me to add. All in all it was a good dish. The atmosphere is bright and interesting, a little noisy for hanging out and talking. More of a go and be seen place but still was fun. Will I go again? Not until I try all the Thai places Vegas has socked away. It was good but didn't take my breath away. Nice if you are on the strip and don't want to wander to far.

OVe44p5BAv7cvC0qYvopAA.text: Pad Thai is wonderful. The Thai soup was just what the Dr ordered for s cold and Jose the bartender was very friendly and gave great service.

QiRubTgcF30Ya2pkmT8ZGA.text: This place has a lot going for it: great location, really cool vibe, amazing service and decent prices. But the food needs work.   We ordered the crispy tofu app and it was really bland. Basically just a delivery method for the sweet chili sauce. We expected more flavor from the tofu crust/coating.   My wife's pad thai and my pepper beef udon dish both had flaws. Hers was quite dry, and mine was just pure black pepper bomb, not a whole lot of of balanced flavors.   On the plus side, our server was great and the thai tea was great. Portions were huge too. I just wish they tasted better.

qtWC36hzhZYOa58yVd_1dQ.text: I can't stop eating at this place. Don't know the names of the dishes but the seafood salad was magical. I dreamt about it that night it was so good. The next day I had a soup with egg noodles with a seafood add on and that too was amazing. The coconut ice cream on sweet rice was a dessert I will not soon forget... I think I'll come back for lunch tomorrow. Service is excellent and consistent in quality. Can't wait to be back.

rvptmCY3NbzAxzngI3a6jw.text: Very good Thai food conveniently located at Aria and open late. Went there for dim sum as well. Surprised at how authentic some of the dim sum was. Pad Thai is very good. Flavors were all there. As was the Tom yum soup. Sharp flavor profile that had everything in it. Lobster satay was delicious. Came with a nice peanut sauce. Fried squid is delicious. Like their take on calamari. Dan Dan noodles also a good choice. Nice sesame flavors.

iQe1TE06Rga2QJGxcIoVLA.text: Have no idea why this place doesn't have a higher rating. The food is excellent; pad Thai was spot on and oh so authentic. I ate it two days in a row, wanted three, but no time. The lobster ginger was so tasty, perfectly cooked and plump. Ore Our server was nice, she was accommodating. Definitely going back. Definitely recommended. The best pad Thai around. The person next table over was having green curry and the smell was just so prefect; exactly how green curry should smell- coconutty, sweet and salty.

3J60_sEazZ_mN9LHX6dRmw.text: Yum.  Was looking for. Good Thai joint ion strip and found this in Aria.  Pricey, but it's the strip.  Worth it!

DP71lzy9Y3j755D-4w4PmA.text: The service is great and the staff are very friendly. For the location, I was surprised at how reasonable the prices were. Food was great - BUT - I can't give it 5 stars because the Mango Sticky Rice was the worst I have had - the presentation was very poor and the flavour was bland. Sorry Lemongrass

QuaamT9arr8oVOjavo6PRg.text: Sat at the bar and treated myself to some delicious lemongrass tea, Tom Kha soup, and Phad See Ew. Perfectly seasoned and great service from the bartender. She was delightful!

VCcxvxHL30CahzmYzn7_tQ.text: Went for dinner (two of us) had the vegetarian pad thai and the homestyle tofu dish.  The dishes were plentiful and probably enough for 3 people.    We were given the option of mild medium or high spice level.  The food was flavorful but even though we selected "medium" it was quite mild.  Also ordered the spring rolls which came hot and filled with fresh cabbage. Menu did not have many vegetarian choices.  The service was friendly and there is a bar at which one can have a mesl as well.

T3iP0acjKbXT9VNBvxT-kA.text: Standard Thai food. No wait. This place is mostly half full, lots of seating available  For drinks, I got a fresh coconut. It's refreshing with the meal.   Main entree: vegetarian pad see ew, requested without oyster sauce. Comes with gailan veg, asparagus, oyster mushroom, carrots with the flat noodle. This dish was okay. I found it to be too oily. The veggies were also mostly all stems..

Uc4MnuHzvqTgDMNT8Yxyeg.text: Outstanding selection and quality. Impressed by the  lite and delicate fish. As close to Asia as I have come in the USA. China feel with family dishes and round tables. Very impressed.

BEm7Aef3xpQna5zxxrSDxQ.text: I've visited Vegas many times and this by far was the worst service I've ever received at any restaurant.   The food was decent, not anything special.  We purchased a expensive bottle of Chardonnay, we had to pour our own wine the whole evening.  We started the evening with glasses of Veuve champagne, the empty glasses sat on the table the whole evening.   Our server finally vanished, towards dessert time. A rude server took over and We decided to get out while we could.   Customers at tables were raising their hands, trying to get attention from the servers.   **I'd suggest avoiding this restaurant on your visit here.

d7rdiqLEEbt27oTFvxRR1Q.text: This was my boyfriends favorite place I think for our whole trip. Unfortunately for me I was so sick from the night before and extremely hungover I couldn't eat my food but the broth.   My hunny and his sister ate the dim sum and they got the soupy little pot sticker. And a shrimp and pork one.   Then we ordered 3 soups I ordered the spicy meat one with some really fat noodles. And it's was ok. I tried the meat and go my surprise it had this huge fatty piece right in the middle of the bowl and the brisket was way over cooked and dried out. And the broth was too salt and over powering with the Star annis in there.   My sis in law got the dumpling soup all of her food was really yummy. And the broth was delish and the noodles were really thin. I like here better.   And my boyfriend ordered a seafood soup with chicken broth. It has squid and all kind of things I would never eat. But he lied it. Finished the whole thing. The service was good.  I felt like it took forever for the food to come out but as sick as I was I'm sure it was not too long. I just wanted to sleep. Lol.   The price for all 3 of us was $100+ tip a little steep for a soup and the dim sums were like $15 a piece for 3 little piece and the soup ones came in 5. I wouldn't go back. But this review will go for my boyfriend because he truly loved it. And was a special treat for him and his sister. Celebrating her birthday.

velX4dI1ERuW7rKehqXIXQ.text: It hasn't disappointed yet. It is absolutely one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas .  Love the favors, the ambience and the service is always on point.

I0meKyQzPRD_yNGsxMdfqA.text: Been a few times for dim sum on the weekend. It's good, but takes sooooo long for those carts to make their way around. Will go again.

hCiFoHF60WYMj3tL_19Raw.text: This is my favorite Thai cuisine in Vegas! Licated I inside Aria. Try the papaya salad and the shrimp Pha Thai.

2usztNwfBQg50hgmZUbJFQ.text: Food was good.  I ordered the Pad See Yu (my go to Thai dish) for comparison to other I've had.  Flavor was good and not too greasy.  Also order Mee Gorung noodle (interesting use of spaghetti pasta) and the Penang curry (my favorite dish of the meal).  Most memorable was the Thai iced coffee, definitely not Starbucky....

uJlpXidGNYFlqBtPo8r3ig.text: This place was an okay place, yeah it is a fancy Asian place so I was expecting the prices to be over priced and it was, but we ordered the chicken wings and the soup. They are not stingy on the duck and pork and it was pretty good and it was late at night as well..  Overall a good experience.

HBxMPN29Rotb-7Q9wbOeRw.text: I hope yelp has a vote for zero rating as well instead of default 1. Even a rating of default is worst for this restaurant. We visited this restaurent on October 5th 2018. We were welcomed well and taken to the table. Server greeted well and took our order. We got our drinks and Appetizers in 10-15 minutes. Even though we ordered our main course along with the drinks and appetizer, we didn't get our food until 90+ minutes. Looks like there was a change in our server which we were not aware of. Some other server came to us after 60 minutes and said kichen is backlogged and we are still waiting for our food. During the same process, there were people who came after us more than 30 minites later, got their food. At 90 minute mark, when i asked the other server who said kichen is backlogged about the food; He went back and got us our food. The food he got was not hot and looks like the food was prepared like time and waiting for someone to be pickedup. The fried rice was so dried.   When i asked about this to server, no appology in return. He said let me talk to my manager.

43XsR3UKboDOqXRN6NgjYA.text: It definitely satisfied my cravings for Asian food. We ordered the Tom Yum soup, the papaya salad, and the seafood stir fry.   What makes this place unique is you can choose your level of spice from 1- 10. I am a spice lover! I eat everything with tabasco and every place that I eat at their level of "spicy" is very mild for me.   I was very surprised because I tried their level 9 for my stir fry and it gave me a good spice kick. The flavor of the Tom Yum soup was sour and sweet, absolutely delicious! I wish it was sourer but it was still good. If you're in Vegas, looking for some good Asian food, this is your spot!

O5ofXNs7RaRBBa-8BoU4Hw.text: We find ourselves here no matter where we are staying. Amazing food, service and drinks. My favorite drink is the watermelon drink on the menu. So refreshing. We always start with the spicy asian cucumbers. Just the right amount of heat. Next is the satay, the chicken satay is our favorite. If you like spicy food this is the place for you. The basil meats are amazing. We prefer the chicken or shrimp. Yes they have a heat scale of 1 to 10, but it does change so play it safe. I love hot food and even for me it can be too much. I have learned to never go over a 5 or 6, but again depending on the peppers that can feel like fire. The taste of the food here is amazing. I never have trouble getting in for lunch, but weekend dinners require a reservation or a lengthy wait. The bar area is open seating. If you're near the Aria make sure to try this wonderful restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2vh0S6rYkS_ObGQmsZJ-ag.text: This restaurant is conveniently located near Aria Sky Suites; within a couple of steps from the elevator. The restaurant's decor is modern and open. We ordered several dishes to try (names of items on the photo).  The food is above average. It's missing an authentic taste in my opinion. Most of the food is on the bland side and it's not as spicy as one would like. Thai food needs to be spicy, a little sour, and a lot of flavor. Of all the dishes I ordered, I recommend the Coconut soup with Lobster; they give you a good amount of lobster.  Overall, the food is reasonably priced for a casino restaurant on the Strip. The service was excellent and there are a lot of varieties of food; a lot of vegetarian options. We have ate at this restaurant several times and the experience has been great.  PS. The restrooms are individual unisex restrooms and there are multiple ones, which is good.

eJt107lThnLyod2jBhEIMg.text: After reading other reviews I was looking forward to eating at this restaurant. I have visited Thailand and uh unfortunately now know what is good thai and what is not good thai food. At home in oahu, Hawaii there is 1-2 good restaurants and a few back ups.  First of all the service would be laughed at in Thailand. Our server over poured the hot water in the tea cup and said oh yeah as I walked the water spilled over and so that's why there is so much water in the tea cup plate. But no offer of bringing a dry one, so okay. Then the medium steak with tamarind sauce arrived and the medium steak was an edge under well done. My pho broth was hmmmm just okay not the awesome broth you would think a Thai restaurant would have. The category I'd put this in would be in the 3rd or even 4th tier Thai restaurant but paying 1st tier price. Watching others eat the beef satay sticks was not uplifting either but smelled good.  Either way I would not recommend this restaurant to any friend or family and just wait till you go back home and try the one next to the Kapolei theater. That one is authentic and full of flavor and great service. Is 2 stars to high?   Good luck

4YvqN7dKAtVJ-NzbhJgJ1A.text: Wow...some good and a little bad resulting in a one star beat down.  The good - The coconut/chicken soup was the best I have ever had.  Combined with a side of white rice (had to order that to dump it into the soup) along with a chicken and shrimp Pad Thai and BOOM - Epic feed.  Service was also good...except what leads us into the bad below.  The bad - the fried rice sucks.  It was super burned and we told the waitress and instead of offering an alternative, she just said "ok."  The single star removal was for the crappy rice as the rest of her service was very good.  Just a miss on acting on the poorly made plate.

oDjj63YyJeJwEATdTUI5fA.text: A must dine place on every trip to Vegas.  Ok maybe more than once.  We love their food and service!  We always use Open Table or the MLIFE app to make reservations as it does get busy.  Our favorite dishes are the dumplings sum cars rolling on Friday and Saturday.   Prawn cakes, Yellow chicken curry, wonton noodle soup, seafood chow mein, Singapore noodles, and tofu.  Everything honestly is delicious!

XKuc_adx-lU_bsUVa0wJfQ.text: I've been to Lemongrass a few times during my travels to Vegas. Coming from Vancouver I think I'm pretty spoiled when it comes to authentic Chinese and Thai food, so it's pretty hard to be blown away while travelling.   Lemongrass is a good for when you absolutely feel like you need to have Thai or Chinese food, but  I find the dishes lack those aromatic and complex Thai flavours that Thai food is known for. As for the Chinese food, you may be able to find something more exciting at a mall food court...?   Make sure you specify the level of spiciness you want for your dish (level 1-10) if applicable. I find the servers tend to forget to ask if you don't tell them.   I would recommend ordering 1 dish if you are dining by yourself as the portions are pretty big. Or if you're in a group ordering a few dishes to share family style!  In all, I expected a little bit more from Lemongrass as it is in a higher end hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Szechuan Beef Noodle Soup
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon &amp; Prawn Spring Rolls
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Satay

9guBhBDHkvXudnYDrPEmXg.text: Atmosphere 4.5/5: Lemongrass is in my favorite Vegas hotel, Aria, so location is great! The interior looks great and it's very well designed. The only reason I'm taking off half a point is because the way the tables are set up make it difficult for diners to get the attention of their servers. Other than that, I loved the atmosphere!   Service 4/5: Service was a little slower than expected because of the reason noted above, but they were kind. I got a Thai coffee that was way too bitter for me, and they were more than happy to replace it with the Thai tea with no extra surcharge (I had a few sips of the coffee). The dim sum cart only comes out every 20ish minutes, which was annoying because we sat down right when the cart went back into the kitchen. We had to wait awhile to order from the cart.  Food 3/5: From the dim sum cart, we got the turnip cake (good but was soggy--could be crispier), shu mai (my personal fave of the meal), and har gow (good but the skin was way too thick). We also got the Young Chow fried rice, which was delicious with the medley of veggies and meat mixed in. The chow fun noodles had wayyyy too much noodles compared to the amount of toppings, and flavors were a bit lacking.   Overall the food met our low expectations (it's dim sum in Vegas...of course we had low expectations), and the service was good. Because the prices are a bit hefty for Chinese food that can be made with better quality, I'm not too sure I would return. I would definitely give it a try if you're interested!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chow Fun
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Young Chow Fried Rice
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Har gow

5EaJHJNMIBRQfW_gdPH6BA.text: Came here on a whim because our reservations at another restuarant were cancelled on us. My bf and I were staying at Aria, so figured something in our hotel would be easy. Being lover's of Asian cuisine, we were truly impressed and so happy we ended up here.   We ordered the tasting menu, because 4 courses for $49 a person was unbeatable. We also added the drink pairings, which was $29 a person. The first course came out, and we were pleasantly surprised with the size of the appetizer (we figured we'd be sharing). The Satay's were perfectly cooked, wonderfully seasoned, and the perfect portion. Then the soup came out, it was hot with the perfect amount of spice. Our entrees came out which were hugely portioned and so flavorful. My pad thai was filled with shrimp, and his curry had the perfect balance of flavors. The dessert was dynamite and didn't push me over the edge. Plus side, the drinks paired perfectly with the courses and were a great size.   The cherry on top of this experience was our servers Amber and Pittaya. Our waters were never empty, they were helpful with questions, brought out the courses at the right time, and assured us this would be plenty of food. This has easily become top 5 of our favorite restuarants in Vegas. It is not authentic Thai cuisine, but an exceptional fusion of fine dining and Thai food. If you want a phenomenal fine dining experience that's not a steakhouse, this is the place for you.

B0MQAUauRLkgfrDSW-LXzw.text: As a typical asian (I'm from hk), the food this restaurant cooks doesn't match my taste at all. I'm not sure if foreigners like this style of asian food, but I feel very bad after eating this restaurant. This doesn't taste like asian food at all. It's more like a western asian food( with a lot of western sauce added.)  So if you're looking for a traditional asian restaurant, this will definitely not be your choice.

z9u-Sdr3sJGSBqDiSkNzmQ.text: We were looking for a restaurant that was within walking distance that was open late, so we walked back to Aria hotel. My friend said that the restaurant is upstairs, but it was actually on the first floor- just follow the signs.  There wasn't much of a wait, so were seated within 5 minutes. The restaurant was dimly lit and had a romantic feel to it. We all wanted something soupy, so we ordered the wonton noodle soup, chicken wings, and two tom yam soups.  Our food arrived pretty quickly and the bowls were pretty big. I personally ordered the tom yam soup with shrimp and it was alright. There were a lot of mushrooms in it and the broth was a bit tangy, but didn't taste authentic. Overall, everyone thought that the food was just alright and overpriced.

Mo4R5lMghH2LspELr-4kfw.text: We came here after a concert. For several minutes there was no hostess to be found so we walked in. She ended appearing and even the place was half empty, the wait was 25min. We hoped for a bar spot but nothing came available. After 15min we were seated. Service was great and fast. We ordered shrimp steamed dumplings, pork stickers, sesame chicken and prawn rolls. The prawn rolls were ok but nothing special. Everything else was absolutely delicious. The sesame chicken is probably some of the best ever had. Pricey place but really good for late night appetizing dining!

9eR3qccTkvu-MOOb11-3Sw.text: By far, the best place I've had while on The Strip. The service was excellent, the food was tasty, and the ambiance was perfect. We came in on a Thursday night and were seated right away. To start, we ordered spring rolls and seaweed salad both of which were super tasty. Next, we ordered Chicken Green Curry and Shrimp Pad Thai. They asked how spicy from 1-10, with 3 being a medium. The green curry was a #3 and a pad Thai was a #5. The former was quite spicy, where the later was not very spicy at all. Despite, it was sooooo freaking yummy and the portions were huge. I am so glad we came to this place and definitely plan to return!
