cYWOIaN0aPQMqJVuPXLV4w.text: I recently ate lunch and dinner at Lemongrass. The dishes I ordered include duck panang curry, crab curry, chicken satay, singapore noodles and the banana spring roll dessert. The curry crab and Singapore noodles stood out for me. Everything else was satisfactory also.

Vec_-Nhgeax5s8pZ_UjoyA.text: Probably the most reasonably priced restaurant in a higher end casino on the strip.   The service was excellent. the ho spent so much time deciding which table would be best for us (and them) because we had a stroller. The table was perfect. Service was fast and attentive.  the set up and decor is excellent.   Food is good. Not the best but very good and we all left full even though we didn't order a ton of food.  My favorite entree was the three cups chicken. Super flavorful. Lots of garlic and the meat was tender. My wifes complaint on the dish was that there was too much meat and not enough veggies. But thats exactly what made it so good for me.   The highlight of dinner was desert. The coconut ice cream. Id go back just for that and nothing else. Amazing.  Next time I am starting with desert and finishing with the same. It was so so so good.

byUizwiKpyLAykRXLFNHRA.text: After spending a couple of hours at the table wrestling with blackjack dealers and working up a midnight hunger, our Mexican friend said "Lemongrass (at Aria) has the best Asian food and XLB in Vegas.  Trust me..."  Lemongrass, like most of the restaurants on the strip, has a chic and modern decor.  Being that it's a Thai cuisine restaurant, the design also has a bit of Asian twist - all of which was nicely done. The service was terrific, attentive and friendly.  After all, it's Vegas.  So far so good...  Given it was a late night snack, we ordered mostly comfort food: Wonton Noodle Soup, Dan Dan Mian, Drunken Noodle with Seafood and Xiaolongbao (XLB or soup dumplings).  Unfortunately, Lemongrass didn't live up to the hype.  The noodle in Wonton Noodle Soup was clumpy. The drunken noodle was numbingly spicy (but that could be the fault of my friend who said he wanted it "medium" spicy). The dan dan mian tasted like it had chicken broth.  Probably the most disappointing was the xiaolongbao which tasted like the ones you buy at the frozen section of Ranch 99 supermarket or Costco.  Our suspicion was confirmed by the frost bitten skin that was dried at the edges.   Perhaps it was the hype from our Mexican friend but after objective evaluation and deliberation, we all agreed Lemongrass was DEFINITELY not the best Asian restaurant in Vegas.  Next time, I'm gonna tell my Mexican friend that I know the best Mexican restaurant and take him to Taco Bell.

M60hcrCwO-x7_kYT2CEA5g.text: This is a great Thai fusion restaurant on The Strip. I love the atmosphere of the restaurant, the decor and lighting is amazing.  They have plenty of options on the menu, from dim sum, noodles, stir fry, etc and they are reasonably priced. You would think because the restaurant is on The Strip you would pay more and get less food but it is not True at Lemongrass. You can also ask for items to be made spicy or not spicy. This time we tried the Garlic and lime steam cod, beef broccoli, and the Soft She'll Crab fried rice ( I always get this).

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft shell crab fried rice and in the back is beef broccoli
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic and lime Cod

ncZ9dkerkrSMccMuMBeHGQ.text: My oldest sister selected this restaurant for dinner and it was DELICIOUS! The services were also great. We got there around 6:30 PM and were seated right away by the hostess. There weren't a lot of people there, yet. (Pokemon Go fans, there is a gym for you to battle or spin for items).  I ordered the stir fry choy sum with rice and tea. The others ordered beef red curry (medium spicy), drunken noodle, papaya salad (medium spicy), and shaved ice with fruits.  If you love/like tea, then order it here to enjoy with your meal. The tea came in a teapot and a small tea cup. The tea brand is Tealeaves.  We shared the dishes. My younger sister was so impress with the quality of the food, she wanted to back again before we leave.  The hostess and waiter came by to check how the food tasted and also top off our water. The place have low lighting so you can enjoy your food and take your time. Even as the restaurant began to get busier, I never felt rushed.  My sisters and I would come back again. This is now one of our restaurants to hit up when we are in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate after eating the papaya salad
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky rice
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stir fry choy sum

mQ1eVpM8dQSRnXypHMgTyw.text: One of our must visit place when we stay in Aria.  Located next to high limit baccarat, awesome interior, great taste, and reasonable price. Served fast!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork skew
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taste Chicken wings
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak taste amazing!

O_bVA5kwCI2B3VD4d8KqTw.text: We got some take out from this place to bring up to the room, the service was excellent, from the lady taking our order and she was very accommodating when we added to our order and also when we asked for some special chili sauce.   The food however left a lot to be desired. The price is high and the quality is low. Actually that's not entirely True. The dimsum combo was pretty good, and the soup dumplings were juicy! The Walnut lobster was super loaded with breading and kinda soggy. The rice in the softshell crab fried rice was hard and kinda flavorless. We had the basil and crab omelette which was super salty. Ginger soy sauce seabass was probably one of the worst ways I've ever had it prepared... And it's probably one of my favorite fishes.   The homestyle tofu was ok, but you only get 5 small pieces of fried tofu with some veggies per order.   We were starving when we ordered the food, but i can't even say the food was ok. The food was actually so bad we didn't finish any of it and for the price, the only thing my stomach was filled with was disappointment.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0JN9J5bomAYanzH3_JF_Vw.text: Top notch service and amazing ambience! But food was just average. Not bad, but nothing extra ordinary!

mot6OCMew3FMpatH5wYOyA.text: The service here was great, but i wouldn't say the same about the food.   The Tom yum chicken and mushroom was missing something i just cant put my finger on it but it was. It also had a strong herb taste which i usually like but like i said it was missing a flavor.  Every dim sum i got was "okay". I think it was more americanized for me. The chicken feet wasnt as flavorful and the crab claw was cold. The tripe was super bland and chewy.  As for the chili oil used, it was all oil and barely any chili!   Honestly it would be more of a place if i was too drunk to walk anywhere else place. I didn't love it personally but someone else might. I love authentic food, so most of my authentic loves would understand that this isn't a place for us!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken feet
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab stuffing
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab ball

j3sDpXKdNKB90G-m7ndKLw.text: Staying at the Aria and stopped here for an early dinner as soon as we arrived on Christmas Day. Restaurant was only 1/2 full, but we were told the wait would be 20 minutes, so we opted to sit at the bar. Service was quick and we watched a basketball game. We ordered the salmon spring rolls for an appetizer. These were top notch...salmon, cheese, and basil fried in a slim roll with sweet chili dipping sauce. I ordered the Pad See Ewe (spelling?) at a spicy level 3 out 10 and the man ordered Pad Thai with Chicken at level 5. The Pad See Ewe was just ok, I'm not sure it was meant for spiciness and it also needed more veggies! The Pad Thai was excellent!   Only real issue was the bartender, who doubled as our server. He was loud and ignorant...we found many of his comments to be inappropriate and offensive.

ao4cIyaA0Ja035kneiRRqQ.text: Excellent Thai food and fair prices! I highly recommend Lemongrass for dinner - I got the Pad Thai and it was amazing!  One of the best meals I have ever had in Vegas.

5MdoPry51zSEyT0-miCuxg.text: Good service and yummy good. The Tom Kha is so delicous! Perfectly milky and sour balace. I got all veggie (carrots, asparagus, cabbage, baby corn, ginger)Hubby got pad thai and that was very flavorful too! Nice ambiance. They seem to be pretty busy so i recommend a reservation.

VWV7Q3M9SZ85TVlSW3eBUQ.text: Food was good but not great. Two meals, one specialty cocktail and a glass of wine for $140 save your money and find a locals restaurant

NM0NZTctDtzhc6yKtQazqQ.text: I came here for dinner and will definitely be coming back. I had the yellow curry with beef and steamed rice. Delicious!    Prices weren't bad, most of the main dishes were between $14-20. Seafood was a little more pricey of course. When I ordered water I opted for the free tap water as opposed to a $9 bottle of Fiji water. I just don't see myself ever paying $9 for water.   My only complaint is the service. We were seated right away which was great, but after we got our waters we waited another 10-15 minutes to order our food even though we were ready to order after a couple of minutes. We had to wait to make eye contact with our waiter across the room to ask for a water refill. Waiting to ask for the check took another 15 minutes. If the restaurant was busy I would totally understand but it really wasn't.

7rF_QJVhAhfs7rEP8H3i_w.text: You have to try this place in the Aria casino. Everything is good. I eat here 2 times a year - which is exactly how many times a year I am in Vegas.   Wings are fantastic.   Pad thai is killer. Get it a little hot. I got it at a 7.   Pepper beef udon- amazing.   Soooooo good. :)

Zxc5czRYoLZTfQMWW1UEiQ.text: Rating this on a vegas scale. Food was good. Nothing special. Decent prices for a casino restaurant. Nice place. Would go back back. I had spring rolls and pepper shrimp dish. Both were good.

R4m6qDEzeD-Di4XNJGiacw.text: Food was very good , however service was the worst we saw the server only 2 times taking the order and paying the bill we had to track down the server to get a bill. Also the hostesses were very condescending and annoying. The staff needs to learn manners and know how to deal with customers

15UI0yVWJf71b25cx3IC0A.text: The service was good and excellent seafood drunken noodles with shrimp, scallops and squid. I order 5 level spice and need to add spice for my taste which I think is medium ( no nose running but nice heat). If your like medium spice probably need 6 or 7.

fVZktXEMeCcuR44CB1XGaQ.text: I've been in Vegas for almost two months and this place has restored my hope for good restaurants off the strip. If you're a fan of spice and Thai this is the place for you! Atmosphere: A+, service A+, food A++. I really loved it! I got the Thai Basil Chicken and side I can't speak for the other plates, I highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Satay
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai Basil Chicken! Freaking good (and spicy)!
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie egg rolls. Really good spicy chili sauce

pJSZifQNR-K0T58v-oHnUw.text: WOW!  decor~top notch or should i say top-stitch?  LOL (you will see why~amazing! modern yet used antiques in multiples.   staff~friendly, attentive and professional   hours~open late night for after the show dining   food~fresh, delicious served beautifully   mood~relaxed, could be romantic  location~ in the Aria (every room has a corner view!)  *we have been to many casino/hotels in Vegas. all three of us thought that the Aria was the MOST beautiful hotel we have seen. something for everyone! even my husband who is not an artist liked the HUGE televisions in the bar downstairs.

6OiFOfzQePCOVuJiprCNRw.text: I can't really justify giving this place anything other than two stars, maybe that's pushing it... the spring rolls were so good though it sways my rating a bit.  I can testify to the other reviews here that the bad service was one of the reasons I dislike this place so much. As for the taste of food everything tasted like Fish... I mean everything, well besides the spring rolls, the panang curry, which has no Fish, tasted like Fish. The fried rice also tasted like Fish. I voiced my distaste with the manager; however, I was not even credited and nothing was removed from the bill.  With how much competition there is in Vegas, this place isn't worth it.

2Cpf0BKk75FNXsV-G4DC9w.text: Omg seafood drunken noodle here is so good. They could spice it however you like. I crave this place a lot. Anything is good here. There is a wait.

yspOvTYd90iO4Q3ba5BA8A.text: Lemongrass sits tucked inside the Aria Casino just off the middle of the floor in an alcove with another restaurant.  While waiting to check into the Vdara next door, I asked the concierge about great local restaurants for lunch.  She recommended Lemongrass.  Arriving just after 2 pm on Wednesday, I was seated in a mostly empty restaurant that was in a nice open area just off the main floor but strangely had a darkened interior.  To be honest, it was bothersome, as if management had dimmed the lighting to tell people to get the heck out.  It contrasted widely with the well lit slot machines just a few walks away.  Waitstaff was quick but the Asian staff was reserved and didn't engage in anything other than light conversation.  I decided to go with one of my favorite, Chicken Pad Thai.  From past experiences in traditional Thai restaurants, this is one dish that is easy to make, but also easy to screw up and serves as a good litmus test.  While the menu was impressive, the pricing was not.  There is no distinction between lunch and dinner pricing, so my order cost $18.  The meal arrived was a large, very savory portion almost twice what a lunch portion would consists of.  Considering this was a $18 dish, I decided to half it and take the rest for a snack.  True to expectations, the dish was chock full of the standard ingredients with lots of chicken, noodles, peppers, carrots, onions, and bean sprouts.  Overall, it was very tasty, and joined with a kettle of Hot Green Tea, it filled me up and prepared me for the rest of the day.  Overall, I think Lemongrass is a great place.  Considering the location inside the Aria, I expected the higher-than-normal pricing but was turned off by the dark interior but at least pleased with the quiet environment.  Location was convenient and staff was quick and efficient at both service and busing tables.  Overall, I give it four out of five stars.

vbnP9FEp3gaKeREWQ0t17w.text: The food was great! It was served in a timely manner and was hot. The waitress was attentive and kept checking on us. My drink was never empty, someone always came by to refill it. Will definitely go back again.

IxDpgecjXzbK1Po_tuz1fw.text: Service awesome, decor fabulous but food is not up to expectation. We ordered vegetable fried rice  and steam cod. Presentation was really good but food is below average. For the price they charge they should do more authentic taste instead of going fusion.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Satay chicken. ..love the presentation. ..unfortunately taste is 3 star....

qNQEuOqDLnRM04uVoE0Oig.text: ambiance - superb. loved their decor Food - Good. not the best in town but not bad either service - Superb. our waiter was very helpful and attentive over all experience - Great!

VB9AfVWuTzG8RSAKQy-mgw.text: The menu was good, a lot of verity. Good ambiance. Disappointed with the food and the service. We were told that we couldn't handle the spicie level, still asked for it. Food was barely spicy. The service was terrible - waiter does not show after the food is served. We had to fill our own water; we saw a pictcher of water and to serve it ourselves. The waiter forgot tea we ordered. At the end it appeared the waiter realized his mistake.

7t3KlgqiPMtZnn386rOo7g.text: **Review for Restaurant Week 2014** We went for lunch for the $30.14 four course meal.  The dinner option is the same price and same menu.  They sat us on a big beautiful leather couch at a table - it was a very comfortable and luxurious place to enjoy lunch.  The service was friendly, but a bit slow.  But the restaurant was so beautiful and they refilled our water and tea frequently so I didn't mind spending more time enjoying my lunch.  The food was fantastic.  They offer a tasting menu regularly for $59 that was very similar to the $30.14 menu they offered during restaurant so I know we got a great value on the meal while donating to charity.  The starter was a chicken satay and cucumber salad.  The peanut sauce was very good.  Then they serve a small mushroom Tom Yum Hed.  The flavor in the soup was great and I would go back to eat just that.  Then for the main entree we choose to have the Phad Thai with Shrimp.  I loved the pad thai and the shrimp were a good size and fresh.  The highlight of the meal was the dessert - an ice cream with sticky sweet rice, coconut, jackfruit and fruit jellies.  The coconut and jackfruit were very fresh and the ice cream tasted great with the rice.

9MoOyS76zjzUknpi-gFj8g.text: Bit disappointing - place was packed so we thought it must be good. Had to wait 45 minutes to get a table. Prices were very fair for Las Vegas standards and the portions were humongous (none of the three people in our party finished their plate), however the food was not up the same before mentioned Las Vegas standards. Meat in both our curries was extremely hard (I would call it a shoe sole in German, not sure if that translates to English though). I am still marveled how you can produce a tough chicken inside a curry. Our weakest meal while we were here.

INH3cBECsZoPcRVzop0zow.text: fried dim sum (turnip cake and shrimp choice dumpling) came soggy, not crispy. su mai was typical. pork spare rib lacked flavor. beef and broccoli was awful - beef was overcooked and the chinese broccoli was undercooked  the unsweet tea was good and the service was good, but the food would be a 1 star  expensive too but the flavors don't back up the price

LXua8NPk4AlSbdCIvM00uw.text: I love Tai food but this was the WORST and TASTELESS Tai food I have ever had. I wish I had listened to the bad reviews and went elsewhere but I was tired from a long hike in Bryce Canyon and a 4 hour drive to Vegas and wanted to stay in the Aria hotel.  I should have walked  back to the Cosmopolitan were I previously ate at China Poblano and enjoyed very much!! Choose another restaurant in the Aria to try or walk elsewhere!  Lemongrass is BLAND and  DISAPPOINTING!

b6795a_Uc37bbdCsCh_7Vw.text: As my sister put it (without words), "it's life changing" hahaha  Loved it and would happily go again.

B87X1jufIoX4nuy7wzBbFw.text: I came here for dinner with a group of my girlfriends. It was a Friday night around 5:00-6:00pm and the restaurant wasn't busy at all. I ordered the red curry with duck. The flavor actually reminded me of how my mom and I cook our curry so I enjoyed it. The peppers in it were really spicy, too. I also ordered the prawn rolls for my appetizer but I didn't really care for it. I was expecting more flavor in it. The ambiance is feels pretty fancy in this restaurant. I'm not sure I would dine here again, but it was good to try at least once since it was close to our hotel.

f2Vx8dT2zqwdZJtrTfz7Hg.text: Most of the restaurants I've chosen in Vegas I've been happy with but Lemongrass not so much. Overall, the Aria is a slightly strange place. The rooms are amazing - so comfortable, amazing touch screen technology to control everything in the room, bathtub in the shower area, etc. That said, the hotel lobby is gloomy, the casino is very dark, the club is just okay, and the casino tables are not lucky!  Back to Lemongrass though. It's thai-fusion and not all I'd hoped for especially with how much I love thai food. I'd be happier with more "normal" thai food than this spot. We tried to get the seaweed salad to start but had to send it back because it was so strange and fishy. The other dishes were not memorable either and it wasn't inexpensive. We had wine which was pretty good but the food was just not worth it. If I were to stay at the Aria again, I'd choose other restaurants for sure. I'm actually a bit surprised that Lemongrass is still there.

HunZ8RJtqRaUQfcWg1A7sA.text: Not impressed flavors pretty blah and you have to buy rice to go with your dish (i.e curry). Go to Weera Thai off strip on Sahara/Valley view your belly and your wallet will be so much happier...I promise!!

APVOQIlecuzm3UV_wxy5AA.text: Nicely located in one of the best casinos on the strip. It also has nice ambiance and almost all the time, there was no waiting. They are located near a very expensive mall and in an expensive hotel so they are pricey for a Thai food place.   We were a group of four and we were well tended to our needs with courtesy and respect. I would like to point out that place has nice seating arrangement for groups and couples alike. I had a curry dish with rice and it was delicious. Everyone on our table enjoyed their food. The food is very spicy so you want to be careful with your spice number when you are ordering.   I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a very nice place to hangout and get some good Thai food at the same time.

M4vK-MP5GAcqhDInXkj6XQ.text: This is not authentic Thai.... very disappointed. Ordered traditional Pad Thai which was very sweet, noodles were heavy and mushy

Za6666Rz3_f2GBC0CFw2FQ.text: Visited this place for brunch/lunch. Got two items off the dim sum menu, chicken feet and a chicken basil bun. We don't mind spending more money especially when we're in Vegas, but at least have some good food. The chicken feet were unseasoned and lacked any real flavor and the chicken bun was dry and only 1 bun for $6.50 seems kinda sus. For entrees, we got the mee goreng, pretty average overall in portion and flavor (nothing special), sesame chicken tasted like typical Americanized Asian food and batter was soggy, and finally the Cantonese chow mein which was ordered as crispy but was definitely burned on all edges and tasted bitter and charred (definitely not the way my mom used to make it). Staff was friendly enough, probably wouldn't visit again since there's so many more options along the strip.

J0VUk19nt4DP92u8vleVPw.text: Had a really good meal here. Like the atmosphere here it was relaxing. Food was great I had the chicken with cashew. The pricing was a little high for the type of good but the quality was better. Menu had lots of vegan options for my vegan friend.

6CkIq22BeedhkD2KifeKSw.text: Excellent Thai food, best I've ever had. We started w/ the Spicy Asian Cucumber and the Potstickers. Light, refreshing, different. Then moved on to the Panang Curry duck (red curry)... outstanding! Creamy red sauce over savory duck breast. Phad Thai Goong, they asked how spicy? (Scale 1-10) we went with 10... It's "Thai" hot... very flavorful, slow building, warmth... It's real phad thai.  The Mai Tai's are nicely mixed as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basil beef, pork and chicken combo
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5JU1wi77C8IYl8rqRiBjBw.text: Dinner at the bar. Drinks were OK. We expected the dinner (Pad Thai and the Yellow Currie) to be better but it needed seasoning. Cant say i would go back to this place. While not horrible I would not go there again. Bartender was a put off by our presence and did not even ask about our meal and say anything when giving us our check. I really expected more!!! Service was OK at the best. I would go somewhere else for Thai food or drinks.

mGL5Eu4FA8poAgzeCmWnkw.text: A good choice for Thai food in centre strip. With a hot scale from 1 to 10 allowing you to customize the spiciness of your curries. We had a ton of food this visit since I was dying for rice. The Thai food is of course somewhat westernized but when you are Asian and haven't eaten rice in a few days you don't really care. Highlights were the satay,  the pork satay was exceptional. Fried egg with crab meat was really good with the rice. Curry lacked much of the flavors of basil, fish sauce and kaffir lime leaves and was bland. This place is no Lotus of Siam but it is good with a great central location and a cool comfortable atmosphere. You rice eaters will find some comfort here when the craving kicks in.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Satay
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Satay
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fish cake

mZqIcdfouuxMKHbGO3YFZA.text: I am from Atlanta and I thought I have had the best of the best Thai food already. This spot in the Aria hotel/ casino has blown my mind. I loved the food so much that I had to stop by one last time before leaving Vegas! I was with a large group so we all ordered a little bit of everything. Here are some of the dishes that stood out the most to me:   1. Penang curry with duck- you would think the duck was the star in this dish...if you did you are wrong. The curry sauce was so delicious. I would eat all the sauce with plain rice and still walk out a happy customer.  2. Tom yum w/ seafood- this soup is sweet, sour, and spicy. The ginger and lemongrass was not hidden and lost in the soup, all the flavors for a good yum yum soup was present. The best part is...there's HUGE shrimps and lots of squid and oyster mushrooms in the soup. The broth to meat/veggies ratio was good. I have been to other places that had too much broth and not much of anything in the soup.  3. Papaya salad- tasty but nothing out of the ordinary. It's just a well made basic papaya salad.  4. Sea bass- the portion was a little smaller than I expected but the fish was great. It was nice and fatty and not dry while the skin was super crispy.  5. Beef salad- it was my first time trying a beef salad but I really liked it. Never would I think to add grapes to a beef salad with fish sauce and chilies but it worked.   We ordered a lot more food but these were the ones I enjoyed the most. My next visit to Vegas I will definitely be stopping by Lemongrass!

_v-R_ATBDhS00sqD5JIvOg.text: Nice ambience.  Ordered the fried chicken appitizer...it was delish.  It's a little on the pricier side, which is understandable as it is located inside the Aria.  The boyfriend ordered the seafood noodle soup...delish.  Daddy ordered the shrimp wonton noodle soup...delish.  I ordered the yellow curry with beef (special request for the beef, since the menu only says chicken).  They asked how spicy I wanted it, from 1-10.  I ordered an 8...which had a great kick to it!  It was yummy & full of flavor.    Only disappointment was on the menu, they give a few different options for rice.  Sticky rice wasn't an option, but I asked anyway...and they had it!  Still a disappointment...sticky rice is supposed to be eaten with your hands...and it wasn't manageable with my fingers...had to use a spoon.  Btw...they close @ 2am.  Ordered a pho to go at 1:30am after a long night of gambling.  YUM.  Lots of meat!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yellow curry w/ beef, spicy #8.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. seafood soup.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. wonton noodle soup.

ELcq4xz-d6Ri6r00zrRpQQ.text: The Thai milk tea was weird, the drunken noodle with sea food was not spicy at all, the Singapore noodles mediocre at best, the jellyfish was weird too. The waiters were not attentive either.

rSkYuV54WJdkEF0fyPjI3w.text: Its a bit pricey for thai food but you're in Vegas and in a hotel at the strip. Restaurant week special is a must try, price is better than anything on the menu.

bM2p7vyAhDybZnPx1e04RA.text: Very tasty cocktails and yummy spicy Thai food. Had a delicious duck Panang curry at a '5' spice level. Pretty spicy! Handy location close to the cirque de soleil theatre. I'll be back!

2mHdK7sbCAQg1zb735ZQ_g.text: I ordered the vegetable yellow curry from here. I Just recently came back from traveling Thailand and found that the food taste was similar to the real thing. The pad Thai was, however, too oily and the flavor was not spot on. I wouldn't order that particular dish again. I found this place to be overpriced for the quality of service and the food. Although, we still had a really great experience here.

boyJzahFvgBI16lQtGfNgQ.text: Came here with my fiance for the dim sum brunch and was disappointed to see a pretty limited selection l. We didn't receive one of our beverages. As we were sitting the dim sum cart came back and then never returned for an hour. Eventually, we over heard the server talking to another table that they had run out, even though it was an hour into the 4 hour dim sum window. Our drinks were refilled once. We watched people leave waiting for their food. We won't be returning.

X9iUZecrlQNczDa-c0es4Q.text: This is hands down the best "fine dining" thai restaurant that I've ever been to.  It was conveniently located inside our hotel (The Aria) and was priced pretty modestly.  We started off with their awesome prawn  rolls, shared a chillean seabass, a lobster fried rice(was on their specials menu) and duck penang curry. All of these entrees were amazing and they made them with just the right amount of spicyness.  We asked for a 4/5.... and we were sweating ever so slightly...PERFECT :).  We ordered every single drink on the cocktail menu, all of which were awesome.  We opted not to get dessert, but our waiter was really nice and bought us a fried banana on the house.  Thanks for the lovely experience!

OhnZydhQ0hcbBK6B0yeUTw.text: I had never had Thai food before and I am pleasantly delighted with Lemongrass.  The dim sum was what we started with, which is like a choice of dumplings (at extremely reasonable prices).  Also ordered the drunken noodles and basil chicken.  They do warn you about the spice level, but it's even spicier than I assumed it would be.  I like spicy food but even at a "2 out of 10" spice level I still definitely needed a lot of water.  If you don't like spicy at all you need to order a 1 (They let you choose how spicy.).  Service was kind of weird and very teamwork-oriented and you had to ask for service, but I'm pretty sure that's normal for the kind of restaurant.  I wouldn't know though since it's my first Thai experience.  Overall, I will definitely go back on a future trip to Vegas.

jMdrGJymQyR0qiMhHZ4Msw.text: Came here for dinner and waiting for the rest of the group to arrive before I heart radio festival. The best plate was this coconut rice mango dessert. It's so addicting.

aQxQaQLjj-DfjdMcI28hMA.text: Twice I have been and both times I did the chefs selection. Wow. Just wow. Service always amazing, great job Ming, food top notch, and signature cocktails never let down. Just try the coconut rice, I am not a coconut guy but it is so moist and tasty. The shrimp pad Thai, the chicken and shrimp patay, the seafood lemongrass soup, amazing! But the rib eye. OMG. Honestly never tasted anything better in my life. It wasn't even my dish but the flavor and how well it was cooked had me drooling! Don't pass this place up. Thai like you have never had before!!

3PjLYlS0ZyctV2gdGcX3XQ.text: The service was BAD, thank God one waiter was finally nice with us. The food was Ok. I expected so much more from this place...

PmFr51UTYfJUsYWqZEYc7g.text: I've been here a couple times now and it is truly great Thai food. I got a pad Thai beef (level 5) and that was not as spicy as the waiter made is seem. It was a pretty good sized portion though and very flavorful.   The restaurant very pretty cold though, might just be because it's right next to the casino.

Jsy_AdEnHzM0MJd5goxfkg.text: I love Thai food and this place was definitely delicious! My friends and I went late night after seeing the Zarkana show at Aria. We all orderd something different so we could share! Sesame chicken pad thai basil beef fried rice another chicken dish that was in a clay pot pot stickers and their noodles. We enjoyed it all! And the staff was very nice and knowledgeable. Helped us pick out great dishes to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B25Df1-r-Zw9QuQeRNOC3Q.text: Best chicken satay and pad Thai I've ever had. It was all delicious and had a good experience with service. I like that it's open late. We came after a show since we were unable to have dinner beforehand.

4QswJpQYQkDy3TyKLO6DrA.text: The restaurant was beautiful, the service was great and the food was outstanding!   We started with the chicken satay with peanut sauce and bits of chopped celery with a plum sauce that had a little sugar and vinegar and it was amazing! For entrees we had Chow Fun  and duck curry and they were both incredible! To me sauces make a dish and both of these are over the top!

alHrfjlG7iYa10OwwaBd4A.text: My sister and I were on our way to eat at Treasure Island, but it started pouring down really hard when we got to Monte Carlo.  It was a thunder and rainstorm outside, and there was no way we were going to walk out there, and the line for the taxis was very long.  So we remembered we had seen a Thai restaurant in Aria years earlier, and decided to go look for that...good thing Aria was connected to Monte Carlo.  We ordered the Basil Beef Fried Rice and Drunken Noodle with Seafood...and oh my, we sure loved it!  It had good texture and flavor.  A year later, my sister and I went to Vegas again and went to eat here again.  We ordered the same two items and also ordered the Sampan Spicy Crab...I was loving it!  My sister gets too lazy to break open crab legs, so I basically had it all too myself, and I sure ate it all!  Delicious!

yzGnETBvMR_RPO59Xx8GPw.text: Great quiet restaurant when you are in the busy world of Las Vegas.  All of our meals were exceptional, and the drinks were such a tasty treat.    I would recommend if you are into spicy do not be afraid to have them kick it up a notch, the "medium" for the curry is pretty tame. So if you are just looking for the curry flavor it is great, but tell them to spice it up for you if you want.

BTFBdgd30uR0gZWVdTfTkA.text: This restaurant is an option if you lost most of your money money playing with their not so expensive choices. I really like asian food so I liked Lemongrass. However, the service is bad. It looked like there was only 1 waiter in the area with 6 tables.

AG75JxLTZ_ijDIJMq_8uSA.text: During my time in Vegas, I visited Lemongrass a number of times. It was always very good. Consistently good and had good service as well and at a reasonable price.  I eat a LOT of thai food and I have to say that Lemongrass has some of the better Thai food I've eaten, not the best, but it's very good.  I often started with the chicken satay which is standard but good and/or the tom yum soup which had a bit more flavor than a number of other tom yum soups I've had.  For the entree, I've had a number of things. My favorite Thai dishes are yellow curry and panang curry and Lemongrass offers high quality curries, both had good flavor and spice without overwhelming and the consistency of the curry was correct as well, not too runny like some places. They have plenty of fried rice options which are good and also offer a good pad see ew. One of the times I was there, a friend got the crab which was a full crab on a plate. I'm allergic, but it was very cool to see and looked incredibly fresh and delicious.   Overall, I always enjoyed Lemongrass and would gladly recommend it to others.

nkLkdB180MGU-B_XzyDtOg.text: Simple awesome food. Ordered red curry vegetarian. The fried banana with ice cream was out of this world. Never had such good dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Wjl5Nc7_heuwOrE9eV3i6g.text: Lemongrass is in the beautiful Aria Resort and Casino Hotel.  The atmosphere is breathtakingly beautiful!!    Pros: 1) Excellent service 2) Food was great (Ordered the pad thai with beef) 3) Huge menu variety (including dim sum) 4) Clean and new 5) Quiet atmosphere  Cons: 1) On the pricier end 2) Location of the restaurant was tucked in so it was kind of hard to find

6mN2kPrYHHFogTMfXDvcgQ.text: Went here during a conference. Got the Cuban sandwich for lunch. It was good but the bread was soggy on the bottom and the meat was a little dry. Not bad but there are better options nearby

_oe2pKAqrMvULsOwpq1IdQ.text: what can be better than lemongrass... mediocre asian food for affordable prices and long time working operation. the best dish will probably be soft-shell crab fried rice and green vegetable curry with lot's of veggies and asian eggplant. i will also recommend Watermelon Caipiroska... it's ok choice for lunch too especially not to many restaurants around accepting lunch reservation. definitely not a five stars and probably not even a four stars but being drunk and generous today i will leave four stars for today...

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. watermelon vodka

4k7-xYxxoGGFXgSR0RZHgg.text: It was just ok! I expected more. More value, more flavor, for the Tasting Menu $59 +$29 for pairings (which had little alcohol in them). The Thai restaurant in San Diego in our neighborhood has better flavor. Aria advertises this place as the only Thai place on the Strip....well...thy best kick up their game as the #1 spot is up for grabs.  We asked for spicy,..it was not.   The Chilli sauce condiment bowl was empty. We brought this to the attention of the waiter. Bowl was refilled, not washed or cleaned prior with the old Chilli still dried to the wall of the container.   The Chicken Salad tasted bad and merely looked like it was boiled and processed through a meat grinder! ..it was bad and something I wouldn't feed my beagle.  We wanted to order a drink with Ginger - they were out of ginger.   We announced a special occasion - they forgot.   Flavor wise - it was all mediocre  ...I woke up the next day thinking about how bad it was. I will call the restaurant today and suggest management sit under cover, and eat the tasting menu. As Gordon Ramsey would say to the chef "did you taste it?"

Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WDHOE3Dhu_CzVTowzkkscA.text: This place seriously surprised me. Wandered in one day just to see what it was about and was impressed by not only the selection, but the execution, and the staff friendliness.  I expected pretentiousness, overpriced small-portioned dishes, and mediocre flavor. What I actually got (both visits so far), is friendly and responsive service, generous portions, and extremely fresh and well-balanced flavors.  This place is now on my list of places to go every time I'm in Vegas. And it rivals most places I've been to in the Portland, OR area. The prices are a little higher, but not egregious. Myself and two friends had quite a good feast for under $90.

C7BkeS6Dy5gn5dLOawGQew.text: Nice place for entertaining guests who don't want a super ethnic Asian crusine.  It is Americanized to a large extent but if you consider that your in the middle of the Las Vegas strip,  it's a cool place.  This time around the food was pretty much a salt bomb.  They have expediting issues as two groups of guests who showed up after us received their food first *and* finished  On top,  everything was super salty.  Even for my palate,  which loves salt.    To be fair most of the time when I order lemongrass its pretty spot on and I typically order it frequently since I play poker  But still not much of an excuse.  The house did offer free desert.  For what that's worth

8CPWejRdkttwSMTFOq_gcQ.text: Really.....fancy smancy place alright, in Aria hotel chain area, that took me 45 mins to find it. I haven't have had  fish in weeks and so I thought I order the whole founder with sauce. It came over fried. Fish doesn't not need to  so fried, the meat will just be hard. Even the stick rice was steamed not to well either. Cooking rice all my life, this person, definitely did not know how to cook sticky rice. And the som tum, flavorless. These folks has never eat papaya said in real places of Thailand, Thai town in LA. I even make it better myself. I wanted hot, 4 peepers, tasted more like one peeper. Clearly this place is catered to westerners or folks who had never eaten (real) Thai  foods before. All I can say was, was so looking forward to it, and was very disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Place is awesome designed though.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sum Tom. Nothing compares to home made. Sorry. I asked for 4 peppers, it wasn&#39;t still hot. Catered to none eaters of a Thai.

MYADGC20RatWHOm7_YFmHg.text: The food was good and they had a great selection. Service was incredibly slow, however. I think they were understaffed but I never saw Manager and the severs didn't seem to have the hustle. Loved the atmosphere and would eat here again as long as I don't have anywhere else to be and I don't arrive hungry as food will not get to the table anytime soon.

iRKIPxFDf-R1pU-CIzkILA.text: Located in the Aria. What I love about Vegas is the fine dining restaurants. These pretty, intimate looking restaurants make me feel like I can get fancy here at these places. Not only does the environment look and makes me feel good, the food is good! Also there's so many of these hidden little gems I'd have to come back to Vegas a few more times just to try them all!   On a crave for Asian food so we came here. My girls and I started off with sticky rice in those leaves and some dim sum. Of course a bit on the pricey side, but nonetheless GOOD food. We shared the Young Chow Fried Rice and the Mee Goreng.  I like that their food isn't too salty. It captures the right taste and has such good flavor! Their food is made fresh and their presentation is decent. Yummy food here!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Young Chow Fried Rice
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mee Goreng
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shu Mai

6Kp7SpeKV2QteUP74IuBUA.text: I was pleasantly surprised by all of the dining establishments I was able to try @ Aria over four days.  Lemongrass'  Sea Bass was fantastic. The noodles and side vegetable plates - noteworthy.   Staff was especially accomodating. My large group had no reservations on a Friday night AND did the separate check thing, which is daunting enough a task, especially when people get up and move around expecting their Tom Yum Goong to follow them wherever they go.   Only did Hendricks & Tonic for cocktails but they were perfectly poured. All three rounds of them.

-wGAdlrQUkTVEB5yr9mmew.text: One of my favorite restaurants in vegas! Everytime i come to vegas I always stop by and the food never disappoints! My favorite is the chicken pad thai, if you are looking for some yummy thai food i highly recommend lemongrass!!

rGjo6omwIXGyPVhG42f_Rg.text: We came here for restaurant week and I am so pleased that I did. We had lunch and cannot say enough about how delicious it was. This was not my 1st time here.   The service is fast and very friendly. It started with a lovely soup with mushrooms and vegetables that was mildly spicy for me and more spicy for my friend. Our appetizers were the chicken and beef satay skewers and they were amazing. For my main meal, I had the Panang curry chicken. I asked for it to be as mild as possible. From a scale of 1 to 10, I asked for one. The meal was so good. It was not spicy which I loved, but it could have been made very spicy for someone who enjoys that. My friend ordered the shrimp pad Thai and asked that it be spicier. They honored that! The beauty of this restaurant is that I like Thai food a lot, but I am unable to tolerate very spicy food. This restaurant always successfully manages to create delicious meals that are either very mild or very spicy, depending on how one likes it. Dessert was a scoop of mango sorbet which was very nice on the palate. The prices are reasonable, the restaurant is beautiful, the food is delicious, and the service is always friendly. Highly recommended!

lEPyXHtQBX0BgofbBZp5Fg.text: Came here two times. The Sea bass is not too bad. But I tried the Pad Thai and Pad Se Ew, those two is a fail. As another reviewers said, it's much better outside the mom and pop Thai place for $6.  Portion is ok but the noodle was hard and glue together.   The decor is nice. Hot tea if I remember is $4.50. it is basically a tea bag in a tea pot.  Was expecting more at that price.  Don't plan to come back again.

CdcKvUHsL4-P2zGaJYNomA.text: I go to Vegas a bit too much at times and Lemongrass is a great escape from the usual steak/fish dinners. It's conveniently located at Aria and they're open late!    I usually go for the prawn rolls, satay combos, panang duck and mee goreng street noodles. Try the Thai spice drink, it's like a rum spiked Thai iced tea. But I don't get sticking the lime on the glass. Maybe a pineapple or shaved coconut would be more appropriate, just a suggestion if you're reading this, Lemongrass peeps.   Food and service is always consistently good and I enjoy making a stop here every time I stay at Vdara/Aria.

gUKKqHBqMi4zizAP4KSazw.text: Maybe you reason why all the doors are closed So you could open one that leads you to the perfect road Like a lightning bolt, your heart will glow And when it's time you'll know at...LEMONGRASS! - Amber Carrington (firework cover)  I was staying at the Aria this past weekend and it was 1:30 am and we hadn't eaten yet for unforeseen circumstances. The only places that were still open at the Aria was Lemongrass and their 24 hour cafe. Without much deliberation, we came here hungry but also not expecting much.   We ordered the red curry with duck and vegetables and wow, it was a huge portion of duck, pineapple, green eggplant (fairly certain it was eggplant lol), red and green peppers, bamboo shoots, and cherry tomatoes. I was quite impressed by the sweetness of the curry with the tastiness of the overall dish. The jellyfish appetizer that I was happy to see on the menu wasn't good though as it was very rubbery. I've eaten a lot of jellyfish and this was something that definitely looked like it but wasn't quite there. I even tried adding chili sauce to mask the rubberness but that didn't work haha  Now I know the reviews overall haven't been great here but there are positives: A. open till 2 am /// B. restaurant decor is nice /// C. food looks authentic  Honestly, I would normally never choose a place like this to have a dinner when I usually only get 2-3 nights per visit in Vegas and there's TOO many restaurants to choose from. The thing was that all the places I had on my list to try were already closed and we were staying at the Aria and this was open. I'm not sure about the rest of the menu but the red duck curry made for a satisfying meal that won't leave you feeling stuffed to enjoy the rest of the night.

D9wmgCza4inPYOqoqlRxrg.text: One of the best Thai food I had till now. Panang curry with duck is flavorful and heavenly! Pad Thai was just ok. Not worth the price imo. The interior decor is perfect .Not recommended if you are on a budget as it is definitely a posh restaurant, but you are in Aria and can't expect anything less, but I would still go there just to have the Panang duck curry !

p6THWgFQzFB-iQdrIodRVw.text: Loved this restaurant. The best part was the lobster satay a little on the expensive side ($24.00) but worth it. Everything was cooked perfectly and tasted great. Will visit again next time I'm in Vegas

wrqRRO0x19VlpUiLOiTibQ.text: These guys totally deserve 5 stars for food and service. Everything was awesome. We got the Tom ka soup that was amazing, dumpling and spring roll pretty average. The main dishes hit the spot. We got the beef fried rice, sesame chicken, cashew chicken and a couple other dishes that were all great. Definitely will be going back next time.

U6WB33luT7qCyHufyoDI_Q.text: Expensive and overly salty with their dishes. Can't see this place lasting into the future.

EfG9VCxSDXyB3KWOaDmGQQ.text: Went here for dinner. The atmosphere is very romantic and uptown. Their tom yum soup is a surprise, delicious!!

jIyJfq9KY3rM1V7fPQrCJQ.text: Lady at the front was rude. I would have walked out if I wasn't super hungry. Waiter service was good though. Food was delicious. Would be a 4 star for me if the front lady was polite instead of telling us off. Told us wait was 5-10 min. We were thinking of taking away then. Then she told us this "I told u table is 5-10 min we will be ready and it's ready now". And that was only the next minute. With a newborn it was hard to wait 5-10 min

c5Bm9_Cd3scal2DJwqihXg.text: Delicious food and good service. Came here with a group as we were in Vegas on business. Hot and sour soup was excellent. My beef and broccoli was fresh and delicious also. Of the five people at our table no one complained and everyone complemented the food. The service was fast and friendly.  What more could you ask for?

HzZgTKYUeQHi_7vr9BCzeA.text: Papaya salad- good Drunken noodles- good Overall the food was good and a 3.5. The service sucked and I would give it 1 star.  I requested a mild salad and medium spicy entree and received the opposite.   It took a long time for my server to take my order (the noodles came warm, almost too cool to eat) and forever to bring the bill because he was too busy flapping his lips with his coworker.  Better service=higher tip. Just say'n!

3yE18Aus6iU7KgAWN1yDKw.text: +/- decent food + big portions (the soup is HUGE as was the various noodle dishes we got) - overpriced + attentive servers +/- easy location to find in the hotel + has it's own bathroom (at a lot of hotel restaurants you have to go back out into the lobby) + in the Aria so part of the MGM chain so you can add it to your hotel bill if you're at any MGM hotel

HJ0xzEFnchtkb0Wuh0wcfg.text: Panang was mediocre. Heavy, too sweet curry.  Not very spicy.  The roast duck in it was good, crispy, but very fatty.  Lemongrass soup was also a disappointment, thick with no subtle taste and the chopped up lemon grass made eating it like chewing tree bark.  Beer selection was minimal.  Draft beer consisted of Bud Lite.   And of course prices were very high.  I'm sure a better Thai place can be found around here. Keep looking.

f6wHSorY7Y-e3_3D74g7jA.text: HORRIBLE!! Don't even bother. I left with a sick stomach from the food and the floating things in my water. They brought me a 2nd glass and it still had floating crap. Not worth $75. These fancy ads are nothing more than gimmicks.

NpHEIR33l_4fyvXadGlclQ.text: I like Lemongrass and will grab a bite to eat here about once during each  time I stay at ARIA.  The food is good, the wait staff are attentive, and the restaurant is nicely decorated. However, nothing here, other than when dim sum is served at lunch, stands out.  Again, the food is good, but not really better than any other Asian-fusion restaurant found in other parts of the country. If you are near Lemongrass, give it a try. I have checked-in 6 times, and dined there many more. If you are there when the dim sum carts are out, do yourself a favor and dine there! The dim sum is a good as I have had in Beijing or Shanghai. Yep, just as good and authentic.

oTz4Yk0EW294KYz97WNj7w.text: Over-priced Thai food, but else can you expect on the strip. My boyfriend and I were in the mood for Thai food and had limited time for lunch. We walked into the restaurant around noon on Sunday and noticed a sign that they also served dim sum here. Looking at their menu, Lemongrass is advertised as thai food, but there's also chinese and vietnamese food on the menu.   Thai Iced Tea- (3/5) it was okay, slightly too creamy Chicken Wings- (3/5) the wings without the sauce didn't have much flavor and tasted better with the sweet chili sauce. However, you can get the sauce from a bottle at an Asian market. Tom Kha soup- (1/5) enough for 4 bowls, dried chicken pieces and mushy mushroom, no other veggies Chicken Pad Thai (lvl 6)- (3/5) didn't have the tradition sweet taste of pad thai and tasted mostly like spicy  I think if you're really really craving thai, I guess this place is okay. However, if you can drive a little off the strip, you're better off going to a hole in the wall thai restaurant. You'll probably get much more authentic food for a quarter of the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Pad Thai (spicy level 6)

w2CGitML5QKjL2UcBu6TuA.text: Had the Chicken Pad Thai. Was Mediocre. We had a really hard time finding this restaurant, but the staff was friendly and prompt.

Q5GlEWWvblYIuo9zuCG5Wg.text: Came here with co-workers after conference. Had the 3 course mea special. Enjoyed but for sure ate somethings I had no idea was. They were light dishes very well cooked.  The banana desert with ice cream was amazing. The manhattan  drink was nice as well

UIVdMGI6GEB4hp5U8yXVZw.text: Normally, Lemongrass is a favorite of mine. Having been to Singapore earlier this year, I was excited to see a Seafood Singapore Laksa, which is supposed to be a spicy, coconut milk soup with complex flavors. What they gave me was completely, utterly flavorless. It had the opacity of coconut milk, but none of the taste. It's as if they had just plain water (not any kind of broth) and splashed in some coconut milk for color. I started with the lobster satay, which was excellent as always, but was sorely disappointed with the laksa. Stick to the Thai dishes!

9LQWwIKhQAOevdi0M9Q7LQ.text: I love the beef chow fun here.  As a rule, I do not prefer asian fare.  Lemon grass has something for folks like me.  Case in point: Beef Chow Fun.  The prices are reasonable, and it is available to go.  They have a dim sum cart with about 20 different choices that is only offered at lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OnARDLEPG7BGDcPF9dQw-Q.text: Both my boyfriend and I love Thai food. As luck would have it, there was a Thai restaurant located in the Aria and we decided to make it our last meal in Vegas. It was a great decision and I highly recommend giving it a try.  I stuck to my usual order of chicken phad see ew. Oddly, the menu only lists three meat/veggie options for each dish and the phad see ew only offered a choice of pork, seafood or veggie. For comparison's sake, the phad thai listed chicken, shrimp and veggie. I decided to take a chance and inquire about substituting chicken instead and they easily made the change with no questions. I'm not sure why the menu only lists certain protein options for each dish but I was pleased to see that they're not strict on that.   My phad see ew was absolutely delicious. In fact, I'd even go so far as to say it's one of the best that I've ever eaten, which is a good thing as it's also probably the most expensive at $18. While it was a little hard to justify spending nearly twice as much on the same dish, the quality of the food and the ambiance of the restaurant made it worthwhile.   My boyfriend ordered the home style tofu with rice at a spice level of ten. Our waiter warned him that it's extremely spicy but my boyfriend grew up eating New Mexican green chiles and always asks for high spice levels at Thai and Indian restaurants. He's usually disappointed that they fail to reach his desired spice level but the spiciness here is no joke. He was pleased that they actually lived up  to their warning.   I also decided to splurge on a Thai iced tea and it, too, was very good and gave me the caffeine burst I needed to make it through the rest of our final day in Vegas.  The restaurant is beautifully decorated and would make a great date night spot with the dim lighting and quiet setting.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Phad See Ew with Chicken
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Home Style Tofu
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai iced tea

jxzsEa7lCg5TN81S5QpVsQ.text: This is a pretty mixed one,  The ambience, the atmosphere and the service was excellent, the restraurant looked fancy outside but their cost is pretty cheap compared to other restaurants in Vegas. The food however is not that good and doesn't met my expectation. Tried the basil chicken and it was meh, as a Southeast Asian and a frequent consumer of Thai food I'm sure that this is not authentic.  The tom yum is acceptable but that's just it.  If you just want to eat to fill your belly and eat Asian food then you can eat there but if you are genuinely looking for Thai then this is not for you.

ZvRoJoEX9voBZd4KWXMLyg.text: I tried the signature tasting menu. The choice of Rib-Eye steak was very good, but overall an average tasting experience of Thai food.  The Watermelon Caipiroska cocktail was very good.  The Lemongrass menu is available to order from the poker room at the Aria, so it is probably better to order individual dishes, rather than the signature tasting menu.  Cheers

Be8v_ZxpAvkYknMJYgY-vQ.text: Weekend in Vegas, we went for an late evening dinner at a Show. Made reservations for 10:30PM they MGM app, when we arrived we were surprised to the see the restaurant packed on a Sunday night. We were seated promptly, large menu we order a shrimp roll appetizer just perfect. Pad Thai dish was not bad but not our favorite. The green curry was amazing with side order of rice 3 items was plenty for the 2 of us the dishes had reasonable portions. We really wanted to try dessert, however we had No room for dessert. Defiantly will make a point to visit lemongrass on most trips. Next time we will try some other dishes, with green curry being a must.

5hNMQbavzqLvSKY1ml53mg.text: Toni the bartender is awesome!!  Located in the Aria.  My husband and I come for lunch everytime we are in Vegas.  We usually sit at the bar.  The same bartender has been working for years!  He makes a great gin and tonic!  We always order the pot stickers and yellow curry.  You can't go wrong with eating here.   Prices are Ok - it's Vegas don't forget.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot stickers
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half eaten chicken curry

_md_5JzRPOLHhFgckKdgZQ.text: I am not sure that I will ever forget this place. I tend to eat so much Asian food and I love Thai the most. I feel that this is at good as it gets without being in Thailand and I want to try ALL of their menu!  I loved the decor... and the service. We got to sit near the bar and admire everything. It almost seems like you are sitting in a giant basket with all the woven work above you.  To start, we got crispy shrimp spring rolls. SO good, well executed. SO good that they were gobbled up before the photo opp. I got the red curry as my main, 8/10 on the spice level and it did not disappoint. It is the best red curry that I have ever had. Pineapple, bamboo shoots.. everything was in there. Make sure and order jasmine rice on the side to really enjoy it. I had half to take home as leftovers. I like that they come to your table to fill the to-go boxes with your food. My dinner partner had sweet and sour chicken and she enjoyed it. It had a kick to it, that is for sure. I give that dish a 5 too. (She gave it a 3 which shocked me a bit but it is all a matter of taste!) If I could tele-transport myself back there right now I would. Hanging out at Aria for any reason is always a good time too.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red curry, 8 out of 10 requested for spiciness. Delivered. Best curry I have ever had. Order jasmine rice as a side.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet and sour chicken. Delicious, spicy!

XP7xrVohWB76RZVlVl0trg.text: Been wanting to try this restaurant and glad we finally did. My boyfriend and I got a small booth. The seats were so comfortable I could fall asleep on it. The cushion was soft and there was a pillow. I love the design inside and atmosphere was cozy. I loved the place where we sat. Came here to try the dinner. We ordered the beef satay and spicy cucumber for appetizer. The beef satay was delicious! I liked the sauce that came with it. Spicy cucumber was pretty good. The only thing I would say is I wish it was more crunchy but it was fine.  My boyfriend ordered the chicken dish and I ordered the big crab dish. I told them I can't eat spicy well so they made the crab non spicy for me. Big portion and it was yummy. They give you wet towels on the side. My boyfriend chicken dish came with steam rice so I had some of his rice. His chicken dish was delicious as well. Chicken was tender and sauce was yummy. My crab had plenty of crab meat and it was yummy. Our server was very friendly, although I would have to comment that I wish he was more attentive to us. I understand it was busy but customer service is very important. The other servers and workers attended to us and they were very friendly and fast. I think our server was just tied up so he had help. I wish I had save more room for dessert but we ordered a lot and we had to take it to go.  Definitely will come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy crab!
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My crab dish and the chicken dish
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy cucumber

F3aTLP23juivP0jF_VD6Wg.text: Disappointing for Aria. I've eaten at Lemongrass several times and gotten takeout a couple times as well. The food is just not up to par with what you'd expect from a 5 star Vegas resort. I ordered beef with broccoli and it came out lukewarm, the meat very fatty and the sauce just not tasty at all. I sent it back for the black pepper shrimp which was good, but not the best quality either. Service was slow despite not being super busy. Skip this one unless you really can't get seated anywhere else in the hotel.

K92TduBrjl6ZlRI9OldiSQ.text: During our weekend getaway in Vegas for my bachelorette party, 6 of us girls made reservations here for dinner one of the nights. I was completely wowed by everything: the ambiance, the service (for the most part), the drinks, the food, and the price!  I LOVED the vibes of this place, and the gorgeous fresh flowers that were outside the restaurant. What a beautiful sight! Our service was outstanding: our server was so friendly and accommodating. I was very impressed by the wine that we shared, and it was a good price too!  I ordered the chicken "pad thai" (I remember the spelling being a little different, but you get the idea). I loved the spice level! My sister got the green curry and it was absolutely fantastic. We shared a few of the appetizers with the table as well, which were tasty before the meal. I was on the fence about a 5-star rating, but the other five girls got their meals before I did, and mine didn't come out for about 5ish minutes after. I felt as though maybe they had forgotten my order. Overall, a fantastic choice for Vegas dining! I will definitely go back when I'm in town!

o9ndTjaefhVtm-RTh5uvfw.text: This is our favorite restaurant in Vegas. It has passed our 'rule of three' - more than three visits with good food and good service. When we come to Vegas, we usually go to Lemongrass twice!

_LMTS_Ltb26ZX79TYgvdew.text: Pretty tasty laksa and yellow curry crab.  It was a bit more modernized than I'd prefer (like all fancier restaurants tend to be) but I enjoyed the food and dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab yellow curry
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Laksa

qjI7z8Zl-PnQmWriSIK1rA.text: I'm so glad I came here, despite some of the bad reviews. I had read their food was bland. Let me assure you, that's not the case. I've just eaten the best red curry I've ever had. It had all the notes of spiciness, basil, lemon, and curry. The hubs had fried rice, which was also delicious; it wasn't greasy like some fried rice you run across. If you're a Thai fan, you gotta try it.   Service was also impressive. Our server, Cesar, was very attentive and answered any questions we had regarding the menu.

hNCec0MNZbW2k89As0f5Zw.text: The papaya they have there was pretty good.. but I wouldn't recommend their beef pho.. the flavor was very bland and wasn't satisfying...

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d-Ux_VvSVijtsg_gQ4amOg.text: I'm very confused by the previous reviews as we had a FABULOUS dining experience!  We made reservations before seeing Zarkana so as soon as the show was over, we headed to dinner. We were greeted by Bank, our waiter and he was great! We ordered drinks to start and then decided on dinner. I went with the cashew chicken dish and an order of the pork fried rice.  The food came out within 15 minutes.  That fried rice was one of the best I have ever had! Great flavors!! The chicken was very tender and fresh!  I enjoyed every bite! ! Bank was very attentive during the entire dinner.  Definitely eat here as you won't be disappointed! !

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cashew chicken,  fried rice and Asian cucumber dish!

Gh9no4xEjKoQNPhfrDLpAA.text: I'm a little biased because i know the hostess...  Nice ambiance. Food was good, just a tad on the hot side. Fast service.  Prices a little high with the average entree price at $15.  If you have a sky suite room, make sure you check out the secret lounge - you get free drinks, cookies, snacks, and fruits!

orHhV8Lyusk7Vr1NDRprRg.text: Food tastes incredibly fresh. Got the drunken noodle dish - it was a really large portion. Service is efficient. They have no problems accommodating patrons and can make your dish vegan if you ask them. BTW, unless you really don't care about costs, don't be fooled by the nonchalant offer of an alternative for a drink... my friend said yes to the coconut milk/water and then was shocked to see 12$ on the bill later on. ^^

ZPKeP9n5Mfx5PIKge6TiBQ.text: Pretty standard Thai restaurant at very high prices. Had a few curries, rice dishes and noodle dishes with seafood. I would normally just give the place 3 stars, since the prices don't really reflect the level of food you'd expect. The food was good, like any Thai food you'd get for 8-10 bucks would be. However, the duck curry was pretty unique and good, albeit pretty petty portioned in comparison to the economy-sized curry that was as big as my face. The shrimp in each of the dishes that had seafood was amazing! They were so fresh that biting into it, your teeth snapped into the shrimp. I have only had shrimp this good in one other place, which is now closed.  If you go, order something with shrimp. It's amazingly fresh.  The service was great as well. The staff was very attentive and friendly.

IYYututD3HJdhC5mWidzPw.text: I love Thai food and have been there over 50X. I wanted desperately for this to be a good Thai outlet, but I was sorely disappointed. The dishes are very uneven. The satay and Tom Yum Ghoong soup was excellent as were the satay. The chicken breast dish I had was breast meat that was over battered and the meat so dry I could not chew it or swallow it. My partshrimp entree was good, but not excellent. The mango sticky rice desert was good. The fried bananas were terrible. The menu and cooking seems to be dominated by Chinese influence. May be part of the reason it was lacking. Service was good through the entrees and then everyone disappeared. Had to grab someone from another section to get desert and the check at the same time. Really wish I could have had better things to say.

GBrEFCpvNEPP7KOZRsc3Og.text: Lemongrass was the perfect place for dinner before a show. The dishes were large enough to share for 2. The server was constantly checking up on us, which we appreciated. The level of spiciness was given a 1-10 rating, which was easy to choose. The best thing is they're open until 2am! I totally recommend this restaurant. (An extra star for serving brown rice!)

yjFGpoRu_LQgsQhUG7R4lQ.text: The best way to sum up this place in one word is:  OVERPRICED!  Dined here for dinner with some friends on Saturday 6/25/11.  Since the Aria is so big, it was hard to find this place.  When we finally did find this restaurant, we sat down and looked at the menu.  I was shocked to see Thai food so expensive and so overpriced.  Can you believe they were trying to sell pad thai for like $16??!  I was shocked.  I can find better tasting pad thai for less than half the price they were selling their's for.  I ended up just ordering a bowl of their wonton soup for $14.  Yes, $14!!  There was nothing great about it.  The wontons were good, but the overall soup tasted like it came out of a Top Ramen bag.  Totally disappointing.  One of my friends ordered the pepper shrimp which was good, but a bit on the salty side.  Their pineapple fried rice was good I do have to say.    My advice is  save yourself some $$$ and dine somewhere else.  Personally, I like Archie's Thai Restaurant on Flamingo.  Food is great and affordable.  Or if you don't want to that, try YELPing a few places.  :)

e37gwI5hk13QZ_7b9SIboA.text: Don't go there! It's expensive AND not good. I took the chicken cashew. No taste and the chicken was so tender that you can be sure it's not natural. All of my meal was shiny. Yes shiny! Why? It's so discusting! 18$ for something that you can have for 4$ in all others big City? No thank you...

J2YVC3fjBBNJfTBDhJ6NzA.text: Edible. Nothing special.  Had some fried Rice and Steak on New Year's Day.  Service lagged, even for hungover visitors.

7pQK8MK4zXYQ3kw2cJ5UmQ.text: One of the best thai places I've had in a while. We were staying at Vdara and just randomly stumbled upon it as a realized its right next to the enterance to the sky suites I've stayed at before in Aria.  First of all, the decor and atmosphere is fantastic. Very trendy yet comfortable. The service was prompt and they were very helpful in helping us decide what to order.  I actually tried their watermelon juice; its delicious. As for the food, we had beef satay, yellow curry, spicy seasame chicken, chicken & basil, and the wings. All were absolutely spectacular. Good size portions, very tasty, and definitely filling.  Once we left I immediately called a good friend of mine who frequently stays at Aria and had to tell him about it. He can't wait to try this place now.  After my great experience there I will definitely be back again soon!

_xlIFlnTgCLAnFj1W65nOg.text: I have eaten here many times. It is always excellent. They have one of the best drink menus in vegas. The lobster soup is fabulous and the spring rolls are perfect. I love it.

w56_e13NSQDKRsFwNKrmZQ.text: If you are staying at Aria- this thai restaurant is probably the most affordable one aside from their lunch buffet.   Just make sure that you specify the degree of spicyness that you want. We wanted a 2/10 but it tasted like 6/10. 10 as the most spicy and 1 as the least.  I liked their salmon roll. I would not recommend the spicy lobster salad.

QnilwvzdhJow1z5c0hwGyQ.text: We decided to have Thai tonight with the excitement of a trip to The Strip. Unfortunately Lemongrass didn't impress us any more than some of Aria's other offering have so far.  I ordered an appetizer of satay chicken sticks and the wife had vegetable spring rolls. The rolls were OK but not amazing, my satay sticks were mediocre. They came well presented, but the satay sauce was a tad bland. I'm usually willing to overlook this because I know this is a property of Thai satay, with my own preference usually leaning strongly toward Malaysian or Indonesian satay which tends to be spicier and nuttier in my experience, however the chicken itself was bland and nearly tasteless beyond the outer glaze and clearly hadn't enjoyed the hours of marinade-bathing essential to imbue a stick with a good flavour.  For mains we ordered Pad Thai "J" (for the wife) and I ordered Chicken Mee Goreng. My wife rued the lack of a strong peanut taste in her pad thai which was overwhelmed with chunky vegetables. She felt the dish lacked finesse and looked like it had just been plopped down on the plate.  My Mee Goreng was bland and gluey. I would chalk this down to poor ordering on my part, with with the rest of the meal suffering similar issues I think it's more of a quality issue. I was surprised how tasteless my meal was, considering we were informed of the restaurant's 1 to 10 heat scale in which 2-3 means "medium" and decided to go for a "4" meaning a bit spicier than medium. What I got was a 1 by any scale I've used for measuring spiciness.  While the restaurant looks nice here, the food simply isn't. For half the price you can enjoy far superior Thai fare at any number of establishments around the city. Even our generic fountain lemonades that we had to drink cost a staggering SIX DOLLARS each bringing the price of our meal up to around ninety dollars after tip for two appetizers, two noodle dishes and non-alcoholic beverages. For that sort of coin I expect my tastebuds to have their socks blown not only off, but then discovered in someone's backyard several states away a few days later. Lemongrass didn't impress me at all and I see no reason to return.

BXUm713Ml1ARWxRRwDkWcg.text: I liked the interior design and the atmosphere. The prices are reasonable for Vegas. However no one in our party liked the food, we got the yellow curry so did our friends and we all thought that it was the most tasteless and bland curry we've ever had! It was as if they ran out of curry and added loads of water to it to make more of it, it was loaded with tasteless potatoes and bitter onions....such a big disappointment. We got chicken satay for appetizers and that one was pretty good although nothing special or unique. The service was subpar as our waiter wouldn't come to check on anything... We'd have to track him down to get water, our bill etc. so wouldn't recommend this place at all. I need to get some real Thai food from the family restaurant near my house to forget this unpleasant Thai food experience.

rTUruHlQOvfCHYYr9wHs0Q.text: We liked this restaurant - above average quality Thai food with some unique dishes.  Also, they are open between lunch and dinner, and until 2 AM - one of the best and highest quality late-night food deals in Aria's area.

kyKgoObHI2AIgCf9OCkHbg.text: Not great, but they're open way late and prices are reasonable. Noodles were a little soggy.  I'd had a bit much too drink and the bartender told me the Thai place in Aria was still open, so there we went.   Really not that memorable but it hit the spot and was much needed!   And oh yeah, the "Shrimp egg rolls" are just sort of battered prawns, like hors d'oeuvres at a fancy wedding or something, rather than like real egg rolls.

oK5vI4GbmqRJ87lJHZC0og.text: I'm getting into the habit of giving 4 stars out - but I think I'm getting better at finding the good places!    I went to Lemongrass for lunch, mainly because it was in my hotel (the Aria) and I wanted Asian cuisine.  The service was gracious and kind.  Every server who passed me was pleasant and eager to please.  I had the peach-ginger cocktail, very refreshing and creative.  I moved onto the potstickers.  I'm a potsticker lover, so I'm always on the lookout.  These were large, with a very nice dough, steamed/fried to perfection with a nice spicy sauce.  I then moved onto sesame chicken - I know, it's Chinese, and not real original, but it was delicious, a sweet-chili sauce that wasn't cloying sweet.  The ambiance is beautiful and serene, an oasis tucked away from the casino.  Would be a nice romantic spot - but for just me, it was really enjoyable.

lMenraWUneAaqXs5mgKWwA.text: Sticky rice was so hard it had to be separated with a knife!  Not much chicken in Basil chicken, way more mushrooms.  Disappointing

ETRNxlvgHH6IX_p3qQW6CQ.text: Really not a good Thai restaurant. the food has no taste, it is unnaturally shiny, the chicken is really bad quality. Not a good experience at all. The chicken cashew nut is to avoid.

CZXwAtXYfYKbcMaO-fS8tw.text: Delicious.  Nice atmosphere.  Kind of tucked away so its not too loud.

WmvYoc3JNo-u8OwfFFXztw.text: Went here for a business meeting last month and decided that we should go out for some good ol Thai food.   I ordered the classic Pad Thai and shared some noodle and rice dishes with my fellow co workers. It was actually not too bad for a restaurant inside a hotel! The decor was very nice and clean. Service was prompt, just didn't blow me away. I will keep this restaurant in mind, the next time I am back in Sin City:)

zww277Hs9jUOJbAl976IbA.text: I enjoyed the drunken noodles, but my one complaint was that when the waitress asked me about the spiciness I said medium to hot and this turned into a conversation that medium was a 3 on a scale of 1-10, which seemed odd for medium. I didn't want to get smoked out but didn't want to have it too bland so I took the 3. If I went back, I would ask for 5 for spiciness. Place was good though.

JKW-3iNFzbI6Xe2YTBXaig.text: Yes, I know you could just drive down Mountain Spring Road for good cheap Asian restaurants. But, when you're looking for something nice and classy, I think Lemongrass hits the spot.  Been here a couple times and I don't have much to complain about.  They have a large selection of food to choose from- there's some Thai, Vietnamese, and Chinese food, even dim sum on weekends.  They also offer a cool satay bar.    Sure, its a little pricey, but what else would you expect from Aria?  The quality of the food sure surpasses those of the Asian places down the street and the service is far better.  My boyfriend I really likes the spicy pepper beef udon.  My parents love the vegetarian pad thai.  And I enjoy the dim sum- especially the spicy tripe and har gao.

jqLDBp8rp1DmPP-_EMzgHA.text: my bf and i decided to change up the scene a little for our 3 year anniversary dinner..we usually go to blossom's (which is right next to lemongrass). we just wanted to try something new and different.  lemongrass is thai cuisine resturant and is located in aria next to the barracat area in a hidden hallway. i had called beforehand to make reservations to reserve private booth and a lil early bday dessert for my boyfriend. the host who anwered my call was a bit of a bitch when i asked about these not so difficult accomodations...either she gave me that long "ooookayyyyyy..." as a reply or not even a thank you...who said it?
