The servers were stretched a bit too thin which ultimately resulted in subpar service. Overall, this place is nothing spectacular but if you're wanting late night Thai and want to stay in the vicinity of Cosmo and Aria, then give it a shot.   Pros- Nice ambiance  Location Decor  Thai ice tea  Satay   Cons- Food was average  Service was meh  Portions a bit small  Pricey for what you get

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Satay

tT_DQeTutOCgWlP-aud3Qw.text: Adventured to Lemongrass for lunch and found the menu was a refreshing change of pace from other restaurants in the area. Prices were fair. However, I sat at the bar and had a poor experience with the staff and food. The bartender was busy, but didn't stop to take my full order... He would stop and listen to a word then run away. He forgot or didn't hear my drink order even though I asked several times. When I was able to order I got the drunken seafood noodles and found it to be dry and flavorless (disclaimer, 4/10 spice). Steamed BBQ buns are not to be missed though.

GnkB7tpivPbTAwz7CgCW1Q.text: We ate here in August...OMG!!!! We loved it!!!!! Great food, drinks and service!!!! sweet and sour chicken...filet steak was YUMMY!!!!!

u3SClv1W_5aBlpNCtnoPwQ.text: Everytime I am in vegas i make it a point to go here.  The staff are couteous. Food tastes amazing. You cant go wrong with anything . Their noodles and fried rice are my favorite  The ambiance is really good.

Ks0Bn46iGpAGMHJ8qOB9iw.text: Bad service. Waited 10 minutes after ordering to get water. Pho wasn't good. Almost tasted like there was sugar in the broth. Mediocre at the most even being hungover...

InJI07k7qlXO3d0Up91JFw.text: We are staying at Aria & we decided to order take out.  We have tried this place before u didn't really like it but this time I must say it was much better & everything tasted amazing.

ndJ074XgcztGEFwIcDO3bA.text: Excellent service, friendly staff and nice ambience. The food is good but not spectacular. Definitely try their tom yum soup, it was one of my favorites on the menu.

kdtVLgwkEW5iJpImsjcXNQ.text: sorry- it is not the most authentic thai restaurant on the strip.  staying at aria its almost midnight so we just decided to stay in the hotel to eat. I wish we had not. the service was average but everyone did not enjoy their food. (group of 5 people).  the chicken in my tom kha soup was super chewy.  the roast duck noodle soup was bland.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. roast duck noodle.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. after I ate the tom kha soup.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. before I ate the tom kha soup.

mAWW1ImXpxEVb2DKxD_4JQ.text: I ordered a mixed veggie chow fun n fried rice. Excellent. Lemongrass tea is delicious. Lemon grass soup is a bit salty. Overall good good for late eaters.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SWaiLrpybWUHyHg9sPztwA.text: Discovered this place about 2 years ago...been coming back ever since.  First off, it's never easy to find a restaurant that tries to incorporate many types of Asian food, and have all the dishes tasting good at the same time.  But this place definitely is an exception.  I can honestly say that I haven't had a bad dish here.  Of course, the dishes are more catered to "mainstream" customers, but the sauces and flavors are very on point!  Many places serve sweet & sour shrimp and sesame chicken....but very few of them get it right.  This place definitely gets it right!  Regardless of how "authentic" places may be or not, good food is still good food!  As always, my opinion is simply that.  Make sure to try for yourself.  Some recommendations:  - ribeye steak w/tamarind sauce - sweet & sour chicken/shrimp - sesame chicken - green seafood curry - papaya salad

2lIKakMgxTAYW0R3kmauqA.text: Years ago I worked in Vegas and loved here for the healthier Thai options.   I would order: yellow curry, cashew chicken, fried flounder, egg rolls, chicken satay and pad Thai.   Not too impressed with the depreciating quality over the years or the decor compared to blossom next door but the pad Thai and satay are still good. As for the chicken and flounder- go to blossom for those.   I suggest here for lunch or afternoon dining- not dinner.

AhgT0_viGGeo-cDXOze9MA.text: Looked on Yelp for a fun spot for a Saturday night dinner in Vegas and stumbled upon this place. The menu looked great, so I booked some reservations.  We arrived on time for our reservation and were immediately seated.   I decided to order a bit of sake, admittedly not knowing much about sake. I decided to go with one of the cheaper options listed under "bottled sake." I was always lead to believe that sake was meant to be served warm, usually out of a bottle. What did I receive? A can of ice cold sake. Yes it may have been my fault for not fully understanding the sake concept, but it shouldn't be listed under the "bottled" options.  That tangent aside, we browsed over the menu that had many intriguing items on it. Pineapple fried rice, bbq pork rice and the many curry options jumped out to me. I went with the red curry and a bbq pork rice.  After our order, the service plummeted down hill, many times sitting for quite a while with empty water glasses.  Upon receipt of food, I was pleasantly surprised by the curry portion size. The red curry was very flavorful with a bit of a zing from spice.  The bbq pork fried rice was good, but disappointing for the price.  Upon finishing our plates, we sat, and sat, and sat, waiting for our server to come by so we could ask for the bill... nothing.  Overall, service dragged this rating down. The food was generally solid for the price point. If you are looking for Thai food, you can take your chances here, or look at the many food options elsewhere in Vegas.

JO_3fRXTB2IiPbqYiJJRXA.text: I was so happy when we walked in and they said they closed at 2 AM. It's very nice and well-kept Thai restaurant inside of the Aria Resort and Casino.

O1lCgvO5c58Yd9lTU0uMIQ.text: This place is actually pretty good! I almost didn't come here because of the somewhat bad reviews but I decided to give it a shot since I was staying at the sky suites and it's literally downstairs by the elevators.   I sat down with low expectations and I was shocked. I ordered the pad Thai, basil beef and Tom yum soup. The service was good as well, everyone is really nice and my waitress accidentally ordered me the wrong soup but was really sweet about it and made sure my order was correct.   Pad Thai 5/5. It was really flavorful and had a really great taste to it. It wasn't dry and it wasn't just a plain red/orange sauce they for sure added a lot to it but in a good way. I can't really explain it but it was really good.   Basil beef 4/5. I enjoyed this, it was really tender and flavorful. I've had better but still amazing.   Tom yum soul 4/5. I don't like the mushrooms they use. They're really big I like the traditional small mushrooms, but overall the flavor and spice was there. I ordered spice level 4 on everything and it had a good kick to it and I like spicy.   So cool that it's open until 2AM. I'm definitely going there for a late night bite.

6DW3onoNJnWUz26EGycMvw.text: Beside the casino pricing, this place is awesome. The food was very tasty. They adjust spiciness upon request. Warning: three is the level of a jalapeno. I ordered an 8 out of 10 and it was one of the hottest dishes I have eaten; no compaints as it was the spiciness I was looking for. Service  was great. For dessert I had a coconut rice dish and I really wish I had seen if they would give me the recipe as it was one of the best desserts I have ever had. Seriously, if you visit here you need to try it. It isn't s something overly complicated but is so satisfying .  I did have to resist the urge to ask people at other tables what they were eating .  It all looked and smelled great.

TBfyl8hVvbybU5qo0i6aaw.text: Excellent service.... Yummy food.... Tom Yam & Dim Sum can't be missed.... Noodles are out of this world.... A must try in Vegas...   Many vegetables & Seafood options available - highly recommend for Muslims too!

8ze2rYRWDirLA18v3WcLdw.text: Dined here with my boyfriend during our short trip to Vegas. It is located in the Aria and I was unsure of what the attire is. I opted for jeans and a black blouse thinking I should be somewhat decent. I saw some people wearing basketball shorts and very casual outfits. So I don't think it''s too strict here.  The interior is beautiful but I did not find the couch booths that comfortable. Waiters were attentive and nice. Food presentation was pretty nice but overall it was so-so. I enjoyed the Tom yum soup and the chicken skewers with that peanut sauce. YUM! I was looking forward to their spicy cucumber appetizer dish but that was so-so as well as their pad thai. Overall, they have good food but nothing special enough for me to return.

80tcz8rSiSxqKJXfZOl9uw.text: Needed to grab lunch and lemongrass had lots of seating available. Overall, fine meal. They allow you to choose the spice level which I appreciated - I should have put mine higher! Had the basil chicken and some dumplings. Speedy service but hefty price tag. But that's Vegas for you!

nywpcY1QAlTeA_dVNqKLZg.text: Lemongrass is inside the Aria Resort and Casino; they are open until 2 AM which is awesome, most places to eat inside the resort are packed with people at night or closed and Lemongrass was perfect, not in the middle of the gaming area or bars, the place is in a hidden area that provides peace and quiet after being in the mix all night. The service is great, quick and friendly. OMG they have THE BEST sesame chicken seriously!! I strongly suggest the dish as one of your choices. The cucumber salad was bland, the fried rice was ok, the noodles were very thai-ish; the restaurant is an Asian fusion type of place that is very chic with dim lights and great ambiance. The price is $$-$$$ and the drinks are expensive in my opinion but that's Vegas. Over all the place was bomb diggity and I totally recommend it, especially that sesame chicken!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pdtcm4ty3nqUK_iNAIBMJQ.text: Located inside the Aria Hotel and Casino, this restaurant was perfect for a Sunday afternoon meal. Today was dim sum day so of course we tried a few options - Har Gow (shrimp) and a pork option. Both were delicious. There were several options to choose from but I was happy with the selections. I enjoyed the chicken and shrimp pad Thai for me entree and it did not disappoint. Looking forward to dining here again the next time I'm in Vegas.

58e2ugVAYbytzPQ-FoJLiA.text: Fantastic!   The Tom Yam soup was beyond amazing!!!! So good we ordered another! The dumplings....wow wow wow...and that would've been plenty. Potstickers were good too. Service was on point. AND the price tag was very reasonable too!  Oh, and they have jellyfish which was cool though I didn't enjoy it.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jellyfish

eYAzyWeU5CVkjakbdOVrvQ.text: Juby is an amazing server at the bar came to see her twice in 1 day and every trip, her recommendations on the crab fried rice was spot on it was so delicious! She is so attentive, service was excellent , food is amazing

iDZjpXJ2xTclMd9W_yfK4Q.text: I love everything I've had at Lemongrass! The ambience is so intimate and very chill. This is definitely a fav on the Strip!

cifI2ttya-5VlD82BYEJMA.text: Nice ambiance. A great variety of courses. Big issue I had was I ordered pineapple fried rice and the description reads: Fried rice, Chinese sausage, shrimp, pineapple, cashew, raisins, curry powder. When I got it, the flavor was great; however it was full of small pieces of chopped onions. I HATE onions and there were so many, you couldn't pick around it. I ended up not eating the dish and didn't have time to order anything else. They need to revise the menu or not add onions to this entree.

iRrbXTNGVphH7ZZyDW7LPw.text: The food was delicious but the cleanliness was very questionable and we were not pleased with the customer service. My husband found a hair in his chicken pad Thai and sent it back. They did make him another plate but we thought for sure because of the disgust from the hair and having to wait for another plate, that the restaurant would at least comp us his meal. We were charged full price for it. They could have at least comped half for the trouble/the fact that both of us were grossed out. We felt like they should have done more than just apologize/remake the meal.

3VfhUbQ-mI02YaFZK8_G-w.text: Great service and excellent food. The prawn tools were delicious. We also enjoyed the shrimp and pork soups dumplings. The Riesling flight was perfect with the Thai Basil Shrimp and Chicken - spice level #4 out of 10 was great. Also enjoyed the egg fried rice.

TijxA3MXK4j7C31rMaULBg.text: I love Thai food, I'm a big fan. This place has "Thai hospitality" to offer. I've been to many Thai restaurant for some reason they are all different, the way they cooked and flavor each dish. This place is on the mild version (not in a bad way). I had fresh coconut, chicken satay and green curry. I say it's pretty good and tasty and the service is fast too. Well I came here before everybody else and it's very quiet.  Although I think it's a bit pricey but generous in portions, knowing that there are so many Thai restaurants who offer cheaper prices and may be a bit better (taste wise). I've been in Thailand and yes I've had authentic Thai food. I'm just saying

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken satay, with peanut sauce and cucumber
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green curry with chicken, it&#39;s mild and it taste fresh
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh coconut, what&#39;s not to like

tSsoQ6PTfIi1w0k6nXs_7g.text: My girlfriends and I enjoyed our quick lunch here. We ordered the seafood salad, drunken noodles with seafood and garlic and lime steamed cod. The food came out quick.   Seafood salad was burst of flavors but I wished there was more veggie or lettuce. It was mainly seafood. Drunken noodles was decent. The codfish was moist and garlic lime sauce was delicious. I loved the cabbage that was soaked in this sauce. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood salad &amp; drunken noodle with seafood
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic &amp; lime steamed cod

ZGwRUrhlyjhmDqhllzKnqw.text: Came for lunch and the food was disappointing. Crab claw balls were mushy and too fishy, the baked bbq pork buns were way too sweet and they didn't tell us it was sweet at all. The shrimp dim sum was also very fishy. The only thing we enjoyed was the tea (bagged) and the steamed pork buns.

C1Gfh-jKYslWlD3ipgJXdA.text: Waste of time & money. Bland food. Bad service.  No reason to ever return.  Coming in thinking it's a Thai restaurant, but their menu has Chinese translation & Chinese inspired dishes, Vietnamese food, & Thai. Very confusing.   Don't let the beautiful decor fool you into dining here.

4Q_HVZOk__oO-uMdUEY05g.text: So after my friends & I left the Mandarin bar, we were like let's find the best restaurant that's open and get a tasting menu. We had no clue what would be open but to my surprise there was a spot called LemonGrass open in the Aria hotel.   We headed over there and sure enough it was like midnight at they were open till 1-2AM and still were doing tasting menus. We were quite toasty at this point however they served us. They also don't think had any idea what "gluten-free" meant since our waiter didn't even speak English. Which in the food industry hey, It could be a good thing! The food was excellent, the drinks were tasty and overall I'd go back to LemonGrass, especially for being open late night.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemongrass
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They brought multiple plates of stuff you just threw on your plate all together.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shark Fin Soup? JK No idea but was so good.

aTPLDThh7Y2-dPKA4nlnmQ.text: Upscale and elegant, Lemongrass is a great business or date night location.  We were with my husband's coworkers so there was a myriad of plates ordered, everything was quite tasty. Service was super slow, though.   Dinner for four, plus a few cocktails, was $280+ tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jB3BRtUw0-VLNNeMGCEo3Q.text: There was so much left to be desired. I love Thai food, and I was really excited to start my day off with some good Thai food. However, I was incredibly underwhelmed. They had mediocre food at a high price. I left there thinking - I could have gotten better authentic Thai food elsewhere. I'm not too keen on presentation - I like me some GOOD food and Lemongrass didn't do it for me.  Presentation wise, the food looked good, but for the price point...I feel like I could have eaten MUCH tastier food than this.

Wq0331PeqISU_nemK3NiJA.text: We went here for lunch and were more than happy with the food and experience. We had the seafood drunken noodles. They were really good. We also ordered a few dim sum items. The spinach and shrimp dumpling was my favorite. Would absolutely go back again.

b0xtJWMWe7DKkKfPnEh5Xg.text: Someone recommended this place to us and it was definitely the only reason we came to Aria. So glad we did because the food was incredibly delicious. Spice level 4 is not spicy at all but I added chili on the side. The only reason I knocked off a star was because the service was incredibly slow. We got seated and no one came to our table for so long that I had to ask someone for our waiter.   The Panang curry was heavenly because of the simple addition of a lychee in the dish which complemented it so incredibly well. I wished we were not going to a concert after because I would have loved to take my leftovers with me.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panang curry with lychee in it was amazing.
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soup is meant for sharing. Portions are huge.

lRv_C8lbfpaoGaa70Kybug.text: Worst hostess ever at this restaurant. I've gone here many times and it's gotten worse. This time it was epic!! This  hostess told me a 40 minute and now it's an hour. There is always at 40 minute wait with 10 tables available. Not sure why the long wait. The servers are good, but your hostess sets the tone for your  establishment. There are so many restaurants in a 2 mile radius. Maybe they want my patronage at their restaurant.

tFgJ_8TmnaOEIVUx9rdA8w.text: The service was super slow but it may have been bc of the busy weekend. Good thing is the food came out quickly. They did forget my glass of wine but the food was so delicious that I wasn't even mad about it

8ffbfitWVskS1CWRXLW4xQ.text: This is a staple of our crew's annual Vegas trip. We usually go 1-2 times per weekend. Open super late and pretty early. Ambience is great- relaxing & chill. Food is always good. Cesar is the best waiter there by a mile. So helpful & reliable. I would go back just for him, but luckily I don't have to because the whole place is great.

ZiDMN_jo2I24MINV2njCfg.text: Extremely disappointing since the pictures of the food looked so good!   The food was flavorless and way overpriced (but then, its Vegas).   The beef noodle soup was excessively bland and the meat was so dry and flavorless, you'd imagine them boiling it in plain water and then leave out to suffer for several hours. The only decent part about it was the chewy noodles (which of course had no taste either). The soup was also cold...  Just save yourself the disappointment and go elsewhere.

Wyrwjqoldvn5bvs_0_WVyw.text: We came at 11:30pm, sat at the bar to not have a wait and still were there for 1hr 20m.  They did not refill our waters, were not attentive at all, and were bad mouthing another guest for only tipping $10.  The food is ok at best. The service is awful.

KM_hvpnr0RUZbI9XEPY2Eg.text: Food was delicious.  We had the VEGETARIAN SPRING ROLLS as an app.  For dinner we had the THREE CUPS CHICKEN and Vegetable fried rice.  The food was delicious and generous portions.  Highly recommend the fried banana dessert!  Drink pours were just 'ok' for the price

BJWGhHzSxVgRRtpqAIlpdg.text: We just checked in at the hotel and we were starving. This menu looked delightful so we decided to give it a go. It was very busy so we took that as a good sign.   They sat us right away without a reservation which was nice. We got ice waters and my bff got a watermelon caipiro (vodka based). The cocktail was delicious and you could barely taste the vodka because the watermelon juice was so flavorful and delicious.   We started with the potstickers app. They were delicious. 6 pieces Steamed soft in the middle and then fried to a light brown crispy texture - perfect and delightful.   I ordered the beef brisket egg noodle soup and my bff got the pad Thai with vegetables. This is where the evening took a dive.    The egg noodles were super thin and bunched up. I had to fight them to get them to seperate so I could eat them.  They were totally flavorless and bland.  The beef brisket came in as cubes of tough meat that was hard to chew and had fatty sides on each piece that I had to try to peel the meat away from to eat. The broth was flavorful and there were Baby bok choy pieces that were plain but yummy.  I stopped eating about halfway through - just couldn't keep fighting the dish with the huddled up noodles and tough meat squares.   The pad Thai was spicy and flavorful. It came with raw bean sprouts, a slice of lime, peanuts, and the veggie option had huge pieces of veggies - big slices of carrots, Asian corn, asparagus, mushrooms. There were way more veggies than noodles and they were cut into such big chunks that it overwhelmed the skinny noodles.   The entrees were a total bummer. However the cocktail and appetizer were very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai with veggies
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s1Eiuh6DMsot3V7mt-ctcQ.text: Delicious thai food with GF / soyfree / vegetarian options...mmmmmmm! One of us had the vegetable Tom Kha soup and Green Curry, and one of us had the Pad Thai with shrimp, requested no bean sprouts or peanuts, add cashews...they got it right! We had a wonderful, memorable experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entry decor at Lemongrass!

iE9mDMUA_TM5CbrXqM-D6g.text: Fantastic Thai restaurant in an elegant atmosphere.  We ordered the chicken satay grilled sticks to start and it came with a delicious peanut sauce, bread, and pickled peppers and cucumbers. Very delicious!  Next, we had the chicken Penang curry (yes, despite the menu confusion, you can order it with chicken). We wanted it to be medium spicy so ordered the 3 per our waiter's (Pei) suggestion but it was not spicy at all (probably because it's sweet). But it was very delicious and the curry was creamy and perfect.  We also got the Thai Basil Chicken which was overall good but not as great as the curry. If you love basil though, it is very strong on the basil taste along with the satay chicken.  Lots of chicken too!  We ordered sides of brown rice (You have to order as extra) which was average.  Overall, a good experience, lots of good food, and good service by Pei. Thank you! We would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Thai Basil and Chicken Penang Curry with sides of brown rice.

VoTYW-9HU5-bvky8oqvZmQ.text: SKIP THIS FOR LATE NIGHT DINING The pad Thai was the worst one in my memory.  Service is terrible when it gets close to closing time. they want to leave and that's okay but if the business hours are not concluded you can't say one will be served in a box! What is that?  I arrived 115-120 am and host offered a table but since I was alone I requested the bar to which the bartender says we stopped serving here I can place order but it will come in a box to go and no problem if you want to eat it here! My jaw dropped I immediately requested the manager she stated we stop serving at 130 is 129. She adds we will serve you this time.  Yes please because it wasn't 130 and I won't be returning. Change the closing time! Because 130 is not 2 am original closing time and tasteless noodles don't take 30 minutes to prep!

8TR0yWO82t5YUzqHY84GPQ.text: I dined at Lemongrass with my vegan husband and a friend of ours on a Tuesday evening. We arrived around 6 pm, did not have reservations and did not have a wait to be seated.  The ambiance was lovely, as expected from a restaurant within the Aria. We were seated at a comfortable table that allowed us to converse easily while we dined. I have absolutely zero complaints about the service, the staff was efficent and amicable.   Of the items ordered, Tom Kha soup with lobster was my favorite dish. $24 got us serving that was large enough for 2 to share, with great flavor and huge chunks of lobster. The Phad Thai was average at best. I would recommend passing on this dish.  The serving size for the chicken Larb was a bit small but it was minty and delicious.  I did not eat any of the Panang Curry, but my husband enjoyed it. A bit of a bummer that rice is an additional $3 for this dish, but overall I found the pricing fair for the items we ordered considering we were eating at one of the higher end resorts on the Strip.  Mango sticky rice for dessert was the perfect way to end our meal.   I left stuffed and happy. As a local, I have a few Thai restaurants located off-Strip that I would choose to go to over Lemongrass, but for on-Strip dining I would return here.  Yelp Reviews 2018 36/100

r0rT0mLuXovS2uGSIZIqKA.text: This place is really good! I came here this past weekend with my Fiance. I was now disappointed. What I really liked about this place was the Thai/Chinese/Vietnamese dishes they offered. I love variety.  This place is located inside of the Aria Hotel and Casino. Across from Blossom.   The inside was nice. Vibe was pretty good, not super romantic. We were able to get our own side table which was big enough for all of the food we were about to order!  Service was was bad. Our server took forever to come and check on us. We had to grab different waiters throughout the entire dinner to ask or get things. Also, it took forever for us to get our food. Even just the appetizers.  As for the food - We ordered pretty much everything they had to offer:  Seaweed salad - Huge portion. Very good.  Assorted Dim Sum - Good. I've had better  Chicken Green Curry - Really good. Good portion  Duck Panang Curry - Really Good! Lot of duck.  Sticky Rice - Very good  Seafood Drunken Noodles - it was ok, I've had better  Pork Pad See Ewe - We asked for Chicken...they still gave us pork. Dish was still good.  Chicken Pad Thai - Huge portion. Had all the ingredients to me awesome. I don't this it had enough spice.  Sweet and Sour Chicken - Very good  Sesame Chicken - Very good!  Pineapple Fried Rice - Very good! Huge portion  Overall - very good. Huge portion on food. Love the variety of dishes. Nothing blew me out of the water. Service was awful.

MQ-mtMqMgQU-0yNR11uKvA.text: We checked in late at 12 midnight and was starving so this was the place that was still open and was recommended by the front desk.  The food here is bland for there is no Thai flavor in it at all but when I'm hungry I'll eat pretty much anything.  One thing that I had ordered was "Fresh Orange Juice" which I had them remove because what was served is by far fresh and even in my state I could not drink it.  It was like cheap OJ from your local supermarket.  Anyways I don't have anything good to say about the food here.  Service was good still at that time so that would be the reason why this isn't 1  Update to the comment:  That was only 1 pic which are not what we ordered as a whole.  But I know what good food is because I'm eating it so all reviews are just my opinions.  I appreciate your comments however the food is still not good regardless.  No justification will make it better and you say your chief is from Bangkok...well he needs to go back to school to learn to cook and hire someone that can cook real Thai.  this may come across as mean, however this is the truth and not everyone can handle it.  Best wishes for maybe someone else might like it but your food is not for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2eVVJBo_XjJlENRPBzd-OQ.text: Dined here as a group of 5 last weekend.   We ordered chicken satay skewers, papaya salad, pineapple fried rice, duck panang curry, baby bok choy, sweet and sour chicken, and a tofu dish. Everything tasted good, just as you'd expect but honestly nothing to write home about.   What DID stand out? Our server, Bank. All of us agreed that it was the best service we have ever encountered by a server, ever! And that is saying a lot.   Our curry was on the salty side and he insisted on getting it remade for us even though we told him we were fine with keeping it. Food was coming out really slow because they were short staffed, but Bank continued to check on us and update us.   Three stars for the food, five stars for the service.

suArdOlpo40MTFzKcrciiA.text: Very good food, nice staff however no changing table for babies which always makes me like a place a little less...

vnHsKf0CRCvCmMSW2TUNWA.text: Authentically frozen spring rolls with a cold creamy consistency. I had to send them back and they still charged me for them. Bad move. You want to consider going to a real Thai restaurant or the Pizza place instead. Poor service too. Marketing is pretty aggressive within the Aria but trust me: Don't be tempted. There are far better ways to waste your money in Vegas.

cMkbJ9oT7kyiYRQhFAbl8Q.text: Great location and ambience. I had the Duck Penang curry and my husband tried Thai basil chicken fried rice. Both of them tasted amazing

USfZIOxIImkU-RCAGgNVcA.text: Food is ok. But service could be better... but the dum she is a bit dry wish it could be better

rsxH_4nQY619AWgxw1ahmw.text: My girlfriend and I were staying at Aria and decided to have dinner at Lemongrass. The last time we stayed at Aria, we had lunch at Lemongrass and enjoyed it. This time, however, we were primarily disappointed in the service. We ordered two appetizers and waited about 20-30 minutes for them. People around us, who were seated after us, received their food before we received our appetizers. We received our entree shortly after the appetizers. Food was ok. 3/5 for the food, 2/5 for the service.

PgxZzf_WAtw60ZOPyvq3gA.text: Nice food with good portion size. 5 out of 10 is good spice level. We tried chicken satay, yellow and green curry along with basil pork. All the food has good spice level.

qIrIUMEUzNhLGVs4cjBGxg.text: Was so happy to find this place open at such a late hour after I finished working an event off the strip.   I got the yellow coconut curry and it was AMAZING! The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because after added a thai iced tea and some rice my bill was over $30. I understand that this is in the Aria but paying that much for curry just seems to be too much.

ZBcyv7MX_qwEJ3O12gJrOQ.text: Ordered Pad se ew and it had no flavor. Very disappointed for price. You would think beung in a huge hotel like the Aria it would be of better quality.

Vc-p-vM0pJFH_nskW5IDug.text: The best Thai restaurant in the strip. Food was amazing (pad Thai, pineapple fried rice And the fish entrees were all really good!), portions were decent.Customer service was great!

q88PcCkj13x4U9ZCEZVAKA.text: We arrived to Vegas in the evening and Lemongrass was one of the few restaurants that is open after 10pm, so we decided to check it out even though we were planning to come back in the morning for dim sum.  Thankfully, there is a good selection of food and our two meals felt like they could have been from two different restaurants.   Lemongrass is a fusion restaurant. I'm usually weary of Asian fusion as I feel it's often a watered down version of what the authentic dishes would be, but Lemongrass does a good job. Is it going to match the country-specific cuisine I can get back in the Bay Area?  No, but it's good enough.   For our first meal we tried the tasting menu. The chicken and seafood skewers were tasty, nothing mind blowing, but a good start. The soup, unlike what I've read from other reviewers, was actually quite good. The seafood and vegetables were fresh, tender, and broth so good I made sure to finish it to the last drop.  For main course, we both had the pad thai.   I understand the criticisms of other reviewers.  There are many variations of pad thai and this one is less flavorful and on the blander side than most. However; the key to the more mellow style is to let the basic ingredients and cooking technique shine, which the chef did quite well.  The freshness and technique made what otherwise would be a zero a hero. I'll admit I usually like a more flavorful sauce, but I enjoyed this dish. The spice level, was a bit higher than I expected though.   We returned the next morning for dim sum. Again, this is a fusion restaurant so I went in expecting that it wouldn't match what I can get back in the Bay.  I agree with other reviewers in that the traditional flavors were not there, but the execution was done well and still tasty.  I enjoyed the twists Lemongrass put on the traditional dishes.   When we went later at night the service was a bit cold, yet still professional. The morning staff was much more friendly and pleasant. I chalked this up to the night staff having to deal with all the party people.   Many reviewers have mentioned the inflated prices here. EVERYTHING in Vegas is expensive, that is just how it is.

Wou9mWTWdnAyYIWsLRU_5A.text: We had looked forward to trying Lemongrass based on in-room TV ads and our passion for Thai food.  We arrived at 3:15pm.  There was nobody at the hostess stand.  Nearly 10 minutes later a woman appeared with not one drop of interest in her job and seated us.  After waiting 10 minutes and not being waited on, we left.  I politely introduced myself to the manager as we left and I was told, "So sorry."  It's unappetizing when seemingly half the tables in a restaurant have not been cleared of dirty dishes.  Lemongrass wins the award for the most uncleared tables!  Needless to say, I cannot score Lemongrass favorably.

A887MaBkkbo3dVjWkF3HQA.text: We been there yesterday. We ordered a few thing. Two yellow curry, one of them we asked few times - No asparagus. It comes with. They changed it after 20 min.  Then in both of those yellow curry the potatoes were almost raw. Not fully cooked at all.  We told the server, They didn't even offer to remove this item(s) from the bill. You really throng after 40min I will change it again? I paid in full almost 100$ bill and will never come back.

qfiOfmatU2tNrT4VrSOuBg.text: Food was hit or miss. The salmon spring rolls were bomb, but the cashew chicken and sweet and sour chicken were really bland. Overpriced all around.  They also seated us at a table next to the waiters' kiosk (or whatever it's called - basically where the waiters input food orders and print checks). The entire meal, the waiters were hovering over us and the restaurant was not even close to full. We asked to be moved. The waiter came back and said the hostess told him he couldn't move us because there was nowhere else we could sit. Literally three tables were open the entire time we ate and that's just in view of our seats. There's a whole other half to the restaurant. Made me feel really bitter about the whole experience. Throughout dinner I felt like I was protecting my meal from the waiters standing above me.

bInkdKkQT0r0nOjkpStKpQ.text: This is my MUST DO place every time I am in Vegas! Thai food doesn't get any more authentic than this. I only have good memories from each of my visits from this place and I highly recommend this place to everyone who is a Thai cuisine lover looking for Thai food in Vegas. The variety of food is good and the portion sizes are huge for the price you are paying, compared to most of the places within the resorts on the strip.  On my first visit, we had the red and green curries with pork and chicken. You get to dictate the spice level in your food from 1-10 and I think 6 is the lucky number if you like it spicy! The flavors were spot on and the quantity was huge and we had to get it packed. On my second trip, we got the dim sum platter with the duck red curry. The dim sums were sooo good and the duck curry was most perfect duck curry I have had so far. As always, the curry was soo much that we went through 2 bowls of rice without even realizing it as it was all so good. I always get the warm satisfying feeling after having food here and the restaurant is right there on the strip as well which is very convenient.  I hope you all visit and have a great time as we did.

GSEKQ3p1CqZqM7Sd-c_OBQ.text: We paid no attention to the silly girl at the front desk of Lemongrass when we came for lunch.  Blew past her and she didn't even pay attention.  Got seats at the bar and quickly served by Shawn who was excellent! Within minutes he had our order- Young chow fried rice (A) and Garlic shrimp stir fry(A).  Food came out quickly, hot and fresh! A+ effort all around!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rdx0TVNiD6f3ZpI-Z49v8Q.text: I loved the food here. Great options for vegetarians! Its a cute place for a nice dinner date.

XL9sUkmppfXYz7u8dchPCA.text: Had the dumplings, coconut soup, and pad see ew. All three were really good and very authentic. Finished the meal off with sticky rice and mango. Was very happy with this pick!

whFwDre7yWgMWG7KCgUFLw.text: I'm definitely a fan!  First of all, you can't beat the hours - they are open until 2AM every night - you just don't see that with a nice restaurant like this. Plus, the food and service are top notch and I feel like the prices are very reasonable.  The restaurant is made to resemble a Thai Silk Factory - it's dimly lit and this might sound weird, but I love the lamps at each table. They specialize in Thai cuisine, but also have quite a few Chinese dishes as well.  When I dined here, I had the yellow curry with chicken. At $16, the portion was HUGE and could definitely be shared. I was disappointed that they charged $3 extra for rice - this is something that usually comes standard with curry. However, for less than $20, I thought it was a great portion and REALLY tasty. I ordered it at a level 5 - their scale is from 1-10 and I was advised that 3 was medium. Although 5 was a bit spicier than I anticipated, I would probably go with at least a 6 next time (for that extra kick).  Overall, it was a great experience - considering I was there just before close (at 1:45AM). The service was prompt and friendly and I was surprised at how busy it was at that time. If you are at Aria and looking for something a little different (this is the only Thai restaurant on the Strip I believe), definitely check out Lemongrass!

_WeFSvkjnLovg4MeWDRixQ.text: My  go-to Thai place is vegas, love staying in Aria as well .

s50Mmv9TklSnWvRQOioy5Q.text: 3.5-4 stars overall. Came late night. It's a nice place in Aria. A lot if restaurants closed before 12AM, this was one that was open late and still served a full menu after hours so we decided to try it.   FOOD: Chow Mein (3.5 stars): Regular noodles, good, but nothing special.   Prawn satay (5 stars): Cooked perfectly! I'd recommend this if you like prawns.   Yellow curry (4 stars): Needs more chicken. Broth was still good though.   Sake: They only have it warm here, wasn't used to that. I like cold better.   SERVICE (4 stars): Everyone was nice but the waiter would disappear at times.  ATMOSPHERE (5 stars): Nice decor, spacious, clean.

gfKvqmIcMsxNadDL6xNbNw.text: First off, the place is very nice looking. We were excited to eat there, but the aesthetics were about the end of our enjoyment.  We started with potstickers which were good, but nothing special.   We decided to try out a couple of soups, the wonton noodle soup and a duck and BBQ beef soup. They were just terrible. They tasted like mop water. Our server did not drop them off and never returned to check on us or refill our waters. We finally flagged him down to get our check. He saw our uneaten meals and asked if we wanted to-go boxes. We told him no and he said okay and went to get the check. He never asked if we liked the food or why we didn't eat more of it.  I'm sure there are other options that we would have enjoyed, but we won't be back to try them.

yc4UvF7VcEtn69Sz49DgFg.text: Absolutely delicious! Pineapple fried rice is a must. And our server Tina was the kindest! Already looking forward to a return trip

3ATfKSySZhUNQsIKEbWIqA.text: This is more of Thai restaurant and offers the usual Thai dishes with a twist.    Like Panang Duck, which was very rich and flavorful.  Tried it twice and it could be on the salty side.  The Satay skewers are their "special" but I really don't think it's worth the $18+ price tag depending on what your choice of meat is.  Another must try is the Crab Omelette, very hearty and comfort food.  I would skip the appetizers like the jellyfish or cumcumber, but I would definitely go for the Fish Cakes.  If you're in the mood for a fried noodle dish, I'd reccommend the Mee Goreng.   The service here is great, but it's kinda pricey for a Thai restaurant.
